description: Includes: 180 new cards to be added to the main For the Girls game. Contains new game cards from the 5 different colored decks (pink, blue, purple, orange and green).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: The Secret Garden of Keukenhof: Spin & Write
description:
It is a game in which we pretend to be the gardeners who work in secret to present one of the pavilions of this beautiful garden located in Holland, the game is composed of several leaves that represent the 4 pavilions of this garden, the gardener leaves of each player and 2 boards that will indicate which flowers can be painted, the number of flowers to be painted and the score that certain flowers will give at the end of the game.

At the beginning of a game round, the flower tokens will turn to see which flowers will be available this round, each player will choose one of the available flowers to paint in their color on the garden sheet, each player in their turn will be able to gather resources to play skills that help him or in his case that hinder the opponents, the game will end when the last meeple of the garden sheet is marked, after all the players have played their last turn, the scoring stage begins, that gardener will win (player ) that more points have obtained.
During the game, the decision of where to paint the flowers, the number of flowers, the choice and the final score may vary depending on certain skills that a player can play, which means that the game may differ from game to game.


The player who will start the round is chosen.
Paint the meeple color that starts on the garden leaf.
Turn the flower tiles.
Turn the flower quantity token.
Earn and spend resources to play skills.
Choose the flower that you will paint on the garden sheet.
Paint an X amount of the flower you chose in your color.
End your turn and prepare for the next round.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, Enclosure, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Market, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Turn Order: Auction

name: Escape from the Two Base Stations
description:
Escape from the Two Base Stations is a new style of escape game kit that allows two players in different locations to play together using a video call app of their choice.

With no time limit on it, anyone can experience an authentic escape game with this game kit! The only catch? You'll need to find a friend to send the other half of the game kit to, and cooperate with each other to solve the puzzles.

One side will have the "North Pole Kit" and the other will have the "South Pole Kit". Progress through the story together by sharing information from each unique kit through a video call app of your choice.

This remote communication game must be played by 2 parties over video call, where one side has the North Pole Kit and the other side has the South Pole Kit physically with them. The game cannot be played with only one of the kits.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Federation & Empire: Combined Operations – Rulebook 2021 Edition
description:
Combined Operations has more rules for Federation & Empire.
It is newly improved and updated, having gone through extensive review and discussion during Stratcon 2021. All rules questions from ADB, Inc.’s BBS and Captain’s Log issues have been addressed to provide the best experience for every empire.

This product includes many new concepts (stasis field generators, electronic warfare, light tactical transports, monitors, special units, and Marines), which enhance play value by providing players with new ways to destroy their enemies. New economic factors include commercial convoys, base stations, and PF storage depots. You can take the fight to the planet with ground combat, including special attack forces. Prime teams can help in combat or aid in capturing a ship, along with other abilities.

And there are scenarios galore!
Koval’s Lightning has Klingons and the Federation facing off;
Thunder over Kzintai has Kzintis, Lyrans, and Klingons;
The Hydran Expedition has Hydrans trying to get to Federation territory without being stopped by the Klingons;
The Wayward Wind explores what would have happened if the Coalition had attacked the Hydrans first, rather than the Kzintis;
Reptilicon Revenged has Romulans and Gorns;
Cold Front can be used as a training scenario with the experienced player commanding the Hydrans and newer players commanding the Coalition;
Tholian Gambit has the Klingons facing the Tholians;
The Late Kingdom explores what would have happened if the Hydrans had to start the General War by reconquering their territory.

You will need the Federation & Empire 2010 Rulebook and various countersheets to use this expansion.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Pirates Under Fire: Mercernary Ship Promo Tile
description:
A promo tile to add to the game.
It follows the same rule as the other mercernary ship tiles.

Power: when you place this tile (after paying 4 gold), you activate the power of the 3 possible ships of your color that surround it (left/right and above).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Relick TCG
description:
Relick is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star!

In the game, each player chooses a character that has a number of life points, in each turn the players can: draw 1 card, attack, use 2 cards from their hand or level up. To win you have to attack your opponent with the attack dice, if you hit the result of the dice you will subtract life points from the opponent, you can also use other cards that will allow them to reach this objective faster, when a player reaches life 0, don't lose the game, but if you manage to hurt him one more time with at least 1 damage, you win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: Super-Chance
description:
Super-Chance is a dice racing game with a background in traffic education. Players roll the dice and drag their pieces along a winding path to the finish line. Those who are lucky may use shortcuts. Along the way, the meaning of traffic signs is explained. The player who gets his 3 figures to the finish line first wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ground Assault
description:
On the modern battlefield, military units face off against each other, the terrain, and the elements. Carve out the best strategy to navigate the terrain and build structures to control land. But be on your guard! Pitfalls await you around every turn, and your entire strategy can quickly unravel…

Ground Assault® is a military-themed game where two to four players navigate challenging terrain, build structures to take control of land, and battle to defend their land.

The object of the game is to control six pieces of land at the same time across the battlefield before your opponents do the same. Each time you play, the tiles forming the battlefield are randomized, making each game a unique challenge!

A turn starts with 10 actions points that can be used in various ways. The most common ways to use the AP are moving troops around the board and using a combination of AP and skill cards to build something on a terrain tile which represents a piece of land. For instance, if you're on a river tile and you have the correct skill card (in this case the Engineer skill card) you can build a bridge across the river (you flip the tile over and the river becomes a bridge). Then you put your land control cube on the tile to mark that you own it.

The game ends for a specific player if they run out of troops. Troops can be lost in battles. The game ends altogether when one player acquires six pieces of land.

The catchphrase of the game is "Control the Field, Win the War." So it's all about maneuvering your troops around the battlefield (made up of terrain tiles), building structures to take control, and then defending them against attack.
With 100% hand-painted artwork by graphic novel illustrator Mark Woods-Hawkins and unique mechanics, Ground Assault® is a must have game in your collection!
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Grid Coverage, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: BATTALIA: Hero Sheets
description:
The Hero sheets introduce unique powers to the different heroes in the game. Each hero has 3 own special abilities (skills) separated in 3 levels. All first level abilities can be used once per turn for free and are equal for the male and female character of every faction. All level 2 and 3 abilities need to be activated in order to be used and may be played several times per turn as long as the player has resources (supply cards) to activate them. They are specific for every single hero.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Moxie: A Journey of Monsters
description:
Fraywick, the last great human city, is constantly under threat by the dangerous wild monsters of the world. But when Fraywick would fall, the Moxian Guard stands tall against the menace. Using the charismatic power of Moxie, the Moxian Guard command their own monsters to fend off threats from beyond the gates. You have discovered your own Moxie, and set off on a journey to rally your own band of monsters together. Tryouts for the Moxian Guard begin in eight weeks, do you have what it takes to make the cut?

Moxie: A Journey of Monsters is played over a series of 8 rounds, culminating in a final tournament between the players. Each round has two phases, a scouting phase in which players search various decks of cards, called routes, for monsters to recruit to their team, and a battle phase where they will face off against another player, pitting their recruited monsters against one another for rewards.

In the scouting phase, there are no turns. Instead, players act simultaneously, scouting routes they've reached. Players begin with just a handful of moxie tokens, which they'll spend to scout these routes. Players can search each deck they've reached one time each round, choosing only a single card from it to join their team, and so must choose how best to spend their moxie tokens to cover the most ground. By committing many moxie tokens to a route, players draw more cards from that route, giving them more options to choose from, but at the cost of less moxie to search other routes with. Once each player has spent all of their moxie tokens for the round, the game proceeds to the battle phase.

In the battle phase, players pair off against each other to pit their team against the others. Each player prepares their team for battle by determining the order they'll send their monsters out, attempting to position each monster where it will best counter their opponents. Once players have committed their order, the battle begins, with players sending their monsters out one at a time to do battle until they run out of strength. Monsters strength is determined by that monsters particular strength dice, by comparing monsters types to see if one or the other can score a critical hit, and by utilizing the various effects of each monster to further alter the outcome. Once only one player has any monsters remaining, they win the battle that round.

After each battle phase, players are rewarded based on their performance. Players who win their battle progress along the route tracker, opening up a new route for them to scout going forward in future rounds. Players who lose their battle, on the other hand, are rewarded additional moxie tokens to allow them to scout further into the routes they've already reached. In addition, defeated players may advance one of their monsters into a powerful new form, granting it new strengths and abilities.

Play continues in this way until the end of the eighth round, where players will compete in a final tournament bracket to determine the games final victor.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Real-Time, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Ancient Mediterranean
description:
The 'Ancient Mediterranean' is a civilization Euro style game for 2 to 5 players with easy rules and relatively short gameplay. (1-2 hours) In this game each player controls one of the 5 ancient cultures that settled around the Mediterranean Sea in a fictive period BC: Romans, Greeks, Persians, Egyptians and Carthaginians.

Each turn in the game represents a period roughly around 30 years, and it covers the rise (and fall) of the reign of one king. Every ruler will usually be specialized in one of the 5 aspects of the game and will improve its nation in one of those 5 areas: military, science, seafaring, city building and nation expansion. Each representing a type of action the players may execute on their turn.

Every turn, as an action, each player will play one set of cards from his hand, but all cards played must be of the same type. Each action may be activated up to 5 times throughout the game. Every time a player wants to activate the same action, one more card is always required than the previous time. The game ends the moment some player manages to activate any action for the 5th time.

At the end of each round, the player will draw an amount of cards equals to the number of resources his nation controls, but (out of those cards) he will get to keep only a number of cards equal to the number of UNIQUE resources he has.

Players will collect 2 types of victory points: Glory and Culture. Final score is the LOWER of these 2 types of points. At the end of the game, the player with the highest final score wins.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Artistes Misérable
description:
Artistes Misérables is a humorous race-to-the-bottom card game where each player is a 19th century artist, trying to create as many masterworks as possible before dying sick, broke and depressed. In other words, a historical simulation.

A player's muses are Poverty, Infirmity and Despair, represented by colored tokens. These are not only part of your score, they are a threshold that must be reached for the quality of certain paintings, e.g. "you must be this miserable to paint this masterpiece".

On their turn, a player can take two different actions from the following list:

1) Draw a token of any color
2) Play an Action on any player
3) Draw a card
4) Paint a painting

All of these are done in the form of dark humor, from glorying in the despair of being dumped to reveling in the poverty of gambling debts that you will take to your grave unpaid.

The game ends when a player succumbs to the weight of their combined poverty, infirmity and despair (a literal 'sudden death' ending), or when the deck runs out, in which case all the players are drafted into World War 1 and die a horrible death in the trenches of France.

Scoring is based on accumulated misery, and the quality and quantity of paintings you produced before your predictable and unlamented end.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Sudden Death Ending

name: Skogen: Bäck Expansion
description:
Play out new species and elements and rake in more points with the expansion Bäck!

This expansion let's you play Skogen with up to 6 players.

Contains: 3 brook trays 14 species trays, 5 element trays, 3 brook trays, 1 rule booklet, 2 life cards, 2 screens, 2 extra piece holders.
categories: Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Wellerman
description:
You captain a 19th century Weller Brothers supply ship. Your Wellerman sails from Dunedin, New Zealand with four cargo holds which carry sugar, tea, or rum. Use available wind cards to beat the other captains to the destinations where your cargo is currently the most prized. But, the more money your ship earns on a run, the more your crew drinks on shore leave... and jolly crews are slow to return to sea.

Win the game by gathering the most coin before the last sailing season.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Movement Template, Order Counters

name: Stackegories
description:
Stackegories is a fast-thinking word microgame of stacking categories with four ways to play. The base mechanism is finding an answer that fits a restriction and relates to two categories. For example, what's something that Starts with C and is related to Food and School? Cafeteria!

With four ways to play, you can either:

Race your friends to be the first to find an answer.
Come up with the most answers for a grid of categories.
Outlast your opponents by finding answers to an increasingly restricted category.
Cooperate to find a secret answer by giving clues related to the categories.


—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Real-Time

name: The Middle Path
description:
The Middle Path is a board game about everyday Muslim problems. This hilarious, Party-style game, can be played by 2 to 4 players. Play up to 8 players by adding another deck of cards (which can be purchased separately).

Each player will take turns drawing cards from the deck. There are Attack cards, which move you away from the Middle Path, unless you have the correct defend card. Kind Deed cards will take you to the center of the board, unless and opponent ‘steals’ or ‘obstructs’ your kind deeds.

Although a fun party game, there is some strategy to it. Each card in the game simulates real-life problems that Muslims face on a daily basis.

There are 2 ways to win: First to reach the middle path or Last-Muslim-standing.

1 Deck = up to 4 players
2 Decks = up to 8 players
3 Decks = Sectarian violence

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Piensa Palabra
description:
Be the fastest to find a word that meets all 3 conditions.

For lovers of word games, comes this super agile proposal to train mental skills and vocabulary. A game where participants play simultaneously, trying to be the first to say a word that complies the given conditions.

For an easier game or to play with children, you can play with two or one of the categories.

SETUP
Shuffle the 3 condition decks separatedly and reveal the top card from each one.

GAMEPLAY
Each round, players try simultaneously to say a word that complies with the 3 conditions. The first player to find that word, gains 1 point and take one of the 3 cards of their choice, and replace it with the top one of the correspondent deck. Then the next round begins.

The same word can't be used again during the next 3 rounds.
The same category can't be replaced twice in a row.

END OF GAME
The first player to reach 10 points, wins.
mechanics: Race, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Spelling

name: Hopp
description:
With the help of wooden see-saws, you shoot colourful wooden dice into the ‘target box’. (The felt lining muffles any noise!)

Depending on the position inside the grid, the dice hitting the targets score points. Special rules also apply for skilled players; no matter how much chance intervenes, the more you play, the easier it becomes to score hits and the bar can be raised higher. The dice and see-saws can be packed into the solid and lockable wooden box to take away.

The games ends after all dice are thrown.
The player with the most points win. Points depend on the position of the dice in the Target box
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Meanwhile, at the Con....
description:
Meanwhile at the Con is a fast paced hectic drafting game to create the best booth at the Convention!

Players draft 5 cards each round. After drafting, each player adds cards to their tableau to build their booth, or attracts meeples from the convention through marketing cards and generates income in various ways. The player with the most money at the end of 5 rounds wins the game!

Through clever drafting, players can choose to sell either Comic Books, Collectible Toys or Board Games at their booth and build on their quality more. The better the quality, the higher the price.

Hire the right staff for your team and make sure you don't forget your marketing. Fans and customers go to the best booths with the best marketing. Start a craze with the cosplayers or even go as far as creating your own movie based on the game or comic book at your booth!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Market, Open Drafting

name: Filler Clash
description:
Filler Clash is a free board game "print to play", but you don't need to print it to play.

It was created to fill in the gaps between games, to play while you’re waiting anywhere, or just for fun. Players can experience the action of a fighting game and RPG in less than 3 minutes per player.

The idea is simple: each player chooses a character that represents a fighting class. You can use a printed or digital version of it, it's the same! Then using dice, the players will take turns to defeat each other. The last one standing wins.

And something important, depending on the table you play at, it will change the battlefield.
For example a table of 4, or for 6. Or in a bar! Even in a classroom or in the car, even at the cinema before the movie starts.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Martian Expansion
description:
An unofficial game set in the universe of The Expanse.

The players are Martians aiming to dominate the Outer Planets by controlling the most spacecraft destined for each planetary system. Each player has five agents who seek to gain control of spacecraft landing in the Docking Bay of Ceres Space Station before freedom fighters from the Outer Planet Alliance (OPA) capture the spacecraft, and before an OPA Uprising occurs which ends the game.

Quick to learn, set-up and play.

Push-your-luck against the other players, the game’s OPA, and the end of game Uprising which increases in likelihood throughout the game.

Solo mode: challenge yourself against the OPA.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Damnlands
description:
Damnlands :a long time ago, Great Old Ones breached into our world and wrecked chaos and disasters. Humanity managed to survive by combining magic and science, building grate city fortresses. Now after 500 years the Great Old Ones are trying to breach again. A group of exceptional investigators adventurers must break their plans and discover whereabouts of their Avatars (Nemesis) to destroy them...

Damnlands is a turn based, action-selection, rss management, adventure, co-op, variable player powers game, from 1 to 5 players.

On their turn, players will upgrade their characters with cards, resolve skill tests on location and fight minions. Good cooperation is required to ensure success!

Players activate their skills icons with cubes and move on a board.

The game ends if Nemesis track reach the end. Players win when they found and destroy Nemesis in combat.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Splintered Lands
description:
Splintered Lands is a post-apocalypse-themed expandable deck-building game from Civil Dawn Games. Players take on the role of an enclave governor who must lead their people in a fight for survival using a brand new base-defense tactical deck-building game mechanic.

Somehow, you have cobbled together a band of basic fighting men and women to help you survive in the inhospitable wasteland you call home. However, you’ve noticed another group of survivors competing for resources in your area. If you are going to survive for long, you are going to need to spend your ever-dwindling resources to convince new and capable people to join you in the constant struggle...but finding them can be just as difficult as convincing them to come back with you.

Players take turns attacking their opponent, fortifying their enclave, and searching the Dunes to acquire new and powerful characters to join their fight. Defeat your opponent by crippling their authority, and do it quickly -- your opponent will only grow stronger the longer you let them live. Unfortunately, they know it, too.

Each player starts the game with an 11 card deck. Then players choose which factions they want to be represented. Combine your favorite three factions to create the six card Dunes deck. This is where you will find powerful allies to join your enclave. On their turn, players play cards, pick cards, and arrange/navigate cards on their side. The game ends when one player has had their Authority (life) reduced to 0 due to actions happening in the game. A player wins by reducing their opponents Authority (life) to 0 or below.

Along with the four starting factions, Splintered Lands has five expansions already planned out. Each expansion contains two new factions, plus exclusive bonus content. These unique boosters create new ways to engage with the world of Splintered Lands, giving players optional new ways to defeat their opponents, new and interesting mechanics to discover, and unusual aberrant creatures to defend with or against.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Constrained Bidding, Deck Construction, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Envy
description:
The illustrious Carnegie family is hosting a giant party of frivolity, laughter and a few spiked drinks. From Gatsby to Governors, everyone's invited for the riotous affair. Unfortunately, the bloodied dead body suggests there are one too many guests. Was it a jealous lover? Or filthy blackmail? Or plain old fashioned Envy? This is the bloody 1920's at its worst.

Envy is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a 1920's Gatsby style murder mystery escape room experience. What's it like? Well, imagine what would happen if you mixed an escape room and a house party in a cocktail shaker. That's Envy.

This printable escape room kit combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laidback ease of group party games. Players will work together to solve the mystery of Lord Carnegie’s murder, before time runs out. Gameplay is centered on a series of puzzle sheets hidden around the room. Each puzzle solved puts you one step closer to cuffing the killer red-handed (literally… there’s blood everywhere!).

Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then pitting them against each other to see who finishes the game first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.
categories: Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Alone Against Fear: The Coming of the Dark Templars
description:
The Coming of the Dark Templars is a short adventure for Alone Against Fear.

Will you manage to stop cursed crusaders who come back to life to avenge the times when they were judged, tortured, maimed and killed?

You move on a map (a poster-sized image is included in the download) trying to avoid the cursed crusaders -- who are blind, but have a special sense allowing them to hear your heartbeat.

Requires only the core Alone Against Fear book.

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Imperial Legion Faction Starter Set
description:
Protect Tamriel and the third empire from your enemies with the staunch heroes of the imperial legion. Hadvar provides leadership and tactical expertise to the legion troops and is supported by the imperial mage, whose expertise with magic and weapons makes her deadly at range and up close. Finally, three imperial swordsmen provide a stalwart backbone for your force.

This set contains five 32mm scale high quality multi-part hard plastic miniatures with bases. Requires some assembly. Supplied unpainted. Scenic bases not included.

Hadvar, Hero of Helgen
Imperial Mage, Spellsword
Imperial Soldiers with Sword and Shield

For use with Elder Scrolls: A Call to Arms Core Rules.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Catastrophe
description:
In Catastrophe, you and your friends prepare for an unforeseen disaster, securing resources and surviving the impacts to emerge alive together!

Players may be hit with any one of Catastrophe’s nine possible disasters. Can you survive an earthquake? What about a volcano or cyber attack? Maybe a radiological disaster will test your mettle. Strategize your way through seven potential emergency impacts with a wild card each round that will catch everyone by surprise. Will you hoard your resources or share with your neighbors?

The player who survives with the most vitality tokens will win, but be careful — if anyone perishes, the game is lost for all!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Docentis
description:
Docentis is a game where you become a PE teacher whose goal is to plan an innovation project for the class. For that purpose, you will have to meet your students’ specific needs, manage playground spaces, consider meteorology, defective material, internship students and all kind of contingencies that may affect your planning. You may need to take care of the students during their break, substitute another teacher or respond to a headmaster’s request. Will you finish the day exhausted, or will you have some energy left for teacher’s training after class? Will you be able to carry out your dreamed project?

The goal is to obtain the highest score amongst all the players by obtaining the different parts of each project. Some of them are:
- Curricular elements: educational goals, skills, contents, and evaluation.
- Methodological elements: teaching styles and pedagogical models.
- Teacher cards from other subjects’ colleagues, training courses or school trips.

Players will take turns to discover the school facilities in the game board, trying to obtain their project’s element cards.
Energy will be the currency of exchange to get the elements and will increase or decrease during the course of the game.

At the end of the 6th shift (6th hour of class), a count will be made of the elements achieved (+2) and those that remain to be achieved (-1). The one with the highest score will be the winner of the game.

In its educational version, once the game is over, the elements obtained can be used to develop a real case study.


Docentis es un juego en el que te convertirás en docente de Educación Física que debe planificar un proyecto de innovación para su clase. Para ello, deberás atender a las necesidades específicas de tus estudiantes, gestionar los espacios del patio, tener en cuenta la meteorología, el material defectuoso, la llegada de los estudiantes de prácticas y otras muchas situaciones que acontecen en el transcurso del día que dificultarán o facilitarán tus planes (recreos, sustituciones, avisos de dirección, etc.) ¿Terminarás agotado al finalizar el día o te queda energía para un curso de formación? ¿Serás capaz de lograr el proyecto soñado? El objetivo del juego es convertirte en la persona que consiga la máxima puntuación, que estará determinada por la obtención de los diferentes elementos que componen cada proyecto. Algunos de ellos son:
- Elementos curriculares: Objetivos, competencias, contenidos y evaluación
- Elementos metodológicos: Estilos de enseñanza y modelos pedagógicos
- Además de cartas de profesorado de otras materias, cursos de formación o excursiones.

Turno a turno, las personas que juegan recorrerán por el tablero las diferentes instalaciones de su centro educativo consiguiendo distintas cartas de elemento que componen su proyecto. Su energía será la moneda de cambio que deberán gestionar durante toda la partida. Ahora bien, la limitación de recursos y espacios generarán encuentros y sinergias entre compañeros de departamento que se verán obligados a cooperar si quieren alzarse con la victoria.
Todos aquellos elementos conseguidos otorgarán puntos positivos y aquellos que no se logren puntuarán en negativo. Cuando el día lectivo haya finalizado, si eres el profesor que más se acercó al proyecto planificado… ¡ganarás la partida!
En su versión educativa, una vez finalizado el juego se puede utilizar el resultado de la partida para desarrollar un supuesto práctico real con los elementos conseguido. Sin duda, un interesante serious game para futuros docentes.
mechanics: Memory, Negotiation, Simulation, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Der Fluch des Waldes II (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary.

Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.

Robin and his friends took the injured Guardian to the secret camp and were concerned if he would survive this unpredictable onslaught. Robin paced frantically, pondering who was behind this evil could. Because only he can save the keeper so that he can recover. It was clear that the Sheriff of Nottingham must be behind this curse, for the sheriff had been following her for a long time. The forest was a good hiding place and the guards always had great difficulty finding them. Suddenly voices were heard nearby. The sheriff's guards were alarmed, because Nottingham was swarming with soldiers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tyranny of Blood: India's Caste System Under British Colonialism, 1750-1947
description:
The first place winner of the 2021 Zenobia Awards, Tyranny of Blood models the rise and fall of British colonialism in India from 1750 to around 1947, and the ensuing social displacement—in the religious, military, economic, and labor domains—that still resonate today. The game seeks to answer the lofty questions: how do classes with disparate bases of power work together in a society, how do they struggle against each other, and who are the victims of this process?

In this asymmetric card-driven game, each player plays as one of the four major caste groups (Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra/Dalit) with the end goal of shaping the coming independent Indian nation-state to support their interests while dealing with their unique and unequal places in the hierarchy. Each faction has its own role to play in the game and its own method of earning victory points based on its distinct goals.

In this game, the British are not a playable faction, but a non-player force that players will have to respond to, either by fighting against colonial forces, or working with them to oppose the other players.

Designer note: Tyranny of Blood is about a hierarchical system that has oppressed people throughout history and has lingering effects that continue to cause suffering today. The game is meant as a condemnation of the system and a method of understanding it, not an endorsement or celebration. I hope that learning about this history will inspire players to think critically about the inequalities that plague the world today, and to struggle against them.
categories: Age of Reason, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Religious, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Connections, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: BattleTech: MapPack – WWE2018 Terrain Set
description:
BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Use these sheets in conjunction with the random terrain tables found in Total Warfare, or any time you need a quick map, but transporting physical terrain is impractical. Mount them on poster board or cardboard for longevity, or cut them up to mix and match your own unique battlefields.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Map Addition

name: Rapture: Angels Starter Box
description:
One of the game factions.

The Angels were created by a civilization classified as Type III on the Kardashev scale - commonly refered as "gods" - in the center of the Milky Way. Originally entrusted with the cultivation and harvesting processes, the angels were further developed into combat units after the first confrontation with the Lhon'Dar.

Once the harvesting sphere has been successfully deployed on a planet, the angels are responsible for cleansing the planet and preparing it for the next cultivation.

The angels appear to absorb the light around them, which is why they always seem to be surrounded by darkness.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Line of Sight, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Being Mr Bean
description:
"Goodness me. Doesn't time fly when you're enjoying yourself?"
- Mr Bean

Laugh out loud with this hilarious, storytelling party game where you get to get be Mr Bean!

Whether taking a leisurely stroll or making a holiday dinner, Mr Bean makes funny situations out of anything! Now it's your turn!

Lights, camera, ACTION! In Being Mr Bean, you set the scene!

Each round, one player acts as a Director and reveals a Scene card. The other players then take turns trying to explain, emote, or act out what happens next in an iconic moment from a Mr Bean comedy sketch... but watch out for the TWIST!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: BattleTech: Aerospace Battlemat
description:
Aerospace BattleMat was made available exclusively at GenCon 2021.

It is a double-sized, double-sided 36” x 22" neoprene map with an aerospace theme. Side A is Aerospace #1 and Side B is Planetary Invasion #1.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition

name: BattleTech: Tundra/Grasslands Battlemat
description:
This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The map is high-resolution with great color quality, making it one of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility. The primary side includes a never-before published map Tundra terrain.

The secondary side also includes brand-new maps—designed to be used together.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: BattleTech: Holth Forest/Lake Losiije Battlemat
description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Holth Forest (Clan Ghost Bear) on one side and Lake Losije (Clan Nova Cat) on the other side.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: BattleTech: Robyn's Crossing/Devil's Bath Battlemat
description:
Battles of Tukayyid Battlemat

This map is 34” x 22", the perfect "two-map" size for most games. The maps are high-resolution with great color quality, making them some of the most beautiful and durable BattleTech maps ever produced. The neoprene is also thin for ease of storage, and double-sided for versatility.

This map details the Robyn's Crossing (Clan Jade Falcon) on one side and Devil's Bath (Clan Steel Viper) on the other side.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: BattleTech: House Arano – The Aurigan Coalition
description:
High Lady Kamea Arano led a rebellion, dispatched the usurpers who stole her throne, dismantled their dictatorial government, and restored peace to the Aurigan Coalition. Now her true battle begins…

The Arano Restoration has succeeded, and High Lady Kamea rules over the reunited Aurigan Coalition. But all is not well – the Coalition’s hardscrabble planets teeter on the brink of collapse, while its powerful neighbors await another chance to subvert House Arano. More than ever, the Coalition needs warriors willing to do whatever it takes to claim victory.

House Arano: The Aurigan Coalition brings the setting of the hit PC strategy game BattleTech into the long-running tabletop experience. Learn the proud history of the Coalition and its hope for the future, then take up the defense of the Arano dynasty with four all-new scenarios picking up where the game left off.

To survive on the fringes of the Inner Sphere, those of noble birth must once again call on champions of mercenary mind.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Candies for Cthulhu
description: Candies for Cthulhu is a printable Roll & Write in which the Cthulhu gang has become addicted to sugar and will attack on Halloween all the houses that do not have supplies of sweets, that is why we must deliver the different packages of sweets and protect all the houses in our neighborhood.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Arcmage: Shadow Waves
description:
The fourth core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Most Cutest
description:
Is Amy Doghouse cuter than Authur the baby rhino? What about Meatball the Meerkat? It’s all relative as you take turns picking the Most Cutest animal around, and trying to guess how the other players voted.

Gameplay is simple; draw a series of adorable animal cards face up onto the table, and take turns being the cuteness critic, secretly choosing which you think is the cutest. Then the other players take turns guessing your choice and earning points along the way.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Arachnid
description:
You are part of a colony of intelligent spiders in a secret military research base struggling to survive in a harsh “Bug eat Bug” world. Build your web, grow your colony and enhance your skills as you struggle to gain food and fend off attackers. There is an ominous humming sound as the Hoover-Bot 3000 gets closer and closer to the web, threatening a to destroy to your colony in a horrible Hoovergeddon. Your only chance is build an EMP (Electro Magnetic Pulse weapon) from parts you find in the lab and fire it off to destroy the Hoover-Bot. Can you build the EMP in time, or will you be overrun by attacking critters and meet your Hoovergeddon.

Game Description

Arachnid is a cooperative game for 2-4 players. Each player is a spider with unique abilities controlled by their own action board with upgradable worker placement spots. The center play area is a hex grid, where the spiders reside and tiles are placed as the web is spun. This shared web is the spider’s home, where food is trapped, new skills are acquired, and new workers are hatched.

Flies occasionally fly by, becoming trapped, and eventually, food. Players influence when the Flies are triggered, but this also increases the risk of Critters attacking the web. It's a fine balance between starvation and safety. Players can also enhance their spider skills, but this involves sacrificing parts of their valuable web home.

How to lose

-If the web somehow becomes detached from the edges of the board due to critter attacks, it will mean the end of the colony.

-if the Golden Scarab reached the Den in the center of the web , then "Activates", the colony will be destroyed.

-If the the Hoover-Bot reaches the web, the game will end in a horrible Hoovergeddon.

How to win

Find enough spare parts to create the EMP, then all spiders meet at the Den to set it off and fry the Hoover-Bot. Easy as Pie!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Events, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: Althing: Sous le signe d'Hela
description:
Althing is the first expansion to the game Althing with 22 new cards. It includes a set of modules, complementary or independent, that will renew your games and the way you approach Althing, even in solo mode.

- Thorfinn legend (solo mode)
- Coward troll
- An epic under the sign of Hela : Add Hela cards under the step cards to add special effects to those steps
- Stridur and Bolvun : this module adds 2 new step cards with special effects.
- Loki, Tyr, Idunn are new player cards with new effects
- Jotünn : new vikking card with more options to trick your opponents

If you want to win, you still have to speed up your opponents in the race for the throne... But with this expansion you have new challenges to face, and new options to win!
mechanics: Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Symposium: A Game About Asking Questions
description:
Symposium is a Descended From The Queen storytelling card game for 3-8 players, simulating a philosophical dinner party (or "symposium") in the classical style of the ancient Greek world and based on Plato's work of the same name, with some modifications to make it more accessible to a modern audience.

In the game you play guests at dinner party filled with interesting people: philosophers, poets, doctors, playwrights, and many others. All the best things in life are there: good food, wine, beautiful servants, and interesting conversation. You are a guest, and after you get comfortable your host makes a request of you: make a speech in praise of love. Every guest gives a speech, the contents of which are directed by a different metaphysical perspective. If your speech is the best one, the host will award you the relevant card.

After this initial round of play the role of host shifts, new perspectives are selected, and a new Question card is drawn by a new host; introducing the players to a variety of interesting questions. (What is is to be wise? What is courage? Why do I still love them?) Fresh speeches are given, and the card is awarded. Play continues in this manner until the You are drunk card is selected, at which point the game is over. The guest with the most cards at the end of the game not only wins, but is also the wisest.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Player Judge

name: Europa Tour
description:
In Europa Tour, each player starts in Amsterdam and tries to complete their trip; East, West, South or North, through Europe as quick as possible. The aim of the game is to make his journey through Europe as quickly as possible by adding the city cards of your route in the correct sequence to your route. Each route visits 16 European cities and requires 8 Visa cards at certain specific points of the route for border crossings. You win the game by being the first player to finish your route and end up back in Amsterdam.

The game starts with every player in Amsterdam, the other 96 cards of all four routes (16 city cards and 8 visa cards per route) are then shuffled and put into a grid formation on the table.

During their turn, a player flips 2 cards of their choice and if they fit, extend their trip by adding the cards to their line.

If one or both of the cards are part of your trip but not adjacent to the city you are in, you can safe the card(s) by switching it/them with another one (logically with a card in the grid close to you). At the end of your turn, you flip back all cards.

Some advancements of the routes require visa cards which need to be placed before you are able to advance, and the visa cards are shared between North & East and shared between South & West. Visa cards cannot be saved. The end point of Amsterdam can also not be saved.

This game can be summarized as a game of memory, where you can safe cards for later use and where their is a small competition for visa cards between players (South&West and North&East).
mechanics: Memory, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Montsoriu: the legend of Sant Joan
description:
Montsoriu: the legend of Sant Joan is a game of ingenuity, chance and strategy where you have to play your cards very well to get hold of the riches of Montsoriu. Getting the treasure will not be an easy task!

On each turn, layers pick and play 2 development cards. The first player to reach and activate four target cards, wins.



Montsoriu: la llegenda de Sant Joan és un joc d'enginy, atzar i estratègia on hauràs de jugar molt bé les teves cartes per fer-te amb les riqueses de Montsoriu. Aconseguir el tresor no serà tasca fàcil!
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Lose a Turn, Pick-up and Deliver, Traitor Game

name: Gather Your Party: Tavern Edition
description:
Gather Your Party is a 2-4 player tavern party game where you and your friends compete to gain the most Reputation in the tavern. Recruit Patrons, Send Drink Tokens, Complete Quests and avoid all perils of a night out at the tavern.

To win, players will have to manage how much Reputation they have, and how much they Drink.

Get four (4) Reputation, win the game. Get four (4) Drink tokens, get knocked out.

Players will take turns adding Patrons to their parties, completing Quests and avoid getting too drunk. Once you gain enough Reputation from completing Quests, you become a Drinking Legend and win the game.

Alternatively, you can drink your friends under-the-table and become the last player standing. There are many different Patrons and Events cards that give and take away Drinks, but essentially, if you hit your limit of 4 Drink Tokens, you are knocked out of the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Vossa Excelência: Calamidade Pública
description:
The world has plunged into a pandemic. Fear, economic ruin, and death are everywhere. Governments are opening their coffers and implementing emergency measures against the virus. And what does all this mean for Your Excellency?
It's time to make money, A LOT of money.

Vossa Excelência: Expansão Calamidade Pública (Your Excellency: Public Calamity Expansion) is a standalone expansion that can be played alone or in conjunction with Your Excellency – The Political Game and its other expansions. In this expansion, you assume the role of a newly-elected federal deputy who needs to take advantage of the perfect storm of a pandemic to gather support, voters and (lots of) money, thus ensuring his permanence in power.

Can be played alone (for 1 to 3 players) or combined with the other products in the series.

Includes 60 cards:


3 Politician cards
3 Party cards
13 Supporter cards
16 Maneuvers cards
7 Event cards
10 Electorate cards
8 Infamy cards
15 money markers
1 dice
1 instruction sheet
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Simulation, Take That

name: Godzilla Battle: Monster Card Showdown!
description:
Godzilla Battle: Monster Card Showdown! is a two-player battle card game based on rock-paper-scissors. Choose one from each of the four popular monsters: "Godzilla," "Mothra," "King Ghidorah," and "Mechagodzilla," and aim to win the battle by utilizing skills and playing cards like a fighting card game.

Similar to the rules of rock-paper-scissors, the success or failure of a match is determined by the choosing of one of the three fighting styles "Goo, Par, Choki" (Rock, Paper, Scissors) written on the card. Keep in mind though that even if you lose the fighting style choice, you can still overcome your opponent and win by utilizing your monster's special abilities. There are a variety of effects monsters have using these special abilities. You'll have to play to find out and master them all!

Let's aim for victory by making full use of powerful techniques!
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 2
description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Mimic” lets you copy a card

Use it to make a "copy" of any active card on the table and put it in your hand. Just pick a card that's in play (including ongoing effects), grab it, and put Mimic in its place. It's like Steal and Reserve combined – only better!

“Decoy” is a new reaction card

This reaction card prevents you from being affected. After resolving the action you're reacting to, you can't be touched until your next turn. Drop this decoy down and make your escape!

“Cheat” lets you take from the discards

Yes, any card. Just play Cheat, then start digging through the discard pile like a crazy person until you find that sweet card which your opponent foolishly threw away. It's yours now! Oh, and you can Boost it, letting you take more cards. This can be a big game-changer.

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Runes of Zun: Promo Card Set 3
description:
A set of rare and powerful cards for Runes of Zun. Each card is designed to make gameplay a little crazy. Include one, two, or all three in your Runes of Zun deck to spice up your game. You can even add multiple copies of the three cards – play your way!

“Surge” lets you power up

Use it to peek at the top 5 cards in the deck and put any modifiers you find right into your hand! After you put the rest of the cards you looked at back on top of the deck, you'll have advanced knowledge of those cards, which can be very useful.

“Divine” lets you get an extra card every turn

Take a card from the deck at the end of your turn. If you can also guess the card type before you take it, you can keep Divine in play for your next turn!

“Absorb” is a new reaction card

Play it as a reaction, then take that action and any modifiers played against you into your hand. Sweet, sweet revenge...

Note: The Kickstarter version has a star on the cards that identify them as from the Kickstarter. Second printing doesn’t.
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Events, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game

name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Climas
description:
8-card Weather expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval.


The second expansion of the game that adds a weather mechanic that will modify the conditions of how we play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: That's Bananas
description:
That's Bananas is a bluffing party game for 3 to 8 players, where all but one bad apple in the bunch can share in the victory (must provide your own bad apples).

That's Bananas adds a fresh theme and a unique twist to the genre! Collect 4 identical fruit cards, or be unable to play when required, and you lose. Everyone else shares in the victory!

However, a player who calls a bluff correctly earns a Banana card. Banana cards can provide increasingly devastating disadvantages to the player of your choice. Use your Banana cards at the right time, and you can ensure a group victory (or a single loss, depending on how you want to look at it)!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Single Loser Game

name: 2 Simple Rules: Co-Op dice game
description:
A co-op dice game for 2 to 5 players of simple rules and dice rerolling. Everyone gets four dice, then a goal is revealed and then 2 simple rules. Everyone tries to add to the goal before everyone has to reroll.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Tempus Mortis
description:
Tempus Mortis is a miniatures based MOBA game with several beautiful maps, rich characters and exciting objectives. Players can use miniatures from any system or company they want. Tempus Mortis is a free download.

2+ Players - In Tempus Mortis players will choose a map and be dealt 2 objectives, choosing one that will hopefully win them the game. Objective's can include area control, assassination's and more. Players then draft from a set of heroes that will best suit their objective. They will gain a hero character card and a deck.

Gameplay involved moving miniatures around the map via a set of basic actions or using cards that specify special moves. Heroes can all move and attack, but they also all have a set of unique abilities and passive skills that players will need to utilise to complete the game.

Solo Mode - There is a solo campaign based on one of the Tempus Mortis realms taking the player through an exotic and immersive story while completing story based objectives. The player will gain experience over time upgrading their character.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Set-up

name: Cards Against Humanity: Jack White Pack
description: The 2018 Jack White Concert 6 Jack White themed regulation-sized Cards Against Humanity white cards and 1 regulation-size Cards Against Humanity black card. Made by Matthew Jacobson and Cards Against Humanity. The cards were sold at the show with a 18x24 inch double-sided poster that was silkscreened in Chicago by Baker Prints.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Operation Neptune
description:
The British assault on the river Seine in August 1944.

This historical ASL (HASL) module includes:

10 scenarios plus a campaign game
1 25"x25" map
90 1/2" counters
32 5/8" counters
Rules
Chapter Divider card.


This is not a complete game. Ownership of the following products are required to play all of the included scenarios:

BFP: Either of the following: Poland in Flames or Onslaught to Orsha 2 (2 counters needed)
MMP/Hasbro/AH: Beyond Valor, For King and Country (or West of Alamein)

3 of the scenarios need boards from other MMP products.
ON 1-7 use the HASL map
ON-8 uses boards 81 and 83 from Forgotten War
ON-9 uses boards 1b and 4b from Action Pack 6 & Action Pack 8
ON-10 uses board 7a from Action Pack 9
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Pandemia
description:
PANDEMIA is a competitive strategy game for 1 to 4 players.

In this game, players need to manage resources to protect the world from a spreading virus. Players are assigned different areas and objectives at the beginning of the game and, by turns, will perform different actions to create synergies and score points.

Easy to learn but hard to master, "Pandemia: Raging Outbreak" brings some innovative mechanics to the soft-medium euro genre by adding a moderate level of randomness that forces you to collaborate with your opponents and adapt your strategy as the game evolves.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Territory Building, Travel, Word Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Kantin Wars
description:
A card game for people who love playing with their food, or throwing them at other people.

From the co-creator of The Cikgu Life, comes a game inspired about a real food fight that broke out in a school canteen. Kantin Wars will remind you of the food you enjoyed back in school, while also allowing you to sabo the people around you.

Players draw food cards which they can throw at each other, until the Discipline Teacher shows up and punishes them all! Play different cards that help you throw better, dodge flying food, hide away or even wash up to ensure you stay clean during the fight!
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Depths of Courage: The Raid on Alexandria, December 19, 1941
description:
Depths of Courage volume 9 is a solitaire game on the Italian mini-sub attack on Alexandria Harbor. The active player takes on the role of the commanders of the three, two-man crew S.L.C. (Siluro Lenta Corsa) Maiale (Pig) class mini-submarines. You must endeavor to overcome the Allied defenses and night-time visibility to inflict as much damage as possible before being killed, captured or escaping.

Each copy of Depths of Courage volume 9 is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 point-to-point map
20 double sided, un-mounted counters
6 pages of rules with designer notes and bibliography

Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards (a custom card set for the entire series of games is available) and six sided die to play the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Hockey Chess
description:
A hockey game using 6 chess pieces per side to represent, goalies, Forwards, Defenders, Centers, etc. Each chess piece has a two-number "skating ability" that it uses to move along the hockey rink as it tries to score a goal, or block an opponent. The chess pieces move on the rink along lines connected to boxes, so it is a point-to-point movement, in an attempt to get into scoring position.

A game is complete when one team has scored a goal. A longer version can be played by allowing 12 movement turns per team to complete one period of play with as many goals as can be scored within that 12 move period. After three periods have been completed the game is won by the team with the most goals.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement

name: Daddy Issues
description:
Have you heard the story of the father who "went for cigarettes" and never came back? You play as that guy! The premise is simple: you win the game by getting a pack of cigarettes and returning home in one piece... but that ain't easy when the city is full of dangers, fat pigeons, criminals, and... werewolves?

The dangerous journey can cost you your life... or worse, make you late for your anniversary!











Daddy Issues was created for the 10th BGG Roll & Write contest. It is a highly thematic solo roll & write that combines dark humor, RPG-like narrative, and light management elements. Each run through the city is completely unique, as you roll the dice to explore, fight, and even draw your own map!











You will immerse yourself in a dangerous world of crime and the paranormal. You will be navigating the mean streets day and night while receiving texts from your family and making tough decisions. Time is not on your side, so make every choice count! Trust me, you really don't wanna miss your anniversary!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Gettysburg (Second Edition)
description:
A new edition of the first Last Full Measure title; Gettysburg with a larger map in size and area covered; new map art and colors; new charts and tables; and new counters.

The Last Full Measure Series is a collection of brigade-level wargames covering battles of the American Civil War. The games use regiments to represent the brigades on the map, and allow them to occupy multiple hexes. LFM is an intermediate rules set that includes cavalry charges, ranged artillery fire, and a simple command system, at a scale 250 yards per hex and 100 men per strength point.
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Hazardous Movement Scenario Pack 2: The Un-Civil Wars
description:
Hazardous Movement Scenario Pack 2: The Un-Civil Wars thematizes three very consequential civil conflicts that took place immediately before and after the Second World War: in Spain (1936-1939), Greece (1944-1949) and China (where civil war resumed in 1945 and ended in 1949). The pack consists of 10 exciting, innovative scenarios spanning these years. Civil wars, ironically, are very bitter affairs, a fact that is reflected in the combination of No Quarter, Hand-to-Hand Close Combat and Political Commissars (for the Communists) that makes for particularly violent scenarios, even by ASL standards . . .

—description from the publisher

Ten scenarios for ASL focussing on Civil Wars
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Totally Medieval
description:
Totally Medieval is a game where you control opposing Armies. As you move closer to your opponent you will find new terrain and different weather systems which may help or hinder your progress. When you meet your opponent's army, be ready to attack and/or defend yourself so you can stop or slow down their advances on your homeland. Your survival is based on your success in keeping your opponent from advancing. Your goal is take over their homeland before they take yours.

In the base game you will start as Viking or knights with other types of people to come later. Each type of person comes with historical aspect to each person on the team.

This game also comes with a great twist of the dice roll. In a game that would normally have a pair dice to roll and move your army's around you draw cards instead. These cards are call Math dice and they come in different levels of Math. Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, division and Algebra and all the choices you could use. Each player would draw a card and have the opponent draw it solve it to get a bonus for each battle.

So for this game you will learn a little fun history and solve a few math problems. With the upgraded armies to miniatures you gain a great chess set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Exploration, Math, Medieval
mechanics: Area Movement, Different Dice Movement, Zone of Control

name: Allies
description:
Legend has it that long ago, Gah'dir the supreme mage forged a weapon known as the Scarlet Sword in order to form an alliance with Bashok the great orc king. By wielding the sword together, they created the most powerful alliance ever built among enemies and gained a power like no other. Since then, the sword has disappeared and reappeared many times over the years and it has determined the destiny of all nations time and time again.
Recently, the legendary Scarlet Sword was rediscovered, causing the most powerful leaders in all the land to seek out an ally and once again prepare for war.

In Allies, you will create and control a fantasy army by uniting two different factions of your choice. You can either use your cards to command your troops or deploy them onto the battlefield. The unique abilities of each faction can be combined to create many different synergies, so choose wisely.

Allies is a competitive two-player card game in which every move matters. It includes tactical and strategic components. Prepare your strategies well and don’t get distracted! Remember that your plans need to change constantly to anticipate your enemies’ movements as well as to disrupt them.

In the end, the army that gains control of the battlefield first claims victory!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Shootout in Dingstown
description:
In this tabletop adventure you take over a gang of up to 8 cowboys or other western characters and compete against your fellow players in Dingstown. You can equip your heroes with their own character traits that make them unique in the game.
The game with German-language rules is not only suitable for skirmishes in the Wild West, but also on all other locations.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Chilli or Chunder
description:
As chilli eating contestants there are two things you focus on: Eating more chillies than the other contestants. The other... Not chundering!

Over five rounds of ever increasing hotness, you will eat your way through each chilli, bite by bite. You will need to keep down the bites and once the whole chilli is gone, you show your empty mouth before progressing to the next round. Or fall victim to the chilli, either by failing to take the next bite or chundering it back up.

Outlast your fellow contestants to take the crowning glory and become the Chilli or Chunder Champion!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Duellum
description:
Two gladiators face each other in the arena.

Each player choses a card from the 5 available, and they are revealed simultaneously. Effects include damage to your opponent, pushing him on the ground, and raising yourself from the ground. The effect depends also on what your opponent plays - try to guess his move. You can't chose the same action twice in a row.

The first gladiator to inflict at least 5 damage points to the opponent wins.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, Italian edition, issue #13.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): Order Battletome – Daughters of Khaine
description:
Guided by the will of Morathi, their mysterious and cunning ruler, Khaine’s faithful go forth in search of conquest and sacrifice.

With their mix of highly-mobile, aggressive units, empowering sorcery, and deadly Heroes, this is an army that wants to get in their opponents face. This battletome will help generals make the most of their unusual abilities and tactics. Customise your army to your preferred play style with six different Temples of Khaine, each with their own abilities, traits, and Artefacts of Power. This essential guide also contains a wealth of updated background material detailing the aftermath of events in Broken Realms: Morathi, painting guides, and stunning art.

This 104-page hardback book contains:


Allegiance abilities for the Daughters of Khaine, including a variety of battle traits
6 Temples of Khaine, including abilities, command traits, and Artefacts of Power.
Lore of Shadows spell table
Prayers of the Khainite Cult prayer table
1 Ceremony of Blood battleplan
Rules for creating a Daughters of Khaine warband for Path to Glory, including Champion and Followers Rewards Tables
7 warscroll battalions
23 warscrolls, including 2 endless spells and 1 Invocation of Khaine warscroll
Pitched battle profiles for all units and endless spells featured in this battletome.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Evil:101
description:
Evil:101 is a card game for 2-6 people between the ages 13-Infinity. It is a fast-paced warm up game for those game nights when one or two players are running a bit late.

The theme is a parody of the old spy thriller genre.

The majority of the players act as villains attempting to set their various plots into action, while one player acts as the Agent, trying to trip up the rest. After each round the role of the Agent goes to a new player.

Victory depends on how much Evil you can spread throughout the world, with points being given based on how well the plan fit with the target of your evil deeds.

Every round, the Evil players lay down one of their Plot cards, face down on one Target card, matching all the Plots symbols with the symbols on the Target card. No two players can place their Plot on the same Target. The player acting as the Agent then tries to guess which symbols each Evil player has used on each Target, and place their D.I.C. Agent card with the symbol of their choice on each Plot. If the Agent guess right, no points are given to the Evil player. If the Agent guess wrong, the Evil player gets points according to the Plot and the corresponding symbols on the Target. The Agent does not get any victory points even if they foil a Plot. Chase cards may be used by the Evil player to escape with their points if the Agent guessed right, and the Agent may respond in kind. The players then replenish their hand and may buy new Chase cards for a victory point cost.
First player to 20 points wins and ends the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Matching, Push Your Luck, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Turn Order: Progressive, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Save the Cat
description:
A game in which we help the firefighter to put out the fire in order to save the kitten that has been trapped on the roof.

Players take turns to roll a dice and do actions: move the firefighter around the board, put out fires or place fires on the board.
If the firefighter manages to get back to the fire engine with the cat all players win. Otherwise everyone loses and the game is over.

A game that works on learning about numbers and their value, generates debate to reach agreements on the best strategy to follow and helps to manage tension.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Guess My Dress
description:
Dress your character as creatively as you can and hide him behind the wardrobe. Now your opponent, based on deductions, must try to dress his character as you have done. If he guesses correctly, he wins!

Each player receives a game board which they place in front of them with the undressed character.
Each player receives a full set of clothes.
One game has two rounds and each round has three steps:
1: Player 1 dresses their character
2: Player 2 uses their intuition to dress their character then asks player 1 to validate their guess using the validation counters.
3: If player 2 has correctly guessed all three items of clothing win their round. If they have guessed any of the clothes incorrectly, they have to interpret the validation counters to deduce the correct combination. Then, player 2 repeats step 2, modifying their character’s outfit and asking for a new validation.
If player 2 does not guess the winning combination after five attempts, they lose their round.
The number of attempts is marked on the counter panel.

When the first round has finished, the players switch roles and play a second round: player 1 becomes player 2 and vice versa.

If both players have won a round each, the winner is the person who won their round with the least number of guesses.
mechanics: Deduction

name: Valavendur
description:
In Valavendur you fight as a sorcerer for the rule over the magic land Valavendur.

Players play hidden karma and attack cards against each other and bet the game currency Vita to attack their opponents. Using Vita allows players to build towers in the kingdoms of Valavendur.

You need to be able to read and bluff your opponents and build your towers in a strategic way to get the most points in the end to win this game. Each round a player plays one karma or attack card and the game ends when all karma and attack cards have been played or when a single player has built 50 towers on the board.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection

name: Exceed: Under Night In-Birth – Londrekia
description:
Under Night In-Birth makes its way from the arcade to your tabletop with the Exceed Fighting System! Each fighter’s unique special moves and personal strategies have been translated to the tabletop in stunning detail.

Londrekia's aggressive style holds the advantage while building up power for massive payoffs.

Not a complete game. Requires another Exceed Fighter to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroclix: Fantastic Four
description:
In this set, the Fantastic Four are joined by some of their favorite allies such as Wolverine, Ghost Rider and the Silver Surfer to take on some of their greatest nemesis. Dr Doom, Skrulls and the Frightful are just some of their enemies awaiting them on the battlefield. This

Heroclix set contains 16 Common, 16 Uncommon, 16 Rare, 12 Super Rare, 4 Prime and 6 Chase figures for you to collect.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: As Long As The Grass Grows
description:
Your Father has provided a country large enough for all of you, and he advises you to remove to it. There your white brothers will not trouble you; they will have no claim to the land, and you can live upon it, you and all your children, as long as the grass grows or the water runs, in peace and plenty. It will be yours forever.

President Andrew Jackson
