Seeking the magical wood of the Takka trees, which endows the Floating Isles and their giant fox denizens with the ability to levitate, the merchants built a vast fleet of sky ships. Swarming over the islands like a pestilence, they established ports, seized resources and displaced the cloud foxes.

You are the leader of a cloud fox clan and have allied with a band of human outlaws to take back your homeland. With the other clans competing for their share, will you be top fox in the new order?

GAMEPLAY:

The game takes place on a 6x6 grid. Roll three dice and assign one to select a row on the grid. Assign a second dice to select a column and the third dice determines what type of fox tile you get to place.

Each fox tile has an ability that activates immediately when placed as well a 'Control' value which determines how much control you have over the adjacent islands. Whoever has the most control over an island at the end of the game will score Vulpis Points (VP) for it.

You can also score VP for looting merchant ships and trading the resources with the matching ports at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Trick Builder
description:
In this trick taking deck builder game you will be building your own personal deck to be then used to take tricks. Be the first person to win enough tricks to win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Stardriven: Gateway
description:
Stardriven: Gateway is a game for 1 to 4 players where you control your own starship and crew to determine the fate of distant colonies near an ancient alien Gateway. It can be played competitive, cooperative, or solo depending on which Episode is selected at game set up.

Running your Starship entails assigning crew to different stations on your ship board, which allows you to assign dice to those stations to activate ship actions. Move and explore space, encounter Raiders, face Anomalies and use your crew abilities and skills to fulfill Mission requirements and activate their bonuses. Manage your ship’s power, weapons and shields, promote crew and recruit new crew to enhance your ship and achieve your objectives to ensure your side prevails.

—descroiption from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Set-up

name: Perplexus Rebel
description: Perplexus Rebel is a solo dexterity 3-D maze game where players must maneuver a small marble around challenging barriers inside a transparent sphere, but where a wrong move can spell failure and require you to return to the start. With 70 barriers to overcome
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Perplexus Go! Harry Potter
description: Perplexus Go! Harry Potter is a solo dexterity 3-D maze game where players must maneuver a small marble around challenging barriers inside a transparent sphere, but where a wrong move can spell failure and require you to return to the start. Join Harry Potter as you conquer the moving staircase, drop through a magical panel, and get a kick out of 30 different obstacles. The Quidditch Cup awaits you at the end!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Heartseeker
description:
Anime dating sim turned board game. Win hearts in this easy to play board game for anime fans!

The objective is to win the favor of ANY 3 Characters before any one else. To win the favor of a Character you must be the player to play the last matching Move icon onto a Character card.

Actions and Favor cards mix things up by adding special effects that allows players to play more cards, switch hands, cancel other player's cards and more!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Matching, Take That

name: Syntopia
description:
Populate and form a new planet. Create connections between species and ensure balance and diversity. Form joint units of settlers with your opponents, work together and assert yourself as the wisest leader.

Tile-laying, route-building and area control with a twist.

Every player plays a different species. They all came with a giant spaceship to populate the newly discovered planet together. As their common society is very advanced, they know that it will only work out with diversity and balance between the species. And working together. Not through anybody trying to dominate the whole planet. So everyone gets secret missions as a test to choose the wisest leader. Like populating and different areas and connecting them with routes. Or connecting cities. This is achieved by laying tiles. Besides using their leader to shape the land, players can also build units of settlers with the other players. Whenever a player has completed three secret missions, the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

—description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Lo Straordinario Gioco del Pugilato
description:
A game of boxing, fruit of the creativity of Guido Crepax.

Published in book form with cut out drawings of 32 famous pugilists of the past, from the pioneers (John L. Sullivan, Bob Fitzsimmons) to the champions of the 1970s (Muhammad Ali, George Foreman, Joe Frazier).

Gameplay is based on the roll of the dice, which determine movement on the ring. Some boxers are slower than others (Primo Carnera), other move faster than the average (Sugar Ray Robinson, Muhammad Ali).

When the boxers are in adjacent squares, each roll a die to exchange punches. The one who rolls higher scores points. The boxers also have a limited number of powerful punches, for simplicity called "destri" (two dice) and "destri super" (three dice) allowing knock outs.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Square Grid

name: Home from Oz: Expanded Starter Set
description:
As you make your way home by following the Yellow Brick Road, you will encounter both friends and enemies. Beware of the Winged Monkeys or the Fighting Trees that will try to keep you from reaching home. Gain protection from obstacles by befriending the Cowardly Lion, Tin Woodman, and Scarecrow.

The Wicked Witch will try to stall your progress, but just as your friend Dorothy in her own journey through Oz, a simple Bucket of water will get you back on your way. What will happen when you encounter the Wizard or must pass through the Poppies?

If you’ve played the Original Game, you’re familiar with its twists and turns. This Expanded Starter Set paves the way to new possibilities. Get help from a Munchkin or be attacked by a Winkie Soldier. Visit the Emerald City or befriend Princess Ozma to unlock a wealth of new resources.

Find your own adventure when you get swept away by the Tornado into this mystical land.

-description from the back of the box

This set includes everything in the original game, plus more cards to expand the number of players, as well as new cards from a yet to be released expansion to the original version.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Flying Frog Roll-to-Move 2022 Goodybox
description:
A box of goodies for the Roll-to-Move 2022 virtual convention. All content was for Shadows of Brimstone.

Contents:

8 cards (63×89 mm)
Wasteland Warrior specialty ally (P942)
Wasteland Guard specialty ally (P943)
3 Dark Fragment gear (P944)
Remnant of Evil Mine artifact (P945)
Fate Worse Than Death Darkness (P946)
Blessed Torch gear (P947)

Wasteland Bodyguard exclusive miniature
4 The Official Brimstone Saloon coasters
Forbidden Fortress key chain
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Western Legends: Spieleschmiede Promo Pack
description:
The bundle of promo cards was sold at the Spieleschmiede crowdfunding project by publisher Corax Games

It contains:
- Western Legends: Carbine Promo Cards
- Western Legends: Man in Black Promo Card
- Western Legends: The Man In Black – Multiplayer Variant Promo Cards
- Western Legends: Big Box Promo Pack
- Strongbox card

All in German.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: StarForce Commander
description:
StarForce Commander is a game of tactical starship combat. It uses streamlined and intuitive game mechanics so you can focus on tactical decision-making. You are NOT merely resolving the battle by doing bookkeeping and rolling dice. You have decisions to make, and your decisions matter. There are tactical tradeoffs for every choice. This is an accessible and fun game, whether you are a new cadet or a crusty old spacer. Optional rules let you tailor the complexity to your preferences.

Check Out our first instructional video on YouTube. THis video covers Basic Maneuvering, or search for "StarForce Commander Mariner Games" to find other videos as we add them.

https://youtu.be/iT6T6sQeBak

As the Captain, you decide where the ship’s emphasis is; weapons, shields, or maneuvering? You will manage individual ships by allocating energy, arming weapons, maintaining shields, using sensors, and deciding how to outmaneuver your opponent. It sounds like a lot, but most ships have 6-8 points of energy to distribute, so you won’t need an accounting staff! Your crew works out details.

Strike the right balance between weapons, maneuvering, shields, and sensors to gain an advantage on your enemy. Weapons require power and have firing arcs, so you must maneuver to hit the enemy where they are weak. Your ship has four shields protecting all sides, so maneuvering, repairing, and reinforcing weakened shields are vital to survival. Seven turn templates handle maneuvering for 20-60 degree turns depending on your ship’s speed and maneuverability.

Managing a ship is easy enough that with a bit of practice, you can promote yourself to commodore and command 3-4 ships, or even admiral if you want to fight a larger battle. A game takes about 45 minutes per ship on the board, though duels can finish more quickly.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Measurement Movement

name: Wargamer's Guide to Afrika Korps
description:
A 49-page supplemental booklet for the Avalon Hill wargame, Afrika Korps. Contains variant rules plus strategy and analysis articles. Recently reissued in PDF form with a new afterword by editor Don Greenwood.

User Summary
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Unstable Unicorns: Titanium Unicorn
description:
Titanium Unicorn is a new mini in the Unstable Unicorns Vinyl Mini Series which comes with a promo card.

Card text:
Magical Unicorn card
This card cannot be destroyed.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: CATastrophe: A Game of 9 Lives – Paws Out, Claws Out Expansion
description:
Get your cattitude on in this wild expansion that is sure to leave you clawing for more! The Paws Out, Claws out expansion for CATastrophe: A Game of 9 Lives adds 52 all-new CATastrophic events, 16 epic Power Cats, and 7 brand new Characters.

Keep your paws out and claws out - or else you might find yourself eliminated! Whether you are clawing your way to victory as the Mad Catter or as Tacocat, you're sure to have a pawsome time!

CATastrophe: A Game of 9 Lives is a competitive game as spontaneous and unpredictable as cats themselves, featuring iconic cats from around the world!

Start with 9 lives and try to survive the chaotic mayhem. The last cat standing wins. But beware of the villain, the Grim Reapurr, who is plotting your untimely demise and attempting to be the sole victor!

-description from designer
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Plagues & Players
description:
A co-operative board game for 1 to 6 players about the Elizabethan theatre. It can be played as a straight board game or additionally as a narrative game.
The Company of 6 key people work together to put on a series of new plays over the course of one year. Events may help or hinder the Company whose goal is to make a profit of at least £200 in order to be invited to put on a performance for the Queen herself. Do badly and you could all end up in debtors prison! So be careful in the choices that you make.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Negotiation, Renaissance
mechanics: Income

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Lobotomy 1 Monster Conversion Set
description:
The cards were remade, adapted to Lobotomy 2 mechanics and contain graphics in the old Lobotomy style. The set includes rules and cards that will allow you to use the monsters in 19 additional Daily Nightmare scenarios. The set includes all monster cards from Lobotomy 1, including the add-ons.

IMPORTANT: Miniatures not included.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ulandi Wars
description:
Ulandi Wars is a unique and dramatic expandable battle card game in which players compete in Ulandi’s spectacular sci-fi universe.

A beautifully illustrated Sci-fi card game for 2 or more players set in the amazing universe of Ulandi.

Ulandi Wars is a one-of-a-kind combat card game in which players can change the victory condition of the game using our unique event card packs.

Gain control of powerful faction decks and battle your way across the galaxy to gain control of the western belt.

Choose your hero, arm them with mighty weapons, use your infrastructure cards to generate deployment tokens to deploy powerful cards from your hand to the combat zone, outwit your opponents with special upgrade event cards and fight your way to victory!
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: 18 Holes: Putting, Wind and Coastlines Exclusive
description: Exclusive add on for the putting, wind and Coastlines expansion that adds more course tiles, new green cards, two new golfers and a wooden wind token.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Soldiers Of Fortune
description:
Wage war to muster the most powerful army by creating platoons of troops. As you create platoons, you’ll stack them in front of you in an alternating pattern. Watch out! These troops are mercenaries and your top platoon can be stolen by your opponents if they have a matching troop or a wild card. Every time a platoon is stolen its power grows. Will you build the most powerful army, or be overrun by your opponents?

On your turn you MUST perform one of four possible actions (make a platoon from your hand, make a platoon from the discard pile, attempt to steal a platoon from an opponent, or discard and draw new cards). On your turn you MAY play one tactic card. Tactics are powerful cards that could give you a small advantage or completely change the course of the game.

The player with the most powerful army at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: By Battalion, Volley Fire!
description:
5th in the series of Fast Play Rules

Designed for Fast Play Convention Miniature Games with the British Empire with the Dervish, Zulu, Pathans and Boers.

Can be used with other colonial conflicts as well
mechanics: Unspecified

name: From the Cellar: Pack 12
description:
This scenario pack contains twelve color scenarios designed by the publishers at Le Franc-Tireur. Also included with the pack is an article from Jim Bishop on "Attacking in ASL, A Mid-Level Player’s Perspective".

All the scenarios are compatible with Avalon Hill's / MMP’s ASL System. The scenarios are:

FT#314: Red Army Funnies - Hill 65.5, Hottinen, Finland, 11 February 1940
FT#315: Stumbling Colossus - Raseinai, Russia, 24 June 1941
FT#316: Operation Munchen - Bratuseni, Bessarabia, 5 July 1941
FT#317: Bridge to Oblivion - Ruunakorpi, Finland, 28 June 1944
FT#318: Arsenal of Communism - Targu Frumos, Romania, 2 May 1944
FT#319: Tuloksa River Assault - Tuloksa river, lake Ladoga, Finland, 23 June 1944
FT#320: Osasto Bjorkman - Ruunakorpi, Finland, 28 June 1944
FT#321: A Counter Offensive Denied - Kecskemet, Hungary, 30 October 1944
FT#322: Last Desperate Gamble - Elsenborn Ridge, Belgium, 18 December 1944
FT#323: Empire Strikes Back - Clark Airfield, Luzon, The Philippines, 29 January 1945
FT#324: Smashing the Corridor - Charlottenburg, Germany, 26 April 1945

Maps needed : 1b, 2, 3, 4, 5, 4a, 5a, 6a, 7a, 9a, 17z, 42, 43, 44, 53, 56, 58, 62, 69, 70, 71, 78, 79, BFP Q, BFP R and t

Overlays needed : RttR A, RttR D, Wd 1, X7, O1, O2, OG2, OG3, X14, Hi8, Rv1, OW1, Be1 to 4, OC1 to 4 and X11.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Ypres Salient: A soldier's life during the great war
description:
What was life like for the millions of professional, conscripted or recruited soldiers, who fought in the Ypres salient during the great war? The trench experience involved the terror of mud, slime and disease and the constant threat of shellfire. Heavy artillery and new weapons such as poison gas and machine guns threatened
death from afar; but hand to hand combat with clubs and knives killed many during the grisly business of trench raids.
When troops were not fighting, they were locked into trench deadlock, at which point boredom also became a serious issue. Luckily there where the letters from home and regular
behind the lines periods to keep the soldiers going.

This game, or rather simulation, lets you lead your character(s) through the great war.
It’s very uncertain that a soldier who starts at the beginning of the war will make it until November 11,1918 but maybe he is lucky.
Best is to take into account that this game will make you have several soldiers who will at a certain moment during the war get killed in the field, die of wounds, get wounded but rejoin their unit, get a wound that will get them home as a cripple, have them hospitalized with health problems from which they maybe recover but equally have a chance to be send home; unfit for further duty. Finaly there are mental problems like shell shock in the game. A soldier has the chance to get fit for duty after a while or be send home to a mental institute but there is also a chance that he will be threatened as a coward who is unwilling to serve. In that case he will end before the firing squad.

This is a role playing game for 1 to six players where you build the stories of soldiers around Ypres by using cards, tables and some sheets. Let your imagination create their lives and death while in Flanders fields.
Like real life soldiers you for your character will have almost no influence on it.
But you have some topics that you can get changes on. That, in the end, could become the difference between life and death.

The game is mainly card driven. Since the trench lines only fluctuated little during the conflict around Ypres there is no use for a map of the area.
For the soldiers a trench was a trench, maps where something for the higher ranks.
Each game round plays over a two months period in which a series of events will take place.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Jersi
description:
With the wise men of the Jersi universe you will cross mountains, but beware of fools! In this chess game where rock, paper and scissors fight each other, the goal is for your king to cross the field. You move each cubic piece either individually or by stacking it on top of another which then acts as a quick mount.

Each player must bring his king to the opposite edge of the board and thus win the war.

A print n play file of the rules (without components) is available.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Stacking and Balancing

name: Tournament Director's Pack
description:
Advancing Fire normally works only on deeply historical games, but this time we are proud to produce the work of an important external developer, that is a unique and very interesting release.

TOURNAMENT DIRECTOR’S PACK is the collection of ASL scenarios designed by Enrico Catanzaro (known in ASL community as ecz) with an experience of about thirty years as ASL player and Tournament Director of ASL tournaments, as well as wargamer and chess player. His main attention turned in particular to the balance and replayability, while trying to develop interesting and innovative dynamics. The Tournament Director's Pack features 16 scenarios all using dedicated new rules which are used to decide sides and Victory Conditions at once. We made sure the scenarios were playtested by many different level players, from the best who won many tournaments to the inexperienced ones, and they have shown, with their rules for determining the VCs, to be suitable for all levels, and to have a very high replayability. These scenarios are ideal for use in tournaments or to practice competitive ASL, maintaining a high adherence to the war events they represent.

ecz1 The Bet, Trøgstad, Norway, April 1940. An old classic first created for a scenario design contest on the Game Squad forum and later published by Le Franc Tireur (LFT 181). This is the scenario where CBS made its debut. The Germans must control a village defended by a Norwegian MG company. 5.5 turns on two boards.

ecz2 Liberating Bukovina, Bukovina, July 1941. 6.5 turns and three boards for a Romanian attack vs Russians in the first stage of Barbarossa. Cavalry and tin cans in the OB.

ecz3 Turf Wars in Mongolia, Mongolian-Manchurian border dispute in May 1939. Two boards and 5 turns for this all-cavalry action (with the exception of only two MMCs not mounted at the start). In this scenario Steppe terrain and Sun Blindness are in effect.

ecz4 Flash and Thunder, Neuville-au-plain River, Normandy June 1944, in the first hours of the D-Day. A company of Paratroopers tries to find their officers, regroup, and move toward its objective, avoiding the German garrison patrolling the area and increasing its presence turn by turn. Three boards and 7.5 turns for this scenario where movement is crucial.

ecz5 The Good and the Bad, Montefiorino Italy, July 1944. The final action of the largest Partisan battle fought in Italy. In this scenario (three boards and 7 turns), Fascists and SS using Armored Cars, Flamethrowers, OBA and a lot of firepower, jointly attack a small town defended by elements of the Partisan Division ‘Modena’. The Defenders must stay in the town as long as possible to prevent the Fascists from making a large scale encirclement and exiting off the opposite board edge, and try to save their lives by retreating into the woods before it is too late.

ecz6 A Diurnal Assault, Central Stalingrad, October 1942. 7 turns. This time the Russians are on the attack, but they must watch for a German counterattack. In this scenario, setup is sequential, counter by counter. Both players have the chance to attack in depth or to play more conservatively to parry the enemy offensive blow by blow. Soviets have Rocket OBA!

ecz7 Clash of Cans, Guadalajara, Spain, March 1937. The first attempt at a large scale armored blitz by the Italian army during the Spanish civil war in this all (tin can) armor scenario. Six Italian L35s face 4 Light Russian tanks in a three board, 6 turn scenario. Clash of Cans is a complementary scenario to ‘The Puma Prowls’ that could easily be used as a teaching tool for AFV rules, particularly the platoon-movement rules which aren’t used in the Puma Prowls scenario.

ecz8 A Hot Week in Sicily, Sicily, August 1943. Again in Sicily for the crucial moment of the battle for Troina. The men in Monte Basilio were isolated, flanked and were suffering ammo and water shortage, but they held heroically against the final push of the 15th Panzer Granadier division in this 6 turn, three board scenario.

ecz9 Culquaber, Ethiopia, November 1941. This time the action moves to the Italian East-African colony where the elite ‘Carabinieri’ fought a hopeless battle against an overwhelmingly superior enemy force on the famous ‘Cliff of the Crags’. In this 7 turn, two board scenario there are also warbands of natives fighting each other as allies of the Commonwealth and of the Italians.

ecz10 The Capture of Malta, Krendi Airfield, Malta, July 1942. A fictional, ‘what if…’ scenario in which the Italians and Germans jointly launch ‘Operation Hercules’. We can see German Paratroopers and Italian Marines of the ‘Battaglione San Marco’ fighting together against the Malta garrison in a 6.5 turn scenario on three half boards for the capture of a small airport in the south of the island.

ecz11 Blood and Brine, Calais, France, May 1940. Another scenario created for a design contest on the Game Squad forum. In the dramatic days of the great retreat of the BEF, the battle of Calais was decisive to delay the German advance to Dunkirk. Blood and Brine is a two board, 6.5 turn scenario featuring a very peculiar SSR about ‘random (German) air attacks’ on the British units tied to the SAN.

ecz12 A Tragic Victory, Vilnius, Poland, July 1944. Another scenario coming from a design contest. The dramatic last battle of the Polish Home Army, winning on the field against the Germans, but doomed to deportation by Soviet hands in the following days. In this 5.5 turn, two board scenario, with the help of the Russians of the Belorussian Front, the Polish force successfully closed any escape path for the Germans trapped in Vilnius.

ecz13 Leaving Changsha, South-Central China, October 1939. This urban, 5.5 turns, Sino-Japanese battle on two half boards depicts the attempt of the Japanese 13th Division to break the encirclement and leave Changsha. This was the first great defeat of the IJA.

ecz14 The Streets of Shanghai, Shanghai, August 1937. A large, 8 turn scenario on two full and two half-boards highlighting the major Chinese land offensive to free the city. A mostly infantry scenario with the exception of a few ACs and Chinese light tanks trying to clear their way across rubble and debris.

ecz15 The Best Defence, North of Aachen, October 1944. Facing encirclement, the Germans try to widen the gap between the two American pincers around Aachen with a local armored counterattack. 6 turns and two boards for this ‘heavy armor’ scenario.

BR11 Fields of Golden Wheat, Sicily, July 1943. This scenario is the ‘prequel’ to Scenario T9, The Niscemi Biscari Highway. It depicts the events that happened earlier in the same day that led to the capture of the pair of Italian AT guns that were later used by the Paratroopers against the Germans. Two half boards and 5.5 turns for this small scenario.

TOURNAMENT DIRECTOR’S PACK contains the following:

16 action packed scenarios

Ownership of the following MMP/Hasbro products are required to play all of the included scenarios: Beyond Valor, Yanks, For King and Country, The Last Hurrah, Hollow Legions, Doomed Battalions, Armies of Oblivion, Rising Sun, boards 43, 52, 56, 57, 5b, 60, 62, 70, RB, RO, z

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Chak
description:
Chak is a Chess and Xiangqi style game designed by Couch Tomato in 2021 specifically to answer the hypothetical question of what a chess variant developed by mesoamerican cultures would look like. The design philosophy was to start from scratch and use only the common elements from all forms of chess: a king, a rook-type piece, a knight-like piece, and some sort of pawns; the rest would develop organically infusing a specific Mesoamerican culture -- in this case, the Maya.

The various pieces move and capture in different ways by replacing the captured piece, as in chess, and victory is achieved by checkmating or stalemating the opposing king. An alternate win condition called "altar mate" is achieved by moving the king into the opponent's space on the board called the "temple."
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Assault on Gallipoli
description:
Assault on Gallipoli is a two-player strategic wargame that covers the key battles of the Gallipoli Campaign of 1915. The first edition of the game sold out in December 2022. A second edition of the game published by Hexasim is now available for pre-order at https://www.hexasim.com/en/3951-Assault-on-Gallipoli.html

One player controls the Australian, New Zealand and British forces (ANZAC player) while the other controls the Ottoman forces (Turkish player).

Each turn represents one day, units represent battalions, companies and individual ships. Players take it in turn activating groups of units in an area. Once they are activated to move, fire or dig a trench, the units are flipped over to their Exhausted side. At the beginning of each new turn they are flipped back to their Fresh side.

Game design by Kieran Oakley and Russell Lowke. Game art by Jose Ramon Faura. Rules editor and TableTop Simulator module by Rolf Grein.

For details and to pre-order the game, visit https://www.hexasim.com/en/3951-Assault-on-Gallipoli.html

HISTORICAL BACKGROUND

After months of stalemate on the Western Front, the British and French decided they would open a second front by attacking Germany’s ally – the Ottoman Empire. In March 1915 they sent a fleet of battleships through the Dardanelles in an effort to reach the Turkish capitol, Constantinople, and force the Ottoman government to surrender.

However, the Dardanelles were well defended by forts and sea mines and the Allied fleet suffered heavy losses. The naval campaign was abandoned until the forts could be captured by amphibious assault.

The game focuses on the Australian and New Zealand Army Corps (ANZAC) sector of the campaign; thus, it does not cover the British and French landings at Cape Helles or Suvla Bay.

The board presents one of the narrowest sections of the Gallipoli Peninsula, from ANZAC Cove to Mal Tepe and Khetia Bay. The ANZAC goal was to capture this area and cut off the Turkish forces fighting the British and French at Cape Helles further south.

The heights of Chunuk Bair and Mal Tepe were considered especially important because they provided observation of both sides of the Peninsula. From here the ANZACs could capture the forts which dominated the Narrows and thus allow the battleships of the Royal Navy to sail up to Constantinople. At least that is what was supposed to happen.

In fact, the British commanders had seriously under-estimated the Turkish resistance. The Turkish soldiers were veterans of the Balkan Wars, armed with modern, German-made rifles and artillery. Inspired by the leadership of Colonel Kemal and Lieutenant Colonel Sefik, they stopped the ANZACs in their tracks. The ANZACs only managed to establish a small beachhead, which was repeatedly counterattacked by the Turks.

In August 1915, the British and ANZACs made another attempt to seize the ridges of Sari Bair. The New Zealanders and Gurkhas managed to capture the heights for two days but were eventually overwhelmed by Turkish counterattacks. In December, after eight months of fighting, the ANZAC forces were evacuated.

In the words of Australian war correspondent, Charles Bean: “ANZAC stands for reckless valour in a good cause, for enterprise, resourcefulness, fidelity, comradeship and endurance that will never admit defeat.”

So what went wrong?

To quote the 'Gallipoli 1915' Facebook page: "At Gallipoli, inexperienced troops, led by untested commanders, supported by staffs that had yet to learn their jobs were sent with wholly inadequate artillery, ammunition and logistical support to perform one of the most challenging operations of war: an opposed landing on an enemy shore. Add in the nature of the terrain and we can begin to understand how it was that 4,000 Australians landing that early morning of 25th April 1915 were held up by a force that, initially, numbered only around 80 Turks."

Lest we forget.
mechanics: Area Movement, Area-Impulse

name: Tercio de la Muerte:  The Battle of the Ebro River, July-August, 1938
description:
1938 went from bad to worse for the Republican cause in Spain. Successes the previous year at Guadalajara, Teruel and Belchite were undone by Nationalist victories that overran Vizcaya as well as continued and massive military support from Nazi Germany and fascist Italy. Madrid was finally cut off and fell in the early summer and many outside of Spain felt the cause was lost. However, there was some hope in the Republican enclave centered on Barcelona. A new and friendly government came to power in France that reopened shipments of badly needed arms and supplies, and new shipments of arms from the Soviet Union successfully made it past the Nationalist blockade, reinvigorating the Republican forces still in the field. A larger war in Europe was increasingly apparent, and it was hoped that if the Republican forces could hold out long enough, they could be part of this larger conflict against fascism. As such, the Republican military decided upon a bold offensive across the Ebro River to retake ground in Valencia, as well as demonstrate that all was not lost.

Each copy of Tercio de la Muerte is composed of the following:


Two 11 by 17 inch map sections with Turn and Game Record tracks.
154 un-mounted, double sided units.
This set of rules.


Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards and a six-sided die (D6) to play the game. Units represent regiments or brigades or regiments (infantry, cavalry) and companies (infantry detachments and armor). Each turn represents three days of time. A map hex is a little less than 1.5 miles across.

Players use a standard deck of playing cards (a custom card set is available from the publisher) to activate their units and determine some game events (Random Event and End of Turn occurrence). A six-sided die is used to determine how air and artillery strikes a player has each turn, as well to resolve those types of attacks as well as for resolving ground combat between opposing units.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Hole In The Wall
description:
In Hole In The Wall, each player leads a gang of outlaws, each aiming to get their hands on as much money as possible.

At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt four outlaws from the Outlaw deck. These represent his gang, and determine his gang's capabilities.

Every turn, a player can perform one of five actions:

Go “Along The Trail” by drawing a card from the "Along the Trail" deck, and see what happens (usually little risk and little gain).
Go “Into Town” and try and pull a bank job by drawing a card from the "Town" deck (usually large risk and large gain).
Go to “Hole In The Wall” and attempt to recruit another outlaw into the gang.
Attempt a “Jailbreak” to attempt to free an outlaw lost in a previous turn.
“Call Out” another outlaw for a gunfight. The fight is resolved by rolling the dice.


There are three ways in which the game can be played. This determines when the game ends.

Fight to the Finish: Game ends if all outlaws are killed, the player with the most money wins.
Time Limit Game: Game ends at predetermined time, player with most money wins.
Wealth Game: Game ends when first player reaches $50,000
categories: American West, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: WWE Heroclix: Mixed Match Challenge Starter Set
description:
HeroClix is a tactical combat miniatures game where you put heroes and villains from your favorite comics, movies, and TV shows in head-to-head combat. It utilizes the patented Combat Dial System originally found in the collectible Mage Knight miniatures game.

Now you can have your favorite WWE Superstars battling it out on your tabletop.

HeroClix miniatures use the combat dial to reflect a change in a characters' combat values, powers, and abilities over time. Some characters will pivot from long range to close quarters combat styles, others will move from acting aggressively to stealing their opponent's energy. The easiest thing to observe will be which characters are worn down by battle and which ones experience rage from getting hurt that helps them strike back at their foes! HeroClix uses gridded maps instead of a measure-and-move system, as well as die rolling.

Comes with Wrestling Ring and the following Superstars
- AJ Styles
- Charlotte Flair
- Finn Balor
- Sasha Banks
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tethys
description:
Tethys is a collaborative space dungeon crawler where you, along with your teammates, must explore the mining colony on the surface of Saturn's moon, Tethys, complete missions and defeat the Alien Queen. At each turn, you will open new rooms, face fearsome aliens, conquer new weapons, modifiers and items that will enhance your arsenal: your precious dice. Find and open the chests to receive loot and access codes that will lead you to unexplored places, until you discover the underground hangar that hides a terrible truth ...

During your turn, you can perform 2 Actions, Move and Attack, as well as collect loot and open rooms.

If you complete the mission objective, you win!
If, on the other hand, you and all the players who participated in the mission lose all Energy, bringing the battery to 0, the Mission has failed.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Ascendia: Seasons of Thargos
description:
Ascendia - Seasons of Thargos is an exciting game that requires you to set out as an ill-equipped adventurer in the hidden Valley of Ascendia, in the fantasy World of Thargos.

Collect raw materials, craft, trade and interact with wild animals and merchants to improve your equipment and skills, whilst striving to survive the approaching winter.

But beware as each season brings its own challenges and some more fearsome creatures, often pushed by hunger, venture down from the mountain peaks into the valley...

You compete but at times cooperate for survival for the ultimate goal as a future leader of Ascendia.

Achievements reward you in Renown and at the end of the game, having survived all seasons and got through the winter, you total up your points to see who wins the game. Events are triggered from season-specific decks. Encounters with wild beasts and fell creatures require special dice rolls, modified by equipment and character skills that you can improve as the game progresses through trading and crafting. Although you compete in the game, at times you need to cooperate with others in order to survive. You explore a Hex-based board that flips over to a winter side when that season comes.

—description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Economic, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Beach Dogs
description:
In Beach Dogs you do your best to help your human collect shells on the beach. Not only will you find the best shells, but you'll also protect him from angry crabs by stomping on them! Crabs are tasty so those are good too. When the day is done the doggo that helped their human the most wins!

Beach Dogs is a quick game played across 12 rounds(waves). Each wave you choose to help out your human on the beach in the sand or dive into the surf to try and grab a shell. All sorts of surprises await in the beach and waves decks as you try to collect sets of cards worth points and counter cards that could hurt your score.

When the wave deck runs out the game is over. Determine the winner by tallying up all the shells you've found, subtracting any points for live crabs and adding points for any you were able to stomp. The player with the most points is Top Dog!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Legendary Creatures: Wild Creature Pack Mini-Expansion
description:
Mix in more variety with 3 brand new wild creatures! Replace some of the creatures from the base game with some of the following:

- Medusa: Horrifying Visage allows you to take resources from other players.
- Hydra: Prismatic Scales allows you to play a round as if you are in possession of all the gifts.
- Quetzalcoatl: Serpent Rides for All allows you to move all familiars in a realm forward.

Contains 12 cards.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: The Key
description:
The Key is a cooperative PARTY GAME that brings together different generations through free-flowing creative expression.
The goal of this party game is to get to the presents locked in the sack.
The key to unlocking them is on the end of a spiral. The spiral holds many challenges. Players will have to act, imagine, draw, dance and connect through cooperative effort while the sand trickles into mystery.
No learning necessary, easy start. Suitable for large groups of children, younger teenagers and family events. Children that can read can play by themselves.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Into the Mountain
description:
Lead your steampunk dwarf clan to mine the most mythril in the mountain. More than a deck builder, you will construct mines in the mountain (area control) and send your dwarves to locations in the factory (worker placement) for powerful effects. Packed with options and decisions, every card has three functions. You can play them for effects, spend them as resources, or permanently build them as constructs for reusable benefits.

There are many paths to victory in this competitive strategy game. You can rush to build 8 mines, collect valuable mythril steam drills, advance your technology in the factory or construct a powerful engine. Your strategy will be bolstered by one of 8 unique asymmetric clans; each bringing different benefits and supporting a strategy.

This unique combination of game mechanics with a hearty theme will bring excitement to your game table. The decisions and play flow with this high powered deck builder.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Interplanetary: Skywards – Expansion 4
description:
This fourth expansion for Interplanetary, titled Skywards, simply adds additional directive cards which are added to the base game's pool of these components.

This increases variety even further, since the number of possible campaign deck configurations grows.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: H.D.P. 7: Hasta Donde Puedas
description: New cards, the same black humor as always. 50 new cards to add to the H.D.P.: Hasta Donde Puedas collection you have at home.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dungeon Universalis: Snake Island Oracle
description: This pdf book consists of 10 quests for The Snake Island Oracle campaign. These quests are made for the board game Dungeon Universalis.
mechanics: Role Playing

name: Mafia: Crime Scene
description:
Mafia: Crime Scene is a party game in which you have to bluff and suspect. In Mafia: Cards, designed for 7-20 players, some players take on the roles of mafia members, while others become civilians of the criminal community. Every night the mafia kills another person, and every day the civilians have a chance to discuss the murder, choose suspects, and sentence one of them to death. Because each role is secret, you never know who is an innocent bystander and who is part of the mafia. If the mob kills enough civilians, the community will become a permanent haven for criminals, but if the civilians rid their community of the mob, they win.

Mafia: Crime Scene offers 24 different character cards, as well as 55 superpower cards for a fun game. You can play as a don, a doctor, an innocent bystander, or a cunning minion. Whatever your role, play it convincingly, make your choices carefully, and trust no one.

As a gift also comes a premium subscription - 1 month, for our application, with which your game will be even cooler and more interesting.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Mafia, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #5 – Minor NATO
description:
NATO never fights alone. Even the smallest nations of NATO have well-trained pilots and capable aircraft. In the Minor NATO pack, you’ll gain access to seven new nations, each with a distinctive aircraft. The Dutch bring F-16s for multi-role work. The Norwegians bring nimble F-5s, while the Portuguese bring heavy hitting A-7 strike aircraft. The Danish fly the J-35 Draken, and the Spanish bring their Hornets. The Belgians enter with Mirage 5 strike aircraft, while the Turkish fly their F-4s. Finally, each nation will have national skills to help their pilots feel distinct and get the most out of their airframes.

This set adds 56 cards and 54 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


54 x Aircraft cards (F-4E Turkey / F-5 Norway / F-16C Netherlands / EF/A-18 Spain / J-35 Denmark / Mirage 5BA Belgium / A-7P Portugal)
2 x Event cards
14 x Skill counters
1 x Pilot Skills sheet


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wolf & Raven
description:
Wolf & Raven is a 2-player cooperative asymmetrical deck-building campaign game.

In Wolf & Raven, 2 players take on the two roles: one plays the Wolf and the other plays the Raven. They must pay costs for each other to hone hunting skills and overcome hazards on their journey to spot and eventually catch their prey before hunger overwhelms them.

Primary mechanics include deck-building, hand management and path selection. With 4 suits: Eyes, Paws, Fangs and Feathers, the gameplay is highly tactical and also boasts a deep overarching strategy as the campaign develops.

Wolf & Raven has a rogue-like campaign structure through the four seasons: Spring, Summer, Autumn and finally Winter.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Nothing to Lose: The Attack on Tan Son Nhut Airbase January 31, 1968
description:
“I will never forget the night, that Tan Son Nhut was hit. “C Flight was on duty then, we knew that this was it. We hit the dirt and looked around with anxious waiting eyes, and said a prayer as mortars came raining from the skies” –Opening stanza of an anonymous veteran’s poem about the attack at Tan Son Nhut.

When the Communist forces of North and South Vietnam launched the 1968 Tet Offensive one component was an attack on the Tan Son Nhut airbase north and west if Saigon. This was the largest airbase in South Vietnam, with its aircraft ferrying men and material from the US, as well as basing combat aircraft that support military operations throughout all the region.

The Communist offensive was supported by the National Liberation Front’s 9th Infantry Division that had recently been rebuilt following extensive losses fighting the US and ARVN (Army of the Republic of [South] Vietnam) by the attachment of the 267th and 269th Main Force Battalions. The assault force would also include sappers attached to the division’s 1st Battalion of the 271st Regiment who were armed with satchel demolition charges used to destroy the base’s aircraft and air control towers, as well as the division’s mortar and rocket artillery batteries. The battle here would usher in a new phase of the Vietnam conflict. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

Each copy of Nothing to Lose is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch map area map sheets with game tracks and tables.

One sheet of 80 double-sided, unmounted counters

One rules booklet

A standard deck of playing cards (a custom card set is available) and ten sided die are needed to play the game.

Each turn of the game represents one hour of time. Units are mostly companies (I). Tank units represent 2 (full strength) or 1 (reduced) vehicles. An inch on the map is about 200 yards.

Players use playing cards to determine which player gets to activate and with how many units, as well as determine when to determine random events for the turn and the end of the turn. The die is used to resolve combats (assault, air and artillery strikes), rally units and perform other game functions. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Nils Johansson.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Dawn on Titan: Alien Technology
description: The intrepid explorers of Saturn have discovered strange artifacts and anomalies in space. This must be proof of an alien civilization been here before us! The expansion adds new moonlets, battlecards, and alien spaceships to your arsenal.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Modulorka
description:
Modulorka is a Free-to-Play, Orc V Orc Skirmish Combat Game, with straightforward easy-to-learn rules that make for snappy, dynamic, and brutal games

Unleash your creativity and build your very own gang of orc ladz, each with their own unique character, weapon and skills, and have them duke it out in brutal combat!

In Modulorka you be as creative with your units as you are with your miniatures. Build custom, unique minis and then design loadouts to make sure your models play like they look they should.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Haunted Inheritance
description:
You are eligible to inherit a vast fortune, which is hidden in the rooms of an abandoned mansion, and you only have one night to do it. There is one other little problem–the mansion is haunted.
You will arrive at the mansion as night falls. The clock marks off the hours as you explore the decaying rooms and dark halls in search of the fortune. But you aren’t the only creatures that walk those floors. Monsters haunt the rooms of the mansion and intend to make you one of them.

If the monsters wound you three times, you will become one of the walking dead who hunt the live players, for by wounding them you can be restored to life. The living player who has collected the most money by sunrise will be declared the winner.
Yet the mansion holds another secret. Somewhere in the dust-covered rooms are six pages of scripture verses that can end the mansion’s curse and bring the dead players back to life. If you can find the six verses and give them all to one player before sunrise, the curse will end and all of my money will be distributed to the players equally.

The choice is yours: work together to assemble the verses before sunrise and share the victory, or work alone to avoid the monsters and dead players and try to collect the most money for yourself!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Negotiation, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wizard Promospel
description:
Free Promotional game of Wizard.

The standard game consists of a 60-card deck that consists of the traditional 52-card deck (1-13 in four suits) along with four Wizards (high) and four Jesters (low). In the promotional game, the amount of wizards and Jesters is the same, but the four suits only number up to 11.
Otherwise the game works completely the same.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Khorne Team Booster
description:
Fill out your Khorne team's roster with four more players, each in a different pose to those found in the Skull-tribe Slaughterers set.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Kroxigor
description:
Surprising as it may seem, Kroxigor are the gentle giants of the Lizardmen race. Thought to have been created as builders and labourers to be strong and powerful, Kroxigor coexist contentedly with Skinks. Yet there are few sights more terrifying than a Kroxigor roused to anger. Capable of effortlessly tearing a man limb from limb, these mighty creatures have served in the armies of the Slann for millennia. Today, they are considered a great boon to any Blood Bowl team. Their long muscular arms and rows upon rows of serrated teeth set into powerful jaws make them a terror on the Line of Scrimmage. Woe betide any player unfortunate enough to be tasked with marking a Kroxigor!

Add some raw strength to the speed and skill of your Lizardman team with a mighty Kroxigor. They'll smash through any player foolish enough to try and stand in their way on the Line of Scrimmage.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Rebel Revolt
description:
It's treason time in the empire of lies, and the stakes have never been higher.

Your crew of specialists has just one objective: take down the United World Government's W.A.R facility, FAST! Failure isn't an option. If that facility comes online, our Resistance won't stand a chance.

So gear up rebels, you've got a suicide mission to win!

Rebel Revolt is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a daring escape room adventure. What's it like? Well, imagine throwing the best bits of 'Mission Impossible' into your next house party. That's Rebel Revolt.

This printable escape room kit combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laidback ease of group party games. Players will work together to sabotage the W.A.R facility before the United World Government can crush the Resistance, and rule the world! Gameplay is centered around a series of puzzle cards, divided into 4 'challenges'. Players will need to solve each challenge in order to progress the story, bringing them one step closer to completing their mission.

Game setup is quick and spoiler-free, and hints are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then pitting them against each other to see who finishes the game first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

So, last chance to save the world... are you in?
categories: Adventure, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: PONY SOLDIERS: A Solitaire Game of Soldiering during the Plains Indian Wars (1865-1890)
description:
PONY SOLDIERS is a game about Soldiering and Indian Warfare on the American Plains from 1866-1892. The Player takes on the role of a Cavalry Officer recently posted to a Frontier Fort. The Player’s Officer starts out as a 2nd Lieutenant and with the goal of surviving and advancing through the ranks by participating in various Mission and Combat. The Fort’s Mission is to patrol their Frontier AOR to protect and secure the US Settlers from Indian Attacks, Guard and Escort Stage Coaches, Wagon Trains, Mail Riders, Patrol and combat Hostile War Parties.

—description from the designer
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: Escape Room Z
description:
I know, this doesn't look good... trapped on the 28th floor, between a pizza-hungry zombie horde, and the last deep dish in town...

You'll need to think quickly if you have any hope of surviving this apocalypse (and saving your pizza). It's time for an escape plan!

Escape Room Z is a printable game pack that transforms any space into an edge-of-your-seat escape room experience. Just imagine the perfect blend of 'escape room' and 'house party'... then add zombies!

This printable escape room kit combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the funloving elements of group party games. But be warned, this is a challenging game. Players will work together to escape the zombie horde by: finding a weapon, securing their pizza, and unlocking the balcony door. If time runs out... the zombies run in! Gameplay is centered around a series of puzzle and clue card which are hidden around the room. Players will need to logically connect elements on each card in order to solve puzzles. Each puzzle solved puts players one step closer to escaping the zombie horde.

Game setup is quick and spoiler-free. Hints and puzzle solutions are handled by an online hint system that players access on their smartphones. This means that no game master is required to supervise the experience, so you can join the game alongside your players.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then pitting them against each other to see who finishes the game first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.

So, think you've got what it takes to survive the zombie apocalypse? Let's find out!
categories: Adventure, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Escape Quest
description:
Oh no, we're lost in time!

You and your friends were having a blast, when you were suddenly sucked right through space and time! Maybe it had something to do with that strange machine you found...

Either way, you better figure out how to fix it. It's getting dark, and those dinosaurs don't look happy to see you...

Escape Quest is a printable escape room game that transforms any space into a kids escape room experience. It's designed for young children (age 6-9), and plays like an immersive party game.

This printable escape room kit combines the teamwork, tension, and puzzle-solving of escape rooms with the laidback ease of group party games, all packaged for young children. The game is primarily centered around scavenger hunt mechanics, with some age-appropriate puzzles. Kids will need to find puzzle cards in each 'quest', and combine them in the correct order to fix their time machine and move to the next 'quest'. Progressing through 6 'quests' will finally see the kids find their back to their own timeline.

Game setup is quick and easy for parents. At least one adult will be required to run the game as the 'game master'. A step-by-step guide, complete with narrative text guides you through everything you need to know. So there's no prior experience required.

The game can expand to accommodate any number of players by dividing your group into teams of 2-4, and then pitting them against each other to see who finishes the game first. In addition, you can edit the game file before printing to customize your own escape room experience.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Team-Based Game

name: Sun Moon Rising
description:
Does your sign know you better than your friends do?

Sun Moon Rising comes with 300 double-sided cards, with 50 statements tailored to each zodiac sign, and each round of the game you vote on whether statements are true or false about your friends and attempt to match what they'll say about themselves — with them guessing what you'll say about yourself, of course.

Choose to play with your sun, moon, or rising sign deck to test your friends on three different sides of your personality. Your sun sign deck is a great go-to for anyone, your moon sign deck works best with close friends and family, and your rising sign deck is a good pick for casual acquaintances.
mechanics: Voting

name: Coba
description:
Coba is a cooperative strategy game that will take players to a mystical temple in search of hidden treasure.

Each round, players will attempt to ascend the temple as a team by simultaneously playing their cards, and then resolving their actions in numerical order. Cards are not just used for actions and priorities, they also form the path that the players must traverse in ascending order to win. If that doesn't sound tricky enough, players also have limited communication as they confront the cursed spirits that guard the temple.

Through clever planning and anticipation of teammates' actions, you just might claim the treasure in this cooperative game for two to four players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Godsforge: Twilight of the Great Houses
description: An expansion for Godsforge. Includes 16 Great Houses each give a unique ability to modify your game’s play style and power level, adding replay value. Adds one to player count.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards

name: Brain Storm
description:
Bring the thunder: Pretend play as you race to the finish line in Brain Storm by getting your team to think lightning fast and guess the answers on the cards based on your quick descriptions.

How to play: Land on a category, then one teammate has to describe words in that category while the rest of the team guesses. Repeat this using that same category for as many cards as you can until time's is up. Move forward based on how many cards are guessed correctly. First team to the finish line wins.

Categories: Each answer falls into one of six simple categories: movies and tv science and nature (like the weather), actions (like winning), objects (like this board game), and places and landmarks, plus random topics for the Lightning Spaces.

Fun for friends and family: Brain Storm is a family friendly trivia game meant for 4 or more players ages 12 and up. Each game takes about 30 minutes.

What's in the box: Brain Storm includes a gameboard, 5 cloud pieces, a sand timer, the rules sheet, and 500 cards, each having answers to all 6 categories on them. With 3,000 possible answers, you can play Brainstorm as many times as you want for endless fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Theme Park Tycoon
description: An economical deck-builder for managing an amusement park, designed for 1-4 players, with a game time from 45 to 60 minutes. By running our own amusement park, we will be able to purchase attractions that generate happiness, which in turn will attract more visitors to our kingdom of fun. And these are an irreplaceable source of income. We will be able to spend the earned money, for example, on the purchase of decorations for our park, which will give us victory points. But not to be so rosy, people visiting the funfair like to litter and be fussy; attractions break down all the time and the employees are demanding payment! In addition, we must deliberately manage the park space, which is not unlimited. The goal of the game is to collect as many park recognition points as possible
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Never Mind The Billhooks: Wargaming Late Medieval Small Battles and Big Skirmishes – Deluxe
description:
Billhooks is a fast-action game of late medieval European warfare, set at the small battle/big skirmish level – think Nibley Green rather than Towton.

You will need around 100 figures a side, lots of D6, and a 6 x 4 foot table – everything else you need to play the game is included in this book. A typical game can be played through in around 90 minutes (or rather less if the Dice Goddess wills it!).

Billhooks Deluxe gives you a ‘Core’ Wars of the Roses ruleset and then expands that to cover seven new Theatres and Conflicts from across Western European Christendom c.1350-1525. You will find troop stats and special rules for Irish Gallowglass, Hussite War Wagons, and Landsknecht Pikemen along with all the other troop types to be found on battlefields of the period, from Hundred Years’ War France to Renaissance Italy.

The game uses a card-driven turn sequence and simple but exciting combat mechanisms (with loads of dice being rolled!) to produce battles that are full of period flavour but always unpredictable.

The following are the Theatres and Conflicts in this book:


Albion – The Wars of the Roses
Gallia – The Hundred Years’ War
Bohemia – The Hussite Wars
Helvetia – The Swiss-Burgundian War
Italia – The Italian Wars
Northumbria – The Anglo-Scottish Border Reivers
Lusitania – Late Medieval Portugal
Hibernia – Warfare in Ireland


Finally, there is a Modelling Masterclass chapter with a comprehensive guide to painting, modelling, and kitbashing 28mm plastic figures.

The book is an A4, 180-page, full-colour, softback (perfect bound) publication.

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Triple Scoops
description:
Ex-champion football coach, Clyde Dugan may have retired from the game, but its spirit lives on in his new passion…ice cream!
Working at Coach Clyde’s ice cream shop is not only fast-paced and hectic but is also known to be highly competitive. Treating each day at the shop as a “game day”, Clyde challenges his employees to outshine each other on the field of battle (behind the counter). He keeps a tally of their best plays (displays of scooping skills) and his scoopers continually contend for the coveted role of team captain (shop manager).

Now, looking to expand the franchise, Coach Clyde has open tryouts for positions on his scooper squad.

In Triple Scoops, you will compete with other scoopers to serve customers by stacking cone and scoop cards in the proper flavor sequence. You gain points based on the flavors on the customer cards you serve. Flavors will vary in point value based on your hidden assignment.

On your turn, utilize special scooper tricks to manipulate your and/or your opponents' scoops to your benefit: swap a scoop from one cone to another, mix the order of scoops on a single cone, or plop a random scoop from the deck on any cone. You may also sway customers in line into changing their minds on what flavors they want!

Triple Scoops is delicious fun! With chaos and sabotage on the menu, can you scoop your way to victory?

-description from designer
mechanics: Drawing, Hidden Victory Points, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Initiation
description:
The Scourge is an underground organization of serial killers that has secretly plagued Valley Falls from the shadows. Although there have been mentions of them from time to time, they have been dormant for the past couple of years. That all changes when an officer with the Valley Falls Police Department comes across a jar containing 3 human hearts. Minutes after the officer radios in the grotesque findings, a courier delivers a package containing a disturbing VHS tape. Your friend, Phil Herbert with VFPD, gives you a call to immediately bring you in on the case because you were so helpful during Duel, the previous Scourge case. Phil mentions Anubis, The Scourge, and some type of initiation, and your mind immediately goes back to the serial killer competition that gripped the city a few years earlier. Will this be something similar? You pray that isn't the case as it will undoubtedly mean bloodshed on a wide scale. With a deep breath, you grab your things and head to the police station to get the details. What is The Scourge up to this time? Find out in this newest Scourge mystery…Initiation!

Difficulty Rating – 8/10

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Baratheon Heroes 4
description:
Whether commanding units of their own or standing united around King Renly Baratheon in support of his claim, the heroes of the Rainbow Guard comprise some of the most skilled warriors to take the field in the War of the Five Kings. They count among their number Ser Loras Tyrell, Ser Robar Royce, Lord Bryce Caron, Ser Emmon Cuy, Ser Guyard Morrigen, Brienne of Tarth, and Ser Parmen Crane. Each a capable commander in their own right, they are at their most formidable
standing together with King Renly himself on the field, not just for their expertise, but as a symbol for all King Renly’s troops to rally behind.


Details:**

The Baratheon Heroes 4 box presents a brand new unit of elite knights to fight fpr the Iron throne in the name of Renly Baratheon.
Contains the 7 rainbow guard and their Lord Commander, Loras Tyrell as well as the 'king' himself, Renly Baratheon.
The miniatures are highly detailed and come pre-assembled so they can be played with and painted straight out of the box.



Contains:**



12 Miniatures
1 Infantry movement tray
8 Attachment Cards
6 Tactics Cards
1 Special Rules Card
1 Unit Card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Boneforest
description: A tabletop skirmish warband game, 18+ mature content, a player versus player game, average game duration 2 hours, an out of the box game.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Ironjawz – Weirdknob Shaman
description:
Wildly unpredictable, savage, untamed and violent, Waaagh! magic cannot be controlled by anything with even a shred of sanity. Luckily, the Ironjawz don’t have many shreds of sanity amongst them, and the least-shredded of all are the Weirdnob Shamans. Seemingly never truly in control of their own bodies, they twist and twitch and gibber as Waaagh! energy courses unstoppably through them, staring at sights only they see and talking to nothing. The larger the gathering of Ironjawz around one of these strange orruks, the bigger the fireworks display when it all kicks off – maybe a blast of Waaagh! energy will hammer into the enemy like a particularly smelly gust, or maybe a massive green foot the size of a mountain will kick the entire enemy army in the face. Nobody’s exactly sure, and that’s half the fun!

This multi-part plastic kit contains the components necessary to assemble one Weirdnob Shaman, the bizarre and unpredictable wizard of the Ironjawz. Posed in a twitching, staggering stance as the power of the Waaagh! flows through him, he’s covered in detailed shamanic fetishes and is armed with a smouldering Waaagh! staff. 13 components, supplied with a Citadel 40mm Round base.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Ironjawz – Megaboss
description:
The biggest – and therefore the best – of the Ironjawz, the orruk Megabosses lead the Ironjaw warclans with a ramshackle unity, smashing and stomping and breaking and battering everything in reach. The more fights an orruk wins, the bigger they get; Megabosses are understandably massive, and more than happy to use their immense, muscular bulk to kick in the heads of anything and everything in their path. Covered in scraps of iron taken from bested foes, festooned with trophies of war and armed with some utterly brutal weaponry, orruk Megabosses are absolutely terrifying to even behold, let alone actually take on in battle.

This multi-part plastic kit contains the parts necessary to assemble one orruk Megaboss, covered in nailed-on iron armour, armed with a boss choppa and rip-tooth fist. Fourteen components are included, along with a Citadel 60mm Round base.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Catan Scenario: Malta
description:
The Catan - Malta Scenario was created for the 13th Catan World Championship held in Maleta, Malta November 2022.

Catan and Cities & Knights: Replace the desert hex with the Malta hex. Build board starting with the Malta hex on the edge of the board. Seafarers: Replace a random water tile near the center of the board.

Then place the Malta "10/11" number token on Malta with "11" side up.

You may not place a starting settlement or road within the Malta hex during set-up, but you may build on the hex's intersections and/or outer paths.

The Malta Hex: The hex has 6 routes (dotted paths) to enter the island of Malta.
Malta Routes: Building a malta route requires 1 lumber + 1 wood.

This is compatible with Catan, Catan - Seafarers, Catan - Cities & Knights, and their 5-6 Player Extensions.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2022 Goody Box
description:
The 2022 DiceFest Goody Box is filled with Promos and the DiceFest exclusive game miniature, the Veteran Bandido, made specifically for DiceFest! Except for the keychain, all the contents are for Shadows of Brimstone.

Other contents:

"Wanted Poster" Gear Set (6 cards)
Dark Thoughts (Growing Dread)
Stolen Gear (Darkness)
Whiskey Stash (Gear)
Barkeep’s Shotgun (Gear)
Derelict Ship/Canyons joiner tile
Dark Stone Well/Machine Gun Nest tile and its Mine and Trederra map cards and the Echoes from Below and Abandoned Position event cards (Promos 1007 to 1010)
DiceFest-Exclusive Veteran Bandido Miniature in Thermal Plastic
Last Night on Earth keychain
categories: Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: alcasan
description:
The somehow different card game.

Play tactically smart to keep your opponents at bay.
But was your first decision the right one? Will luck be on your side? Find out now!

Goal is to get rid of all card in your hands, but if a played card shows one of the 4 elements, then special rules apply.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: RunArch
description:
RunArch was found few years ago in the dusty ground as a relic of our ancestors. Noone has known the rules, but we decided to bring this game alive.

In RunArch, players move tokens on the board to create the best combination identical to combination on their cards. They can choose quick or boost strategy.
When the combination matches, player archives his card to archive hopeful to get some additional points.

But anything of that won´t happened if the archive wouldn't have a bet - GOLDEN or SILVER TOKEN. Player has to be quick to get golden or silver token first but also careful.
BET is still a BET and sometimes you can choose a wrong horse.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Catch the Leader, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Wanyama
description:
There is a tribe of people that can communicate with animals (Wanyama). You, the player, have the ability to borrow the animals’ powers. There is a law in this tribe, that the leader’s ability to communicate with the animals is extraordinary.

In this game, you will compete with other players to become the leader of the tribe. The object of the game is to reach the goal with the help of the Wanyama.

This game is played by gaining points as you draw cards and play them against your opponents, you can play this game in a short time with a steady rhythm.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Race

name: Yama Yama Tani Tani
description:
Oda Nobunaga once said that he would hunt his enemies down "on every hill and valley." That term, in Japanese, is "yama yama tani tani".

In Yama Yama Tani Tani 2 or 4 players choose from among 6 different Chinese warlords of the Three Kingdoms era or from among 6 different Japanese daimyo of the Warring States period to battle each other in a no-luck, no-dice faceoff for supremacy in their respective countries.

Each leader comes with his 9 most trusted generals and must be divided into two armies of five units each. Players select their first 5-man army for the first battle, and assign each general a troop type based on that generals allowances and the strategic advantages that player wants to pursue. Then each player assigns those units to the first battlefield.

Generals move about the battlefield, attacking enemy generals, but with a twist. The skills that each general has allow him to do more than just make basic attacks. They allow him to both manipulate the enemy units and his own to his advantage, but, more importantly, the correct use of a skill can trigger another friendly general to use one of his skills, adding more damage to the attack. That general's use of a skill could trigger another, an so on. The real strategy is trying to make the most of your generals' skills and build wildly powerful combos of attacks on the battlefield to destroy your opponent's army.

After each battle, the winning player gains Mandate according to the number of his generals still alive. After 6 battles, if one player has more Mandate, that player is the winner. If players are tied, there will be a 7th and final battle, using all 10 of those players' generals, to determine the victor.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Float: From the Deep – The Bowels of Davy Jones' Locker Promo Card
description:
"The Bowels of Davy Jones' Locker" is a KS Exclusive 'From the Deep' promo card.

Unbeknown to the survivors of the crash, they had arrived in water riddled with death. Below them lay centuries of bodies lost to Davy Jones' Locker. Now these bodies are but servants, commanded by the sea to bring it more souls. When the Bowels of Davy Jones' Locker opens, hell will follow.

The card reads:

"Swallowed by the sea many years ago. Reborn in the raging bowels below. They haunt the waves as their legion grows."

The card stats are:

8 Hit Points required to defeat creature

-1 Castaway and -1 Equipment if player is defeated

This promo was free for Day One backers and included with pledges $55 or higher. It was then available later for $3.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Cid Campeador: Warrior of Fortune
description:
Cid Campeador: Warrior of Fortune is a Strategic level wargame set in the time of El Cid Campeador, the Moorish Spain in second half of XI century. The game starts in 1080. El Cid is exiled by King Alfonso VI being forced to leave his lands and properties in Castilla, and it ends in 1099 just after his death.
