During the last 20 years of el Cid´s life (5 turns), four players taking the role of Cid Campeador, Cristian Kingdoms, Taifa Kingdoms and Almoravids respectively, will fight to expand and protect their kingdoms to achieve the supremacy in the Iberian Peninsula.

Each faction is asymmetric so the experience of playing each faction will be different. For instance, Cristian Kingdoms will start expanding their frontiers by conquering territories to the Taifas from the north of the peninsula. Almoravids will arrive from north Africa and will start conquering territories from the South of the peninsula. Taifa player will try to defend his Taifa kingdoms and will try to avoid internal wars between Taifa kingdoms. In the meantime, el Cid Campeador will offer his service to the best offeror as an experienced and recognized Warlord taking advantage of the situation.

Each turn is split into two different segments. At the beginning of each turn players will get cards and will have to arrange them in two decks one for each segment not being able to exchange cards between these two decks after the administration phase. In each segment players will playing cards (one at a time) based on their initiative. Cards can be played as Events or Action points.

The player who gets more victory points at the end of the game will win.

Turn sequence summary:
1. Administrative phase.
2. Diplomatic phase.
3. Initiative phase (first segment).
4. Action phase (first segment).
5. Initiative phase (second segment).
6. Action phase (second segment).
7. Maintenance phase.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: 5D20 Football
description:
5D20 Football is a game built for the solo gamer. Everything runs off the roll of 5 d20 dice. The game is fairly simple yet has depth in how plays turnout. The tabletop version uses charts and dice.

To begin with the dice are rolled to get the play type, depth, and the who which is all based off a teams' offensive chart. The plays take into account the down, distance, and the ball location on the field. Later in the game, time left and the score can affect the play calls as well. This roll also on occasion can trigger a fumbled snap or a pre-snap penalty.

Once the play is known we progress to the play itself which require rolling 5d20 dice. To start, the red die gets you the defender for the play (this player comes off the defensive teams chart), and who the player is also depends on the game situation (a passing situation is more likely to get a player from the secondary while a run play is more likely to have a lineman).

For a PASS: The white die gives you how the defender affects the play. They can get pressure on a QB, get a chance to break up a pass, allow an open receiver, which will result in the receiver making a catch, a drop, or yards after a catch. The blue die is checked against the QB or the receiver, depending on what the defensive player allowed. The black die gets your yardage and the yellow die is for a possible penalty.

For a RUN: The white die gives you how the defender affects the play. They can get penetration and hit a runner in the backfield, hit the runner at the line, or allow a hole for the runner to run through. The blue die gets how the runner reacts to what the defense gave them by spinning away from a loss, to breaking a run through a hole. The black die gets you the yardage gained and the yellow die is used for a possible penalty.

Special team plays are as simple as rolling the 5d20 and using them to get distance, the returner and yardage, along with chances for penalties and fumbles.

Players are rated so that their impact in the game reflect their real life styles. So while the game may seem simple there is a ton of interaction allowing everything that happens in a football game to happen on the tabletop with 5D20 Football.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Revolution: State of War
description:
Revolution: State of War is a 2 player asymmetric military strategy on the Armed struggle for American Independence. The primary objective is to establish and maintain the support of the population for your cause, but to do so often requires one to have control or possession of the territory where people live, and for that one must take command of your nation's forces, maneuver and engage in battles to secure the colonies.

Both sides have very unique and distinct advantages. The British with their professional force and naval prowess can dominate coastal positions, but may have some difficulty when getting too far away from their coastal bases. They know the longer the war drags on the more chances Americans will have to secure French support along with building up their forces to a higher standard. As such, the British will want to hit the ground running and maintain the pressure, seeking out engagement after engagement to decimate the rebel forces so when they are better trained it will be immaterial at that point, or a day late and a dollar short.

The American's on the other hand need time to secure an alliance with the French and convert this rag-tag band of revolutionaries into a professional army to really flip the script but one doesn't always get the army they want, when they need it and have to fight with the army they have. As such, to buy time and save face with the population the American forces will need to make the British advance as costly as possible by occupying advantageous terrain, leveraging the support of the population with Militia forces, and knowing when to simply run away.

The game incorporates cards but is not a card driven game, the cards provide enhancements and bonus abilities as well as enable deception actions that can really through a wrench in the works for your opponent.

When forces contest territory on the Game Board, the game zooms in to a unique battle sequence, which is a mini-game itself; units deploy into lanes of combat and roll dice to score hits and kills with bonuses and enhancements for aspects like rout, exposed flank (enfilade), and Dragoon Charge.

Can you lead your nations forces to victory?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Lunar Chess
description:
The moon is the next frontier of human civilization and mega-corporations rush to build colonies on the harsh lunar landscape. Joint ventures must be formed to complete the behemoth cities of the future, but the corporations, desperate to maximize profits and secure their legacy, never stop fighting for majority control.

In Lunar Chess, you and an opponent play as two such corporations. On your turn, you will add a card to the shared colony, enlarging groups of various development types: housing, crystal farms, and solar arrays. Every card you lay also activates the movement of your Speculator who is dispatched to make investments on your behalf. At the end of the game, you will identify the largest group of each development type. The player who made the majority of investments in these groups is the winner.

Lunar Chess borrows elements from Western chess and blends them with modern mechanisms like area control and tile-laying to create a unique gaming experience that feels part abstract and part strategy game. Lunar Chess is both tactical and strategic and is full of surprises.

-description from designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Addition, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Tile Placement

name: Fullstack Ninjas: el trabajador unicornio
description:
Juego de cartas/mesa del mundo IT.

Cada jugador se abre paso en el complejo mundo de IT con una empresa de uno de los cuatro tipos disponibles (consultora cárnica, tapadera fiscal, startup o crypto fintech blockchain wichiwey).

Deberán completar el desarrollo de El Producto™, y para ello deberán ir contratando una plantilla de sufridores obreros del teclado, así como de otros animalillos de la fauna del ecosistema IT.

Tendrán que gestionar cuidadosamente los fondos y sopesar con cuidado las contrataciones… Y sufrirán, como en todos los proyectos, eventualidades que pondrán en peligro el desarrollo, la financiación, etc., así como con soporte y tecnologías que le serán de gran ayuda. La guerra empresarial jugará un importante papel también para ser el primero en desarrollar El Producto™.

Pero además de desarrollar El Producto™... ¡hay que venderlo! Paco el vendehumo te puede echar una mano con los Clientes. Pero no te fíes un pelo, ¡que te la lía!

Fullstack ninjas es un juego de cartas/mesa por turnos, donde tú, en cada turno/sprint, como empresa IT, tendrás que hacer trabajar a tu plantilla (con una original mecánica de dados y decisiones estratégicas) para desarrollar tareas, contratar/despedir personal, contratar campañas publicitarias para ganar clientes, o subcontratar servicios de consultoría/soporte. Algunos trabajadores y habilidades te permitirán atacar a tus rivales o defenderte de ellos.
El juego termina cuando un jugador consigue desarrollar El Producto(TM) (llega a la casilla "Go-live"), y tiene suficientes clientes (el número depende de las tarjetas de desarrollo que se utilicen en la partida).

...

Fullstack ninjas is a turn-based card/board game where you, in each turn/sprint, as an IT company, will have to make your team work (with an original dice mechanics, modifiers and strategic decisions) to develop tasks, hire/fire staff, hire advertising campaigns to gain clients, or subcontract consulting/support services. Some workers and abilities will allow you to attack your rivals or defend yourself from them.

The game ends when a player successfully develops The Product(TM) (reaches the "Go-live" space) and has enough clients (the number depends on the development cards used in the game). Then that player wins.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Market, Race, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Arcmage: Changing Winds
description:
The fifth core set of our libre fantasy style strategic card game Arcmage.

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spatial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: UnderBEEt them!
description:
Bees are the main theme of this game. You can find honey combs with values from one to ten, but also the queen bee, worth zero. Zero for a queen bee sounds nothing, but that's what the game is about: Gathering as little points as possible, as the games name suggests. Besides the honey combs there are a few action cards, worth twenty points.

At the begin of the game, each player is dealt hidden cards, he may peek at two of them. Game proceeds in clockwise order, players draw a card. Action cards are executed immediately, honey combs and queen bees may replace any of the hidden cards or be discarded. If a player thinks, that he has the least score in his hidden cards, he can announce the end of the round. Everybody else has one more turn, then the cards are revealed. Each player gets points according to his cards. If the announcer does not have the least score, he is fined additional points.

The game leaves out any kind of plastic packaging, a percentage of the revenue is donated to projects protecting bees.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Saga: Age of Alexander
description:
Age of Alexander is the second SAGA supplement to cover Antiquity. It describes the many events that forged the Greek world, starting with the Persian Wars and ending in the chaotic agony of the Successors. This Universe presents six new faction, all totally compatible with the previously released Age of Hannibal and the soon to come Age of Caesars. Some factions include multiple variants, and all of them come with their Battle Boards, historical summary, Legendary Units and Special Rules.

Factions included: The Greek Cities, Persians, Thracians, Macedonians, Indians and the Successors.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Death Ride Normandy: Gold Beach
description:
The British 50th Infantry Division, landing to the west of the 3rd Canadian Infantry Division, made good gains on D-Day and looked like it would be able to advance on Bayeux on the 7th without problem. After consolidating for the night the British moved out smartly in the morning to the south along the road toward Bayeux. For the 2 days they would make some headway, and then be stopped cold for weeks by Panzer Lehr, possibly the best Panzer Division in the German Army. The fight between these 2 divisions would become legendary during the campaign and filled with vicious combat.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Ice-Panning
description:
You play as a youngster in the spring of 1927. The ice is breaking up in the fjärds of central Stockholm. The object of the game is to dare your friends to stay the longest on the ice sheets that are continuously breaking.
Place your meeples on a paper and tear out the biggest possible piece without toppling any meeples. Then play the pieces you have collected to win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Map Reduction, Sudden Death Ending

name: Stregherie: La Sfida
description:
A game of averts and spells for subversive witches! Diana, the queen of the witches, has passed on, through her daughter Aradia, the knowledge of the old religion to the women of the people; explaining to them how to perform averts to avenge the oppressions they have suffered.
Today, on the sacred day of the Moon, the most powerful witches have gathered to challenge each other to find out who will be the chosen one to whom Aradia will reveal the secret of Magic!

Goal of the game
To complete the greatest number of Conjuration with the required Ingredient Cards, thus accumulating points.
Each Conjuration has a point value.

Conduct of the Game
Distribute to each player 4 Ingredients Cards at random (5 in the case of Morgana), place on the table 5 Conjurors to complete and 4 free Ingredients Cards face up, thus forming the Witches "Market".
Starting with whoever last stroked a cat (in case of a tie, whoever stroked a black cat wins), each player must place a minimum of 1 ingredient up to a maximum of 3 on one or more of the Conjurors on the table.
If he or she cannot do so, he or she must reveal his or her hand to his or her opponents and turn over the cards in the Ingredient Cards deck until he or she finds one that can be used on a Conjuring. Cards thus uncovered and unused should be shuffled back into the deck.
In addition to playing Ingredient Cards, during his or her turn, each player may also perform the following actions in any order (even BEFORE placing the ingredient on the Conjuring)

Draw an ingredient card by choosing it from the Marketplace or drawing it covered from the deck
Use the abilities of one's Witch.
Use the Spell of a Witch (see below)
Place a Corrupted Ingredient on an already played Grain, Water, or Lemon (also outside your turn)


On a Conjuration, placing both cards in the discard pile.
The following steps are also performed before passing the turn:

A check is made to see if one or more Conjurors have been completed. In that case, the player who placed the last ingredient takes the completed and places them next to his Witch card. As many Conjurors are drawn and placed on the table as needed to return to 5.
You replenish the Market deck until you return to 4 the Ingredients Cards shown as soon as they are less than 4
You draw cards from the Covered Ingredient Cards deck until you reform your hand of 4 cards (5 in the case of Morgana)


Spell of a Conjuration
Each Conjuration has a Spell attached to it. When a player who has already completed a Conjuration wants to use it, he must-in his turn unless otherwise indicated-read aloud the text portion of the ritual and then use the Spell listed on the card. Each spell can be used only once; to remember it turn the Conjuration card upside down with the spell that was used.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Interrupts, Once-Per-Game Abilities

name: Sellswords & Spellslingers: Close Quarter Battles
description:
A 90-page campaign for Sellswords and Spellslingers where players build a party of 2-3 heroes to fight across city streets, alleys, squares, markets, gardens, meadows, and forests all while completing scenarios to unveil an intricate plot. Can be played solo or with up to 3 players, each controlling a single hero.

Contents: Complete rules for smaller, quicker games (1-2 hours). A story-driven campaign in 12 scenarios (6 mandatory acts and 6 optional side quests). An NPC management system to control sidekicks. Random tables (Loot, Wandering Monsters, Complications). A magic item generator and 18 new monsters.

—description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Web Warriors Affiliation Pack
description:
Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Web Warriors Affiliation Pack brings together the version of Peter Parker originally included in the Core Set with the Venom originally found in CP09 and Spider-Man (Miles Morales) and Ghost-Spider originally found in CP10 to give players the miniatures that will form the foundation of their Web Warriors teams.

Along with these miniatures, players will find stat cards for all four characters and reprints of the Sucker, Trip Up, Lethal Protector, Uneasy Allies, All Webbed Up, and Web Barrier Team Tactics cards, ensuring they have everything they need to swing into the thick of battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rhino
description:
A new villain charges onto the battlefield in Marvel Crisis Protocol: Rhino.

With a durable second skin grafted all over his body, the aptly named Rhino is stronger, tougher, and more inured to pain than your average supervillain. This pack adds this rampaging villain to players' rosters, giving them another powerful option in the Spider-Foes and Criminal Syndicate affiliations. Additionally, three Team Tactic cards enhance Rhino's abilities, making him even more versatile in battle.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Race of Legends
description:
A racing game with multiple themed decks of cards for racers. Players take control of racers and the first to reach the finish line wins. Each racers has special powers that can alter dice, effect other racers, effect themselves, or the board.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Within Walls: Infiltration
description:
First expansion for Within Walls a paranoia driven hidden traitor game with social deduction elements set in the early 20th century horror setting.

The "Infiltration" is the story response by the "Agency" to gather information while obstructed by the "Cult"

Within Walls: Infiltration deepens the mystery of the original Within Walls story.
While the conflict between the Agency and the Cult escalated, it also became obvious
that the real threat was somewhere else and far more malicious than just human
organizations with different agendas.

See what happens when the Ghost is added to the equation!

Up to 8 player games
New professions
New interactions with the "Change" cards
A new Agenda!

The game is played in the same setting as the original since the goal of the game is playing the interaction between players instead of with the board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Events, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Tales of the Arthurian Knights
description:
In Tales of the Arthurian Knights, you are a hero or heroine in a story of adventure and awe! You and your fellows will travel the land at the behest of the renowned King Arthur. Through a series of quests, you will make impactful choices that will steer the course of your journey. Secure your place in history by achieving glorious feats, lest your efforts be doomed to obscurity. Gather your band of Knights around the table to enjoy your own epic tale as it unfolds!

Building on the mechanisms from the classic storytelling game Tales of the Arabian Nights, you now find yourself in the age of chivalry alongside Lancelot, Merlin, and many other characters from Arthurian lore. Quests will lead to glorious battles, daring rescues, and the discovery of such marvels as the Holy Grail.

As you navigate through this paragraph-driven experience, an updated victory point system will track your success. Tales of the Arthurian Knights eliminates matrixes and charts in favor of a streamlined method of dictating the paragraphs that will shape your adventure. After making your choices, a single roll plus skill bonuses will determine success or failure.

Choose your actions carefully, and you will be rewarded with skills, renown, and nobility. Choose poorly, and be scorned, cursed, or made a pariah. Bring the age of King Arthur to life in this incredibly replayable board game with a plethora of tales that are sure to challenge, amuse, surprise, and entertain!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Disc Cards
description:
Disc Cards is a fun and challenging card and dice game set in the world of disc golf. Players navigate through 9 or 18 of 555 unique disc golf locations, creating a new course each game: no two games will be alike! Players choose their Route (Ace, Birdie, or Par), roll the dice, and use their Disc Cards to match the obstacles presented by each location.

Play solo or with a golf mob of up to six players, play competitively or cooperatively: it's up to you! Create your custom 60-card deck from a pool of cards or use a premade random deck right out of the box. With 222 unique and powerful discs to choose from, the strategies are endless!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Sports
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Matching, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: King of the Court
description:
Set in the King of the Court tournament, in this card game you will become a beach volleyball player trying to win points against your opponents and stay as King for as long as possible.
In each turn only 2 players face each other (King versus 2nd), whoever wins the point remains King, and the loser will have to wait for a new opportunity at the end of the row of turns.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Hand Management

name: Feast of Olympians
description:
In Feast of Olympians, spend Obol to build your deck with fierce monsters, weapons and heroes. Use Swords to conquer your foes. Gain enough Ambrosia, with the help of Olympic Gods, to win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Lion Rampant: A Viking in the Sun – The Mediterranean Adventures of Harald Hardrada
description:
This expansion for Lion Rampant: Medieval Wargaming Rules explores the Mediterranean world before the crusades through the adventures of the exiled Viking prince Harald Hardrada (“hard ruler”). Harald is best known for his invasion of England in 1066 as king of Norway, and for his death at the Battle of Stamford Bridge, which was a prelude to the Norman conquest of England. However, between 1033 and 1042 Harald spent his formative years as a commander in the famous Varangian Guard of Byzantium, taking part in campaigns in Upper Mesopotamia, Palestine, the Aegean Sea, Southern Italy, and the Balkans.

In this supplement you will find historical information, new upgrades (from new tactics, such as Feigned Retreat, to terrain upgrades, among others), and three mini-campaigns based on extracts from Norse sagas and Mediterranean chronicles. The first campaign is a fight against a bandit boss in the Holy Land during an armed pilgrimage to rebuild the Holy Sepulcher in Jerusalem; the second takes place during a Byzantine attempt to retake Sicily from its Muslim rulers; and the third one tackles the early stages of the Norman conquest of Southern Italy.

At the same time, there is no requirement to use Harald and the Varangians. This supplement includes five army lists (Varangians, Muslim Powers, Byzantines, Normans, Lombard and Byzantine Italian principalities), and alternative leaders for each of the campaigns with suggested skills based on their back stories.

The campaigns are also easily adaptable to other medieval contexts and to other rules sets.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Moon Bunny
description:
In Moon Bunny, you take on the role of a master bunny alchemist inspired by folklore. Your task is to guide your bunny assistants on a journey through the lunar landscape to gather rare Asian herbs. Each assistant has their own unique hopping movement pattern, and it is up to you to choose the right ones for the task at hand. Once you have collected the necessary ingredients, bring them back to your workshop and arrange them in a specific pattern to brew the ultimate elixir of life. The bunny who is able to gift this elixir to the world, bringing health and happiness to all, wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Omni-sight Goggles
description: A prize card for gambling in Red Dragon Inn. The card lets you look at another players hand before you ante.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Birds of Prey: TOPGUN
description:
1986. Present day. The Indian Ocean. OPFOR airspace. Across 36 years of technological advancement, can you still prove you’re the best of the best? From its small start in a trailer out back of Miramar’s hangar row and validated in the skies over Vietnam, the role of the Navy Fighter Weapons School exploded into public consciousness at the climax of the Cold War. Hollywood’s flash and fiction can’t distract from one consistent theme — the drive to win. Not as a lone maverick, but part of a team; pilot and RIO, lead and wingman. Together, just like the name — one word, all caps — TOPGUN.

Face an array of Navy adversaries and opposing air forces hell–bent on teaching you very real lessons. Fortunately for you, you are not going it alone! Included are a variety of scenarios teaching the real-life tactics for employing your mighty wings. This game is about combat, so study hard and lean into what you’ve learned. There are no points for second place!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Kódem TCG
description:
Kódem TCG is a new trading card game where you become the Protector of the Adendei, you must choose your cards to defeat 6 rival cards while you protect your own cards.

You can equip your cards, choose your play field and your Protector, each with unique abilities.

The player which manages to defeat 6 rival cards win.

Kódem TCG also has Multiplayer game mode.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: Mafia: Fantasy
description:
Almost nothing has changed in the City version of the Mafia card game since 1980s. But what if there was a new version of Mafia, where the game experience becomes more diverse, unused and balanced with each card having a special ability. A team of players with 5 years of experience playing Mafia came up with an advanced version of Mafia. Our team has tested this version of Mafia in London for the last half a year. The result is that after playing Fantasy Mafia no one wanted to play the usual city Mafia ever again. The cards for this Mafia are for sale in two languages ​​​​(English and Russian).There are also two different card designs themed in "Fantasy" and "Science fiction" settings. The cards also exist in two formats - "Poker" size and "Tarot " size.

Different timeline settings - this version of Mafia has either :


High Fantasy styled cards
Science fiction styled cards


In this version of Mafia each Card has a different ability, so up to 21 abilities per pack of 21 cards.

Some "abilities" examples:


" After the death a player gains a new card chosen from 5"
"The Player can choose whom he starts the game as Mafia, Killer or Villager "
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Space Exploration
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Desert Blitzkrieg: Rommel's North African Campaign
description:
Desert Blitzkrieg is a two-player game covering the North African desert from April 1941 to December 1942. Units are regimental level and Divisional Integrity is key to maximizing the density of your forces on the map covering eastern Libya and western Egypt from Aghelia to El Alamein. The game is of low-moderate complexity and features a ‘Point-to-Point’ system while introducing a number of unique features.

"Losing Tobruk was one of the heaviest blows I can recall during the war.” — Winston Churchill

Movement is along three different road types. Limited Port movement is possible. Supply Unit availability is critical for Battles as supply units must be expended to conduct a Battle.

Simple but involving combat. Battles use a ‘Battle Board’ with a ‘Front Line’ and ‘Second Line’ where positional tactics to maximize Combat Values are key. Battles can be a ‘game within a game’ and go for many rounds or be over quickly depending upon the player’s decisions. Unit types reflect different capabilities on the ‘Battle Board’ and the main map.

A deck of event cards is provided to introduce a limited set of ‘random events’ that will force players to deal with the uncertainty of combat.

While game play is relatively easy, players will be confronted with many decision in a given game turn, with many different outcomes building play tension while delivering great replay value.


HQs must decide whether to enhance Supply, Movement or Combat each turn.
Use of one or two ‘Long Range Desert Force’s (specially marked Recon units).
Player must decide a limited Card draw is to be made (there are only 6 per game, base).
Supply Units must be used for supply line extension and also are expended for Combat, so decisions about usage are key.
What boxes to build a limited number of Fortifications?
How to use the limited air support; Combat Attack, Defense, or Interdiction.
“Battle Board” management. Deciding where to place units to maximize Combat Value.


Product Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10 (Low/Moderate)
Playing time: 2.5 hours for short game, 10+ hours for full campaign
Solitaire Suitability: High
Players: Two (suitable for solitaire play)
Map Scale: Abstract (point to point)
Time Scale: Monthly turns
Unit Scale: Regimental equivalents with Divisional Integrity

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Caged In
description:
Caged In is a fast-paced 2 player fighting game that has players squaring off in MMA combat. Fighters will choose from four unique styles and try to knock each other out, submit each other, or impress the judges for a decision. Caged In is perfect for those who like games that are simple to learn and hard to master. The strategy comes from managing your hand and trying to exploit your opponent's weaknesses. The game features a unique hexagonal box design, dual layered player and game boards with damage cubes that sink into the board and custom designed 3D miniatures.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Single Loser Game

name: Kreel Manor: The Dungeon Crawl Card Game
description:
Prequel to the award-winning Veilwraith: A Veil Odyssey Game, Kreel Manor takes place before the end of the world, whence colour and life still bloomed. A last alliance of powerful heroes discovers the existence of a potential tear in the Veil between worlds, which threatens to release a plague of ancient demons upon the realm of Kilforth. Venturing forth, the heroes trace the source of this foul scourge to its origin: the ominous and deadly citadel, Kreel Manor.

In Kreel Manor players become the legendary champions of bygone times, embarking on a doomed quest to save the world.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: PUNCHLINE
description:
Punchline è un gioco cattivo, irriverente, di black humor… e assolutamente non politically correct!
I giocatori devono creare l’abbinamento più divertente e mettere alla prova il senso dell’umorismo degli altri

COME SI GIOCA? Un giocatore legge una carta domanda. Gli altri giocatori mettono una carta risposta. Vince la combinazione più divertente

400 carte scandalose, cattive e trasgressive. Punchline è un gioco vietato ai minori. Siete avvisati!
Un gioco perfetto per feste, compleanni, addii al nubilato o al celibato, serate con gli amici. Insomma: è perfetto per qualsiasi occasione

Numero di giocatori: 3-20 | Età consigliata: 18+ | Durata media: 30-120 min. | Edizione in lingua italiana
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Спящий агент (Sleeping agent)
description:
You are a secret agent and have been leaking secret info to the black market for many years. But now an auditor has been sent after you. One careless word - and you are exposed! Each turn, one of you becomes an agent and the other an auditor. The agent explains the secret word to the rest, and the auditor listens and monitors the list of forbidden words. If the agent calls one of them, he is caught - they are already coming for him! If you don't get caught, you will earn points. Then another couple becomes the auditor and agent. The game ends when everyone has has played as auditor twice.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Real-Time

name: Shadow of the Lich
description: Shadow of the Lich is played over two stages (consisting of nine rounds total), on a grid of nine cards representing your town: the first stage involves finding the three artifacts needed to summon the lich by defeating the undead or searching buildings using dice rolls. The second stage requires finding the lich before all locations come under his control (one is randomly flipped after each round).
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement

name: Trench Offensive
description:
Trench Offensive is a miniature wargame for two or more players, set in World War 1 trench combat. miniatures raid the trenches and try to get the objective and fight off the other set of miniatures.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Zone of Control

name: Detectorama
description:
Detectorama takes place at Village Green, a small town in South England where there is a curious interest in metal detecting. The Royal Society of Detectorists is organizing an exhibition to introduce this interesting hobby, so the Board has asked its members for a big collection of finds to fill their showcases. This demand has energized the entire detectorist community and turned afternoon detecting sessions into real battles for the best finds.

Inspired by BBC's "Detectorists" series, Detectorama is a competitive themed eurogame in which you will play the role of a member of the Royal Society of Detectorists seeking recognition from his fellow detectorists. Buy equipment, get it ready for your field trips, get detecting tips, official permits, discover new locations to detect and find the most valuable finds for the exhibition or even gold... who knows.

The main action of the game is metal detecting and everything revolves around it. This action is represented by a dice roll conditioned mainly by the equipment used for detection. But dice can be manipulated and optimized to reduce randomness; so before going out to the fields you better get ready.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Income, Loans, Multi-Use Cards, Order Counters, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Advanced Squad Leader Overlay Bundle
description:
The Advanced Squad Leader Overlay Bundle contains a re-printing of every overlay (on 37 cardstock sheets) issued by Avalon Hill or MMP except:


Overlays from MMP's Red Factories
Deluxe overlays (available in MMP's Deluxe ASL)
Gavutu-Tanambogo overlays from Avalon Hill's ASL Annual 93b (re-released as a paper map in MMP's Rising Sun)
Overlay E1 (escarpment) from Avalon Hill's West of Alamein (re-released as board 25e in MMP's Hollow Legions 3rd Ed.)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Hugsa: Guardians of the Community
description:
In the town of Mon Khunkhao, where you live, things have started to change: the skies have turned gray, people have started to look sad.

You know that pollution is the cause, so you decide to join the Hugsa, a group of kids the same age as you, who are trying to make a difference. They go out at the end of each day to collect and recycle as much waste as they can before the people burn it at night.

But the kids at the Hugsa would like to test your commitment first: if you and your friends can collect waste and earn enough recycle hero badges, then you will be allowed to join the Hugsa and help clean up all of Mon Khunkhao.

Work together and gain 6 recycle hero badges before 6 terrain tiles are removed from the game because of pollution and you will win.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Reduction

name: KISS Tour: The Board Game That Rocks
description:
Go on tour with your favorite rock band, KISS! Help The Demon, The Spaceman, The Starchild, and the Catman, as they travel across the USA.

Put on the best shows, collect tons of cash, and bring Rock and mayhem everywhere you go. First player to hold a concert in each city on this cross-country tour wins!

Will you become a Rock Legend?

—description from publisher
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Dimir Control
description:
Challenger Decks 2022 are a set of preconstructed decks designed for tabletop players that wish to start competitive tournament play right out of the box for the Standard format. Released on April 1, 2022, there are four decks in total, containing a 60-card main deck, a 15-card sideboard, as well their associated tokens.

Dimir Control contains 2 mythic, 23 rare, 17 uncommon, and 18 common cards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Marvel United: Maximum Carnage
description:
Escaping from prison, Carnage partnered with Shriek and the couple started a twisted sort of “family”, bringing in Doppelganger and Demogoblin under Carnage’s symbiotic “wings”. Joined by other dark Villains like Morbius, the living vampire, these New Sinister Six pose a unified threat that will test the heroes’ resolve to the limit. Carnage poses a whole new kind of challenge, though. Spreading his infection around, the symbiote is hellbent on bringing Maximum Carnage to the world!

This expansion brings a whole new set of sinister Villains for the Heroes to face. Whether tackled on their own, or as the united New Sinister Six, each of these Villains poses a unique threat. But to bring Maximum Carnage to any of your games, this set also includes the Carnage Challenge, where Dark Carnage prowls around the game area infecting people and raising the stakes of the game. Take him out quickly, or you may find yourself facing Dark Carnage as a full-fledged Villain!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Red Coats, Grey Jackets: The Battle of Chippawa, July 5, 1814
description:
Red Coats, Grey Jackets is an introductory level wargame on the battle of Chippawa. It is part of the Battles for Canada Series of games that portray famous battles fought for control of Canada during the War of 1812.

Players will also need a standard deck of playing cards (a custom series card set is available from the publisher) and a six-sided die to play the game. Each hex is approximately 50 yards across, a regular or militia infantry unit is 250-350 men, First Nation and Dragoon units are 80 to 100 men, and artillery units represent 2 or 3 guns. A turn represents one hour of time.

Each copy of Red Coats, Grey Jackets is composed of the following:

• One 11 by 17 inch map with Turn Record Track.
• 90 double-sided, un-mounted counters.
• 8 pages of rules.

Each hex is approximately 50 yards across, a regular or militia infantry unit is 250-350 men, First Nation and Dragoon units are 80 to 100 men, and artillery units represent 2 or 3 guns. A turn represents one hour of time.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: A Sharp and Fierce Fight: The Battle of Cook's Mills, October 19, 1814
description:
A Sharp and Fierce Fight is an introductory level wargame on the battle of Cook's Mills. It is part of the Battles for Canada Series that portray famous battles fought for control of Canada during the War of 1812.

Each hex is approximately 50 yards across, a regular or militia infantry unit is 150-150 men, Dragoon units are 80 to 100 men, and artillery units represent 1 cannon or 4 Congreve rocket launchers. A turn represents 45 minutes of time.

Players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units (a custom series card set is available from the publisher). A six-sided die is used to resolve combats (assault and fire) as well as to resolve other game events.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Jena
description:
Jena: La Disfatta della Prussia is an Italian wargame - published together by "I Giochi dei Grandi" and "Torneo Master" - on the battle of Jena-Auerstadt, with four scenarios: the two eponymous battles, the campaign linking both battles and a variant based on a Prussian early assault, as analysed by the English historian David G. Chandler.
The game-system is derived from Kevin Zucker's Napoleon's Last Battles published in 1976 by SPI.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Unstable Unicorns: Sugar Raid Unicorn Promo Card
description:
Convention promo card for 2023

Card Text
If this card is in your Stable at the beginning of your turn, you may skip your Draw phase, then play 2 cards during your Action phase.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Cosmic Encounter: 8-player Combo Cards
description:
Combo Cards present specific match-ups of aliens to have in a game, listed in order of player count.

The 8-player Combo Cards were promos developed for Escape Velocity, a science-fiction themed convention.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Indio
description:
Indio is a Euro-style board game for 2-4 players age 14 and up. It takes 60-90 minutes to play, during which you'll be using workers to collect resources, modify the production of the land, and build structures. Your goal is to have the most influence (victory points) and be crowned the ruler of Indio!

The game is divided into 7 rounds (called years) where each year includes five phases: Quests, Production, Crafting, Harvest, and Actions. Quests give you goals to accomplish in order to earn influence. Production adds resources to the game board. Crafting allows you to add resources and workers to your buildings. Harvest is a time to feed your workers and prepare them for the year. Finally, the Action phase is the core of the game where you'll use your workers to move, collect resources, improve the land, build structures, and even attack other workers.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: PolliNations
description:
PolliNations takes you into the fascinating world of pollinating insects and invites you to discover their importance for our cities' well-being! By helping bees, butterflies, hover-flies and sphinx moths to collect pollen, build urban gardens and green corridors you might be able to save the cities from pollution!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Apples to Apples Picture Time
description:
A version of the popular Apples to Apples game with pictures only. Great for young kids and families.

The game play is the same as the original game where the judge reveals a green card and players each choose the most fitting red card from their hand to play that best matches the green card. The only difference is that you are trying to match pictures instead of words. The judge chooses the player whose card best fits the description given by the green card, and they get a point.

Contents: 168 cards quick play rules.
mechanics: Player Judge

name: Hell On Halloween
description:
Hell on Halloween is a 1-vs-all retro horror themed game. One person acts as the killer and tries to murder all players before midnight, while all victims try their best to survive until midnight on Halloween night.

There are six rounds indicated by hours during the night eg. 6-7pm. Each round consists these phases: stalking, trick or treat, location, encounter, combat, regroup.

Stalking is when the killer plans the round, drawing location cards and selecting a hidden area they are stalking. They also lay traps around town.

Victims will go trick-or-treating around the board, rolling for candy to use in the location phase. The killer also rolls for a chance to place razor blades in candy to cause injuries, forcing a victim to visit the hospital.

During the location phase, the killer reveals the traps they have laid causing further damage. The killer shows victims where they have been prowling, causing some to hide. Victims consume the candy they collected to relocate to better areas where they can search for supplies later on.

The encounter phase is when the killer reveals their hidden stalked location card. This phase will play out differently depending on where victims are in relation to the killer, but various things happen such as sabotaging supplies, finding fuel and med kits, and searching locations for weapons and trait cards. Relocating to stay in groups can also occur.

The Combat Phase initiates any time a victim is at the same location as the killer. Weapon cards would have been collected by now at locations and during game set-up. Each weapon card has allocated strike cards red/green. Each player will draw strike cards equal to their weapon cards. All hits are added together and combat is resolved, taking items or inflicting damage.

Regroup is when the board is reset for the next hour of Halloween night and the only time victims can share their items collected during the previous round/hour.

If at least one victim reaches midnight alive, the team wins, and if the killer murders all victims, they will be victorious.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Kill Steal, Multi-Use Cards, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Indio: Renaissance
description:
Indio: Renaissance is an expansion to the Indio base game. It adds new land, resources, workers, and cards.

The core gameplay of Indio continues as before, but players now have access to wood (from new forest lands) which fuel invention. Innovation cards can be purchased to provide new player powers, resource bonuses, and additional victory points. Merchants roam the land and give gold resources in trade. House cards allow players to start with asymmetric abilities. Honor cards give bonuses to players who accomplish their goals.

—description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid

name: Blither
description:
Blither is a simple capture and territory game for two players.

It's an abstract-themed strategy game played on a unique hexagonal grid where each space corresponds to one of the three piece types. Players try to capture groups of their opponent's pieces. The goal is to be the first to have captured at least one of each of the opponent's pieces in each of the three types.
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Witness
description:
Group game with secret roles.
A robbery has just taken place in the town's bank and the thief has managed to escape.
The Sheriff is going to interrogate all the witnesses present to try to draw his portrait.
But it is very likely that the bandit had accomplices, they will certainly lie and give false clues.
The Sheriff will have to rely on the help of the real witnesses to avoid mistakes and will have to be careful with the lies of the accomplices who will know how to defend themselves and accuse the others.

In Witness, you will be either the sheriff, a witness who only tells the truth, or an accomplice who will lie and accuse others.
Witness is a new type of secret role-playing game that will bring you a lot of fun with friends or family.

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Valnarok
description:
Every player starts with 4 face down cards. When the game starts each player look at one of his card.
On your turn, you start by picking a new card from the discard or draw pile. This card can be played then discarded or used to replace one card from your game.
A card is either a number from 0 to 15 or an action (or both).
The goal is to have less point in front of you than other players. When you think it's the case, say 'Valhalla', each player can then play a last time.
Win 3 times to win the game.

—user summary

Le Clash des Vikings !

Dans ce jeu de défausse mêlant mémoire et stratégie, chaque joueur devra se débarrasser de ses cartes pour atteindre le Valhalla. Mais attention à ne pas provoquer le Ragnarok !
Pour aider les joueurs, les chefs Vikings pourront solliciter l’aide des Figures Divines afin d’attaquer les autres clans.

Qui remportera le Bouclier d’Or et atteindra le Valhalla ?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory

name: 18RoyalGorge: The rails of Fremont County and the Royal Gorge wars
description:
18RoyalGorge is an 18XX game set in Colorado. The game covers a 30-year time span from roughly 1870 to 1900. The game features 11 companies, incremental capitalization, a steel mill that provides track for the companies, and a gold market that players can own shares in. The train companies can be used to ship gold along their rails, and steel shares can be purchased by individual players as well.

Only two companies are available to start the game, and only five companies come in to play in total. This means that with 3-4 players, some will be forced to play investor strategies initially.

The game also has many historical features including a war over the rights to the Royal Gorge route, local coal mines, and more than a dozen private assets.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Stock Holding

name: Trek 12: Ultimate Trek
description:
You reach the top of the summits, not the highest, but the most beautiful, for sure. So many tests to reach the ban.. You enter the temple courtyard, a monk logger puts away wood, he greets you and welcomes you, on your left, two residents in full meditation.

Yautman and El Choucas, these two legendary guides, congratulate you on having arrived so far...

...But rest, you will need it, they are giving you a new challenge!

The Ultimate Trek contains 3 Mountains: the bottom one with white squares, the middle one with green squares, and the top one with blue squares.
You can play Ultimate Trek in Expedition Mode (Multiplayer or Free Solo). Namely that the Shipping is done in one go and not in 3 steps. The end goal is to achieve the highest score (you don't earn reputation stars during the Trek ultimatum)

The normal rules of Trek 12 apply, plus the following constraints:

It is mandatory to start from the bottom mountain, in one of the 4 lowest squares. Then, the classic rules (enter a value in an adjacent box) apply until the 3 mountains are completely filled.
Each mountain has its own table for choosing the outcome of the dice. You must necessarily fill in the boxes of a mountain with the table specific to this mountain (it is for example forbidden to fill in a box of the white mountain using the table of the blue mountain). (to help you: pay attention to the arrows).
The passage from one mountain to another is done only via Rope Paths (represented by dotted junctions). It is forbidden to move from one mountain to another with a Zone.
BONUS: the first player to connect a lower square (therefore without a compass) with a square adjacent to a flag surrounds the latter. This will bring him a corresponding bonus at the end of the game. In the event of a tie, both players score the bonus. In Free Solo, there is no need to indicate anything since both players score the bonus anyway. Better to score it anyway in order to try to beat the absolute record of the ascent!
The use of Assistance cards is possible (but not compulsory, we advise you to warm up with a simple game before!). Obtaining an Assistance Card is done in different ways:
Setup: Shuffle all assist cards and make a face down draw pile.
Each time an area of 0, 1 or 2 is made, draw 3 cards and keep one. Discard the other 2.
When the stack is empty shuffle the discard pile and create a new stack.
You can use as many Assistance Cards as you want during a game, but the limit of 3 Assistance Cards in hand is still valid. At the end of the game, the unused cards in hand always bring a bonus of 3 points!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Le Franc Tireur #15: Arid and Desert Terrain
description:
This issue focuses on arid and desert terrain. It includes 8 new maps and 23 scenarios (in color) as well as a small set of rules. The magazine is 88 pages in English.

The scenarios cover warfare between 1919-1945, and covers such diverse nationalities as Native American vs US, Mongolian vs Chinese, and Chinese vs White Russian as well as the usual forces in World War 2 conflicts. 7 conflicts are pre-WW2, while 16 are set in the 1941-1945 period.

Contents:
- Editor’s Foreword
- Advancing Fire
- 30 years of ASL Ring
- 10 questions to Steve Swann
- ASL events
- ASL humor "The play fast machine"
- The North African Tirailleurs
- The Tunisian Campaign 1942- 43
- Surrender (A15.5)
- Map concepts
- Left out in the Sun too long
- Chapter AD : Arid Desert Terrain
- The Russian Civil War ASL rules
- Night and Desert rules
- Bibliography

Scenarios:
LFT274 Bear Valley: Native American / US, 9 January 1918
LFT275 Trust Us: Mongolian / Chinese, 18 July 1919
LFT276 Genghis Khan Lives: Chinese / White Russian, 13 February 1921
LFT277 No Post Here: Japanese – Russian, October 1935
LFT278 Toridatsu: Mongolian / Japanese, 12 February 1936
LFT279 The Russians are coming: Spanish Nationalist – Spanish Republican, 29 October 1936
LFT280 Salvation at the Temple: Japanese – Chinese, 25 September 1937
LFT281 Pink Hill: New Zealand – German, 25 May 1941
LFT282 Gardens of Heaven: British – Vichy French, 14 June 1941
LFT283 Road to Merdjayoun: British – Vichy French, 16 June 1941
LFT284 Vichy Strikes Back: British – Vichy French, 16 June 1941
LFT285 The Arab Legion: British – Vichy French, 1 July 1941
LFT286 The Last Fire Mission: Russian – German, 24 April 1945
LFT287 Operation Scipio: British – German, 6 April 1943
LFT288 Fondouk Express German – British & US, 21 9 April 1943
LFT289 Haka at Takrouna: German & Italian – New Zealand, 20 April 1943
LFT290 Picking Olives: Italian – British, 20 April 1943
LFT291 First Skirmish: German – US, 26 November 1942
LFT292 Engineer Hill: US – Japanese, 29 May 1943
LFT293 Wild Men from Texas: German – American 15 December 1943
LFT325 The Cauquigny Bridgehead: American – German, 6 June 1944
LFT326 Vitamin B: Japanese & Indian – British, 14 February 1945
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Almighty
description:
Almighty: A Game of Gods & Ends is a competitive game of divine proportions. You are a primordial cosmic deity who wants to build and control an eclectic pantheon of gods and act upon your various followers in all the ways that ancient deities tend to do: create marvelous miracles, bring about horrible curses, generate mysterious omens, and make increasingly outrageous demands — all to amass the divine power needed to perform even greater acts, attract even better followers, fulfill the best top-shelf prophecies, and prove once and for all that YOU are the almightiest in the universe!

Almighty is a tableau-building game of hand and resource management, with a dash of tile placement and area control. Each turn, players choose a god in their pantheon to perform an act card from their hand, impacting one or more of their followers. Acts and followers generate boons, such as Belief (used to buy new gods from an open market, as well as better acts and followers), Power (needed at increasingly higher levels to perform better acts and impact better followers), more followers (with higher, more valuable populations), and Souls (which grant endgame victory points, but offer bonuses if spent during the game). Acts are performed in one of four lands shared between all players; the more presence you have in a land, the cheaper it will be for you to build temples there, and each land grants a different amount of victory points for temples at the end of the game.

The game is broken into several ages, during which players compete to have the most boons of a specific type. Players also have three private prophecy cards to work toward, but must choose only one to score at the End of Days — the final, apocalyptic doomsday round of the game in which every player does their almighty best to make their final mark on the doomed mortal plane. The player with the most points at the end wins the title of ALMIGHTY!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Fantasy, Humor, Mythology, Prehistoric, Religious
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tags, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #63
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #63 was published in October of 2022.

Table of Contents


Features


The Swedish Navy and Air Force and Annexes C - L for Swedish Vessels and Aircraft Currently in Service

Designations and Names of Chinese Aircraft

PRC Fighters, Bombers, and Attack Aircraft of the 20th Century

CaS Scenario - Action off Ushant, June 1944, by Paul French

DoB Scenario - the Battle of Cape d’Orange

Adding British Gunboats

Winning Operation Sutton

Additions to the Red Fleet


Rule Changes and Corrections


What is a Crossing Target?

Running Operation Sutton at Historicon 2022

Using Antiship Missiles for Land Attack


Product Updates


New Ships from Shapeways

Brown Water Miniatures


Book Reviews


Handbrake! Super Etendard Fighter-Bombers in the Falklands/Malvinas War, by Mariano Sciaroni & Alejandro Amendolara

Airborne Antisubmarine Warfare, by Michael E. Glynn

Tower of Skulls, by Richard B. Frank
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Sliders
description:
Whilst some Winter Sports enthusiasts might disagree the Slider event down a narrow,twisting and banked ice track isn't really a spectator sport. With only one sled on the run at any one time each might seem very similar to all the others give or take the odd 'drama' of a brush with an ice wall, or a trip too high up a banked curve, etc. But one aspect makes every run different and exciting - the intermediate Time Checks that are flashed onto large electronic scoreboards for all to see, so that everyone is aware just how close the sled currently on the run is to the run-leader, how much time needs to be made up in the remaining Sectors. Take those time checks away and, dare I suggest, you have a boring spectacle for live and television spectators?

But all this is lucky for us when presenting a replay simulation of the sport.

In sliding events start speed is vital. After 50 metres we get the first time check and that reflects how quickly the sled has been launched down the runway - in the team events that involves strength and running speed and a quick and tidy entry into the sled and settlement into the seats, in individual events 'pushing off' with feet or gloved hands.

But also the start is all about getting the sled moving as quickly as possible on its journey down the course, for what speed is achieved in that first 50 metres is the momentum that will build up over the run as the weight of sled and crew and the laws of gravity get to work. In 'Sliders' we provide a Start Rating, based on actual start times, which not only sets the first segment of elapsed time for the run but also determines what we call Raw Speed (momentum) which is carried forward to the next Sector. So a good start will bring two advantages, a low Elapsed Time and a good Raw Speed carry forward. Start Ratings range from 0 to 10.

Driver Skill (the range is 0 to 4) can be used in two ways. From Sector 2 onwards one DS can be used to increase the RS by 3 before the time for that Sector is determined, or used to improve the sled's Stability (ST) by 2. This represents the driver's ability to keep to the best racing line, and to ensure that the sled is 'in shape' and stable. The increase of 3 RS converts to a time saving of 0.03 secs., but again, as RS is carried forward, that is 0.03 secs. for this and each of the remaining Sectors, so gaining that advantage high up on the track is reflected all the way down. Stability is both a driver and team function, with the driver dictating the sled's line and the crew using their weight to keep the sled at the best angle and maintaining the narrow runners in best contact with the track. High up the course stability isn't really a problem, but as speeds build steadily down the run it becomes a vital factor and there is less time to get everything right. Once a sled starts to get 'out of shape', like RS, it is carried forward to the next Sector and as each Sector has a Stability Check it becomes progressively more of a problem, maybe needing the expenditure of a valuable DS to help correct the situation.

Initially the Stability Rating can be as high as 8, and until that is reduced there is unlikely to be a problem, but with lower Ratings failure of the Stability Check is likely and this will eat further into the ST figure and also reduce RS. 'Braking' (most sleds have some form of crude brakes) is a last resort for RS is automatically reduced by 20 in regaining some (1D6) STABILITY points.
mechanics: Simulation

name: Pixel Brush
description:
A coloring book full of pixel art where you create your own brushes and compete to become the best coloring artist!

Components (For each player)
Colored Pencils (each sheet has 6 specific basic colors)
A PixelBrush Sheet
3 d6 dice

How to play!
Each turn cross one turn spot and roll 3 dice to activate each one in any order you want. For each die choose a custom brush / single color brush to paint on the canvas or on any of your custom brushes (creating them in that way).
The colors needs to match on the canvas and white fields can't be painted on!
The game ends when you manage to fullfill all the color fields on the canvas or you run out of turns.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Ephemeral Path
description:
Ephemeral Path is a quick and customizable skirmish game for two players. Ephemeral Path uses no set miniatures or figures but instead allows players to play with either printable pieces or miniatures they already own. Players create customized stats and ability combinations for each figure they play with by making figure stat sheets on the game's website and printing them off. Games are short, and use no custom dice or cards. Other than standard polyhedral dice, everything players need to play with is printable.

Story: The paths have opened up across space and time. Intelligent beings of all types have been lured through the mystifying black gates that mark the path’s root. Whatever the being’s reason for embarking along the path, science, curiosity, instinct, their aspirations have shifted to mere survival. Once the gate had been activated it vanishes shortly after, never returning. Those who managed to traverse the path found themselves on a desolate planet, with no way home. The planet grew more crowded and dangerous by the hour as intelligent creatures from every corner of the universe flooded its barren surface. After some time, the gates that mark the head of the path began to appear on this planet as well. With resources running thin, most chose to take their chances with these newly opened gates. If they could only get to them before they close.

The game is played on a 40cm x 40cm play area with a round, 9cm gate placed on the board. Each player begins the game with a set of between two and six figures. Each figure has only two or three actions per game so players must use their actions precisely in order to maximize their chances of winning. Players win by having the most figures in contact with the gate after each player has run out of actions.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mycology
description:
Explore the forest floor through the changing seasons and discover a wondrous array of fungi. As a mycologist, you'll collect and classify a wide array of real fungi from around the world by collecting the resources they need to grow.

Roll dice to collect resources as you move through the seasons. Use resources to fill your basket with mushroom cards, which are worth points at the end of the game. Be careful when collecting poison mushrooms, as they may hurt your score! The game ends once a player has completely filled their basket.

Mycology is a fun and approachable game for all ages and experience levels, is for 2-6 players, and plays in 45-60 minutes. Perfect for a cozy afternoon - perhaps with a steaming mug of mushroom soup!

-description from developer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Trail Story: America
description:
Pack your bag and grab your journal — it's time to trek through the 1930s American wilderness! Wander the rural landscape and discover opportunities and threats unknown: friend and foe, cute and dangerous wildlife, and the mysteries of unexplored terrain, ominous abandoned buildings, and even the supernatural. You'll look back at these experiences and grow from them, gaining new skills, as well as inspiration from the lands you've visited. You'll record these memories in your journal as a testament to your grand adventure, until next time!

In Trail Story: America, you travel to new locations, collecting stories and constructing havens along the way. A hungry cougar, a lost lumberjack, an ancient burial ground, a foggy swamp – there are many things in the wilderness, and you decide how to interact with them. Use memories and inspiration to record story cards in your journal to document your adventures and score points.

The object of Trail Story: America is to collect the most points by establishing havens across the land and writing about your travels. Will you have the most exciting story to tell after your adventures?

(Originally announced as Americana)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Storybook Battles
description:
Welcome to a land of fantasy and mystery, where the fables of old have fought for the prestigious honor of being remembered in the storybooks. Narrator, you have been chosen to determine the fate of your characters - Do you have the skill to guide their plots to be remembered forever?

Storybook Battles is a tactical card game for 2 or 4 players that puts you in command of characters from your favorite stories! Tactically play, maneuver, hide, and reveal cards to capture your opponent’s characters as you create your very own adventure. Be the first player to capture enough plot points and the writers will remember your story forever - you win!

Players are free to play with whatever set of characters they want; they don't have to be from the same book - "Peter Pan Vs. The Queen of Hearts?", no problem! By combining books, you also unlock Expert and Team modes of play. Expert mode includes deck-customization for a serious best of three match. Team mode is a 2 Vs. 2 match for four players to enjoy working cooperatively for a shared victory!

There's so much to explore - which book will you open today!?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: D100 Dungeon: The Rune Forge
description:
The Rune Forge adventure book introduces a different way of playing D100 Dungeon, and will give you choices much like a choose your own adventure game. It uses all of the D100 Dungeon rules from the main rulebook with a few modifications. Also included are new rules called "Random Dungeons", that can be implemented into any of your games; whether you're playing a quest, campaign, or using the World Builder expansion.

You will need the D100 Dungeonrule book to use this book

THE RUNE FORGE ADVENTURE

Deep in the mountains to the northeast of the Arcane Tower is the Ruin Forge. It was built by the dwarves exactly 100 years after they completed the Arcane Tower. Work began in the year -2489 and took just nine years to complete. The Council of Seven, who commissioned its construction, chose its location beneath the Irontorn mountains, in an effort to hide it away from preying eyes, but alas it fell foul to a powerful demon named Vakanar. Vakanar is one of a handful of demon lords that first emerged from the Demon Gate after its construction in -2790. He craved a huge arcane power and set off on a mission to capture the White Tower. Along the way he summoned a horde of minions, but when he reach the Arcane Tower he learnt of a more powerful structure being built, The Rune Forge. He changed course and waited for its completion. Whilst the dwarves dug, he planned the attack and on the day the Rune Forge was finished, Vakanar and his minions devoured its caverns, spreading torture and fire to its darkest corners. Many dwarves escaped with their lives, but an unlucky few were left behind and were tortured to death to reveal the secret of the nine rune crystals the arcane council placed within its depths. One crystal for each scripture of magic and two more for balancing the arcane power of the forge.

Numerous battles took place to regain its control, but alas the Arcane Council and their battle mages failed to breach its depths. Then, after the Great Icing of -2300 and The Melting of -1400, the location of the Ruin Forge became lost. The Lair of Vakanar (another name for the lost forge) is now where the demon lord and his minions use the power of the nine arcane crystals to sustain and power their existence, preventing them from diminishing back to the demon realm.

You have heard this tale a thousand times, as it's told in every tavern across Terra. Warming your back to the camp fire, you keep watch and recount the story you overheard a few days ago in The Broken Claw, a scruffy little inn at the heart of Blitsworth…

By chance, you have found the entrance to the Rune Forge and must now delve its depths, find the forge and use its power to enchant an item. If you can present the enchanted item to the Council of Seven at the White Tower, it will prove you have found the location of their Lost Forge and secure a handsome reward.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Laniakea: Across Dark Space
description:
Laniakea: Across Dark Space, is a 1-4 player game. You will take on the role of a Solitary Celestial; exploring the galaxies of Laniakea in order to achieve ultimate ascension. Each new galaxy you discover could hold the resources you need to advance your abilities; some may even be ideal locations for you to build new Sanctums, Gateways or thrones. To aid you on your journey, you will bring life to new beings of your own creation, with powerful special abilities.

At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will become the most powerful being in Laniakea, and be crowned the winner.

Main Action Phase:

The main action phase is where players will be able to move around the board, gather resources, recruit powerful Entity cards, and build various assets around the board.

Gameplay begins with the start player, proceeding clockwise until the game ends.
During their turn, the player must draw Cosmic Power cards from their deck until they have five displayed in a row in front of them. Players may perform the actions shown across their Cosmic Power card display in any order. Once a Cosmic Power has been used, players should add it to a face up discard pile. A player may perform as many actions as they wish, but they must end their Main Action Phase with at least two Cosmic Power cards still in their display area.

Upkeep Phase:

Once a player has concluded their Main Action Phase, they must then decide whether to keep any Cosmic Power cards they have left on display, (which may be used on their next turn), or discard any number of them. After a player has completed their upkeep phase, the next player begins their turn.

Additional Actions:

During your turn you may perform any number of the following additional actions at any time:

1. If you have any “Instant Action” Entity cards dormant (face-down) on your player board, you may turn them face-up to activate the action on them.

2. If you are currently positioned on a galaxy with a Gateway, you may move to any other Gateway at any time (Though no resources may be harvested).

3. You may place resources from your personal supply onto any available Galaxy resource slots.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pins & Beetles
description:
You and your fellow players have just stepped into the exciting world of coleopterology: the study of beetles! Travel around the world, assemble your collection of specimens, and present your findings to museums and magazines to become the most recognized expert in your field!

Pins and Beetles is a hybrid set collection and tile placement game. Players collect Beetle cards from eight families and use them to score points, either with Features that depend on the size of their collection, or Exhibits that place tiles in the Museum. Once the Museum is full and no more Exhibits can be played, the game ends and the player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Rondel, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Hectic Highways
description:
Use the elastic cord to help the Hedgehogs pass safely through the Hedgehog Highway!

Be the first person to get all your Hedgehogs to the other side.

A hectic but fun game requiring precision, skill and a little bit of luck.

Giggles GUARANTEED!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nightshift
description:
Nightshift is a thematic board game that immerses players into the role of a strip club Dancer. The Customer stories and gameplay are inspired by the creator’s personal experience working as a stripper, providing an authentic and empowering take on this often misunderstood profession.

Players must select from five different Dancers who each have a distinct approach to charming Customers. The goal is to earn the most money over the night. Be careful about interfering with another Dancer’s Customer or your night may not run so smoothly...

Players use Action Points to Navigate the club and discover new Customers. Each Customer is unique and has variable wealth and loyalty, as well as a diverse range of potential outcomes. Some of them will have a preference for one particular Dancer. Choose your Customers wisely! Engaging with a Customer involves rolling the dice, which combined with the Player's abilities, Power Cards, and potentially a few Drinks, will determine the outcome. 

Successfully getting a Customer to the Private Room, or even better, the VIP Room, initiates a theme-based “push-your-luck” challenge.
