The aim is to maximise earnings from the Customer without breaking the illusion... This is achieved by performing a combination of dance moves (via card draws) in the Private Room, or deepening your connection (via dice rolls) in the VIP Room, with the ultimate goal of making the Customer fall in love.

Players can purchase Drinks from the Bar. Champagne is a valuable tool for persuading Customers to extend their time with you in the Private Room or VIP Room, whilst Shots can help you get them in there. 

Watch out for the Full Moon, this can trigger strange Events… Players must also keep track of when they are rostered on Stage, which provides benefits such as acquiring extra Tips and Power Cards. Don’t miss your Stage or the club will fine you! These unique Power Cards add another layer of strategy and interaction - will you help out your fellow dancers, or will you play dirty?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Events, Grid Movement, Kill Steal, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Invisible - Sniper -
description:
A postcard wargame that places you in the role of a sniper during WWII

Game takes 15-45 min.
Components: 2d6 and the 2 counters that come with the game.

The goal of the game is to take out as many target enemies as possible while trying to survive.

The game is played by rolling dice in a variety of tables and deciding the best moment to take out your target. But watch out and don't push your luck too far! Because for every shot you take, the enemy may react to it through the game's Enemy Behavior system and things can get quite dicey for you in no time...

VP's are won by amount of enemies eliminated and kill track milestones.

Game can be played as a single mission, campaign and Legendary sniper (insane mode).

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: It Rolls for Ivan
description:
It Rolls for Ivan is a set of table top wargame rules for fighting Brigade-Divisional level actions in the Russian Civil War. The rules are based upon the "For Whom The Dice Rolls" Spanish Civil War rules. They are designed to enable games covering a large area, with sweeping cavalry movements and dogged infantry. Detailed sections cover the uniqueness of the war, from the reluctance sometimes of armies to obey their orders, to Armoured Trains and the various odd looking armoured vehicles employed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Hiroshima (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
This Hiroshima map for Age of Steam is themed around the area's association with the color red: the Torii gate at Itsukushima Shrine, Momiji Manju (a maple-shaped cake), and the local baseball team. As the game progresses, many cities will change to red.

All new city tiles (other than the red one) begin on the board, covering red cities, and some of the non-red cubes are removed from the game. When you would add a new city, instead, move one of the new cities that is on top of a red city to a town hex. Delivered red cubes are worth additional victory points at the end of the game.

The game also features special "enhanced" actions. Once per game, a player may use an upgraded version of the action they choose from the auction. Additionally, once a specific enhancement has been chosen by a player, the other players may not use that one.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Centurion: Roman Auxiliaries Pack
description:
Four pairs of tiles, themed for Centurion, for play with any Profile System game.

Cataphract
Chariots
Hoplites
War Elephants

After players select their bags of Soldier Tiles and the gameboard is set up, they take their appropriate-colored tiles from Roman Auxiliaries and add them to their bags.

Move descriptions:
Cataphract - Starting Side: slide straight ahead/behind one space straight ahead/behind, defense one space away left and right, move two spaces away left and right; Flip Side: slide straight left/right one space straight left/right, defense one space away straight ahead and behind, move two spaces away straight ahead and behind;
Chariots - Starting Side: slide straight ahead one space away straight ahead, strike one space away left and right, move one space away diagonally right and left (forwards), jump two spaces away diagonally right and left (forwards); Flip Side: non-capturing move one space left and right, move one and two spaces straight behind, slide straight ahead one space away straight ahead, jump two spaces away straight ahead;
Hoplites - Starting Side: move one space away straight ahead, right, left, diagonally right and left (backwards), defense two spaces away straight ahead, right, left, diagonally right and left (forwards); Flip Side: defense all spaces 2 away diagonally forward and straight, move one space straight ahead, two spaces left and right, strike one space away left and right, non-capturing move one space away diagonally left and right (backwards);
War Elephants - Starting Side: smash straight ahead and diagonally right and left (forwards) one and two spaces; Flip Side: move one space diagonally, dread one space away orthogonally
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Centurion: Emperor's Pack
description:
Three pairs of new tiles, themes for Centurion, for play with any Profile System game.

Cleopatra
Marcus Aurelius
Jupiter

After players select their bags of Soldier Tiles and the gameboard is set up, they take their appropriate-colored tiles from Emperor's Pack and add them to their bags.

Move descriptions:
Cleopatra - Starting Side: move one space orthogonally, command two spaces left and right; Flip Side: slide backwards, dread all other orthogonal and diagonal spaces one away; I: summon on both sides
Marcus Aurelius - combination of move, non-capturing move, non-capturing slide, and full formation on both sides of the tile
Jupiter - move, jump and strike on forward spaces, both sides of the tile
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Centurion: Imperators Pack
description:
Two pair of tiles (Scorpion), as submitted by the campaign Imperators, for use with any Profile System game.

Move descriptions:
Starting Side - strike one space away right, left, straight ahead, and two spaces away straight ahead, non-capture move one space straight behind
Flip Side - non-capture move one space straight ahead and behind, non-capture slide right/left one space away right and left
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Centurion: Gladiator Pack
description:
A pair of Gladiator tiles for use with any Profile System game.

Starting side: strike one space orthogonally, non-capture move one space diagonally
Flip side: non-capture move one space orthogonally, strike one space diagonally
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Centurion: Praetori Pack
description:
Three pairs of tiles, themed for Centurion, for play with any Profile System game.

Numidian
Camel
Legio III Italica

Move descriptions:
Numidian - Starting Side: jump slide two spaces away straight ahead, diagonally left and right (forwards); Flip Side: jump slide two spaces away straight behind, diagonally left and right (backwards)
Camel - Starting Side: strike one space left and right, move one space straight behind, slide straight forward one space away diagonal left and right (forwards); Flip Side: strike one space left and right, move one space straight ahead, slide straight behind one space away diagonal left and right (backwards);
Legio III Italica - Starting Side: move one space straight ahead or left, move two spaces straight behind, non-capturing move or full formation one space right, jump two spaces away diagonally left and right (forwards), strike straight ahead two spaces; Flip Side: move one space straight ahead, move two spaces straight behind, non-capturing slide right/left one space away diagonally left and right (backwards), jump two spaces away diagonally left and right (forwards), strike straight ahead two spaces;
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Polyversal: UN Quick Reaction Force Expansion
description:
One of five initial Battlegroups of miniatures and pre-designed Combatant Tiles for Polyversal.

The UN Quick Reaction Force is a mixed land and air-based force that brings sleek anti-gravity tanks to the battlefield, fearsome tracked Encegon Plasma tanks, mobile infantry carried into battle by Wombat transports, Ocelot and Quoll Support Tanks, and light Janus walkers for scouting and suppression. Advanced Leehark VTOLs provide air support for the UN as the Battlegroup conducts peacekeeping operations worldwide.

This set is a balanced 750-point UN Battlegroup we currently offer for Polyversal, loaded with amazing miniatures and pre-designed die-cut Combatant Tiles. Featuring miniatures from Brigade Models, Plasmablast Games, and TT Combat (formerly Hawk Wargames), it provides a great way to quickly get a coherent force on the table for the UN.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Order Counters

name: Polyversal: UN Peacekeepers Expansion
description:
The UN Peacekeepers Expansion is a standalone Battlegroup including 6mm and 10mm models (Ares) and Combatant Tiles for use with Polyversal's UN faction. This Battlegroup totals 750 points if fielded with standard psychological profiles. The UN calls upon the Peacekeepers whenever a heavier response is needed for any battle or uprising. Land-based, the battlegroup is anchored by a pair of Maarghast Heavy Assault Tanks with Twin Heavy Plasma Guns and Missiles (Plasmablast Games) and two Ares Walkers (Hawk Wargames/TT Combat). Three Encegon Tanks with Twin Heavy Plasma Guns (Plasmablast Games) provide medium fire support coverage. Three Phestorm AA tanks (Plasmablast Games) provide anti-air support in the absence of covering UN aircraft. 40 Industrial Infantry (Dark Realm Miniatures) are carried into battle by three Ghizar Recon APCs (Plasmablast Games).

This set is a balanced 750-point UN Battlegroup we currently offer for Polyversal, loaded with amazing miniatures and pre-designed die-cut Combatant Tiles. Featuring miniatures from Plasmablast Games, Dark Realm Miniatures, and TT Combat (formerly Hawk Wargames), it provides a great way to quickly get a coherent force on the table for the UN.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Order Counters

name: Polyversal: Mercenary Balkenkreüz GmbH Expansion
description:
The Mercenary Balkenkreüz GmbH Expansion is a standalone Battlegroup including 6mm models and Combatant Tiles for use with Polyversal's Mercenaries (MERCs) faction or to supplement the highest bidders among UN or OPFOR factions. This Battlegroup totals 750 points if fielded with standard psychological profiles. Led by the feared and well-connected recluse Victor Köenig, Germany-based Balkenkreüz GmbH employs only the most reliable and relentless mercenaries money can buy. Known to work for any group willing to pay enough, the mere mention of Köenig's involvement in an operation inspries confidence in those hiring him and anxiety in those who must face him.

This mixed land and air battlegroup uses high-tech anti-gravity drives on all vehicles to float above the battlefield for enhanced mobility. The massive and awe-inspiring Valgaross (Plasmablast Games) provides incredible firepower and intimidation as the center of the group. The group relies upon light and fast protection from four Nizzlebats and three Jagons (Plasmablast Games) to flank the sides of the Valgaross and provide recon. The devastating twin plasma cannons of two Gammaran tanks (Plasmablast Games) provide medium fire support as two Dralke fighters (Plasmablast Games) streak overhead. Four Zargan Armored Personnel Carriers (Plasmablast Games) provide transportation for the 40 Operators (Special Forces Infantry, Dark Realm Miniatures). A truly versatile and powerful Battlegroup, these well-equipped mercenaries are ready for action- once the payment clears.

"If you are willing to pay, then we are willing to fight." -Victor Köenig

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Order Counters

name: Twilight Struggle: South Asian Monsoon
description:
“I have spoken here today about India's race with Red China. We want India to win that race. We want India to be a free and thriving leader of a free and thriving Asia. But if our interest appears to be purely selfish, anti-Communist and part of the Cold War – if it appears to the Indian people that our motives are purely political – then we shall play into the hands of Communist and neutralist propagandists, cruelly distort America's image abroad, and undo much of the psychological effect that we expect from our generosity.” -- Senator John Fitzgerald Kennedy 1959

The year is 1959. The next decade will unleash a cascading series of events that will catapult the Cold War into a new, farther-flung region of the world. Twilight Struggle: South Asian Monsoon is the latest stand-alone two player game in the Twilight Struggle series. This game covers the era from the Tibetan Insurrection in China to the normalization of relations between the People’s Republic and the United States. It is a four turn game, longer than Twilight Struggle: Red Sea, but much shorter than a full game of Twilight Struggle.

Twilight Struggle: South Asian Monsoon is intended to provide experienced players of Twilight Struggle with a new, more nuanced challenge. The nations represented in this game – in South Asia, the Indian Ocean and along China’s Asian periphery - are more remote and independent minded. All of the countries represented joined the Non-Aligned Movement. Unlike other parts of the globe, the United States and the Soviet Union can only project military force into the region with difficulty. In short, this is the region of the Cold War where nations felt emboldened to assert their independence and resist the bi-polar world that the superpowers had created elsewhere.

Twilight Struggle players will be asked to contend with newly independent countries, the relationship between the Non-Aligned Movement and increased tensions along the DEFCON track. The game incorporates a new system called “Engagement Actions” and players must plan with the future of China after Mao. The ability of players to master these new factors will be the key to victory in Twilight Struggle: South Asian Monsoon.

The game also highlights the history of many giants of the Cold War era that receive less attention in other parts of the Twilight Struggle system: Nehru, Mao, the Dali Lama, Zhou Enlai, Indira Gandhi, Khrushchev and more all make their presence felt in this pivotal region of the globe.

This is your chance to answer Chairman Mao’s call and “Be resolute, fear no sacrifice and surmount every difficulty to win victory.”

The game will feature backward and forward compatibility. Cards from South Asian Monsoon will be usable in Twilight Struggle, and cards from Twilight Struggle will be usable in South Asian Monsoon.

-description from designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 冲冠一怒 (One Wave of Headgear-lifting Anger)
description:
One Wave of Headgear-lifting Anger is a tabletop wargame that can be played by multiple people. The theme background of the game is the Battle of Shanhai Pass in the late Ming Dynasty. Players will play the three forces of Shun dynasty, Qing dynasty and Ming dynasty to compete.

This work is the second original ancient war game launched by Che-Yu Guan, the designer of the well-received domestic original war game "Seven Grievances: The Rise of Manchuria", together with Kilovolt Design, trying to bring players a refreshing card drive+block mechanism experience!

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Kings of the Castle: The Battle of the Imjin River April 22-25, 1951
description:
Kings of the Castle is a moderate complexity level war game simulation of the climactic battle fought along the Imjin River during the Korean War. Players draw formation activation markers to determine what units activate, and a six sided die ro resolve combats (air and artillery strikes as well as combat between opposing ground units), as well as other game events.

A complete game of Kings of the Castle is composed of the following:

• One rules booklet
• Two 11" by 17" maps
• 325 un-mounted, single-sided counters
• Two players’ aid sheets with charts, tables, and record-keeping tracks.

Note that players will need to provide one 6-sided die and an opaque container (cup, envelope, etc.) to play the game.

Each night turn of the game represents two hours of time; day turns represent 4 hours. Each hex is approximately one third of a mile across. Allied Infantry and both sides’ Heavy Weapons units represent companies (about 200 to 250 men). Chinese infantry units represent battalions (about 800 men). Allied armor/tank units represent 10-12 armored fighting vehicles.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Melting Planet
description:
Melting Planet is a cooperative game, that is, in this game the players do not compete with each other but rather work together for a common goal, in this case, to keep the planet habitable for as long as possible.

Melting Planet has been exposed to the use and abuse of its natural resources that increases the temperature by 0.5°C, 1°C, 1.5°C and 2°C.

The challenge for the players is to align the necessary interventions (decks) to save the planet at different scales, that is, to assemble the stairs of each deck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Ordering

name: Star Wars: Legion – Ahsoka Tano Operative Expansion
description:
Star Wars: Legion – Ahsoka Tano Operative Exapnsion brings a new character to the fight for the Rebellion.

A key member of the founding of what would become the Rebel Alliance, Ahsoka Tano took on the codename "Fulcrum" and worked tirelessly to supply vital intelligence to the burgeoning Rebel cells. Ahsoka brings both her potent skills with her lightsabers as well as her years of experience as a commander during the Clone Wars to the battlefield. In battle, Ahsoka uses her agility and skills to help protect her fellow troops while she positions herself to strike down the most dangerous threats using her mastery of the Jar'Kai lightsaber form. Combined with her four signature command cards Ahsoka is sure to defend the Rebellion through its most vulnerable time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fantasy Planet
description:
Fantasy Planet is a science-fantasy skirmish game played on an ever-changing battlefield. You are a hero sent to explore a new and mysterious planet brimming with mana. Through tactical cunning and military prowess your goal is to scare off any opposition and claim this planet as your own. But the journey is not without risk: the terrain of the planet is ever-changing and volatile. Shape the planet and use its terrain to your advantage to win.

At the start of the game you take turns building up the board by laying down hexflowers. Each flower has two sides with seven hexes on each side. Every hex has one of six different terrain types that govern how you can move across the board. Stepping in lava will burn your foot and trying to swim across a large body of water is impossible lest you know how to fly. Setting up the board to your advantage and utilizing the terrain is detrimental to your success.

You take control of one the game’s six asymmetric factions vying for control of the mysterious planet. What faction you choose to play will highly influence your experience. Each faction presents a different twist on a fantasy race. The orcs have been taken over by plants, the dwarves got taken over by a malicious AI, and the dragons are now bleak images of their former selves due to an abundance of cross-species unions.

Each turn you will draw a bunch of cards from a deck that you can play by spending mana. In the beginning you will only have access to cards that let you put more units onto the field. But, whenever you play a unit you get to draw four cards and add two of them to your deck. These new cards will let you alter the terrain, cast spells, and trigger abilities unique to your faction. Elves can lay traps, the undead cast curses, and the turtles can build structures to name a few. Building an effective deck tailored to both the battlefield and your opponents’ strategy is a sure path to victory.

If you like magic, science fiction, fantastical creatures and tactical gameplay then this is the game for you. Take the chance and step into a rich alternate universe with a fresh take on playing with a modular board.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Coverage, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Income, King of the Hill, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The Unknown: Case 2
description:
Your team, consisting of LKA profilers in training, has come a long way. Now you are facing your first real case. Your instructor will give you a file with all the evidence of a murder case. During your hunt for the perpetrator, you will experience a multidimensional detective board game based on a true story.
As real detectives, you have to follow every lead, including cell phones and the Internet. It is therefore necessary that you have at least one internet-enabled device when playing. At The Unknown you have access to a realistic database in which you can find suspects, listen to interrogations and solve the case!

In this game you play as a team and not against each other. So nothing stands in the way of an exciting game evening!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Wild West Duel Dice
description:
It’s the Wild Wild West. You are a cowboy, minding your own business drinking shots at the saloon bar and someone challenges you to shoot dice.

You need to shoot quicker, and shoot better than your opponent to win the duel. Before you roll, you bid on the number of dice that you will use (i.e. your gun drawing speed). After you roll your dice, you target your opponent's body parts. Knockout your opponent before he knocks you out. Only one person walks away from a duel. This game involves a level of deduction while pushing your luck.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Auction

name: Imperial Settlers: Common Cards Set 2
description:
During the setup, shuffle the Common cards from this set into the Common deck. Set contains 11 extra cards:
Distant Forest, Distant Mine, Distant Fields, Transport of Captives, Ancient Library, Pink Caravan, Welcome Gifts, Scouting Tower, Balista, Abandoned Village and Ancient Temple.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Rabbit Hole
description:
What will your friends fall for?

We took the most revealing internet searches and removed the last few words – can you guess the most popular ending? Players take turns reading the beginning phrase to popular internet searches and must then try to complete it with the most believable answer. They don’t need to be right; they just need to fool their friends into believing their answer is! However, the correct ending is always mixed in, so you’ll have to be savvy with your submission. What might your opponents fall down an internet search query rabbit hole for themselves?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Voting

name: Interplanetary: New Worlds – Expansion 5
description:
This fifth expansion for Interplanetary, titled New Worlds, adds an additional tile to expand the solar system with and introduces further non-standard tiles to play with larger solar systems.

In addition, a new mechanic is added: The Tree Orbital Infrastructure, which alleviates the demand for depots for spaceship construction and may even provide a game-changing bonus...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Massive Darkness 2: Zombicide White Death Crossover Pack
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy gives you the opportunity to bring non-exclusive Survivors and Zombies introduced in the Zombicide: White Death Kickstarter into Massive Darkness 2!

The crossover pack contains cards for the following:

White Death

6 Heroes: Ogon, Yasuke, Sarnaï, Dragomir, Lorna, Jenia
2 Roaming Monsters: Khan Abomination, Defiler Necromancer

Eternal Empire

6 Heroes: Jianrui, Yinying, Shao, Zhi Shen, Zhi Yang, Fengbao
1 Mob: Warden Brutes

Divine Beasts

4 Roaming Monsters: White Tiger, Black Tortoise, Vermilion Bird, Azure Dragon

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles - Timecrash

7 Heroes: Raphael, Donatello, Leonardo, Michelangelo, April O’Neil, Splinter, Casey Jones
1 Mob: Foot Ninjas
1 Roaming Monster: Shredder
14 Item Cards

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: BATTLE of TAROT
description:
BATTLE of TAROT is a two player card battling game using a single 78 card tarot deck inspired by games like Magic: the Gathering, Hearthstone, and maybe a little from MOBAs too.

“Armed with arcane spells, two medieval kingdoms meet on the battlefield for war.”

Play Minor Arcana suit cards from your hand to rally your armies on the battlefield to then march, flank, and battle the enemy until you can defeat your opponent’s castle. Each player is granted Major Arcana Divine Signs to cast as powerful arcane spells to turn the tides of war. Will the members of your court aid you in victory? Or will you be cut down and trampled into the sod by the advancing enemy? Only time will tell.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Hobgoblin
description:
Mike Hutchinson's Hobgoblin is a fast-paced and thrilling rank and flank tabletop miniatures wargame set in the fantastical underground world of The Rotvärlden. With simple and adaptable rules, players can collect and field any fantasy army they can imagine and engage in brutal battles that last under two hours.

The game features original artwork from graphic artist CROM and encourages players to let their wild imaginations run free as they battle alongside cavern fortresses and underground oceans. Whether you're a seasoned player of fantasy army wargames or new to the genre, Hobgoblin offers a fresh and exciting take on the fantasy mass battle experience.

The core ingredients that make up Hobgoblin’s unique gameplay are:

Rock-paper-scissors relationship of unit types, meaning no unit is ever master of the battlefield, and every sort of miniature can have a role to play in your army
Simple and consistent stats and combat rules, making battles super-fast to resolve
Magic, Cursed Artefacts and Fortune Cards provide a huge range of possible strategies and tricks to explore.
Every design decision in the game pushes towards brutal efficiency and smooth, quick gameplay


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Marvel United: Multiverse – Campaign Decks
description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive brings a whole new way to play Marvel United, in the form of Campaigns! Each of these uses the full breadth of existing Marvel United components to recreate iconic story arcs from the comics! Players must battle through a series of 4 or 5 Games on average, facing events based on those comic storylines and living with the consequences of their actions.

The Kickstarter Exclusive Campaign Decks set contains 8 different Campaigns, for a total of 114 cards:

The Age of Apocalypse – 7 Games (23 cards)
War of Kings – 4 Games (16 cards)
Dark Phoenix Saga – 6 Games (16 cards)
Avengers vs. X-Men – 5 Games (17 cards)
X-Cutioner’s Song – 4 Games (13 cards)
Age of Ultron – 4 Games (8 cards)
Maximum Carnage – 3 Games (8 cards)
World War Hulk – 4 Games (13 cards)

Each campaign starts with a roster of Heroes that can be used in each game. As the campaign progresses, depending on what happens, new Heroes may be added to this roster while others are removed. New Heroes may even show up mid-game, depending on events!

At the start of each game, the Rules card indicates which Villain must be used, any mandatory Locations that must be in play, and any other special setup instructions. A few games will even require playing with certain Challenges or in different modes, like Team vs Team, Super Villain, or Clash of Heroes (one particular case even calls for a Commander Solo Mode game).

The back of a game’s Rules card indicates any special rules that must be used in that game, as well as listing triggers for specific Event cards. These could be if the Villain accomplishes a specific task, if the Heroes defeat a specific Henchman, if a specific Hero is KO’d, or many others. There are also usually triggers for winning the game or losing it (and also how the game is lost). When these triggers take place, players reveal the indicated Event card and resolve it. These might introduce a whole new set of rules to the game being played, changing it to a lesser or greater degree, they might affect the Heroes in specific ways, or add consequences for future games.

Winning the game, players then proceed to the next game in the campaign, oftentimes with special changes depending on how victory was achieved. However, losing the game does not necessarily mean the campaign is lost. Depending on how they lose, players may be able to tackle the same game again, with a special handicap or additional aid, or just proceed to the next game carrying a negative consequence. Defeated Heroes may be removed from the available roster, and eventually players may simply lose the campaign outright. If they manage to come through each adversity, unlocking special surprises along the way, players will emerge victorious at the end of richly thematic campaign!

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Marvel United: Multiverse – Kickstarter Promos Box
description:
This set contains all the exclusive stretch goals unlocked during the Kickstarter, including a box to store everything.

Heroes:

Corsair
Black Knight

Hobgoblin
High Evolutionary
Enchantress
Gorr
Knull
Mole Man
Lizard
Purple Man
Shocker


Team Decks:

Starjammers
Gen-X
Young Avengers
Swordbearers of Krakoa
S.H.I.E.L.D.
Dark Avengers
Midnight Sons
Red Hulk's Thunderbolts


Other:

Classic Equipment Cards (Retail & Promos)
Generic Equipment Cards
Super Hero & Super Villain Cards
Monster Isle Location
Dark Avengers Mode
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Drakerion
description:
Drakerion is a Trading Card Game set in a Dark Fantasy universe. The team is made up of veterans of this type of game who wish to offer a unique gameplay experience. With straightforward rules, a dynamic game system, and a focus on interaction, player skill is what determines who wins in Drakerion. We invite you to a brand new adventure beautifully portrayed by some amazing international artists.

Welcome to Drakerion: The playing and trading card game.
In this game, play one of the five factions, use its tactics and strategy to defeat your opponent and lead your troops to victory!

There are two ways a player can win the game:
If at any point of the game a player has no Character left on the battlefield, they lose the game and their opponent wins the game.
If a player has 20 prestige points or more, they win the game. Players will accumulate prestige mainly by destroying opposing Characters: The more powerful a Character is, the more prestige their opponent will gain when they are destroyed.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Krimi total: Des Alters fette Beute
description:
The Story

Edith, Bernd and Paul had been close friends since their student days. Together they had expanded the Stettenwerke, which Paul had taken over from his parents 49 years ago, into a successful mechanical engineering company. Their common path through life has fatefully welded the three friends together.

Six months ago Paul had sold his company. In order to spend his old age in style and with all amenities, he has rented a luxurious retirement home for himself, Edith and Bernd and their spouses. Since then, the five companions have lived in their own wing on the first floor of a historical building ensemble. Two personal carers lovingly take care of their well-being.

But this afternoon Paul lay lifeless in his bed. Deaths are the order of the day in a retirement home, but a possibly unnatural death would mean great damage to the image of the facility. The residence management is therefore determined to resolve the matter internally without making a fuss.

Die Geschichte

Edith, Bernd und Paul verband seit Studientagen eine enge Freundschaft. Gemeinsam hatten sie die Stettenwerke, die Paul vor 49 Jahren von seinen Eltern übernommen hatte, zu einem erfolgreichen Maschinenbauunternehmen ausgebaut. Ihr gemeinsamer Lebensweg hat die drei Freunde schicksalhaft zusammengeschweißt.

Vor einem halben Jahr hatte Paul seine Firma verkauft. Um seinen Lebensabend stilvoll und mit allen Annehmlichkeiten zu verbringen, hat er sich, Edith und Bernd sowie deren Ehepartner in einer luxuriösen Seniorenresidenz eingemietet. Die fünf Weggefährten bewohnen seither einen eigenen Trakt im ersten Obergeschoss eines historischen Gebäudeensembles. Zwei persönliche Pflegekräfte kümmern sich liebevoll um ihr Wohlergehen.

Doch heute Nachmittag lag Paul leblos in seinem Bett. Sterbefälle sind in einer Seniorenresidenz zwar an der Tagesordnung, aber ein möglicherweise unnatürliches Ableben würde einen großen Imageschaden für die Einrichtung bedeuten. Deshalb ist die Residenzleitung fest entschlossen, die Angelegenheit ohne großes Aufsehen intern zu klären.
mechanics: Acting, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Boil + Trouble
description:
In Boil + Trouble, you and your friends play as witches, with the goal to snatch up and eat six children before the end of the thirteenth turn. Lure them to your Coven using magic spells and minions.

Children are manipulated along Direct or Twisted paths. Direct paths are clear, but twisted paths turn and cross each other, and you don't always know where a twisted path leads. "Heroes" are the antagonists of Boil + Trouble, who attempt to rescue children and kill your minions.

Each player has a unique book of spells which can manipulate the board. Players can throw ingredients into a shared cauldron to cast their magic, however, other players use the same cauldron, and the wrong combination of ingredients will limit your spellcasting ability.

-description from designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game

name: Magic Marbles
description:
Magic Marbles is a strategy board game for 2-6 players who race marbles around a track to the safety of their home. There is always the chance of landing on a magic spot leading to an encounter with the Generous Genie, Magic Carpet, Sinister Sultan or Fortunate Spell. Pickpockets and jugglers can sneak up – best to be on the front foot and hone one's own pick pocket and juggling skills.

Inspired by classic games such as Parcheesi, Ludo and Mensch Ärgere Dich Nicht, Magic Marbles is a modern game using themed function cards and a magic dice to inject excitement and game changing twists and turns.

The game is easy to learn. Each player receives a quick start reference card and playing cards themselves have functions printed on them.

The unique felt board design is ideal for travelling. It rolls up into a compact bag: easy to store in any cupboard, caravan, suitcase or bag.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Track Movement

name: Solar 175: Recharge Pack
description:
Available in the Gamefound Campaign.

Everything you need to go back to the start of a Solar 175 campaign!

Solar 175 is a legacy game. This means that as you play permanent changes are made to the components based on your decisions within the game itself! This recharge pack allows you to replace these components so that you can start the game afresh!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Al servicio de la República
description:
"We have been the first victims; be careful, we will not be the last"
(President Negrín)

In the Service of the Republic: The game of diplomats, propagandists and spies (1936-1939) is a diplomacy, propaganda, and espionage game set in the troubled 1930s. It is semi-cooperative in nature and combines exploration journeys, resource management, hidden roles, political intrigue, and abstracted war.

In it, each player represents a diplomat (sometimes also a propagandist and spy) serving the Republican side during the Spanish Civil War. Throughout 3 game turns (which simulate the 3 years between September 1936 and September 1939), your objective will be to travel throughout the map (Europe and North America) in search of military, humanitarian and energy supplies, and once obtained, ship them to loyal Spain, so that the beleaguered Republic has some chance of survival. In the final part of the turn, the military rebels (supported by Nazi Germany and Fascist Italy) will launch several offensives and gradually conquer the cities that are still in the hands of the Republic. At the end of turn 3, World War II will break out (which will mean the salvation of the republican regime, as Spain is framed on the side of the allies against the Axis).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading

name: Escape Experience Adventskalender: Atlantis
description:
In a library, you find notes from a famous explorer who disappeared 30 years ago in search of Atlantis. You set out on a dangerous journey to follow in her footsteps and find the legendary city.
Every day, you open a door and solve a puzzle. The solution will tell you which door to open on the next day. Solve all 24 puzzles and save Atlantis from impending doom.
In case you get stuck, there are digital clues available on the publisher’s website.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ultra Quick Pro Basketball
description:
Ultra Quick Pro Basketball is really two games in one.

We offer you the familiar method employed in Ultra Quick College Hoops, which resolves a game in two rolls of the dice, and a quarter-by-quarter method, which closely resembles the method employed in Ultra Quick Hockey. The Quarter-by-Quarter method has provisions for "Big Games" as well as "Bad Games" and features a very unique and simple season normalization process.

We added the quarter-by quarter method as it provides a little more drama as the game unfolds, and only adds a slight bit of gaming time. The quarter-by-quarter method also allows you to play cross-era match-ups efficiently and accurately, with our season normalization ratings, so you can easily match-up teams from yesterday and today and get unbiased results.
Both methods are accurate and as the name implies, both methods play ultra-quick!

Each season has ratings for both methods of play.

The Printed game ships with the rules, charts, random number sheets and two six-sided dice.


To Play, a season yearbook is required**



-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Simulation

name: Pigs and Rats
description:
What are you willing to risk? And if you take that risk, do you have what it takes to be victorious? Enter the kingdom and squabbles of Pigs, Rats, Dogs and Cats. Of warriors, priests and spies. Of treachery and glory. Much is at stake - the reward great. Time to fight! Tooth and claw!

—description from the back of the box

Pigs and Rats has everything you want in a good card game - strategy, bluffs and battle. The game is composed of rounds and each round has 3 parts - the RISK, the MELD and BATTLE!

A game for the ages! Quick to learn but a lifetime to master. Play with 2 to 3 players in single play or discover the joy of team play with 4 players.

Inspired by the old world German game 'Bezique".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Nestorgames GP: Triple Loop Board
description: A map for Nestorgames GP, with 3 loops.
mechanics: Push Your Luck

name: Battle of Vargas Swamp 1819
description:
The Battle of the Pantano de Vargas was an armed confrontation that took place in what is now known as the Pantano de Vargas, in the township of the municipality of Paipa, present-day Boyacá, Colombia. The battle began in the morning until the afternoon of the 25th. July 1819.

The opposing sides were the patriotic troops and the royalist troops in the liberation campaign for the independence of what was then New Granada, today Colombia, Panama, Venezuela and Ecuador.

In it, the army of "Gran Colombia" under the command of Simón Bolívar tried to block the way for the support forces of José María Barreiro who were heading to the city of Bogotá.

This was the bloodiest and most radical battle on the soil of New Granada during the liberation campaign. Thanks to this, the liberating army arrived in Tunja on August 4, 1819, and defeated the Spanish army in the battle of Boyacá on August 7, 1819.

This is a mechanical Roll And Write game in two player mode, or in solo mode with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

To play it is recommended to have:

The Battle Blade (It is recommended that the blade be found with a polypropylene protector)
An erasable marker.
Various D6 Dice


Objective: Eliminate 5 enemy battalions, before the end of the turn10. If at the end none of the contestants achieve their objective, the one with the most wins.
battalion units remove.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Market, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Charge & Spark
description:
「チャージ＆スパーク」は、色々な効果を持つカードを駆使して、相手のライフを削りきるか、先にゴールすることを目指す2人専用カードゲームです。
使うカードはたった16枚！戦略と読み合いが楽しい心理戦ゲームです。


Charge & Spark is a card game for two players, in which players aim to reduce their opponent's life to zero or reach the goal first, by using cards with various effects.Only 16 cards are used in this game! It is a game of psychological warfare in which strategy and reading each other are fun.
mechanics: Hand Management

name: Paper Dungeons: Dangerous Dungeons
description:
Paper Dungeons: Dangerous Dangeons is a mini expansion to the successul roll & write game Paper Dungeons.

This mini expansion adds 8 new scenarios, 3 new monsters in a 14 only cards expansion.

This scenarios adds hard challenges to the players and christmas monsters to play with in any other match.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Up or Down
description:
Up or Down is a roll-and-write game that uses a set of polydice; d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20 (also known as RPG set). Players try to make an Up or Down in their turn, by creating a sequence of dice that is either ascending or descending. This earns them points. Scores are counted after 9 rounds and whoever has the most points wins.

Up or Down exists only as a free-to-play (personal use only!) Print and Play version. PDF with rules and scoresheet can be found in the Files section. In addition to the rules and scoresheet you need at least one polydice set to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Duo Duel
description:
In a remote town where adventurers gather, the annual "Fighting Tournament" is about to be held.
The rules of this year's tournament are tag-team battles.
The adventurers are trying to decide who will be their partner in order to win the tournament.

Each team takes turns to play their turn.
The winner is the team that eliminates both of the enemy team's characters from combat.
mechanics: Team-Based Game

name: Ardennes Plus+ Volume Two: Hitler's Invasion of France
description:
Ardennes Plus is a grand strategic level simulation of 20th century conflicts in the densely forested and rough terrain of the Ardennes region of France, Luxembourg and Belgium. This game features scenarios for Hitler’s Invasion of France, May 1940. This is Vol 2 of Ardennes Plus+ with the series also including Vol 1 WWII 1944, and Vol 3 WWI 1914. The game uses Army level command structures to simulate supply and command in divisional and corps level units. The game optionally represents the fog of war that was very common in the rough country of the Ardennes, by offering 2 hidden movement systems.

The low counter density, and high map scale is used to create conditions for fast play and resolution is possible in less than 2 hours.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Caquot M / Ae 800 Drachen
description:
The Caquot M / Ae 800 Drachen Special Pack is the perfect addition to the WW1 Wings of Glory game line. This pack brings the excitement of the "Knights of the Air" era to your tabletop, allowing you to experience the thrill of commanding your own observation balloon in the midst of the battles of World War I.

As the guardians of the skies, observation balloons played a critical role in the struggle for aerial and ground supremacy during the First World War. With their ability to support troops, gather intelligence, and assist with artillery fire, these massive Drachens were heavily defended by anti-aircraft guns, groups of machine guns, and patrolling fighter aircraft. But the brave balloon busters, equipped with special weapons like Le Prieur rockets, were up for the challenge of taking them down.

Now, you can recreate these intense and thrilling battles with the Caquot M / Ae 800 Drachen Special Pack. This pack features a beautifully pre-painted model, scenarios, ground units, new rules, new abilities, and even a decal sheet for customization. You can play a variety of missions, including defending your balloon from enemy attacks or attempting to take down an enemy balloon yourself.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Can't Go
description:
A family-friendly, toilet-themed quirky trick taking game.
The goal is to be the first to claim 400 poop points, or to score the most before one of the draw decks runs out.

Players play poop cards into the play area, alongside toilet cubicles, to accumulate potentially claimable points. Once a poop is 'finished' players race to try to claim the points of that poop in play.

Turns can be based on grabbing points, sharing points or sabotaging other players' options. Let chaos commence!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Trick-taking

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Gallowfall
description:
In the doomed depths of the space hulk Gallowdark, elite kill teams hunt each other through crumbling passages. The space hulk is on the brink of annihilation, chunks of it torn away by the catastrophic crash of an Imperial prison barge. As it drifts ever-closer to destruction, long-confined distress signals emitted by an Ironkin of the Leagues of Votann finally break through to the galaxy beyond – and now The Reachfar, a cruiser of the Trans-Hyperian Alliance, speeds to the hulk to rescue their lost comrade. This will be no easy task, however, for they are hunted by a pack of Fellgor Ravagers – fearsome Chaos Beastmen hunters who stand among the Gallowdark’s most ferocious and cunning denizens.

Kill Team: Gallowfall is a full expansion box for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, the ultimate sci-fi skirmish game. It includes miniatures for two new Kill Teams – the hardened warriors of the Leagues of Votann’s Hearthkyn Salvagers, and the savage Chaos Beastmen of the Fellgor Ravagers. They’re packed together with loads of space hulk terrain, which is fully compatible with that found in Killzone Gallowdark, along with more than 500 transfers, a double-sided game board, and a rules manual including missions, background material exploring the mysterious setting, and full rosters for the two kill teams.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Court in Chaos: A Game of Blame
description:
With her Realm on the brink of ruin, the Queen is determined to root out those responsible and punish them. You are a royal advisor, and your life is on the line. You must find a scapegoat and dump the blame on them if you want to keep your head!

Court in Chaos is a game for 2-4 players, lasting 15-30 minutes.

Each turn, you must play a card from your hand to the Blame pile and follow the instructions on the card played.

Each character has a special rule that modifies the instructions.

Characters can change their loyalty, bury secrets (putting cards out of play) and gain Disgrace or Favour.

The game ends when a player with 6 or fewer cards declares. Everyone counts up the BLAME points in their hand - the character with the highest BLAME is beheaded, those with one or more BLAME are banished and the blameless are blessed. If you declare, you cannot be banished - if someone has more BLAME than you, you are exonerated, otherwise, the executioner awaits!

–description from designer
mechanics: Memory, Take That

name: Rando au pic des neiges
description:
Rando au pic des neiges is a team racing game with a question-and-answer session on the theme of mountain hiking.

Rando au Pic des Neiges is a team-based mountain hike (except for the 2-person version) set on a game board. Players must first acquire suitable equipment and favorable weather conditions, then set off from the hamlet to reach the summit of Pic des Neiges.

They advance with the help of dice, and along the way must answer numerous questions on the themes of nature, respect for the environment, knowledge of the mountain environment and, of course, safety (in the medium and high mountains). Correct answers will enable them to gain ground, but they will also have to choose their route strategically and use their yeti map skilfully.

Finally, they'll need to respect the mountains and show team spirit if they're to win by being the first team back to the hamlet after reaching the Pic des Neiges.

—description from the designer (translated)
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Race

name: D6: Advanced D6 Starter Pack
description:
The Advanced D6 Class Starter Pack comes with:


7 Glory cards
7 Heroic Quest cards
7 Advantage cards 4 New Wooden Monster tokens
7 Class-Colored Gelatinous Cubes Minis
7 Travel Stickers
D6 Hero Dice Pad*
2 Dice Pads (combine them with the box to make it into a dice tray)
19 Rule Correction Stickers!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Frostgrave: Second Edition – The Wildwoods
description:
This supplement for Frostgrave brings a new dimension to games of Frostgrave, allowing players to lead expeditions into the wilderness north of the city, searching for undiscovered ruins and facing the perils of the Wildwoods.

For years, spellcasters have flocked to the Frozen City, braving the perils of its ruins in the hunt for relics and forgotten magic. While the city still holds many such secrets, newly arrived wizards must delve deeper and fight harder to make their mark. A few turn from the city, seeking instead the remote settlements that surrounded ancient Felstad. Such expeditions are not without their own dangers, however – in the vast forests of the Wildwoods, death lurks in the empty cookpot and torn waterskin, in the cold of night and the looming storm, and in the teeth and claws of the beast behind the next tree…

This supplement for Frostgrave takes players beyond the ruins with rules for running expeditions in search of secret places and forgotten treasures in the dark Wildwoods. New soldiers and magic items may improve wizards' chances of survival, but dwindling supplies, the hostile environment, and terrifying new creatures will push them to their limits in a range of scenarios set in these deep, foreboding forests.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Italy: Tough Gut
description:
A new supplement for Bolt Action focusing on the later Italian Campaign, following on from Soft Underbelly, adding new units, scenarios, and special rules.

In Italy, the fight continues!

As the Allies push north up the Italian Peninsula, they have encountered heavy resistance from the Axis and their multitude of fortified and defensive lines, slowing the allied advance to a crawl. The 'soft underbelly' of Europe proved to be false, instead it was a 'tough gut'.

This supplement for Bolt Action, and the counterpart to Soft Underbelly, focuses on the battles ranging from the Gustav Line in 1944 all the way to those of the Gothic Line in 1945, with the breakouts at Anzio and Monte Cassino of particular focus. Containing a host of scenarios to refight these famous battles, along with new units, special rules, and Theatre Selectors, this book contains everything players need to bring an end to the war and liberate Italy.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Counter Attack: Club Manager
description:
Take control of a football/soccer club and battle for glory in the league and cup! Can you guide them up from Division 3 to the very top? Can you eventually become the champions of Europe? Buy and sell players, develop youths and improve your stadium along the way.

Draft your squad
You’ll start in Division 3 with a mediocre squad of mostly ageing players. Can you shape them into promotion contenders in your first season? Will you supplement the squad with youngsters or dabble in the transfer market?

Place your staff
Every week you’ll need to decide how to best use your staff members. Will you get to work on the training pitch, or develop youths, or scout your next opponents, or build club facilities, or, or…there are so many options but not enough time in the week! A smart manager will need to deploy their staff strategically throughout the season.

Play your fixtures!
On matchday, you’ll need to pick your best XI to take on that week’s opponents. Where on the pitch will you be able to outfox them? The matchday sequence leaves plenty of room for tactical maneuvers, meaning you can hunt down that win, or hold your opponent at bay, with smart tactical decisions.

Build your legacy
The aim of Counter Attack Club Manager is to rise from Division 3 to Division 1…and then become the champions of Europe! You’ll only do that if you make clever strategic decisions across multiple seasons. Sometimes you might need to sacrifice short term goals for the sake of the bigger picture…

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Dark Matter (fan expansion for Arkham Horror Card Game): Science Expansion
description:
Save the solar system from a dark and ancient primordial force, using new tools of Science! Play as Kate Winthrop, The Scientist, purchase new and real Science tools and instruments, and explore the scientific achievements of humanity across the solar system in Dark Matter – Science Expansion!

To celebrate Dark Matter Day (October 31st), Axolotl, Dr Xavier Bertou (Head of the particle and radiation detection laboratory at the Centro Atomico Bariloche), Levi Thornton (The Cardboard-naut), and Mint Tea Fan have collaborated to bring a new 20 card science-themed expansion to the fan-made Dark Matter Campaign!

The Scientist:
Play as Mint Tea Fan‘s Kate Winthrop, The Scientist! Use your additional actions with Researched cards to discover clues and fuel your Flux Stabilizer, allowing you to do more science! But beware of the Dimensional Rift and the horrors that lurk beyond.

Researched Cards:
Too much experience and you aren’t sure what to spend it on anymore in the Dark Matter Campaign? This expansion adds 10 new Science cards purchasable with experience based on real science, including cutting edge technologies that are actively searching for real dark matter such as the Germanium Detector.

These new cards all have a special variation of the Researched keyword, which specifies the cost to purchase the card between scenarios, instead of requiring a prior condition from an un-upgraded version. However, since it is still the Researched keyword, these added cards are perfect for Mint Tea Fan‘s Kate Winthrop!

Frontiers of Space:
This new expansion also adds 5 new scanning cards to shuffle into the finale of Dark Matter, Starfall. These cards offer a chance to uncover some of humanity’s greatest achievements in space exploration.

Hint: You may want to purchase a few Science cards if you are planning to play with these new scanning cards.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Waters Edge: Natural Disasters
description:
Are you ready for a wild week in Waters Edge? How will your town survive?

This pack will throw all sorts of natural disasters your way so batten down the hatches as you contend with tsunamis, mutant fish, stowaway penguins and more! Waters Edge is about to be hit by the toughest game play yet!

This expansion contains 36 cards and a manual presented in a tuck box. It enhances the gameplay of the Waters Edge base game and can be played alongside any or all of the other expansions!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: MATHARON
description: Fire up your child’s calculation speed and mental math ability through this unique “Math Marathon”. In this game players challenge each other by solving stimulating mathematical equations. Each player will strategically use their colored number tokens to either add, subtract, multiply or divide to move ahead on the track. Race your mind to win this ultimate “MATH-ARON”. Enjoy in solo or multiplayer mode.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Math, Number, Sports
mechanics: Action Points, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Role Playing

name: Dragonbond Quest
description:
Dragonbond Quest is a cooperative quest-style card game for 1-4 players. Based on the Dragonbond universe, players will choose between heroes' archetypes and pit their skill and strategy against the many perils that exist in Valerna.

One of the notable features of Dragonbond Quest is its focus on movement, with heroes being able to travel between different locations during a quest.

Enemies in the game react to heroes at their location, adding another layer of strategic planning for players. The game also provides thematic objectives for heroes, creating a sense of urgency and purpose that goes beyond just defeating enemies and gathering loot.

Dragonbond Quest introduces Dragonbonding, a unique way for heroes to increase their power over the game. This mechanic allows heroes to bond with dragons, transforming them from adversaries into allies.

In turn, players will move across different locations, explore them and face fearsome Dragons, evil villains, and hoards of savage minions, using cards in their hands as actions, combining strategy and leaning on one another’s strengths to complete quests in order to win the game.

Can you survive the threat and emerge victorious?

-description from the developer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Bretwalda: Vanished Kingdoms
description:
9th century AD, Britain. The island is divided between several competing kingdoms collectively known as the Heptarchy. It cannot prevail any longer, the war for supremacy over them all is about to begin. Subdue the minor kingdoms of Kent, Alt Clut, Dumnonia, and Gwynedd. Use diplomacy, coercion, and, if necessary brute, military strength to overcome your rivals.

Vanished Kingdoms is an expansion for the Bretwalda base game bringing new life to neutral units and expanding the game to include more historical kingdoms. The expansion adds four minor neutral kingdoms (Kent, Alt Clut, Dumnonia, and Gwynedd) with their own units, capitals, and automa cards governing their actions.

-description from publisher
categories: Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers

name: Pokémon TCG: Scarlet & Violet Expansion
description:
Pokémon ex are back and stronger than ever!

Pokémon ex originally debuted almost 20 years ago in EX Ruby & Sapphire and were a mainstay in the Pokémon TCG until EX Power Keepers in 2007. Now they're back in Scarlet & Violet, and while they may look a bit different, they maintain the essence of the original mechanic—powerful two-Prize Pokémon that can also evolve from one-Prize Pokémon. Pokémon ex look similar to the more recent Pokémon-EX from the Black & White Series and the XY Series, but Pokémon-EX were almost always Basic Pokémon, while Pokémon ex can appear at any stage of Evolution!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Quest Inc.
description:
In Quest Inc. you are an NPC in an electronic RPG game that owns a mission distribution company. Your plan is to make profit through the quest industry.

It's that old story, people need to solve problems and they won't mind paying a few gold coins to solve it. And that's where you come in! Your company will take on the mission to receive the treasure, but for that you'll need to hire the bravest (and why not the cheapest) heroes, after all, the money left over is yours!

Furthermore, no one will question if some valuable items rescued by the heroes ended up in your hands. “It's part of the mission,” you'll reply. In case of your mission to profit more.

But be careful, competing companies will be around, trying to take the best opportunities before you!

The game is played in rounds, each round has 2 phases: in the first one players engage in an inverted auction to see who gets what quest and the money.

In the next phase players go to a location in the city, to pay to contract adventures (such as Rogues, Warriors, Mages or Clerics), each location has a special rule change.

By completing a quest a player receives loot cards that can give single use abilities and/or can be sold at the end of the game, and if this is part of a set the profit will be higher.

The game ends after some rounds (depending on the number of players), then the player with the most money wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection

name: Meigo
description:
Meigo is a territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square grid (board). There is also an off-board location called prison. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones of their own color. One of the two sides of each stone is marked.



DefinitionsA chain is a stone along with all stones one can reach from it through a series of steps onto orthogonally adjacent stones of its color.

A liberty of a chain is an empty point orthogonally adjacent to it.

A stone is marked if its marked side is up, and unmarked otherwise.

A point reaches a stone if a path along the lines of the board can take you from one to the other without stepping onto an unmarked stone. Note that the path can go through marked stones of any colors.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your first turn of the game, place an unmarked stone of your color on an empty point. On any other turn, play or hold. To hold, remove an enemy stone from the prison. To play, follow these steps:


Select an empty point.
If the selected point is orthogonally adjacent to both marked and unmarked friendly stones, unmark (by flipping them) all marked friendly stones reached by the selected point.
If the selected point reaches a marked friendly stone or no friendly stones at all, place a marked friendly stone on that point. Otherwise, place an unmarked friendly stone on that point.
Move to the prison all enemy chains without liberties. After this, the stone you just placed must be part of a chain with at least one liberty.


You cannot place a marked stone and move a marked stone to the prison on the same turn if the last stone placed on the board was marked.

The last player to play or hold wins.

Before the game begins, to make it fair, the first player places a number of black stones in the prison, and then the second player chooses sides. For handicap games, the weaker player takes Black and opens instead by placing on the board a number of unmarked black stones proportional to the skill gap between the players.



NotesMeigo is a seemingly finite game that plays almost like Go. It was inspired by Cavity, a Go variant created by Michael Amundsen. Christopher Field provided valuable input that helped refine the rules of the game. The prison mechanism was introduced by David Wolfe and Elwyn Berlekamp in their book Mathematical Go: Chilling Gets the Last Point.

-description from designer
mechanics: Chaining, Enclosure, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Dawn of Heroes: The Anna's Roundtable Expansion
description:
The first Anna's Roundtable expansion adds 200 new unit cards, 22 new shop cards, and 5 new solo/co-op bosses!

This doubles the total unit pool for the base game and vastly expands the variations of Anna's Roundtable.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Square Grid

name: Scars of Baladorne
description:
Scars of Baladorne is an immersive and strategic board game that takes you on a journey to the world of Baladorne. In this game, players assume the role of commanders, leading their armies into intense battles for control over the realm. With a focus on tactical movement, players strategically position their units, utilizing their unique attributes and abilities to gain the upper hand.

The game revolves around turn-based gameplay, where players command up to four units per turn. Each unit can perform primary and secondary actions such as moving across the board, launching attacks on surrounding enemy units, or unleashing special abilities. The goal is to eliminate the opponent's captain, while carefully managing your units' health and damage points.

Scars of Baladorne is suitable for both experienced board game enthusiasts and newcomers alike. The combination of unit attributes, action choices, and the strategic use of utility cards adds depth and variety to each game. Prepare for battle as you make critical decisions that will determine the outcome of the war for Baladorne.
Players command armies, strategically position units, and unleash unique abilities in intense battles to eliminate the opponent's captain and claim victory in the war for Baladorne.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Helmet of Shinjaro
description:
A promo Forbidden Fortress Artifact card first given out to Dicefest 2022 attendees, but later available as part of the 2023 Roll to Move webstore sale for orders over $100.

Forbidden Fortress Artifact - Clothing - Hat

One Darkstone

Once per turn you may reduce the damage you would take from a single hit by 2. Requires Strength 3 or higher to use.

1 Weight, 1 upgrade slot, $550.

Promo 455
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Space Aces: Landing Party
description:
Space Aces: Landing Party is a fast-playing casual card game for 2-3 players that is quick to pick up, challenging to master, and plays in just 10-30 minutes. Combine two decks to play with up to 4 players.

Premise: It is the 23rd century and the golden age of galactic exploration has begun. As proud members of the Stellar Alliance, your crew has been sent out on a mission of discovery. But you are just one of many crews, and everybody wants the prestigious honor of discovering new planets. Set your phasers to “stunning” as you deploy a daring cast of Crew Members & Special Guests for a fun-filled episode as you outwit your friends to boldly go and get there first!

Cards: 18 standard crew members & 3 cadets make up the core game, and 8 included special guests can be mixed in to open up new avenues of strategy and tactics. The fast-paced play and infinite replayability will keep you and your friends coming back for "just one more" to settle the score.

Landing Party is a small game of deep strategy. Each player starts with 7 unique crew member cards on their starship and 1 crew member hidden in their ship's transporter buffer. Each player takes turns beaming down a crew member of equal or higher rank to take command on a newfound world. The last player able to beam down a crew member wins the mission for their crew.

Designed to minimize luck and richly reward skillful play. Since all the cards in play (except for 2) are known by all players, the game becomes one of evolving tactics and strategy. The highest ranked crew members are not necessarily the best. Each crew member and special guest has a unique special ability. Mastering when & how to use these abilities is the real secret to success.

There's always an interesting choice to be made! Will you try to crush your opponents with high ranking Officers? Or will you try to draw out their low cards and trap them with a clever Secret Agent? Will you use your Tactician to force an opponent to play that key crew member too soon? Or will you sacrifice your Red Shirt to revive a stunned character in a shocking turn of events? Do you keep your crew member's rank or do you stun it to activate its special ability? The possible strategies and tactics are endless!

Stuck in a bind? Activate your Starship and fire phasers to stun whatever character is in command on the planet. But each player can only do this once, so use this ability wisely!

The beauty of the game comes from the deep interactions between the crew members and their special abilities as well as reading your opponents and guessing their strategy. The more you play, the more tricks & tactics you will discover. And since each round only takes about 10 minutes, there's always time for one more!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: King of the Hill

name: Icons of Kyiv
description:
The harvest is over, leaves fell and the sun, bathing our lavra in gold, is waning. Soon, cold wind will come from over the Dnieper and blanket the plains of Kyiv with snow. There are only a few things left to do – to finish the central fresco on the ceiling and to cover the main iconostasis of our monastery with holy icons.

Players will take the roles of gifted monks which carry on their shoulders the weight of a near-impossible deadline, as well as their own physical degradation, exhaustion, and laziness.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: アリスと謎とくらやみの物語 (Alice to nazo to kurayami no monogatari)
description:
This is the story of Alice, somewhat after she has finished her adventures in Wonderland.
The main character is Alice, of course, and the setting is probably Wonderland.
The reason why I say "probably" is that everything in front of you is pitch-black, and you cannot even see your feet.
Alice, who was supposed to be sleeping in her bed just a moment ago, has wandered into the land of darkness.

She begins to walk fearfully in the darkness, but soon she has a means of communicating with "someone".
Encouraged by his or her words, Alice regains her smile and sets out to escape from the land of darkness.

You already know the story, don't you?
Yes. That "someone" is you.

You are the only one who can save her from being left in the darkness.
Now, let's solve the many mysteries together with Alice and reach the truth of the Land of Darkness!

To play this game, you will need a mobile device (smartphone or tablet) that can use LINE Messenger.
You will have to communicate directly with Alice and guide her.
By giving her the right instructions and letting her explore the land of darkness, you will discover many things.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Beyond the Horizon: Castaway
description:
A new player knight, the Castaway.


Castaway Miniature
Knight Sheet
4 Upgrade Cards
5 Luck Tokens
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pun of Your Business
description:
In Pun of Your Business, you and your business partners have just acquired an entire strip mall of empty stores — but what's a strip mall without its selection of niche shops? Using random combinations of business ideas and helpful market research, come up with clever puns to score points and name these stores before the grand opening!

Combine cards from the grid to make punny business names, focus on the combinations required by the market research card in the center, and complete the objectives to win.

Thirty market research cards and randomized grids from the 300+ business cards make every game different. Simultaneous play means there's no downtime waiting for turns, and you can play with groups big and small by teaming up for twice the fun.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Tomes of Arkham
description:
In Tomes of Arkham each player is a Rare Tomes book collector in H. P. Lovecraft's town of Arkham. Each round players utilise different events in order to acquire the most Renowned Tomes collection. When a player acquires their 8th Tome then everyone calculates their Renown Points, the player with the highest Renown is the winner.

Players have a number of Resources that they can use to purchase Tomes from the common sale area. Each Tome is part of a larger collection which adds to the Renown that the owner gains at the end of the game. At the start of each round new Tomes are placed up for sale and the First Player chooses an Event card to play later in the round secretly, then passes them to the next player who chooses their event card for the round and so on.

The Events determine the player turn order and each includes a special ability that the player can use when it is their turn; Henry Armitage can prevent other Events playing, Creative Banking lets players steal resources from other players, Viewing lets players gain resources from the Lost Tomes Collection, Guard Dogs prevent a players Tomes being stolen, Wise Investments allow players to gain Resources, Collector allows players to acquire more than 1 Tome per Round, Wilbur Whateley allows players to steal Tomes and the Stars are Right makes acquiring Tomes cheaper. But players must beware, owning certain Tomes can lead to players becoming Unstable and unlocking bizarre game twisting actions such as swapping Tomes, moving the First Player and losing resources.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Multi-Use Cards, Set Collection, Turn Order: Role Order

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crisis Collection 2
description:
Team up to save the DC Universe! Crisis Collection 2 brings together the second two Crisis Expansion Packs for the DC Deck-Building Game series and offers a wide variety of new cards to add to any base game. Get ready to face some of the most epic challenges in comic book history with the introduction of Crisis events and Impossible Mode Super-Villains. But this time you won’t be going it alone, thanks to cooperative gameplay that lets you team up to win… and survive!

Crisis Expansion Pack 3 and 4 reimagine the eight Super-Villains from Forever Evil and the eight Super Heroes from Teen Titans with Crisis versions for cooperative play. In addition, the Villains from Forever Evil and Super-Villains from Teen Titans—and some new ones—have been upgraded to Impossible Mode, making them much more difficult to defeat. There are even six new oversized Characters in each expansion to go along with all the new main deck cards!

This is not a standalone product. Requires any DC Deck-Building Game base game to play.

Key Features

Includes Crisis Expansion Pack 3 and 4
Adds cooperative gameplay mode with Crisis cards that require players to work together to overcome
FOIL oversized Character cards
Impossible Mode Super-Villains that add new challenges to cooperative and competitive modes
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Masters of Myth
description:
Masters of Myth is a multiplayer card game featuring gods from ancient mythologies, including from the Norse, Greek, Egyptian, and Aztec pantheons. In this competitive 2-4 player game you play as either Odin, Zeus, Ra or Quetzalcoatl wielding their godly powers to defeat your opponents. Minions, rituals, spells, and relics are all summoned using Devotion, which also acts as your health pool. Unlike other card games, when your devotion is reduced to 0 instead of losing you get a second chance, flipping your God card over getting a refreshed devotion pool and new abilities allowing you to mount a comeback. The goal is to be the last god standing.
