There are 4 phases per turn and each turn will provide cards to cause mischief, battle opponents, collect cards, and provide protection from other players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Move Through Deck, Set Collection

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Rival Panels: Battle for the Throne
description:
The throne of Wakanda is on the line in the latest Rival Panels pack for Marvel: Crisis Protocol! New versions of T'Challa and Killmonger battle for the throne on a beautifully sculpted waterfall terrain piece that can be customized with 4 optional plant pieces. In addition to the miniatures for both characters, players will also find holographic foil stat cards outlining all of their abilities in this pack, along with 4 new Team Tactic cards that further augment their abilities.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Caper: Europe – Dice Tower 2023 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the Druid Pack from the Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

The Critic is a substitute for The Mime, and is based on Zee Garcia from The Dice Tower.

The two Blaze Suit Shields are substitutes for two Eaves Droppers.

These cards do different things than the cards they replace (ie: they are not alternate artwork cards).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Set Collection, Tug of War

name: Muumit Hippasilla
description:
A cheerfully fast-paced game for little Moomin fans.

In the game, each player has their own pretty stones and Moomin character tiles, and character cards drawn from the deck always show each player who they need to find, i.e. catch. The timer ticks in the background, and when it rings, the hippy has to give up one of his pretty stones. The game is won by the player with the last pretty stones left.

—user summary

Iloisen vauhdikas peli pienille Muumi-faneille. Pelissä leikitään hippaa Muumien kanssa ajastimen määrätessä tahdin. Voittaja on se, jolla on viimeisenä hienoja kiviä jäljellä. Peliä voi pelata samanaikaisesti 2-4 pelaajaa. Peli kestää n. 15 min ja se sopii yli 4-vuotiaille. Vauhdikkaisiin pelihetkiin!

Leiki hippaa Muumien kanssa! Uusi hauska peli vaatii nopeutta ja havainnointikykyä – ja hyvää onnea.

Pelissä jokaisella pelaajalla on omat hienot kivet sekä Muumihahmolaatat, ja pakasta nostettavat hahmokortit osoittavat aina kullekin hipalle kenet hänen täytyy löytää eli saada kiinni. Ajastin raksuttaa taustalla, ja sen soidessa hippana oleva joutuu luopumaan yhdestä hienosta kivestään. pelin voittaa se pelaaja, jolla on viimeisenä hienoja kiviä jäljellä.

Pelin väritys ja kokonaisilme on aurinkoisen ihana, ja hahmolaattojen sekä -korttien kuvat esittävät Muumihahmoja suloisimmillaan. Pelin hullunkurinen ajastin viheltelee milloin sattuu, ja se tuo lisää yllätyksellisyyttä peliin.

Hersyvän hauskoihin hetkiin – HIPPA!

—description from the publisher (Finnish)
mechanics: Player Elimination

name: Great War at Sea Jutland: Dogger Bank 1915
description:
“ The 1916 Battle of Jutland was not the only action on the North Sea during the Great War. The battle cruisers of Britain’s Grand Fleet and Germany’s High Seas Fleet met in the January 1915 Battle of Dogger Bank, and both fleets continually sortied into the waters dividing them.

Jutland: Dogger Bank continues the story we began with Jutland: North Sea 1914. It’s a book of history, scenarios and game/historical analysis, all woven together to use Great War at Sea: Jutland Second Edition to tell the campaign’s story.

Dogger Bank picks up the story with the Cuxhaven Raid of December 1914, and continues it into the operations of early 1915 - a rarely-if-ever-discussed part of the North Sea naval campaign. You get 28 new scenarios (11 operational and 17 battle scenarios), plus historical articles and analyses all relating the game play to the actual events. We look at how the game simulates the operations, and then we flesh them out with still more scenarios: fast-playing battle scenarios using just the Tactical Map, and additional operational scenarios using the operational map as well to pick up the action at key decision points and discuss why the admirals involved made the decisions that determined the battle’s outcome.

Jutland is already a very fine game (our most popular ever, even more than Third Reich) and a good instrument through which to re-play history. Dogger Bank and North Sea 1914 take it even further.

You’ll need a copy of Jutland Second Edition to play these scenarios.”

Note: This is designed to work with GWAS Jutland Second Edition (the 2023 printing). It relies on the Second Edition core series rules so there may be issues using older editions/printings of GWAS Jutland with this expansion.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Менше П'яти (Low Five)
description:
1) At the beginning every player receives four cards arranged in a square (2x2) in front of the player, face down. Now, look at your cards and memorize the two closest to you.

2) You will discover the other cards later if you use card abilities correctly during the game. From this point on, viewing the cards at will is strictly prohibited. You must rely solely on your memory!

3) Players take turns clockwise. You draw a card from the game deck and decide whether to play it or play any card from your hand.

4) Different cards have different abilities. During the game, you can peek at your own cards or the cards of your opponents, swap them blindly or knowingly, and, under certain conditions, discard your own and, the most enjoyable part, other players' cards!

5) The objective of the game is to get rid of cards with high denominations, leaving yourself with cards that have a total sum of 5 or fewer points.
mechanics: Matching, Memory

name: Footfalls
description:
Race all of your tokens across a rickety bridge while outmaneuvering your opponents. Use movement abilities to get across the bridge, and combine them for different effects! Your choice of abilities will affect your opponents' next choice, so don't set them up to overtake you.

Once you reach the end of one bridge card, you choose how to connect the next bridge card to create your expanding bridge!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Addition, Market, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Race

name: Horror Season
description: Horror Season is a last man standing Card Game with a twist. Change your role from a Human to one of the Monster roles to get a special ability in the game. Those who lose their hearts may not be able to win, but are still part of the game. Eliminated players are buried in the graveyard and become Ghosts, continue playing to the very end, and there to cause havoc in the game. Ghosts don't get to have a hand, they draw one card and discard all cards in their hand at the end of their turn.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Sudden Death Ending

name: Bitter Pickles
description:
Bitter Pickles is a fast-to-learn, fun-to-play passing card game for family and friends of all brines.

Press your luck by passing for a higher card, but don’t
get caught with a pickle in your hand at the end of
the round or you’ll lose a pickle chip. Wild cards add spice and advanced rules keep the fun growing.

Become the last pickle standing and win the pot of “Pickle Chips” by consistently avoiding the lowest card in each hand.

Pass the pickle, or pay the price.
mechanics: Hot Potato, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Enquêtes Express: Dans l'ombre de Peter
description:
Neverland, the land where you never grow up, is in turmoil: Peter Pan has been missing for several days... In this fast-paced investigation, let's discover together the key to this mystery and all those who surround it!

During a game, players first read and observe as many cards as possible within a limited time. However, each player is forbidden to look at cards of his or her own color. Then, together, they take the time they need to share and cross-check their information to answer a series of plot-related questions. The more correct the answers, the higher the rank of investigator.

—description from the publisher

Neverland, le pays imaginaire, est en émoi : Peter Pan a disparu depuis plusieurs jours... Dans cette nouvelle enquête express, découvrez ensemble la clé de ce mystère et de tous ceux qui l'entourent !

Pour chaque enquête, d'abord les joueurs lisent et observent un maximum de cartes dans un temps limité. Il est toutefois interdit, pour chaque joueur, de consulter les cartes de sa couleur interdite. Puis ils prennent ensemble le temps nécessaire pour partager et recouper leurs infos afin de répondre à une série de questions autour de l'intrigue. Plus ils accumulent les bonnes réponses, plus ils accèdent à un rang d'enquêteur élevé.

—description from the publisher (French)
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory

name: The Plum Island Horror: More of a Bad Thing
description:
A new eye-witness source to the atrocities of Plum Island has come forward to tell their story and let's just say, if you thought the event seemed bad before, you're going to want to take a seat for this because that was nothing compared to the nightmares that they shared.

After countless hours of reviewing new information and consuming an unquantifiable amount of caffeinated beverages, the team that brought you The Plum Island Horror is back with a new expansion chock-full with . . . well . . . more of a bad thing.

More of a Bad Thing introduces:

Three new playable Faction
New Scenarios including a Nightmare Mode that significantly ratchets up the difficulty
New Mutations, Search cards, Fate Cards, and Events
Location manipulation and much more


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: This Bed Is Mine
description:
This Bed Is Mine is a strategic game for two players, each of whom acts for the cat's or dog's camp and vies to occupy a larger portion of the bed by placing their tiles. The player with more victory points wins (and thus, the pet camp they represent can enjoy the bed for a good rest!).
The game also offers an advanced mode: Sweet Dream! Where the toys covered by the pets are involved to enhance the game experience.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence

name: Pastores al azar
description:
Pastores al Azar is an intriguing game that blends memory and strategy into an exciting challenge. As a shepherd, your mission is to protect your sheep from cunning wolves. You must remember the played cards to achieve your goal, always keeping an eye out for hidden wolves seeking to infiltrate your flock.

This game requires you to carefully observe the other shepherds, analyzing their moves and adapting your strategies accordingly. Each decision you make can be crucial to your victory. Moreover, each game of Pastores al Azar varies depending on the objective card you receive, offering a different experience in each playthrough.

Far from relying solely on luck, Pastores al Azar challenges you to use your memory and strategic skills to protect your flock. Get ready to dive into a game where each round presents a new challenge to your wit and memory skills.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Events

name: Aeon Trespass: Odyssey – Talespinner Titan
description:
The Talespinner is a new Titan of the Dreamwalker Strain. What it lacks in strength and finesse, it makes up for in appearance, animalistic theatrics and sheer audacity. This energetic, boisterous personality – if you can call it that – resonates with the mortal side of the Triskelion, making you believe you can achieve more. And believing is achieving.

This Deluxe miniature set contains:
1x 35mm scale resin miniature
1x scenic base
1x titan sheet
1x introductory sheet
1x kraft box

The Talespinner is compatible with both Aeon Trespass: Odyssey and Twelve Sins of Herakles.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Aviation / Flight, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Storytelling

name: Vrahode: Age of Prophecy
description:
The Age of Inception is fading. We can feel it in our very bones. Its cooling embers are already drifting into memory! Tabuhl's Tail, that most ancient of omens, sits poised on our horizon...ready to cross our skies once again...ready to reign in the Age of Prophecy!

There's no wisdom in taking stock of whispers from fools they say. Perhaps it is time for a few of us with keener eyes and wits to get at it...the heart of what this new age holds in store for Vrahode!

Vrahode - Age of Prophecy is the first game in the Vrahode Game System. This exciting, story driven game will introduce players to the rich lore, unique races, deadly new enemies and engaging mechanics that make our system so compelling! Adventure across the Overlands, oceans and Underlands of this seductive yet perilous world.

Join us on this epic journey for 1-4 players, ages 12+ and adventure into a fresh fantasy world over 30 years in the making. Enjoy masterful art and cartography from artists around the world and writing that elevates the genre from epic fantasy writers Shawn A. Dressler and Alex Fox.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Minimap Resolution, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Birdwatcher: Tool Card Mini-Expansion
description:
This expansion gives each player unique tool to take with them into the field.

Setup: Before dealing bird cards, deal two tool cards to each player. 'Return any excess to the box. Each player chooses one, places it faceup next to their tree, and returns the others to the box.
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: Oni Games (I), Renegade Game Studios, REXhry

name: Bite the Bullet: You are a legend – Expansion
description:
This expansion for Bite the Bullet contains six extra scenarios. In addition, a bonus scenario combines two maps.

The expansion includes enlarged maps of all scenarios and eight extra characters with their standees and counters.

Important: you need a copy of volume 1 in order to play this expansion.

The expansion is sold, printed and delivered through the Amazon network.

Here is the link to Amazon US: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CVG7NDS7?ref_=cm_sw_r_cp_ud_dp_Y...

Alternatively, you can acquire the PDF files on Wargamevault:
https://www.wargamevault.com/product/478285/Bite-the-bullet-...
mechanics: Action Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Middara: Lo-fi Nightingale – Resin Kit
description:
Leaving behind your life isn’t easy. Getting transformed into something strange by the Advancement is even harder. Sometimes, it’s worth taking a step back, a deep breath, and searching for the familiar.

The Lofi Nightingale resin kit depicts such a moment, with the youngest princess of Elenia finally taking a moment to relax. Maybe she’s just discovered the incredible diversity of Middara’s music. Maybe she just needs a few seconds to breathe.

This product contains one highly detailed resin miniature of Lo-fi Nightingale.

Included with this product is 1 large card, 1 art card, 2 item cards, and 1 mini card to add Lofi Nightingale to your games of Middara.

This model comes unassembled and unpainted.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: DEFCON 1: Deep Dive
description:
The DEFCON 1: Deep Dive contains expansions and additional material for the DEFCON 1 base game. The latter is needed to play with Deep Dive.


40 additional Mission cards
20 additional Objective cards
1 History booklet
1 Strategic Guide booklet
5 double-layer Block boards
100+ wooden meeples (replacing the counters of the base box)


UN Each player is a member of the Security Council and is able to submit to a collective vote 5 types of resolution. 5 specific Mission cards, 1 UN board, 5 Veto markers.

Doctrines allow you to lead your block by following doctrines, each with strengths and weaknesses. 5 specific Mission cards, 15 Doctrine cards, 5 Locked Technology tiles.

Leaders allow you to strengthen your block by calling to your side the great leaders who marked the Cold War. 5 specific Mission cards, 15 Leader cards, 15 Leader Control markers.

Finance allows you both to gain more resources and to have more flexibility in managing them. 5 specific Mission cards, 1 Finance board.

Air Strike allows you to use fighters and bombers to inflict heavy damage to your enemies. 5 specific Mission cards, 8 Technology tiles, 12 Aircraft markers.

Black Op allows you to mobilize your secret services, your Special Units, and your diplomatic network to use the opposing forces to your advantage. 5 specific Mission cards, 25 Black Op markers.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Variable Player Powers

name: Ancient Realm: Leaders – Set 1
description:
The course of history can be steered by powerful leaders. Achieve their goals alongside other major milestones to make the most of their singular talents.

Leaders - Set I introduces 6 renowned leaders from major eras in history. One leader takes control of your civilization at setup, adding a new scoring requirement that must be met at the end of the game. Another is used for its milestone. Milestones are events which happen during play; on completing a milestone, you are bound by a new rule that impacts your society for the rest of the game. Meet your leader's goal and complete your milestone to secure your civilization's enduring legacy!
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Layering, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ぬくみ温泉繁盛記 拡張・経営支援 (Nukumi Onsen Hanjouki Prosperity Expansion and Management Support)
description:
This combines two previously released expansions for the new edition of Nukumi Onsen Hanjouki with five modules to choose from.

5 additional modules
The opening support card is used to provide resources from the first stage (game development is accelerated).
4 new overall policy cards (challenge a variety of inn buildings).
Random round action (random action cards that increase in each round).
Additional assistant (44 helper cards including 6 new people + α).
Building facility tiles (buy with money for an inn, just as you want).
mechanics: Worker Placement

name: Table Battles: Doomed
description:
In this radical reimagining of Amabel Holland’s popular Table Battles series, players fight a series of short, snappy battles that are forgone conclusions. One side brings to bear overwhelming advantages while the other struggles to stave off certain doom as long as possible. Eventually, they will weaken. Inevitably, they will break. There is, mechanically speaking, no way for the doomed side to prevail – no victory condition at all, and no way for the other side not to achieve theirs. But it’s not about that.

It's about how hard you fight when you know you’re going to lose. During each battle, the doomed side will score points – a running tally that carries over from one scenario to the next. If by the end of the third battle they’ve hit a certain threshold, they win the game. But that threshold increases when you choose which of the game’s six battles to fight next – easier battles raise your threshold more than hard ones. The doomed player also has access to Advantage cards – once-per-battle powers that let them break the rules in some way. But each of these you take on also increases your threshold.

From the encircled Romans at Cannae to the trapped paladins at Roncevaux Pass, the outmatched French fleet at Trafalgar and the desperate highlanders at Culloden, this expansion spans desperate, hopeless battles from across human history and points toward an exhilarating new direction for Hollandspiele’s bestseller.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Defuse
description:
DEFUSE is a puzzle roll-and-write game. The players try to defuse the bomb by draw the bomb equal the number it around for get points. Whoever do their best and get the most point in ten rounds win the game.

The game is played over ten rounds. Each round has two phases: DETECT Phase and DEFUSE Phase.

DETECT Phase: One player rolls all 4 dice (2:D8 and 2:D6) then pair the dice in the same color. each player simultaneously chooses 1 pair of dice and write the clue number form number of D8 dice and draw the bomb equal number of D6 dice by respect the rule.

DEFUSE Phase: Player plays this phase if there met 1 in 3 conditions if not skip this phase.

The game ends after 10 rounds Each player totals their points and those who have the most points win the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Firepower: Battle in a Box – American Civil War
description:
Firepower is written by three of the greats of the wargaming industry, Alessio Cavatore, Michael and Alan Perry.

Its designed as a fast play set of rules for the period of the American Civil War, and gives a flavour of the period without too much depth.

This box includes 2 Generals, 145 Infantry, 12 Cavalry, 18 Artillerymen, 4 guns, 1 farmhouse, over 4 feet of fencing, unit bases for all figures, revised ‘Firepower’ rule set by Alessio Cavatore uniform guide and flags.
mechanics: Line of Sight, Moving Multiple Units, Variable Phase Order

name: Portmanteau: A Game of Linguistic Fusion
description:
What exactly is a Portmanteau? It's the fusion of two words to create something entirely new. Take, for instance, the combination of "spoon" and "fork," resulting in the delightful "spork."

In the game Portmanteau, players are working cooperatively as one "speaker" guides the group to select two icons displayed on the table by crafting a Portmanteau.

Here's the twist: the speaker doesn't employ actual words but, instead, utilizes the beginning letters of one icon and the ending letters of another. For example, merging "chocolate" and "baseball" yields the whimsical "chocball"! Seems simple enough but the difficulty increases as players must solve different lengths of Portmanteaus to win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game

name: Creature Kingdoms: Mayhem Crossover
description:
Three promo miniatures and their character cards which can be added to either of the Creature Kingdoms games:

War for Chicken Island
Dodos Riding Dinos and Dino Dash
Kiwi Chow Down
Party Panda Pirates!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Variable Player Powers

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 7: Fight against Evil!
description:
Etheria needs help! What, on the surface, looks like a breathtaking world, is in reality a dystopia. It's gripped by the iron fist of the Evil Horde, which seized control over that planet a long time ago. Yet, hope flickers on the horizon. The Great Rebellion resist the oppressor's rule abd tries every day to end their tyranny. There's no time to spare - She-Ra and her friends require your assistance!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Stat Check Resolution, Three Dimensional Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Unstable Unicorns: Unicorn of Illusions Promo Card
description:
Convention promo card for 2024
This has the "CON" convention promo logo for an expansion symbol.

Card Text
Unicorn of Illusions
Magical Unicorn Card
If this card would be sacrificed or destroyed, you may return another Unicorn card in your Stable to your hand instead.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Happy Little Dinosaurs: Smell The Flowers promo card
description:
2024 Convention Promo card
Convention promo card for 2024
This has the "CON" convention promo logo for an expansion symbol.

Card text:
SMELL THE FLOWERS
If you would add this card to your Disaster Area, move it to the bottom of the Disaster deck instead, then search the discard pile for an Instant card and add it to your hand.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Number, Party Game, Prehistoric
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Vadus
description:
Introduction:Vadus (from Gothic: Waddjus, meaning "wall") is a board game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty hexagonal board. The default board size is 9 points per side, but it can be played on an 11–sized board for longer matches or on a 7–sized board for shorter games. Each player has access to a sufficient supply of stones in their own color.



Definitions:– The connection part of a group is an arbitrarily chosen minimal connected subgroup containing two edge stones. If the group does not contain two edge stones, its connection part is empty.
– The surplus part of a group is the stones not in its connection part. This part can also be empty.
– The value of a group is the difference between (i) the number of stones in its connection part and (ii) the number of stones in its surplus part (the former minus the latter).



Turns:– On the very first turn, Black places one stone on any point.
– From then on, starting with White, the players take turns placing exactly two stones each on empty points.
– A player is allowed to pass instead of placing their two stones.



End of the Game:The game ends when both players pass their turn consecutively, and the player with the group of higher value wins. In the case of a tie, their second-largest groups are compared, and so on until reaching a pair that doesn't have the same value.



Notes:This is the improved version of the previous Vadus, being much more organic, which was designed by Saïd Gadwen and Michael Amundsen in February 2024.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections

name: Thought 2 Word
description:
Thought 2 Word is simple yet captivating game that holds on a single poker-sized card.

By connecting words, it stimulates your creativity and quick thinking while offering a fun experience. You'll be surprised by the variety of combinations and possibilities you'll discover while playing.

T2W is a coop game that offers different difficulty levels for different players. It also has a variety of thematics, from Nature to Technology, from History to Sports. Players will need to work together to think like the Master and find the right connections. Stimulating and fun game experience for all ages!
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Spelling

name: Renters
description:
In this Roll & Write game, players will try to gain as much profit as possible with their business of lodging renters.

Each turn we will have 3 cards of renters that can range from 1 to 5 people. These are willing to pay an amount of coins for an apartment and even pay extra if the apartment has certain services. We can host up to 5 people per turn (from one or several cards).

At the beginning of the turn we will roll 1 black die and 2 yellow dice, the black die is common for all players, simultaneously each player chooses one of the yellow dice. With the combination of these 2 dice we form the position coordinate where to place a tenant card in our apartment block. We can place adjacent to this coordinate another tenant card if we do not exceed 5 people staying per turn.

The building has broken elevator, community air conditioners and wifi on the top floors, in addition to the apartments on the sides require soundproofing. Throughout the game we will be able to acquire repairs and soundproofing that we will assign to our choice in order not to suffer penalties and to make our rents profitable.

At the end of the turn we draw a card until we have 3 tenant cards again. The game ends when a collection goal is reached.

It includes an advanced mode where you can score by rows and columns completed and suffer penalties for not taking advantage of the space in the apartments by including all the tenants it can accommodate.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Panzer Grenadier: The Book of Armaments Eastern Front Artillery
description:
On the combined-arms battlefield, it’s the armor that slashes through and the infantry that takes and holds ground. But it’s the artillery that destroys, that creates the breakthroughs and crushes attacks before they even begin.

The Book of Armaments is all about artillery in Panzer Grenadier, focused on the Eastern Front games (Fire in the Steppe, South Flank, Burning Tigers, Broken Axis, Gates of Leningrad, The Deluge, Slovakia’s War, Armata Romana) and thus on the Soviet, German and Romanian armies (including related forces like Soviet Guards or German Waffen SS).

It comes with 88 new die-cut and silky-smooth pieces: additional artillery units, plus new units for the heavy and medium batteries of corps- and army-level battalions. There are German 170mm and 210mm guns, Soviet 152mm and 203mm batteries, Romanian 155mm guns and so on. And there are more of the artillery batteries already present in some (though not all) of those games, like the German 105mm howitzer.

In Panzer Grenadier, each off-board artillery increment corresponds to an artillery battery and has the same strength as the battery’s indirect fire rating (so most German increments have a strength of 16 just like the 105mm howitzer). The Book of Armaments includes Artillery Display Cards for each player, and you’ll put your off-board batteries right there on the chart and change their status as you fire them. While it helps keep track of which ones have fired, more important is the coolness factor of playing with artillery batteries on the game board instead of numbers that you write down on paper.

There book also includes some new artillery-centric optional rules to let you do more stuff with the big guns. And of course there’s historical background about the guns and their users.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Bad Trevor
description:
A competitive card game set in a world of crazy superheroes and dastardly supervillains. At the start of each game, all 52 cards are shuffled and dealt out evenly between the players - these will be a mixture of 'Hero' 'Villain' and 'Civilian' cards. There are also two wild cards - Bad Trevor (the ultimate villain) and his arch nemesis Kamikaze Kevin.

Whoever is dealt Kamikaze Kevin places him face-up in the middle of the table - play starts with this person in a clockwise direction. The aim of the game is to get rid of all the cards in your hand before your opponents do. On their go, a player lays down an 'attack hand' against the next opponent. This is three cards chosen from their hand that are laid face down in front of them. The opponent must then draw one at random.

If a player draws a Villain card, this will screw them over in some way. If they draw a Hero card this will help them. In both instances, they must read the card out loud, place it on the discard pile and then carry out that instruction. If a player draws a civilian card, this can be discarded providing they have a matching civilian card in their hand. If they do have a pair, both can be placed on the discard pile. The player can then chose to carry on as normal by playing an attack hand against the next opponent in line. They can chose to reverse the order of play. Or they can demand a certain civilian from another player by pointing at them and asking for it by name. However, if they ask someone who doesn't have that card, their go is over and play moves to the next person.

If a player draws Bad Trevor from an opponent's attack hand, they must also pick up all the remaining cards from their attack hand as well - adding them to their own. Bad Trevor is the only card in the deck that can never be discarded, so as play continues and more and more cards are placed on the discard pile, the last person left holding Bad Trevor is crowned the loser of the game.

At any point in the game, is someone suspects that a certain card in a player's attack hand is Bad Trevor they can pick up Kamikaze Kevin, slam him on top of that card and say "Take That Bad Trevor!" If that person turns out to be correct, they can immediately leave the game and hand all their remaining cards to their opponent. However, if they guessed incorrectly, their opponent can leave the game instead and hand all their cards to their accuser. Kamikaze Kevin can only be used once in the entire game, after which he must be placed on the discard pile.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Hot Potato, Lose a Turn, Matching, Push Your Luck, Single Loser Game

name: Piri Piri Summoners
description:
Theme & Story

In a lush valley blessed by spirits, a tribe of summoners thrives in abundance. In gratitude, the tribe commits to a sacred duty: sending summoners on a challenging journey to forge bonds with powerful spirits.

This quest is far from simple. Each summoner embarks on their own path, engaging in rituals and facing competition from their peers. Only the most skilled can complete this formidable summoning challenge.

Summoners, it's time to bring prosperity to our land. With the spirits' blessings, begin your journey and embrace your destiny.

Special Features of the Game:
- Shifty and unpredictable gaming experience
To strike the perfect balance between strategic depth and simplicity, we've developed a brand-new game concept rooted in the playing card system. By gathering suits, placing cards, and creating patterns, we've transformed these elements into simple rules that form the strategic backbone of Piri Piri Summoners. This game delivers a straightforward yet profound, shifty and unpredictable experience you won’t want to miss!

- The first-ever wooden sculpture tabletop game
Each set of Piri Piri Summoners features exquisitely handcrafted wooden sculptures that serve not only as game meeples but also as elegant decorative pieces. This unique combination brings a touch of sophistication to any game night, providing an unprecedented gaming experience. The game’s distinctive wooden sculptures elevate it beyond a mere board game, making it a standout addition to your game collection.

- Traditional handcraft x modern design
Each game set features wooden meeples that bring to life iconic Japanese mascots: the Japanese Hare, Wild Boar, Capybara, and Tanuki. Our team has seamlessly blended old-world craftsmanship with contemporary aesthetics.

- Tactile quality
Our traditional craftsmanship makes these wooden meeples not only visually stunning but also substantially weightier than traditional plastic meeples. This tactile quality enriches the gaming experience by adding a sense of gravity to each move, deepening players' engagement with the game.

- Dual purpose cards
The dual-purpose cards in Piri Piri Summoners enable a seamless transition between game night and poker night. Each card is designed for both strategic gameplay in Piri Piri and traditional poker, allowing for diverse entertainment without needing different decks. Enjoy summoning spirits or playing poker with the same set, adding unique versatility to every game night."

- Spirit animal court cards
The Spirit Animal Court Cards in Piri Piri Summoners bring each game to life with stunning artwork. Each card is a gateway to discovering a unique mystery spirit, adding layers of visual storytelling to the gameplay. Players are able to engage with the richly depicted mythical creatures on each playthrough.

- Perfectly portable size
The game is designed with perfectly portable size, ensuring you can take the fun anywhere. Our compact design fits easily into any bag, making it ideal for travel, picnics, or casual gatherings. Despite its small footprint, the game offers rich and engaging gameplay, allowing players to experience the full excitement of summoning spirits wherever they go.

Goal of the Game:

The 1st player to successfully summon all 3 of their Spirit Cards wins the game. If no one can summon all 3 of their Spirit Cards and players agree to end the game, the player with the highest score win the game. Points are allocated as below: King: 6 points each; Queen: 4 points each; Jack: 2 points each; Wooden Coins: 1 point each.

Gameplay:

In Piri Piri Summoners, players begin by selecting a wooden sculpture as their game piece and preparing the deck with Spirit and Active Playing Cards, along with Wooden Coins. The game unfolds in turns where players strategically collect cards for summoning, trap and bait their opponents, win territories and mana, and finally summon their spirits.

The core challenge lies in summoning Spirit Cards by adhering to rules of suit and number strength, with the ultimate goal being the first to summon all three of their Spirit Cards, using strategy, resource management, and tactical placement to emerge victorious.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Farmers
description: Even its stewards. Farmers lead the common folk in tilling the soil and laying the foundation for a successful community. Each Farmer scores for every Peasant on the same level. Well-placed teams of Farmers and Peasants can reap a bountiful harvest.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Ered Mithrin Campaign Expansion
description:
As dark threats loom over Middle-earth, ever more people are torn from their homes and left without safety or refuge. What begins as a simple task of escorting a band of such wanderers to a new home quickly evolves into something drastically more perilous when a mighty threat emerges from the wilds of Rhovanion.

In the Ered Mithrin Campaign Expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game, one to four players explore the Wilderlands of Middle-earth in their quest to defeat a dragon that is terrorizing the countryside. Over the course of nine scenarios—which can be played standalone or as part of a larger campaign—the heroes must battle Goblins, explore the vast Wilderland, and steel themselves for a showdown with the dragon itself!

This expansion includes all of the scenarios originally featured in The Wilds of Rhovanion and the Ered Mithrin cycle, now repackaged into one box along with all-new campaign content.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Titans: Kickstarter Deluxe Edition
description:
Kickstarter Edition of Titans which contains four expansions (Spirit of War, Titans Power, King's Emissaries, and Banners of Glory) and also plastic miniature as the first player token.

Banners of Glory expansion is a part of the deluxe edition of the game and is not available in retail.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Garden Builder
description:
Grass. Who needs it? Grow all the things!

Garden Builder is a grid coverage pattern building game. The goal is to accrue the most points by optimally arranging flowers, vegetables, and lawn ornaments.

Draw Garden Cards to plant seeds. Once the seeds match the pattern on any of the Plant Cards, the seeds are removed and replaced by a plant. Increase your score by watering plants, growing more of the same type, and safeguarding against pests. Earn bonuses by planting the Three Sisters and/or Salsa Garden plants.

—description from the designer

Second in the "Builder" series, after "Village Builder".
categories: Abstract Strategy, Farming, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Tír na nÓg: Tower Promo Cards
description:
Four promocards for Tír na nÓg which have been part of the Gamefound campaign:


Glastonbury Tor (blue, PR4)
Glastonbury Tor (yellow, PR3)
Túr Bhalair (green, PR2)
Túr Bhalair (red, PR1)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: 3 of a Kind
description:
What is the scariest zoo animal?
The happiest item in a junk drawer?
The most dangerous fruit?

3 of a Kind is a competitive party game of thinking alike, where players try to write matching answers to wild questions. Each round, players select a Category and 3 different Adjectives. Each player writes one answer for each Adjective in the selected Category. The more players who write the same answer as you, the more points you get!

3 of a Kind plays with 2-8 players and offers near infinite variations of Adjective/Category combos to tickle your brain. Each game is played over 6 rounds and lasts 20-30 minutes.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Divinus: Chest of Plenty
description: All gameplay content, all meeples upgraded to miniatures, and all Stretch Goals stored in a single "Chest of Plenty" big box. PLUS get an exclusive Myth Scenario and miniature chosen by the backers (Charon)!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Corvus Nimbus
description:
A solo roll & sketch map building game.

Roll Corvus dice!

Collect Nimbus!

Build Structures!

Win the Game!

Corvus Nimbus is a roll & sketch game for children & adults.

All you need to enjoy the game is these rules, a pencil, 6 regular dice [d6] and the map page of the game.

In this game your purpose is to roll the dice, collect nimbus, build structures and win!!!

In this game you control Corvus (represented by 6 regular dice or 6 d6- called Corvus dice) and collect Nimbus (the currency of the game) to build structures that bring benefits during the game.
Each round consists of three phases, the rolling phase, the action/building phase and the point phase.
The game is won if you build 9 structures or collect 100 nimbus and it is lost if you lose all your Corvus (dice).
mechanics: Different Dice Movement

name: March of the Ants: Evolved Edition
description:
As spring dawns, the great thaw begins. Deep beneath the sprouting meadow grasses the queen stirs in her nest and the colony comes to life. Soldiers venture forth, battling centipedes while clashing with opposing colonies for territory. Workers dig an ever-expanding network of tunnels in their tireless search for food. The first larvae hatch and it is clear this generation will be different: the young colonies rapidly evolve into a multitude of new forms. The ants march out to claim the meadow as their own!

March of the Ants: Second Edition is a revised and upgraded version of the original base game from 2015 featuring:

New artwork and graphic design
Revised and updated Mechanics
New Resting cards and Great Tunnel Battles
Wooden Ant Meeples
Same quick playtime that delivers a rich 4X feel in under 90 minutes.


March of the Ants puts players in control of an ant nest, competing for success with rival nests. You will explore the unknown reaches of the Meadow, evolve your ants to create new species, and vie for control of the Great Tunnel. March of the Ants is an open-ended strategy game with many paths to victory. As your nest grows and your ants evolve, you must carefully craft your strategy to emerge victorious.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Quadrata Canada
description:
Quadrata Canada is a family game in which you will use multiplication tables to visit the country's major cities and attractions. Making the right combinations of destinations will allow you to use taxis, trains, or planes in order to be more efficient than your opponents, and maybe even win trophies.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Starmada: The Universal Game of Starship Combat
description:
The Core Rulebook celebrates STARMADA’s 30th Anniversary with a complete structural overhaul: every rule is now integrated into a single, logical flow — no more flipping between pages to find that elusive option.

Those who have been playing the Unity Edition for the past seven years will feel right at home; while some updates have been made, care has been taken to ensure existing ships can operate as they have before. To emphasize this point, the "Unity" tag has been removed entirely: going forward, the game is simply STARMADA.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mage Knight: The Apocalypse Dragon
description:
In Mage Knight: The Apocalypse Dragon, the first major expansion for Mage Knight since 2015, you'll meet a new playable hero: Coral, who wants revenge on the Apocalypse Cult.You'll also find new enemies to fight, including the four horsemen and the fearsome Apocalypse Dragon. You'll explore new tiles with new locations and challenges. This all comes together in a story-driven campaign mode featuring new scenarios and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Mythic Battles: Ragnarök – Destroyer's Box
description:
The Destroyer's Box is a Kickstarter exclusive storage box that comes with the Jörmungand, Surt, and Nidhogg expansions.
The box also has room for the Ymir expansion, while that expansion has to be purchased separately as it is not included.

Jörmungand - The Snake of Midgard.
Prophesied, like his brother Fenrir and his sister Hel, as the deliverer of the worst misfortunes to come, Odin, hoping to be rid of the serpent threw him into the seas of Midgard.
A exercise that had little success since Jörmungand continued to grow, so much so that it ended up encircling the world of the Humans.
Unleashed, the Midgard Serpent is wurming his way towards the battlefield!

Surt - The Lord of the Flames.
Guardian of the ardent world of Muspellheim, one of the oldest life forms in existence, probably present before the birth of the Gods themselves.
Now that the Ragnarök has come, he will blaze through Midgard towards Asgard with his Sons of Muspell, incinerating everything in his path!

Nidhogg - The Corpse Eater.
Dwelling between the roots of the World Tree, this strange creature spends his time attacking the bark and draining the sap of Yggdrasil, devouring Oathbreakers' corpses in the snake walled-fortress of Naströnd and waiting for the end of time—when he will carry the dead on his wings.
But, of course, the end of time has arrived, and Nidhögg intends to enjoy himself as the worlds collapse.

Includes:
2 Titan & 1 Monster Miniatures
2 Titan & 1 Monster Dashboards
3 3D Tidal Wave Tokens
2 3D Burning Tokens
15 Activation Cards
6 Adventure Mode Scenarios
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Puppets in High Places
description:
Puppets in High Places is set in the same universe as With a Smile & a Gun, but it is a standalone game, not an expansion.

After gaining control of the streets of Gattory City, mob bosses are setting their sights to the next level: getting a foothold in City Hall.

Puppets in High Places is a cutthroat game of underhanded power. Players will go through the Streets to obtain the resources they need to bribe VIPs and gain their favour. They will then proceed to the Speakeasy, where they will fight over these VIPs through a dynamic tug-of-war mechanism. Of course, mob bosses that they are, they have tricks up their sleeves and goons working the back alleys.

Puppets in High Places uses an evolving rondel, which the players will modify throughout the game, and a tug-of-war mechanism where players try to score VIP's represented by dice, whose value the players will also influence.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Rondel, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tug of War

name: Frostgrave: Mortal Enemies
description:
On the violent and deadly streets of the Frozen City, feuds and vendettas are commonplace. Wizards may start out focused on discovery and exploration, fighting when necessary for survival or to win possession of some long-lost artefact or grimoire, but such battles can swiftly become intensely personal. Competitors become adversaries and, as the cycle of violence continues, some wizards lose sight of their original goals and focus their efforts on the elimination of their hated foes – their mortal enemies.

This 96 page paperback supplement for Frostgrave presents rules for creating recurring villains in both competitive and solo campaigns. These characters are unique individuals who return over the course of a campaign to plague the players' wizards, gaining experience, recruiting allies, and becoming more deadly with each appearance. Against such threats, a wizard's base becomes as much hideout as headquarters, and an expanded range of options for enhancing bases is provided, as are rules for defending your own... and attacking those of your rivals!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Black Rose Wars: Rebecca Personal Spell – Cursed Blood
description:
This spell was created as part of a contest by the community. The files were later shared for print and play.
Its an alternative personal spell for "Rebecca", a Mage from the Black Rose Wars base game.

Cursed Blood
A spell inflicts one damage on you.
Spell Type: Protection, Profane
Effect: If you have been defeated target the room where the spells owner is, summon a Bone Knight and it activates.
Otherwise: target the room where the spells owner is, summon a Landsknecht and it activates.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play, Renaissance
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Black Rose Wars: Spurchia Christmas scenario
description:
This special Christmas themed scenario was released for print and play by Ludus Magnus Studio.
It contains cards, terrain and the Spurchia miniature.

A Legendary Scenario is a special game that allows you to play an event from the world of Black Rose Wars: Rebirth by applying a specific set of new rules.
In Spurchia's Carol, the malicious spriggan Spurchia wants to ruin the holidays.
Can the Mages stop this evil and mischievous villain?
Or will they go home with their pockets full of coal?
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Freebooter's Fate 2nd Edition
description:
This 100 page full-colour rulebook contains all basic rules for Freebooter’s Fate, garnished with entertaining stories, artwork, miniature photography and concept sketches. a handful of scenarios and many valuable advice. Also included are scenarios and rules for naval combat.

Grab the rules and an opponent and try it! You will like it. How could it be otherwise, with these ingredients: Tussling pirates! Scary goblins! Mysterious assassins! Skillful Amazons! Marching Debonner! Occult mystics! Steadfast Imperials! Tough mercenaries! Parrots! A world full of villains, scoundrels, heroes, ladies, femme fatales and much more. With a thousand wooden legs!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Mortem et Gloriam: Pacto
description: Pacto is Mortem et Gloriam small game, but in no way feels small as it keeps all the main features of Maximus that players like. Armies still have 10-20 “units” - so again this is why it keeps the feel of the larger games. But it can be played with armies of just 20-30 bases, making it good for travel and easy to build.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Undaunted: Normandy – Promo Scenario 14: Night Owls
description: Late in the evening a squad of US soldiers on a reconnaissance mission deep in the Normandy countryside are cornered by an enemy patrol and pinned down inside a small farmhouse. Under sustained fire, the unit has taken multiple casualties, including their squad leader. The remainder of the American platoon have been tasked with relieving the embattled squad and taking control of the nearby village.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Undaunted: Normandy – Promo Scenario 15: Entrapment
description:
The German counterattack is in full swing. In their bid to reclaim the gains made by the Americans under Operation Cobra, they lay siege to a vital intelligence post outside Mortain. With no reinforcements within range to support them, the besieged US forces need to repel the assault so that vital intelligence doesn’t fall
into German hands.
This is a fictional scenario, designed by Carlos, the winner of our scenario contest.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Undaunted: Normandy – Promo Scenario 16: The Bridge at La Fière
description:
Merderet River
June 6, 1944.
Five hours before the D-Day landings began, a massive force of 6000 paratroopers jumped from 400 Skytrain troop carrier aircraft into an intended objective area of 10 square miles, either side of the Merderet River. Tasked with taking a Bridge that would prove critical for breaking out of the Normandy beachheads, the 1st Batallion of the 505th Parachute Regiment engaged German troops guarding the bridge under the cover of darkness. The resulting battle has been called “the bloodiest small unit action of World
War II.”
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Undaunted: Normandy – Promo Scenario 17: Battle of San Pietro
description:
Battle of San Pietro Infine
San Pietro - 15 December 1943
Between December 8th and 17th 1943, the small Italian village of San Pietro Infine became a focus for the Italian Campaign of World War II, with the Germans to the North and the Allied forces, joined by Italian soldiers, to the South. The heavily fortified German ‘Winter Line’ ran through the town and was a significant obstacle for the Allies, as it protected an important highway and
blocked their advance on Rome.
The ten day engagement began with a direct attack led by the Fifth Army. After securing the peak of Mount Sambúcaro, an assault on Mount Lungo was planned for the 15th of December. After four successive Allied attacks and German counterattacks, the German soldiers were forced to retreat to more defensive positions to the North. At 12:30 on December 16th, for the first time during the war, Italian and US flags were waving on top of Mount Lungo.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: SolForge Fusion: Battle for Whitefang Pass
description:
In SolForge Fusion, all decks are algorithmically generated so that no two decks are alike. Take any two decks and shuffle them together, then you're ready to play. You and your opponent compete in strategic lane-based combat. When you play a card, it levels up, allowing you to access new powers and abilities to defeat your opponent and damage their creatures. The first player to bring their opponent down to zero health wins.

SolForge Fusion: Battle for Whitefang Pass features new Forgeborn abilities and over ten thousand new cards, including new card types like exalts and solbind, the latter being able to summon their counterparts from outside the game.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Romgon
description:
Romgon invites players into a realm where geometry and strategy intertwine, offering a captivating board game experience set on a hexagonal battlefield. Commanding seven distinct shapes, each with its own specialized abilities and movements, players engage in tactical warfare against their opponent. From the cunning Rhombus to the versatile Hexagon and the elusive Circle, mastering the strengths and tactics of each shape is key to victory.

The game-play of Romgon is characterized by its simple yet deep mechanics, catering to both casual players and seasoned strategists. Players must carefully plan their moves, strategically positioning their shapes to outmaneuver their opponent. With the ability to rotate shapes and engage in calculated attacks, every decision shapes the outcome of the battle.

The goal of Romgon is clear: emerge victorious on the battlefield by either capturing the opponent's pieces or maneuvering your Rhombus to their base. With no draws permitted, each game session culminates in a decisive winner, heightening the intensity and excitement of every match. Whether engaging in quick skirmishes or engaging in protracted battles of wit, players are immersed in a world where every move counts.

Romgon offers a dynamic and immersive gaming experience, combining strategic depth with geometric warfare. As players navigate the hexagonal grid, anticipation, and adaptability are key to success. Are you ready to command your forces, outwit your opponent, and conquer the realm of Romgon?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Movement, Player Elimination

name: 2D6 Dungeon: Lairs Expansion Vol. 1
description:
This is the Lairs Expansion for 2D6 Dungeon and features the rules and tables for the Infernal Caves and Sunken Swamp. To play the Lairs Expansion you will need the 2D6 Dungeon Core Rules and any additional rules are listed below. You will also need the Tables Codex as some of the tables referenced in this expansion are found there.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Harmony
description:
The seasons have been torn from their usual cycle! The essence of each is dispersed through portals, confusing the creatures who now wander lost in eternal chaos. Only one possibility shines on the gloomy horizon: recover the relics of the seasons and return them to the heart of the forest shrine to restore its harmony.

Harmony is a cooperative game with an indeterminate number of rounds, where players must explore a deck to recover the four lost relics and restore balance to the Shrine of the Seasons.

Through hand management, collaboration, and unique deck-building (where cards change hands), players travel a perilous path facing enemies and events.

The group's ultimate goal is to cross the final portal with all the relics in their possession, while managing resources, loss of life, and time (as the game becomes more dangerous the more rounds played) to avoid defeat. The fate of the forest is in your hands!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Corps of Discovery: Expansion 4 – Fog
description:
Something about the fog that’s rolled in plays tricks on your mind. While the fog is obscuring your vision, you can no longer rely on your pre-existing knowledge of the land to find the critical resources you need to survive. In this expansion each terrain rule has been changed, but you don’t know how. Will you be able to navigate your way to safety or will you believe the lies that your eyes tell you while you’re surrounded by this otherworldly haze?
This Expansion also includes new Reference Boards and new Maps to play each of the previous chapters - but with Fog! So imagine trying to kill 3 Minotaurs in the Fauna Chapter - BUT - all the terrain rules are mixed up? This takes Corps of Discovery to a whole new level!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction

name: Zeno
description:
Zeno is an alien game of annihilation for two players expressly designed to be played with very standard household game equipment. As the game goes on, players will shuffle and capture pieces in an attempt to be the last remaining player on the board. A game of Zeno cannot end in a draw.

Equipment: checkers or chess set

Setup: players place all their 8 pieces on their third rank.

Gameplay: starting with white, turns alternate. On a turn you may move one of your pieces in any of the three forward directions one space. At the conclusion of this move, two things happen: you may choose enemy pieces on the rank your piece is now on to advance in the exact opposite direction to your movement one space; any piece that lands on one of your pieces or one of the opponent's own pieces is captured and removed from the game. Following the enemy movement phase, friendly pieces of your choosing on the rank you just moved from can be moved, likewise, in the exact opposite direction one space. Players may make self-capturing moves either off the end of the board or onto any remaining pieces and must do so if no other moves remain. Note: self-capture moves only trigger the backwards movement of friendly pieces as the piece doesn't land on its destination. Passing is strictly prohibited.

Objective: be the last player with pieces remaining on the board. In practice it is polite to resign when it's obvious the players have passed each other and there are fewer moves remaining than the opponent has.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Template, Pattern Movement

name: Flagships of the Imperium
description:
Flagships is a competitive card game with a unique asymmetric twist. There is no deckbuilding, but players will pick from a wide variety of playstyles. Players must weigh the odds in a battle before fully committing their cards. There are two ways to win: militarily by having the higher strength over your opponent, or economically by scoring 5 points through various card effects.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck

name: D-Day Dice: Forgers & Knights
description:
A website and show exclusive set of 12 cards to play with D-Day Dice.

This set includes 2 Legendary Units for D-Day Dice: The Forgers and The Knights, including new Specialists and items.

Fancy playing as the King of the Britons or throwing a Holy Hand Grenade...you can now!

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eternal Wind: Awakening
description:
Prepare for experience an adventure beyond your wildest imagination. Set in the fantastic kingdom of Eldoria, Eternal Wind: Awakening is a board game in which up to five players take on a character (knight, elf, dwarf, undead and orc) and embark on a heroic mission. The game includes high-quality sculpted miniatures and an innovative, easy-to-learn cooperative gameplay sees players working together to defeat the mighty Thulgor.

Each turn has two phases. In the Hero phase, players creep into the cave areas collecting weapons, spells, useful items for their inventory and forging artifacts. In the Thulgor phase, the shadow lord will try to eliminate all those who may pose a threat to his plans of destruction.

The five kingdoms of Eldoria need your help to save the world from the evil Thulgor.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Silent Patrol
description:
A HYBRID game using the 'Silent War 2.0' AND 'Silent Victory' games in combination to provide a single submarine campaign game. In essence, SW determines the encounters and SV resolves the combat. The rule set provides for a seamless integration of the two games.

Players will need both of the constituent games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Vampire Nights
description:
Vampire Nights is a fast playing tense cardgame that pits 2 to 4 brave players against a group of vampires hiding from daylight in a small rural village. The game combines exploration, hidden information and high interaction. Players need to secure precious treasure from the vampire hideout, while rescuing villagers from the grasp of the night creatures. But beware, bites can weaken you and even turn you into a creature of the night yourself! Players explore a vampire infested mansion represented by partly hidden cards, advancing their 2 personal guards (meeples) from room to room, uncovering the hidden content as they enter each room.
Each room, represented by a card, allows you to interact with what is inside by playing items (cards) from a limited hand. These will help your guard inside the room rescuing villagers, evade vampires and hinder rival guards.
Players attempt to reach the garden of the house safely in order to hold one of two available spots that allow a player to claim loot, revealed during exploration.
You win the game with the highest total of gathered points, scored by rescuing villagers, elimination vampires (unique members from the vampire dynasty scoring more points when collected as a set) and getting hold of valuable items. But beware, as rival guards will hinder your plans and mislead you...danger is lurking in every corner!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Set Collection

name: Datos No Opiniones: El Reviente del Rock
description:
Datos No Opiniones is that crazy and bizarre trivia game that you deserve as an adult. In El Reviente del Rock edition you will have data on the excesses, parties and fun of the most well-known rock characters in history (or not so well-known but crazy enough to earn a place in this game). Test your knowledge about the most popular musical genre in history.

The deck has 102 cards with questions about rock that are answered with some number. To start, they grab a random card, read it aloud and reveal the answer, that is going to be the starting point in the data row.

On your turn, you are going to grab the first question from the deck and, without seeing the answer, you are going to place it to the left or right of the card you used as your starting point. If you think the answer is a greater number than the one in the data row, you put your card on the left and, if you think it is smaller, on the right. When you have chosen where to put the card, you turn it over to see if you were right. If the card is placed correctly, it's the next player's turn, if it's wrong, you take it out and keep it. If you place two cards wrong, you are immediately eliminated.

Alert! As the game progresses there will be more cards in the data row and you will have to take them all into account when placing the question that comes your turn.

IMPORTANT: You can mix the three thematic editions of Datos No Opiniones and play purely Sex, Drugs and Rock n' Roll.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Music, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Unspecified

name: 49 On The Turf Football
description:
Forty Nine Football was originally designed to play your favorite team through the current season. This quickly progressed into a game that makes replaying any season a lot of fun due to its statistical accuracy, and each game playing like a real football game with many of the coaching decisions needed to be successful. I have played through multiple seasons playing my favorite teams in the CFL and NFL and I'm very happy with the results.

One thing you will find is all of the player and team ratings come from statistics, opposed to subjective ratings. This does make it a challenge with older seasons where statistical data is not as available.

If you own Forty Nine Football, all of the new seasons will still work perfectly with your original game. But, it is being rebranded into two games, Quick Decks Football, and On The Turf Football. Quick Decks is a perfect standalone quick play game where you play through all the plays in a game with realistic stats. On The Turf Football brings in Defensive play calling, and special plays for both Offense and Defense. This is a much more immersive game, but you can still play in just over an hour and a half.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards

name: Kill Switch
description:
Kill Switch is an abstract boardgame for two players. What makes Kill Switch unique is that the players decide how their pieces move and how the board looks like. As a matter of fact, setting up the board and pieces – and changing them continuously during the game - plays a key role in the strategy. Chance and luck do not play any role in Kill Switch! No dice or chance cards: it’s entirely up to you to win the game.
Contrary to chess and - as a matter of fact - most games, Kill Switch will start differently every time. There are over 1028 possible positions to create in Phase 1 and hundreds of actions to choose from each turn in the Combat Phase!
Goal of the game is to disable the opponent. That is no surprise, is it? The way to do that is by hitting the opponent’s Kill Switch. If you succeed in that, all enemy units are turned off immediately and you win. The challenge is to program your Bots in such a way that enables them to break through enemy lines. But you also have to keep up your own defenses against your opponent who is after your Kill Switch!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Programmed Movement, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending

name: P.E.P.: Porc Entre Porcs
description:
The most awaited night has arrived, and you know it!
The grand royal banquet of the year is being celebrated, and all the leftovers, which won't be few, will be yours.
Who will get the best morsel in their mouth?
Pigs, to the royal sty!
Devour the finest delicacies of the island!

P.E.P. is a fast 3 to 5 player game, in which players will assume the roles of the pigs of the royal sty, trying to satisfy your refined palate.

Throughout the game, players will use their wit and memory to acquire the finest delicacies

But beware of being the most well-fed pig, as that one will be turned into sausage.

At the beginning of the game, all players will be dealt 3 feast cards, once looked at (privately), they will be placed face down in their play area.

After that, players will take turns clock-wise, playing cards in order to discover what feast other players have, and swapping them in order to be able to - when an event instructs the player to do so - eat whatever they have collected, scoring the corresponding points.

Once three scoring events have been resolved, the player(s) with the highest score are eliminated from the game, and from the remaining ones, the player(s) with the highest score are proclaimed the King of Pigs, winning the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Take That

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – Clone Force 99 Squad Pack
description:
In a force of soldiers cloned to be identical, a few stand out as unique!
Once known as Clone Force 99, this experimental unit of clone troopers defies all expectations due to the extraordinary capabilities granted by their genetic mutations. Adopting names that describe their role in the unit, the Remittance is led by Hunter, whose heightened senses make him an unparalleled tracker. Tech is the technology expert, using his superior intellect to hack computers and bypass security systems. The group is completed by Crosshair, the sniper, Wrecker, an unstoppable force in close-range combat, and Echo, a former CAR soldier transformed into a cyborg.

As the Republic transforms into the Galactic Empire, the Remittance is forced to improvise to survive, becoming fugitives. A young medical assistant named Omega joins their ranks, who is also the result of a cloning experiment. Protecting it gives the Bad Batch another reason to find its own way in a hostile galaxy.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Star Wars: Shatterpoint – You Have Something I Want Squad Pack
description:
Tremble before the authority and ruthless determination of one of the most powerful officers and politicians in the Imperial Remnant! It is not wise to underestimate anyone who holds the title of moff, as they are granted considerable authority and dominance over Imperial forces. Moff Gideon would end up proving to be an especially tenacious adversary for the Mandalorian, as he spared no resources in his search for the boy named Grogu, whom he referred to as "the asset."

In pursuit of this goal, Moff Gideon has activated numerous dark troopers, powerful and sophisticated battle droids that are nearly invulnerable to conventional weapons. With the venerated Dark Sword in his possession, Moff Gideon will not give up his efforts until he has achieved what he wants...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Spectral: Mini Expansion
description:
This mini expansion replaces one random card in each row during setup. Each individual card only indicates the row or column where a treasure or curse can be found. Only by finding the pair of special cards can you uncover the exact location of a treasure or curse; the pair will tell you the row and column of the item — the intersection of the row and column is the location of the item.

Because these treasures are harder to find, each one has a value of 36! But beware, these cards also introduce an extra curse! At the end of the game, these treasures are awarded out like normal (evenly split between the surrounding players).

Because 4 random cards are replaced, the game now has a variable amount of curses that ranges from 1 to 5.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Constrained Bidding, Deduction, End Game Bonuses, Paper-and-Pencil, Square Grid, Worker Placement

name: Bread Upon The Waters
description:
You and your friends run shipping company. Buy ships and warehouses to add them to your tableau for your competitors to compete in an auction to join your ship by placing workers on the ship. Roll dice and push your luck to bring the ship back into port safely, gaining goods and resources for you and the players who have workers on you ship. With your goods and resources players can sell them for major contracts gaining points for them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Contracts, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: Reef Project
description:
Despite covering less than 1% of the ocean floor, coral reefs are estimated to be home to about 25% of all marine species. Unfortunately, these vibrant underwater cities are dying. Climate change and its effect of rising sea temperatures is devastating the colorful algae that give coral reefs their brilliant hues, resulting in coral bleaching. Furthermore, other threats like pollution—in its various insidious forms—and overfishing are disrupting the delicate balance of reef ecosystems.

And so, scientists from various fields, along with the researchers studying the ecological complexity and significance of the reefs, are collaborating to address the myriad challenges facing these ecosystems. Your assignment is to take command of a scientific vessel and embark on a journey of reef conservation. Hire the best crew, clean the ocean, and restore the reefs to their former glory.

During the game, players take on the role of researchers and saviors of the oceans. You will sail the seas, hire crew, explore the coral reef, clean the ocean sectors of any pollution, and try to accomplish as many missions as possible.

On their turn players may choose to RECHARGE or TRAVEL. If they RECHARGE, they gain the rewards from the VP track. If they TRAVEL, they may deploy Reef Balls, move their Ship, play Mission cards, and perform various actions. The game is played for a variable number of rounds. When a player has crossed the 45 VP threshold, the end of the game is triggered. After an additional round the final scoring takes place and the player with the most victory points is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, End Game Bonuses, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Puzzle X Crime: A Murderous Birthday
description:
The Thonbach family is one of the wealthiest families in the region. Yesterday, Eduard Thonbach was found dead at home on the day of his birthday! There is a lot at stake and the clock is ticking. Who killed him and why? The investigations begin with the puzzle. Piece by piece, the decisive note is decoded. The truth is out there waiting to be revealed.

Are you ready to become the master of the puzzle and detectives? It's time to solve the case!

Puzzle X Crime is a combination of exciting mystery and puzzle fun! First, the crime scene is assembled from 406 puzzle pieces, then the puzzlers slip into the role of investigators. Which objects in the motif should be examined more closely? The numbers on the back of the puzzle pieces lead to playing cards and envelopes with important evidence. Is it possible to combine all the clues correctly and get on the trail of the perpetrators? Puzzle meets crime game! The popular game principle, in which you examine a case file with evidence and solve a criminal case, is now also available as a Ravensburger puzzle - Puzzle X Crime! The highlight: the puzzle is also printed on the back with numbers that provide valuable information on how to solve the case. Then intuition, combination skills and criminalist sense are required. Together with the enclosed playing cards and the evidence in envelopes, the puzzlers gradually determine the murder and can find the perpetrator, murder motif and murder weapon. Also ideal as joint puzzle and investigation fun! No game material has to be destroyed and the Puzzle X Crime can be played again.

Contents:
- 408 puzzle pieces with printed back in two different colours
- A suction cup for flipping puzzle pieces
- 72 playing cards with valuable clues
- 10 envelopes with different evidence material
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Arcs: Leaders and Lore Pack
description:
Explore unique, tricky strategies in the Arcs base game with new Leaders, and add wild twists to both the Arcs base and campaign games with new Lore.

—description form the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Wargame
