mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Negotiation, Trick-taking, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Player Powers

name: Iceland: Settlement to Independence
description:
An economic and cultural semi-cooperative game starting with the settlement of Iceland and ending with it gaining independence. Only one player can win, but the players as a whole have to develop Iceland sufficiently to reach the independence threshold, or no one wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bribery, End Game Bonuses, Semi-Cooperative Game, Worker Placement

name: Monotheism
description:
Monotheism is a solitaire in-hand deck destruction game. Players will help a small cadre of worshipers discover the deities in their local pantheon, and then, through the strategic use of deck manipulation, pattern building, and special abilities, the worshipers must trick these deities into consuming each other until only one god remains.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Suna Valo
description:
In Suna Valo, two individuals take on the task of establishing their own farm in the Solarpunk world of Overgrown. Located in the picturesque "Sunny Valley" (Suna Valo), nestled at the foot of a mountain and crisscrossed by a broad river, the village of Foriro has been erected — a place of new beginnings! The farmers in this village supply valuable goods using their transport drones and river ships.

The construction of your farms is made possible through farm cards across various categories. Cultivate vast grain fields, and harvest beautiful water lilies or blue flowers. Deliver your sheep's wool to the village for clothing production or collect eggs from your free-roaming chickens. But amidst your explorations of the surrounding lands, don't forget to reinforce your fleet of transport drones!

Suna Valo features an innovative purchasing mechanism. Secure the right cards before your opponent does, snatch up the more valuable ones, and host prestigious events! Each time you acquire a new card for your farm, you activate an entire column of cards, causing your farm to flourish. However, you must also earn the resources to cover the costs of these cards.

At the end of three game rounds, the player with the most victory points emerges as the winner of this peaceful competition, having contributed the most to the development of Foriro!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Unlimited – Shadows of the Galaxy
description: Shadows of the Galaxy is the second set of Star Wars: Unlimited. It set takes the focus off the conflict between the Galactic Empire and the Rebel Alliance and puts the Outer Rim on center stage.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Take That

name: Advanced Game System II
description:
The Advanced Game System II is an EXPANSION for the famous Board Game HeroQuest. It is compatible with the following expansions: The Return of the Witch Lord, The Kellar's Keep and The Frozen Horror (new and old editions).

With the Advanced Game System", you can choose a "Class" and "Level Up" your Hero. You can also investigate the furniture on the board and purchase "Advanced Equipment" during the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Estate: Raise the Realm
description:
It is a time of rebuilding after the Great War. Do you have what it takes?

In Estate, players take on the role of a Noble Leader of a Great House who is bequeathed an Estate post war. Each Leader begins the game with resources, a special ability, a unique build of construction(s) and/or citizen(s) cards within their Estate, a Family Secret objective, and workers prepared to rebuild.

A worker placement reconstruction challenge, players must use their workers wisely to optimize their Estate’s growth over the five Eras of game play. Workers can be used to take one of four main actions each turn: play citizen/construction Estate Cards, gather resources from the center game board, produce on Production Cards within their growing Estate, and draw new citizen/construction Estate Cards to join the cause. As the Eras progress and your Estate grows, worker actions become more powerful.

Don’t forget the Era Events! Revealed at the start of each Era, Era Events impact game play (either positively or negatively) for that Era while also introducing a public Era Objective players can compete for.

Time is limited and not on your side, and careful consideration must be made when determining the best actions for your rise to power. Optimizing your leader’s special ability and family secret objective will also provide valuable victory points at game end.

Game Play:
Estate is played over a series of five Eras (rounds). Within each Era, players take turns placing one worker at a time, proceeding clockwise. The Era ends when each player has used all available workers.
Era Start: At the start of each Era, an Era Event is revealed and its effect announced. Era Events have consequences that affect the game play for the duration of the Era and also introduce an Era Objective that players compete for, with awards for 1st: 6 Victory Points, 2nd: 1 Card & 1 Resource, and 3rd: 1 Resource.

During the Era: Workers may take 1 of 4 actions on the Player Mat:

Play an Estate Card: Play an Estate card for the resource cost located in the cards top left corner. When played, add a cube to the corresponding Estate tracker - Noble (Crown symbol), Production(Money Bag), or Commoner (Scythe Symbol).
Draw Estate Cards: The player may draw from either the Market or the Estate deck at random. Once done, replenish the Market.
Produce on Cards in Estate: Activate production cards within your Estate to take their effect and gain resources / cards / and more! It is possible a player may have more production cards than they can produce on, make sure to check the progress in your production row to confirm.
Take an Era Action: Move your worker from the player mat to the game board to perform an available Era or Progress action. (Some Era Actions may not be available yet if the player has not


progressed the Estate to access that Era.

End of Era: The Era ends when all workers have been used across all players. Before resetting for the next Era, any cards with End of Era effects activate. Players then score the Era Objective.

Era Reset: Take the following steps to resent the board for the next Era:

Add 1 resource to each of the accumulating resource action spaces on the game board
Refresh the Market - remove all cards and replenish
All players withdraw their workers back to their Estate player mat
Reset the Leader Special Ability token
Reveal the next Era Event


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Worker Placement

name: Ocean Pods: Sharks & Rays
description:
In this Ocean Pods expansion pack increase your Ocean Pods game-play experience with new Shark and Ray species.

New research objectives and beautifully illustrated new animal cards bring an extra spice to Ocean Pods with the Bite Rule!

You cannot have predator and prey in the same research pod!

Plastic leaks quicker into the ocean.

Can you still save the Ocean creatures?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: The Chamber Of Secrets Chronicle Box
description:
The first in our new range of Chronicle Expansions for the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game, the Chamber of Secrets explores the cinematic saga like never before! Progress through a series of scenarios, and immerse yourself in the adventure.

The Chamber of Secrets: Chronicle Expansion includes new miniatures, rules, gameboards, cards and counters that not only introduce the new Chronicle Game Mode, but also expand and enhance your normal games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Mindbug: Battlefruit Galaxy
description:
Mindbug: Battlefruit Galaxy is a stand-alone game of Mindbug about Plum Marines protecting the Galaxy from the invasion of Eggplant Space Whales and Celery Sandworms. Activate the Octonite energy of your Scifi fruits and crush your opponent with their crazy abilities in a galactical food fight.

This new set introduces Octonite abilities allowing you to use your Octonite counters to activate extremely powerful abilities. It also introduces the Charge mechanic allowing you to distribute your Octonite counters on any creature(s). Discover insane card combos and spend your Octonite on the right creatures to win.

Being a stand-alone game, Mindbug: Battlefruit Galaxy can be played on its own, or mixed with any other Mindbug sets.

In Mindbug, you summon hybrid creatures and send them to battle against your opponent. But be careful: your opponent may use one of their Mindbugs to take control of it.

Outwit your opponent in a fascinating tactical duel in which having the best cards and playing them at the wrong time can be deadly for yourself.

Mindbug combines the accessibility and fairness of a simple card game with the strategic depth of a complex Strategy Card Game. The result is a skill-based dueling card game that feels utterly different from all the other card games you have played before.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Take That

name: Sebastopol 2225
description:
Cooperative and strategy game set in a post-apocalyptic future in the Crimean peninsula and Eastern Europe. It is the year 2225 and only 5 factions of warring people remain and their objective is to take their faction of allies to the sanctuary city of Sevastopol, avoiding various threats; attacks from enemy factions or forest creatures, while obtaining the necessary resources to continue their journey on the unexplored paths of the territory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Plutocracy: Passengers
description:
Space is Time is Money is Power again.

Plutocracy: Passengers expands Plutocracy by introducing a captivating solo mode as well as the addition of passenger transport to multiplayer gameplay.
In the multiplayer expansion, new actions allow players to pick up passengers and fly them to their destination. When dropping them off, players can choose among a display of favors. These offer new surprising opportunities leading to even fiercer competition and introducing some randomness in a former deterministic universe.
In the new solo mode you are trying to maintain the passenger transport by carefully selecting the passengers you transport and the routes you are taking before time is running out. Ten planet constellations are waiting for you and only you can tell if Mission Impossible turns out to be really impossible.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up

name: Fabled: Eve of Times
description:
Fabled: Eve of Times presents three unique Modules and two advanced Scenario sets. Each Module and Scenario uses a number of special components.

The Magnificent Allies, Obstacles and Guides, and Borderlands Modules may be added to the game in any combination and are compatible both with each other and with the core game of Fabled.

Edge of Worlds and Divine Intervention are advanced Scenario sets intended for the competitive play and for the Challenge respectively. Also, the Legendary level of Difficulty is introduced in the Divine Intervention Scenario set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Mythology, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Map Addition, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The 98 Disaster: "Guerra Hispano Americana"
description:
The Disaster of 98. The Spanish-American War Game is strategic in nature and simply reproduces this conflict with a system that allows it to be played in a maximum of 45 minutes. It is designed for two players and can be played between experienced wargamers and beginners alike. To do this, the game system uses Event cards (one for each side to use in each of the 5 turns in which the game lasts) and wooden cubes of different colors that represent the troops involved in the conflict (Cubans, Tagalogs, indigenous people, Spanish and American expeditionaries).
The Event Cards simulate various political-military aspects of the years 1890 to 1898 and are divided into two separate decks of 8 cards for each side of the game (Insurgent and Spanish).
mechanics: Action Points, Impulse Movement

name: Пенумбра: Испытания Арканы (Penumbra: Trials of Arcana)
description:
Пенумбра: Испытания Арканы (Penumbra: Trials of Arcana) is a competitive euro-style game that blends dice placement, tableau-building card comboing and dice manipulation into an epic adventure with an RPG feel to it.

In Penumbra, you are a young wizard studying in a magical school. Go to classes, develop skills in several magical disciplines, brew potions, summon familiars, gather artifacts — all the sweet stuff that wizarding students usually do.

Every once in a while, the magical world will test your might and resolve with a dangerous ordeal. Angry basilisks, sorrowful ghosts and enchanted wildwood are out there, waiting for you to challenge them and awaken even more magical powers sleeping inside you.

The wizard who best proves their worth during studying and arcane trials will acquire the School Cup and be declared the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Cryptic Nature: Islands
description:
In this expansion, you will discover the most hidden and isolated places of Cryptic Nature. The new cryptids will be harder to reach because they live on remote islands.
But you will have one new way to travel — by sea.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Orléans Jubiläumsbox
description:
Orléans Jubiläumsbox is a tenth-anniversary edition of Orléans, a game set in the French city of the same name during medieval times in which you must assemble a following of farmers, merchants, knights, monks, etc. to gain supremacy through trade, construction and science in medieval France.

In more detail, you will recruit followers and put them to work to make use of their abilities. Farmers and Boatmen supply you with money and goods; Knights expand your scope of action and secure your mercantile expeditions; Craftsmen build trading stations and tools to facilitate work; Scholars make progress in science; Traders open up new locations for you to use your followers; and last but not least, it cannot hurt to get active in monasteries since with Monks on your side you are much less likely to fall prey to fate.

You will always want to take more actions than possible, and there are many paths to victory. The challenge is to combine all elements as best as possible with regard to your strategy.
mechanics: Contracts, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Events, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Mini City
description:
Welcome to Mini City! You're the legendary founder and under your leadership and mastery of urban planning, you will lead your citizenry to develop a thriving metropolis filled with sushi restaurants, castles, and wonders of the modern world...

or you could lead them into ruin. It's up to you!

Mini City is a tableau building, card & resource management game for 1 to 2 players, but can be played up to 4 players with 2 copies of the game.

Mini City was rapidly designed in a matter of weeks in order to participate in the Board Game 150 event in Taipei. The idea behind Board Game 150 is that all games will be sold for 150 Taiwan dollars (roughly 5 USD). The Board Game 150 has been occurring in Taipei for several years and has given rise to several successful games out of Taiwan.
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Snatch it!
description:
Once upon a time there was a pond that hummed and buzzed happily. But then the frogs suddenly appeared. They greedily filled their mouths with everything within reach of their tongues. They even snatched their prey from the mouths of the others.

Snatch It! is a family game for 3-6 players in which the aim is to secure as much food as possible. Become a hungry frog and grab the tastiest cards from the pond.

Protect your well-filled piles from the other greedy frogs who keep trying to snatch them away from you. Only those who collect their piles before they burst will not end up with an empty belly.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Ladder Climbing

name: Wednesday: Creatures & Outcasts
description:
When you inadvertently end up in the Nightshade Library, your uncontrollable curiosity drives you towards the many books in the enormous bookcases that surround you. Your attention is drawn to book after book as you scan the pages about different kinds of outcasts and creatures. But then, suddenly, a small book catches your eye. Its title: "Rulebook, Creatures and Outcasts". When you carefully slide the book towards you from the dusty bookcase, cards fall out. It appears to be an ancient card game about mythical creatures and outcasts. You quickly open the rulebook and begin to read...

In Wednesday: Creatures & Outcasts, 2-6 players play cards on a stack. Each card played needs to be higher than the previous one, and all cards left in your hand when the round ends count as penalty points. Outsmart your opponents by getting rid of the cards you hold as quickly as possible. Should you wait for the right moment to play your highest cards, or take a risk and face major consequences? Stay alert because well-known characters from Wednesday will keep you on your toes. After all, what is a game without some unexpected twists?

After five rounds, the player with the best score wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Dream Games: Kapitel 1 – Böses Erwachen
description:
Böses Erwachen is a cooperative board game that takes place in a world that we enter every night, but to which we usually pay little attention - namely our dream world...

Are you really awake? Or are you still trapped in a dream? Throw back the covers, get out of bed and find out!

Dream Games lets you freely explore the game world with up to three other players. With each action you learn more about your surroundings and gradually reveal more playing field cards.

As you explore your dream world, you must always keep an eye on your supply of dream energy. Because when this runs out, you "wake up" in your bed again and have to start all over again - however, the skills you have acquired so far and the objects you have found remain with you and they are absolutely necessary in order to solve the many puzzles that the dream gives you will provide.

Little by little you will get closer to your goal: finding out why you are trapped in this dream and what lies behind your mysterious backstory - then you can finally wake up!
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Kursk: Rotmistrov's Offensive
description:
As the sun sets on July 11, 1943, both sides prepare for the largest tank battle of World War II! Nearly a week of grueling slaughter has finally gained the 1st SS Panzer Division a few kilometers towards their objective: Prokhorovka. So close, yet so far!

The Russian 18th and 29th Tank Corps have been beaten back, but they are not defeated. Replenished with tanks, they will be the sledgehammer in their only planned counterattack. This has to work! It cannot fail!

Both enemies planned their offensives to begin on July 12th, but neither side is aware of the other’s plan. As dawn breaks, the roar of over 300 tanks signals the coming clash.

Now, YOU are in control. YOU are in command! How will your strategy succeed or will it fail in WW2’s greatest, epic, tank battle that history still talks about?

It is ALL IN YOUR HANDS!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Army of the Potomac: Campaigns of 1862 and 1864
description:
Army of the Potomac: Campaigns of 1862 and 1864 is the second volume in the Civil War Heritage series and the follow-up game to the innovative and acclaimed Rebel Fury. Army of the Potomac uses the same core rules as Rebel Fury, so players familiar with Rebel Fury will be able to jump right into the action. Each battle in Army of the Potomac is quick-set-up, quick-playing, and deeply interactive. The density of counters in each scenario is low, allowing you to see and experience the big picture of the battle.

Army of the Potomac covers the battles of Spotsylvania II, North Anna River, Cold Harbor, and the entire Seven Days battle (McClellan vs Lee), including the prelude Seven Pines (McClellan vs Johnston) when Johnston's wounding brought Lee into the command of the Army of Northern Virginia. Each battle places you, the player, in the role of the Army Commander (Grant, McClellan, Lee, Johnston). You maneuver your army to find the enemy’s flanks, concentrate your forces for an attack, and determine where to commit your artillery assets.

Units are portrayed at the Infantry/Cavalry division level. The Civil War Heritage series game system features a new Zone of Influence/Zone of Control mechanic that controls unit formation (March/Battle) based on their proximity to your opponent. As your units close with the enemy, your forces naturally break into battle formation, where they then maneuver the last distance to engage. Unlike most hex and counter wargames, this system allows you total freedom to move units in any order multiple times, unleashing the full range of historical tactics in a simple and clean format.

Combat features a differential combat system with few but significant factors that capture the key features of Civil War division level combat. Units are rated for quality, artillery support, supporting units, and terrain. The game features artillery duels with the occasional Exploding Caisson result. The Civil War Heritage series combat system accurately depicts the ability of units to launch multiple waves of attacks on the same position, capturing the back-and-forth nature of many famous combat duels.

Army of the Potomac also includes a set of campaign rules that allow you to conduct operations from Spotsylvania to Cold Harbor featuring logistics and attrition. Also included are two bonus scenarios to allow owners of Rebel Fury to also fight Spotsylvania II and begin the Campaign scenario from Wilderness to Cold Harbor using their original Rebel Fury map.

Components:
Five Paper Maps
Three Countersheets
Two Player Aids
Two Off Map Displays
One Turn Record Track
Two 10-sided dice
One custom 6-sided die
One Rulebook
One Playbook
One 2" Box

-description from publisher
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Generic Board "Alquerq" Set
description:
Game set including a board with the front side for Arquelque and the back side for Fanorona.

Also included are the rules for Alquerque and Fanorona, as well as the original games Alquad, Sight, and Collapse that can be played on these boards.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Block Gang Champions and Heavies
description:
Whether their raison d’être is to protect their block, experience the thrill of petty lawlessness or become involved in organised crime, the average citizen and Justice Department alike. When a block war breaks out the block gangs are more often than not to be found taking the fight to the enemy blockers by fair means or foul.

Block champions are often little more than a bully who likes to think they take care of their own and let the rest of the drokking city go to hell. They are at the forefront of escalating tensions between blocks and often responsible for outright block warfare backed up by their cohort of gangers, often armed with heavy weaponry when inter-block warfare erupts.

Box contains five Warlord Resin figures and four game cards.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Potato Tomato
description:
Baked potato. Baked tomato. Which one is the most popular side dish?
No one knows how it started. Rumour has it, the rivalry began when one of the potatoes claimed that baked potato is the most popular side dish. A fiery tomato challenged the claim, asserting that the most popular side dish is, in fact, baked tomato! The argument quickly spread around the world of side dishes. Hence began the “PotatoTomato” conflict! However, the Alliance of Fruits and Vegetables has yet to get involved in this nonsense... for now!
Both the Potatoes and the Tomatoes have started sending spies to sabotage each other. You are one of the spies. Your mission is to reveal other players’ roles. When all role cards of a single player are exposed, that player - and everyone on the same team - is eliminated.
Be careful - Teams can be changed at any time during the game. Trust no-one!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Iliad
description:
The Trojan War has begun, and both sides of the conflict pursue every advantage they can possibly gain. Two opposing heroes — Hector of the Trojans and Achilles of the Greeks — seek the favor of the gods to lend them support and tip the scales of fate. Only one side will emerge victorious, its hero becoming the legend of the Iliad.

Iliad is a tile-placement strategy game for two-players by Reiner Knizia. On your turn, select one of two tiles from your hand and place it onto the board adjacent to an opponent's tile. Both players have symmetrical pools of tiles, with their strength ranging from 1-5, along with the Dolos tile that mimics your opponent's adjacent tiles). The key to victory lies behind the relentless tension of where and when to commit your tiles. When placing a tile, you may also activate the tile's ability, which can serve to turn the tide of war.

When a row or column is filled, the player with the highest total strength in that line earns the right to select one of the two success tokens at the ends of that row or column; the other token goes to their opponent. Success tokens can earn you the favor of the Gods, and they can earn (or cost you) points. At the end of the game, the winner is the player who has earned the favor of all five Gods. If both players — or neither of them — meet this qualification, then the player who has earned the most points wins. Thus, players will face tough tactical trade-offs as they must decide whether to compete for exclusive favor of the Gods or for the most points — then influence the outcome of the game toward their intended advantage.

Iliad is the first game in the Mythos Collection, a line of two-player titles by Bitewing Games featuring strategy and mythology.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: MordsStory
description:
MordsStory is a semi-cooperative crime storytelling game for 2-4 players aged 14 and up.

In the game players collect evidence cards to answer questions about a murder case and try to become the best investigator. Players must use their creativity and imagination to invent the case and it's details as the game progresses.

Every game a new case is created.
mechanics: Memory, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Kickstarter Promos Box
description: A box with exclusive promos from the Kickstarter campaign. This exclusive box contains all the goodies you need to take your game to a whole new level. 79 new miniatures with cards including new deadly abominations.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Bitlight Riders
description: Bitlight Riders is a roll and write game for 1 to 4 players where players take the role of a futuristic biker who will seek to perform the greatest number of stunts, jumps, drifts and shots, as well as to dominate the largest territory and... BECOME IN THE MOST POPULAR BITLIGHT RIDER!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Zone of Control

name: 5 Up
description:
UNIQUE DICE GAME: Up the stakes at your next game night with 5 Up from TOMY Games. Victory is just a dice throw away in this risky 2 to 4 player game that has players race to get rid of all their tokens by landing the dice on the coveted 5 Up side.

PUSH YOUR LUCK: Unzip and unfold the pouch to reveal the game mat. Each player starts with 10 tokens. Roll the dice and whatever number you get, place a token on the corresponding number on the mat. If you roll a 5 Up, you get to discard a token. Roll as many times as you dare on your turn, but if you get a number that already has a token on it, you'll have to take all the tokens on the mat! First to run out of tokens wins.

PERFECT FAMILY GAME: Designed for ages 6 and older, 5 Up is quick and easy to learn and can be enjoyed by mixed age groups of kids, teens, and adults, making this a fantastic pick for family game nights and gatherings with friends.

PORTABLE TRAVEL GAME: This good value, versatile 2 to 4 player board game conveniently folds up into a soft, compact pouch that's perfect to pack in a bag for on the go entertainment in trains, planes, pubs, restaurants, and on holidays.

WHAT YOU GET: Please note this is one game only and the colour pouch you receive may vary - it will either be green or orange.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck

name: Founders of Reyvick
description:
Founders of Reyvick is a 3-5 player economic game of speculation and competition on the newly settled world of Reyvick. Each player controls a company just starting out on the planet that is attempting to amass the most wealth and craft the greatest legacy. Players deploy their partners to collect resources from their assets and complete projects that further research, exploration, and building across the planet.

A game of Founders of Reyvick revolves around assets, which include the districts on Reyvick as well as special assets that differ in each game. Companies compete to own these assets and take advantage of the resources and revenue that they provide, while maximizing their profit by buying low and selling high. Each game round begins by resolving a draw of event tiles. Most tiles place new population, resources like flora and fauna research, or the mysterious "Unobtanium" into the various districts of Reyvick, but some events present setbacks for companies to manage.

While the promise of rich resources have drawn many to Reyvick, the economic climate there is unique. Unlike other planets, Reyvick's Ruling Council uses a radical approach to managing the many companies seeking profits on Reyvick. Every game round, each player must set the price at which they would be willing to sell each of their assets to another player. Players are then obliged to respect their own valuation, so the price must be chosen carefully; if you set it too low, someone else will take over your asset and make a profit, but at the end of the turn you must pay taxes on the price you've set on every asset, so you also don't want to set it too high.

Once prices are set, the Council distributes whatever taxes were collected in the previous turn. Some portion of those taxes will fund public projects, which are placed in districts for the welfare of its citizens — and companies — while the rest is distributed to players. Rights to the resources and profits from a district or special asset are always for sale; any company can buy them by paying the price set by the current owner — and every asset on Reyvick has a price!

Once you purchase an asset, you must immediately set the price as at the beginning of the turn. You can set it to any amount that is higher than what you paid, but the Council will tax you based on what you claim your assets are worth, and those taxes are distributed as incentives in a public/private partnership, so your tax money can end up benefiting your competition.

At the end of the game, the player with the greatest combination of wealth, assets, and projects wins. Founders of Reyvick is based on the economic theories of Nobel Prize-winning economist William Vickrey, as well as the writings of Eric Posner and Glen Weyl, especially their book Radical Markets.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Constrained Bidding, Contracts, Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Ownership, Tags, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Bitterest Day
description:
Bitterest Day recreates the fighting between the American and Japanese troops on Okinawa during May 1945.

Contents:

9 Scenarios
Campaign game rules
1 countersheet with 180 1/2" counters and 64 5/8" counters
1 27x35" historical map of Sugarloaf Hill.
Terrain description and special rules.
Chapter divider and quick reference.


Scenarios:
BD-1: Opening Probe
BD-2: Limited Gains
BD-3: Western Anchor
BD-4: Thicker Than Flies
BD-5: Ultimate Insult
BD-6: Bitterest Day
BD-7: Crescent Carnage
BD-8: We're Dead Anyway
BD-9: Good Luck Charm

Ownership of American and Japanese OOB required to play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Modular Board

name: Golden Cup
description:
The fever for the Fantasphere is now rampant. From all over the kingdom, creatures of all sorts have come with the dream of becoming a champion of this new sport.

The capital is overrun with wannabe players, but as you well know, even the strongest players will not be able to win without a guide. That's why you're here, as part of a group of young coaches who will have to grab the best talent, manage finances, and build the best team. Unfortunately, the competition is fierce, and at the end of the championship, only one will be able to get their hands on the legendary Golden Cup. Will you be the one to triumph in the grand final?

Golden Cup takes place over six rounds, plus a finale. Over the course of each round, players play different phases in which they will first try to improve their team, then compete in 1-on-1 matches at the same time on different courts and, depending on the result, acquire the corresponding fame points. At the end of the sixth round, the two players who have earned the most fame points play the finale.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Finale Ending

name: Patas Arriba
description:
Is it a duck? Is it an airplane? Oh, no! It's a flip-flop! Welcome to Patas Arriba, a game where you'll have to stay on your feet while everything flies around you!

Defend your duck from being knocked down and throw cards to knock down the rival ducks.

When a duck is knocked down 5 times, the player whose duck has been knocked down the least number of times is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Fósil
description:
Fósil takes us into the depths of the desert and turns us into true paleotologists in search of the most amazing animals in the history: the Dinosaurs.
Be careful, you won't be the only one on this journey... avoid the traps of other researchers and use everything at your disposal to become the number 1 paleontologist.
Collect the different fossil pieces of the 6 types of dinosaurs, use support and special cards to facilitate your game and sabotage your rivals; and of course, gain the Jurassic power of the dinosaurs by controlling the space as you wish.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Aeterna
description:
In Æterna you will take the role of a Roman Gens (family) that will try to increase its prestige through three Eras: The Roman Kingdom, the Roman Republic, and the Roman Empire.

Your goal will be to increase your influence over the city by supporting the conquest of the provinces, ruling over the 7 Hills and contributing to the construction of monuments and buildings. While doing this, you must always be careful not to demotivate the people, in the Hills under your direct control, as unrest could put you in a bad light. If you manage majorities, cards, and resources better than your opponents, your Gens will be remembered in the History books as one of the most important in Rome.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Valkyries
description:
Take on the role of four Valkyries who, tired of waiting for the last battle, the battle of the end times, have decided to take the lead and, supported by Freya, rush into battle to try to prevent Ragnarök itself. Face mighty wyrms, cunning dark elves, draugr risen from the depths of Hel, tough frost giants and fearsome fire demons. Defeat them and maybe you will win the favour of the gods and they will aid you in your quest. For Asgard!

Valkyries is presented as a game book. Each chapter introduces new rules and a Battleground to play them on. Throughout the first three chapters you will learn the rules progressively, moving around the Battlefield, eliminating as many enemies as you can, playing your cards as wisely as you can. Compete with your sister warriors to see who should lead the team. Once you've mastered the basics, you can play Full Mode on any isolated Battlefield, venture into the Vanaheim campaign, chronicled in the last chapter, or create your own scenarios and campaigns.

The modularity of the game makes it accessible for casual players or a challenge for the most demanding players, as well as making it highly replayable. Quick games, long campaigns, rule combinations... Everything is available to players in a simple and easy to configure way. As if that wasn't enough, additional content will be added periodically to extend the hours of gameplay even further.

—description from the publisher

Tomad el papel de cuatro Valkirias que, cansadas de esperar a la última batalla, la del final de los tiempos, han decidido tomar la delantera y, apoyadas por Freya, lanzarse a la batalla para tratar de evitar el mismísimo Ragnarök. Enfrentaos a poderosas sierpes, ladinos elfos oscuros, draugr resurgidos de las profundidades de Hel, duros gigantes de hielo y temibles demonios de fuego. Venced y tal vez os ganéis el favor de los dioses y estos os ayuden en vuestra gesta. ¡Por Asgard!

Valkirias se presenta como un libro juego. Cada capítulo presenta nuevas reglas y un Campo de Batalla donde jugarlas. A lo largo de los tres primeros aprenderéis las reglas de forma progresiva, desplazándoos por el Campo de Batalla, eliminando a cuantos enemigos podáis, jugando vuestras cartas de la manera más inteligente. Compite con tus hermanas guerreras para ver quién debe liderar al equipo. Cuando dominéis los conceptos básicos, podréis jugar al Modo Completo en cualquier campo de Batalla asilado, aventuraros en la campaña de Vanaheim, narrada en el último capítulo, o crear vuestros propios escenarios y campañas.

La modularidad del juego consigue que sea accesible para aquellos jugadores más casuales o todo un reto para los jugadores más exigentes, además de conseguir que sea altamente rejugable. Partidas rápidas, campañas largas, combinaciones de reglas… Todo al alcance de los jugadores de una manera sencilla y fácil de configurar. Por si fuera poco, se añadirá contenido adicional de manera periódica para ampliar aún más las horas de juego.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The Many Dungeons
description:
A puzzling dungeon-crawling coop experience in only 18 hexagonal tiles. In The Many Dungeons your party will encounter hidden dangers, loot and glory… Raise your heroes to their maximum level to stand against the dungeon lords and solve the different puzzles in this original adventure for 1 to 3 players.

Either when you plan a long session of dungeon crawling with your friends or just want a quick dungeon to scramble up a bit the cogs in your brain, The Many Dungeons offer an adaptable environment with many different dungeons settings, setups and challenges to keep your both your mind and your evening gaming sessions fresh as the first day!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Pieces as Map

name: Duck & Cover
description:
Duck & Cover is a 20 minutes goofy game in which you're trying to have the less poops in your duck pond. You will either duck your duck by moving them around your grid or cover your duck cards with other ducks. You have 3 rounds to get the lowest score and be the cleanest pond. Your ducks will love that for sure !

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Sky Painters
description:
The colors of the world have been stolen and everything has turned gray. But the guardian of the clouds has a plan: she has summoned brave guides like you to lead the Sky Painters, winged creatures with tails that emanate magical paint. Together, you can restore the planet's vibrant beauty. Your task is to complete sky cards with colored dice and recruit tiles from the most talented Sky Painters to achieve this mission. Are you ready for the challenge?

Sky Painters is a strategy game for 2 to 4 players. The game's rhythm is very simple: you place dice to complete cards as contracts. Completed cards grant you spot chips and heart tokens, which you then use to acquire Sky Painter tiles and unlock their powers. The real challenge lies in the players' tension, as there are three ways to win:


Completing 9 cards in a 3x3 grid.
Completing a 5-pointed star with 5 Sky Painter tiles.
Having the most points at the end of the game, if neither of the other two conditions are met.


Who will become first the greatest master of colors?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Income, Open Drafting, Sudden Death Ending, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Expedition To Darwin IV
description:
It is the year 2358 and a massive Orbitstar is locked into orbit around the newly discovered world, Darwin IV. With the help of our alien patrons, the Yma, Humanity has finally achieved one of its cherished goals – to reach a distant exoplanet. Descending to the surface in sealed Hovercones, a multitude of scientists and researchers, both human and otherworldly, will spread across this virginal world to study the diverse and often bizarre fauna found in all of its varied biomes. From vast savannahs and scattered pocket forests to the frozen tundra and the mystifying Amoebic Sea, explorers will rise to the challenges of a world teeming with biological wonders. It is, here, on Darwin IV that the human race will begin to fulfill its age-old yearning to explore the universe and understand the intricacies of an alien planet.

Based on Wayne Barlowe’s beautifully illustrated book ‘Expedition’, players take on the role of human scientists in the year 2358 AD, exploring the alien world Darwin IV in search of new life. Piloting their hovercones across different biomes, scientists will locate and study the unique indigenous species of Darwin IV, in an effort to learn more about the planet’s strange and wondrous inhabitants. With the data they’ve collected, each scientist will share their work with their benign custodians, the Yma, earning them reputation.

But Darwin IV isn’t without its dangers, as scientists must also be cautious with the planet’s more aggressive predators, navigate its unpredictable weather patterns, and avoid other deadly off-world threats…

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: UND1C1: Club Teams
description:
Twelve club teams:

Larks, Armoury, Cruelles, Bluettes (England)
Monumento, Duomo, Serpenti (Italy)
Coronas, Sagrada (Spain)
Oktobers (Germany)
Tourelle (France)
Birdies (Netherlands)
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: UND1C1: Booster Deck
description:
Two additional card decks (20 new strategy cards + 6 playbook cards each)

More strategy, more powers. Expand your collection by adding 20 new strategy cards to each of your core decks. The booster decks also include 6 playbook cards each.
mechanics: Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Sea of Legends: Vengeance of the Empires
description:
War amongst the Great Powers of Europe has engulfed the Americas. The Spanish Empire’s hold over the Caribbean has been slipping for decades as they compete with rival empires. Now the Spanish Empire looks to reestablish their hold over their colonies to bolster their efforts in Europe. France has marshaled their forces to expand their own presence to ensure their access to the goods and resources of the Americas. But older and stranger forces have also awoken in the murky depths of these ancient waters. Sailors tell tall tales of a haunted ship, the Flying Dutchman, and its ghostly crew. There are also whispered warnings about the mighty Kraken, rising from the depths to hunt those that dare to sail upon the waters.

The Great Powers are gathering on the seas, seizing control of the ports, and punishing all rivals. Is the Golden Age of Piracy at an end? Or will you make deals, manipulate events to your advantage, and become the greatest pirate of them all? Hold fast, gather your crew, ready your cannons and muskets, and prepare for the Vengeance of the Empires.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Infinite Chess
description:
A variant form of chess played with the usual pieces on an infinity-symbol-shaped board. While the rules are nearly identical to those of standard chess, the differing topology changes the game substantially.

Original websites for it are no longer up, but the WayBack Machine has a cached version at https://web.archive.org/web/20141017211751/http://www.colebank.com:80/ichess/index.asp
mechanics: Grid Movement

name: Paper Trail
description:
Help these students survive their 7th grade history class! By passing notes around the classroom, you can add some fun into their dreadfully dull day. The teacher is searching high and low for these mischievous notes, so don’t get caught!

In Paper Trail, students pass notes around the classroom from desk to desk while the teacher tries to find & confiscate these notes. Students also race each other to score the most points before class ends. A student-player wins by passing enough notes to end the game AND scoring the most points. The teacher wins by confiscating enough notes to end the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Movement, Push Your Luck

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – The Mountain's Men
description:
The Mountain’s Men are drawn from the dregs of society. These men have no morals and it shows in how they fight on the battlefield. They give no quarter. They take no prisoners. Those that try and run must be fast, lest they get cut down from behind. Their ruthlessness is well known by the enemy, and that knowledge spreads through the ranks, sowing fear and discord. Nobody wants to be the ones to have to fight against them on the battlefield.

The Mountain’s Men Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Lannister Commanders a new unit to add to their ranks. Their reputation alone can deal damage to enemy forces. The power of their swings with their greatswords means that they can potentially do two hits with each attack. And any unit charged by them instantly becomes Panicked. Truly nothing that enemy Commanders want to face.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Champions of Nexum
description:
Champions of Nexum is a first truly MOBA (Multiplayer Online Battle Arena) board game that will be launched on Kickstarter still this year.
It is highly inspired by MOBA style video games.

Great emphasis was placed on cooperation within your team, which best reflects the emotions that can be found in MOBA type games.

The goal of this game is to destroy the opponent's castle.
Which can be achieved by carrying out the quests entrusted to your team.
In doing this, you will destroy Runic Towers and gain access to the opponent's castle.

Game offers fast and dynamic gameplay with short sessions (around one hour).

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Villains
description:
You are the leader of a fiendish organization bent on dominating "The City", but you are are not alone in the quest to become its undisputed master. Your enemies are lurking in the shadows, watching your every move. If you desire any chance of completing your devilish plans then secrecy must be your watchword. Keep your enemies guessing with bluffs, misdirection, and cunning strategy.

Villains is a 3-5 player game where each player represents a different faction of archetypal villains (players can choose from the invading aliens, an organized crime family, the robot uprisings, invading soviets and more).

Each turn the players secretly set their evil plans in motion by placing face down action tokens in different areas of the city. These tokens allow players to deploy troops, play action cards, initiate battles and use special faction specific abilities.

There are two paths to victory in a game of Villains: be the first player to complete four of your faction's plans or alternatively be the first player to achieve ten victory points by controlling important locations in The City.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Exceed: Sydney & Serena Solo Fighter
description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed from the world of Seventh Cross.

Sydney fights alongside his plant companion, Serena, who has an insatiable thirst for human blood. These two form a unique new take on puppet-fighters, with Serena eventually uprooting herself and taking over the fight!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water - Dens of the Pennagolan
description:
This expansion will transport our heroes to a new location, darker and more dangerous than any they have entered before.

A new breed of danger awaits Okko and his companions in the damp basements of the building: the Pennagolan oni and its hordes of ogrish Gaki.

This expansion contains:

- 1 new Oni: the terrifying Pennagolan!

This character comes complete with a Character card, miniature and Clue card to add to the existing Clue deck. The Pennagolan can be used to replace one of the oni from the Core game or to further complicate the Heroes' investigations by adding yet another possibility.

- 5 Gaki Ogres.

These dreaded undead minions are often found in the service of Pennagolan, and are made all the terrible due to the ease with which they can be resurrected!

These miniatures are accompanied by their Character card.
- New Mortal Thrall Character cards.

The palace where this new investigation takes place is guarded by Ashigaru and Samurai who possess their own characteristics and powers.

It appears that not only does Hiroji serve many masters, but that he has also made his own deal with the dark forces of this palace.

- Equipment cards: Ancient weapons.

10 New Equipment cards representing rare and extraordinary items often reserved for use by the noble samurai are also contained in this expansion.

- 5 Event cards and 5 Clue cards.

Adding even more variety to the twists of the Oni player’s schemes, these cards will add more than a few nasty surprises for Okko and his companions as they relentlessly chase evil through the palace!

- 3 Double-sided tiles.

These tiles will combine to construct the lair of the Pennagolan, including the basements and caves under the palace.

One of these new tiles also add new Missions for our Heroes, or their adversaries to conquer.

- 1 Scenario Book.

Finally, this expansion also includes a 5 scenario campaign that will lead our heroes into the very heart of the gruesome and desolate Den of the Pennagolan.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Summoners
description:
The game Summoners is a tabletop skirmish game for two or more players. Each player assumes control of a powerful sorcerer, with whom he travels the shattered shards of Kalundra. During a game these sorcerers can summon many different creatures to support them, yet to do this they need magical energy, which is hidden everywhere on the battlefield in the form of of magical fragments of the great Crystal. No sorcerer is able to work magic or open portals without these mana-gems, wherefore hostile sorcerers fight bitterly over this vital resource. Only those who make optimal use of the abilities of their creatures and keep an eye on their energy reserves can leave the arena as victors.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – Gamer's Bundle Edition
description:
Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift is intended to be a new kind of dungeon crawl, one that embraces the European school of game design with clever and elegant mechanisms and emphasizes strategy while minimizing luck. Cooperation, planning, and the enemy response deck eliminate the need for chucking dice, creating a tense combat environment with meaningful decisions! The rondels provide another tactical layer, including the enemy's devious and challenging AI.

The rules allow you to learn to play in 15 minutes, with a typical game round lasting less than ten minutes, even with up to six players, but deep, strategic cooperation will be required for your band of heroes to make it through to the Abyssal Rift and maybe even come out alive.

Perdition’s Mouth is designed to be played as a story-supported campaign over several gaming sessions. In the campaign, you have to fight through at least six increasingly challenging scenarios and the level of success during each adventure has a direct effect on the rest of the story. Can you survive the labyrinth of the insectoid god?

Perdition’s Mouth: Abyssal Rift Gamer’s Bundle edition contains all and everything the Retail edition does along with two mini-expansions, Hideout and Witch’s Grotto.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Treasure Goblins
description:
In the dark kingdom of goblins, the order has been given: plunder and rob the neighboring realm in search of the most coveted treasures. We, the thieving goblins, will take on the challenge of filling the king goblin's bag with the most valuable loot, thus feeding his insatiable greed.

However, we face a dilemma: we must control our own greed and be selective about which treasures to add to the bag, as it has limits both in terms of space and weight it can bear. It is crucial that we proceed with caution and wisdom in selecting the treasures, as no goblin wishes to be responsible for breaking the bag.

The risk of breaking the bag is considerable; if we succumb to temptation and exceed its capabilities, we will face severe consequences. Not only will we lose half of our loot to the king goblin.

Are we ready for the challenge of plundering and for blaming our fellow goblins for their incompetence? It is time to demonstrate our skill in the art of theft and cunning in treasure management. Let the adventure begin.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Hot Potato, Matching, Tile Placement

name: Spider Island
description:
BACKSTORY

The notorious flagship - Dead Reckoning - has been scuttled in open water by the Royal Navy. A small crew of cut-throat seadogs has washed ashore on the beaches of an uncharted island...

OBJECT OF THE GAME

The winner is the player that survives the longest.

SURVIVING

To survive, players compete to collect resources and craft them into items to better protect themselves from the threats of the island.

BEWARE OF BITES!

As players collect resources and craft items they’re regularly bitten by spiders. PURPLE, GREY, BLACK and BROWN cubes symbolize venomous spider bites.

When a player receives “bites” she places them on her player board. During play, too many bites incapacitates players. In the final phase, too many bites kills them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Tridimensional chess
description:
Tri Dimensional Chess, or tri-d chess was inspired by a stage property created by Irving A Feinberg for use in the Star Trek television program. While it appeared or was referenced in six episodes (Where No Man Has Gone Before, Charlie X. Court Martial, By Any Other Name, Whom Gods Destroy (dialogue only), Day of the Dove) no rules were ever developed for the game during the original run of the show. However, it did appear to be a two-player only game played with with standard chess pieces having (when viewed in plan) standard chess moves albeit on a multi-level play area.

The play area consists of three chequered 4x4 boards, called levels, mounted at different heights so that the bottom level overlaps the middle level by 2 rows at one end and the top level overlaps the middle by 2 rows at the other end. Additionally, four 2x2 boards, called attack boards, are mounted on columns that may be fitted at any of the four corners of the three main levels. These attack boards may be moved around during play. Due to the overlap, all the boards are transparent. When viewed from above, the square colour of one level or attack board matches the colour and of those above and below (e.g. colourless above colourless, coloured above coloured; the colourless squares are called white and the coloured are called black in standard terminology). However, in the television series (e.g., By Any Other Name) the top level is oriented so that the left hand square of the side nearest the camera is red while the corresponding square of the middle and bottom levels are both colourless meaning this top down perspective of matching colours above colours was not based on the tv show.

Outside of the tv show, rules for the game were first hinted at in the 1975 Ballantine Books in Franz Josef Schnaubelt's Star Trek Star Fleet Technical Manual but there is nothing close to a playable game explained. Encouraged by Schnaubelt, chess player and Star Trek fan Andrew Bartmess published a full set of rules of play. Since then numerous rule sets have been created including those by Jens Meder which include rules for tournament play (largely meaning rules on arbitration, use of a chess clock, official notation, etc.) and the official rules of the World Tri Dimensional Chess Federation written by military fighter pilot John Hawkins ostensibly partially inspired by aerial combat tactics.

The most notable difference between the various sets of rules are to do with the attack boards and vertical movement of pieces. For example, do the attack boards always stand above the levels, or may they be "inverted" to hang as pendants below the levels? Can they move with just one pawn or with any other single piece? When viewed in plan, do pieces block movement for all levels or can the moving piece travel on one level if the other piece is on a different level? Can pieces move just vertically or must they always have least some horizontal component? Lesser differences between rules sets include promotion (e.g., does an attack board above the pawn mean the pawn does not promote) and castling (i.e., kings and rooks start on the attack boards, do they just swap spaces or does one piece move to the main level).

While Tri-D chess bears similarity to the 3-D Chess Game from Lynn R Johnson, the first episode featuring the Tri-D chess set aired in 1966 while Johnson's game was not published until 1967.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Three Dimensional Movement
publishers: Ballantine Books, Franklin Mint, The Noble Collection

name: Rivales: Capítulo 1 – Justicia
description:
In this wallet game designed by Martin Carini and illustrated by Nicolas Viñolo, the intrepid Zorro faces off against the honest Mulan in a fast and asymmetrical duel where they must use their cards to take advantage of the strengths of each fighter and find the right moment to execute combos. and special abilities like in the fighting video games that we enjoy so much.

Other Rivals will be added in future installments with new characters to enter the competition and even new game modes, so stay tuned for the news about Rivales and Pulga Escapista.
mechanics: Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Materia Prima: The Inquisition Expansion
description:
Materia Prima places players in a medieval world where mysticism and science are inseparable in alchemy. In search of the philosopher's stone, recipes must be researched and resources mined.
The Inquisition is a new power in Alka Sowa, in which state and religion are united. Its nobles and priests try to gain control over the continent by banishing or destroying alchemy and all its followers once and for all.
The Inquisition Expansion enhances the world of Materia Prima and includes a cooperative campaign, which can also be played solo, as well as the possibility to play with 5 or 6 alchemists.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: The Black Hand
description:
Black Hand was a name given to an extortion method used in Italian neighborhoods at the turn of the 20th century.
This is a thematic card driven mafia game! Each player is the Godfather of one of the five families in New York, well known as Cosa Nostra. The game is played in 5 rounds, each starting with a variety of real events!

The game includes combat for area control, financial management for the growth of each family, as well as negotiation for forming alliances between families. Every player tries to dominate and become the most respectful Godfather!

Game turn sequence:
1. Event
2. Income
3. New turn order
4. Bidding for police and newspapers - market purchases
5. Reorganization
6. Action Cards' phase
7. Commission meeting

You can win midway through the game by reaching the maximum respect or completing 3 missions. Otherwise at the end of the game, respect, units' strength, investments, Casinos and game end missions determine the winner of the game!

The game won (1st place) at the Greek Board Game Contest 2016 (Category: Board game)
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Exceed: Emogine Solo Fighter
description:
This box contains one complete Fighter for Exceed from the world of Seventh Cross.

Emogine utilizes holy magic to drive back opponents, praying for divine guidance and relying on luck to carry her through. Able to subtly influence her own fate, her defensive abilities provide excellent suitability.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Master of Wills: Dawnlight Expansion Faction Deck
description:
Dawnlight is a powerful organization who view themselves as spirtual heoes. They try to achieve angelic states through technology which present powers that no other faction can proclaim. They protect and influence community characters with a mystical presence. Are they fighting for the greater good or will their extremism take them down a darker path?

“Dawnlight is a powerful organization who view themselves as spirtual heoes. They try to achieve angelic states through technology which present powers that no other faction can proclaim. They protect and influence community characters with a mystical presence. Are they fighting for the greater good or will their extremism take them down a darker path?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Space Empires: All Good Things
description:
All Good Things, the last expansion for Space Empires 4X, provides:


Master Rule Book and Scenario Books. Since this is the last expansion and completes the system, it will come with a Master Rule Book that encompasses all the goodness in all the expansions. Likewise, it will include two Master Scenario Books - one for solo/co-op and one for competitive play.



2 new, alternate empires. Similar to existing, but different. They have fighters that don't need carriers. If the original game had fighters that were like TIE Fighters, these are more like X-Wing. They don't have boarding ships or Titans, but have a new class of ships. The other ships have slightly different stats/costs.



Variable, but balanced home systems. Everyone has the same home system for balance reasons. However, knowing what you are going to find is something that has always bothered many people. This will fix that.



Scenario Cards. Around 30 cards and 1 or 2 could be flipped to change the overall galaxy conditions for the game. A couple of these are from the scenario book, but most are new.



Missions. Missions are Resource Cards that can't be just played, but require a player to complete something on the map to gain a larger benefit. Think of the plot of a simple Trek episode.



Deep Space Planetary Attributes. The NPA planets in deep space will now have a bit of personality. Some will be harder or easier to take. Some will really be worth fighting over.



Crew Cards. Not everyone will always want to play with these, but they will bring even more personality into the game.



Facilities Game. Two new facilities are added. This will really complete the facilities game.



Everything else. Extra cards of every type, Starbases, Defense Satellites, Cyber Armor, New Terrain, more terrain to support larger scenarios (more terrain is needed anyway to support larger scenarios so new terrain types are also included).
categories: Bluffing, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Income, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Glyph Chess: The 3rd Player Expansion Pack
description:
Glyph is a tactic style board game for two to three players, adapted from a famous chinese comic book, Tales of Tarsylia. Each Character has its unique skill. To win, players must maneuver their pieces to get their Scepter Piece to the center of the board or eliminate all enemy players’ Scepters.

—description from the publisher

The expansion pack includes eleven bronze pieces for a third player.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: desConfronto
description:
Everternal is a world of fantasy, adventures and dangers.

In the year 1420 C.E. (post Calamity) the legendary mage Pharanor, wielding the mighty Soul Stone, decides to face a recent mysterious threat that has been taking over and corrupting the creatures and lands of Everternal: the Darkness.

As the last member of the arcane protectors, the Magi Council, whom swear to protect the world after the end of the Calamity, Pharanor gather 3 mighty heroes from all around the world with the hope they could aid him on his journey.

The old mage summons the heroes to his tower, in the Bright Citadel of Kalahad, so together they can follow and seek the path of ruin which Darkness leaves behind to discover the source of the evil that threatens the Everternal.

desConfronto is a 1 - 5 players "LCG" Cardgame where you take on the role of 1 of the 4 most iconic D&D classes.

Each class has an asymmetric deck of action cards (attack, defense, draw, extra action, and “signature” moves), which the player will play with to perform powerful attacks and combos by rolling dices in order to purify de corrupted creatures and animals corrupted by the mysterious Darkness that plagues the world of Everternal.

In a thrilling campaign where players advance from level to level, defeating creatures and collecting the shards of corrupted Soulstones in order to use it to buy new skills, potions and traps, our heroes reach the source of corruption to face the great evil that is threatening the world.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Passed Action Token, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Pike & Shotte: Epic Battles – Push of Pike
description:
The 17th century saw the recruitment of vast armies across Europe that clashed against each other in bloody wars that decided ultimate temporal and divine authority.

The Thirty Years’ War was one of the longest and most destructive wars in European history. Ostensibly about religion, the conflict ultimately shifted the balance of power between nations on the continent.

The English Civil Wars saw Royal authority violently challenged by Parliamentary imposition in a series of wars that rent Britain asunder. Nobles and lords flocked to one side or the other to fight neighbour and brother in bloody war.

Pike & Shotte Epic Battles: Push of Pike provides you with all the information you need to refight the wars that raged across Europe in the seventeenth century in an epic scale, with period specific additions that capture the tactics, conditions, and prominent personalities of both these cataclysmic conflicts.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Star Wars: Legion – Grand Master Yoda Commander Expansion
description: Bring one of the most iconic Jedi to your Republic armies with the Grand Master Yoda Commander Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Yoda has trained generations of Jedi Knights and he brings his skills both as a mentor and with a lightsaber to your armies. Whether he is aiding friendly units or using his mastery of the Ataru form of lightsaber combat, Yoda adds a powerful new option to the Republic’s ranks. This expansion adds this legendary Jedi to your Star Wars: Legion collection, beginning with two beautifully detailed, unpainted Grand Master Yoda miniatures that can be assembled in a variety of poses, such as leaping into battle or concentrating while reaching out with the Force. All of Yoda’s skills, including his deep connection to the Force, are laid out on a unit card and his three signature command cards. These substantial powers can be further augmented by eight upgrade cards that grant him new Force powers and ways to command your armies. Finally, this expansion also includes a Republic unit card and an additional command card for the mighty Wookiee Chewbacca, allowing you to use your existing miniature in this faction.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Atomic Mass Games, Fantasy Flight Games

name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle –  Sabbat War
description:
Sabbat War was the first expansion set for the Vampire: The Eternal Struggle trading card game to be released by White Wolf after the game was initially discontinued by Wizards of the Coast. Most of the cards in the set are reprinted, mainly from the previous expansion set, Sabbat. The cards in this set, like those in the one before it, naturally focus on the vampires of the Sabbat. Many of the new cards introduced here draw inspiration from the Clan Novel Saga and other Revised-era Vampire: The Masquerade sources.

In addition to the standard booster packs, Sabbat War was the first VTES set to feature preconstructed starter decks. The four prebuilt Lasombra, Tzimisce, and Ventrue antitribu, respectively.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Voting

name: Singularity.exe
description:
“Physical reality is a distant legend. Now, humanity is stuck in a digital cage stitched together by chaos and imagination. That’s the way it’s always been. No bodies, only souls. The rules that shape Autumn Network were coded well before our memory. Nobody knows who made them or why, but everyone knows the program that may be strong enough to break them: an ancient, shattered relic – the Singularity. Fragments are already being gathered. Our fates depend on the one who is strong enough to assemble them all. We Hana Mori shamans? We believe it’s the key to getting our bodies back… everyone’s bodies back, and we’ll do anything and everything it takes to see our dream come true.” - Kodama, Canopy Mystic

Welcome to a vibrant, digital universe where humans have abandoned physical reality and fight for control of a legendary program called the Singularity. Singularity.exe is a deterministic card game that empowers endless creativity with absolutely no random elements. In collaboration with hundreds of testers across thousands of playtesting hours, Singularity has become an intuitive and elegant experience that is deeply engaging and enormously fun for a wide variety of players.

With 170+ unique cards and dozens of gameplay mechanics, Singularity has something for everyone. We have ensured every card is viable and packed with strategic potential. Take complete control by crafting your action economy. You'll never experience dead draws, resource flood, or resource starvation. Randomness will never sabotage your strategy. You can be certain every decision and every accompanying consequence is your own. Your opponent is your enemy, not your own deck.


Ready to play and easy to learn with pre-created squads in the core set, Singularity is a fun and perfectly balanced experience out of the box.
Explore the content in Autumn Network as you find Fragments to launch the Singularity through our lightweight campaign system.
Solo & Cooperative play is supported with the companion app launching alongside the game.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Take That

name: Dark Matter (fan expansion for Arkham Horror Card Game)
description:
A fan-made scifi-horror campaign for Arkham Horror: The Card Game for 1-4 players.

In Dark Matter, you have just woken up from cryo-sleep in a seemingly abandoned space ship – The Tatterdemalion. From there on, you are thrown into a deep space adventure across the solar system to prevent the extinction of the human race. Heavily inspired from Call of Cthulhu supplements Ripples from Carcosa by Oscar Rios and End Time by Dr. Michael C. LaBossiere, Dark Matter explores a potential glimpse of the future of humanity in a vast and unknowable universe.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Vendetta
description:
From the DVG website:

Our first venture into the Euro/Mass Market!

A “Family” card game. It's a card game for 2 to 6 players. Each player plays a mob boss trying to take over the top spot in New York City. The game is designed to be a low complexity family game and takes about 45-60 minutes to play. The tone is very light and very socially interactive.

The goal is to take control of different places and people in the "Neighborhood". As you do so, you gain reputation. The first player to reach the reputation goal wins.

Here's the cool part of the game...

The cornerstone to the game is the "Vendetta" mechanic. If I take control of the local Delicatessen, I get some Reputation points. If you then come and Whack (destroy) the Deli, you take the Reputation points I gained from controlling Deli.

But wait!

There's more!

When you Whack my Deli, you must give me some of your Vendetta counters. The specific number is noted on the Deli card. If I attack you in the future, I can spend your Vendetta counters to pump up my attack against your places and people.

So, the more you Whack a player, the more bonuses they have in the future to Whack you back.

This does 2 cool things.

First, you get the whole "Grudge" or "Now it's personal" aspect of mob warfare.

Second, even if a player gets Whacked hard, he still has the resources to make a comeback. Which means until a player wins, everyone has a shot at winning.

The design came together very fast, and the artist, Jerry, is doing a great job of capturing the light feel we're going for.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Nujum
description:
Nujum is a relaxed-paced, abstract board game for 2 players about predicting the movement of the stars.

In a turn of Nujum, players each play one card from their hand face-down to move the Star Token on the central board according to their card's value. The catch: In your turn, your opponent's card gets resolved first. If you can't move the token to the full number of spaces indicated on your card, it's discarded - not scoring you any points.

Should the stars not align for you at any point, don't worry! Eclipse Cards allow you to alter the movement of the Star Token, changing cards' suits, replacing them with cards from your hand or scoring your card without moving the Star Token altogether.

Nujum, the Arabic word for "Stars", draws inspiration from the Islamic Golden Age when scholars with diverse backgrounds used to discuss Astrology, Astronomy and Philosophy on an equal footing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Tug of War

name: Gettysburg 1863
description:
GETTYSBURG 1863 is Volume IV in the Old School Wargames Civil War Brigade Battle series.
