On the outside, Keera is the essence of nobility. But on the inside, an untameable fire burns. Enemies are advised to tread lightly, for it is uncertain who they should fear more— the fiery mistress, or her mythical dragons.

A legend reborn - this set includes:
1x Keera, The Dragon Princess
2x Young Dragons
1x Keera’s Banner (Dragon Hatchling Egg)
All the cards you'll need to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Master of Wills: Shadowcell Expansion Faction Deck
description:
As mercenaries and vigilantes, Shadowcell takes the law into their own hands using deception and the art of surprise. They hide their intentions and set traps for their prey. Shadowcell is clearly more advanced in their methodology and with the right leadership, they may ultimately be unstoppable.

Shadowcell is the faction of the night. They are the secret whisper around every corner and the blurred movement down each alley. As mercenaries and vigilantes, they take the law into their own hands using deception and the art of surprise. Shadowcell is clearly more advanced in their methodology and with the right leadership, they may ultimately be unstoppable.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: The Case of Alexander Morrison
description:
SOLVE THE STORY OF A CRIME
Decipher puzzles, investigate clues and use your detective skills to crack the case. A cooperative game of deduction and mystery.

Alexander Morrison, a risk fund manager, is found dead in his apartment. Involved in an alleged love triangle and a scandal that occurred at the company. It's up to you to decipher the puzzles to prove whether it was an Accident, Suicide or Homicide.

A multidimensional gaming experience that enables a challenging story for all participants. The game consists of a realistic criminal case and requires investigations similar to those carried out by the criminal investigation department in real life. Perfect for date nights, team building, board gamers, crime solvers, challenge fans and everyone who loves a good mystery story!

This case contains 65 elements with very good quality materials and printing.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: A Day at the Beach
description:
A cross between Rummy and Miles Borne - family fun for anyone who loves the beach and card games.

Collect Sandcastles and Seashells, but watch out for Sunburn!

Objective:
Make 3 sets to win!

Setup:
Deal 4 cards to each player (their hand).
Deal 4 cards face-up as "The Ocean".
The discard pile is face-up next to the Deck (reuse if you finish the deck)

Gameplay:
Play goes clockwise. Each turn either:

Swap 1 card from your hand with the Ocean; OR
Draw 2 cards from the Deck. 1st one in the Ocean, 2nd in your hand; OR
Play a Yellow Action Card from your hand


Action Card Notes

Discard means to the discard pile.
Pick which player to play Sunburn, Wipeout and Shark Attack on


The first game, the person most recently at the beach goes first. After that, the winner goes last.

And most importantly: please enjoy A Day at the Beach!!!

Full official rules at http://www.standardgames.com

Purchase the game at:
https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/a-day-at-the-beach

Artist: Emma Glennon
mechanics: Set Collection
publishers: Standard Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Sanctuary Saga
description:
Inspired by 16-bit JRPGs of the 90's, Sanctuary Saga is a cooperative deck building game for 1 to 4 players. Incorporating mild legacy elements, players follow the exploits of guilds from various nations combining their assets to found a new city-state in a resource rich and hostile land. Players must work together to overcome the challenges presented by the Narrative Deck in order to ensure the survival of Sanctuary and its citizens.

Sanctuary Saga is now live on Gamecrafter!
https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/sanctuary-saga-core-set

Try it FREE on Tabletop Simulator.
https://bit.ly/SSCoreTTS

Will Sanctuary flourish into a budding city-state or will the skeleton building frames serve as a warning to future explorers? Your actions will decide!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Moonstone: Two Player Starter Set
description:
This 2-player Starter set contains everything you need to start playing Moonstone.

Contains:


4 Human Miniatures made in fine quality resin with bases and stat cards: Baron von Fancyhat, Eric the Squire, Flintlock, and Friar Flavius (Starter set exclusive!)
4 Goblin Miniatures made in fine quality resin with bases and stat cards: Doug the Flatulent, Beaky Bobby, Vicious Midget, Grub (Starter set exclusive!)
1 Moonstone Card Deck
1 Rules Pamphlet
30 Blue Energy Counters
7 4-Sided Dice
2 6-Sided Dice
1 Moonstone Measuring Widget


Miniatures are multipart and require assembly.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Godtear: Sneaky Peet, The Maligned & Sneaky Stabbers
description:
"Opportunistic, untrustworthy and sly, all goblins are loathes, but special hatred is reserved for the Maligned. Sneaky Peet's rapid rise to the leader of the Sneaky Stabbers has as much to do with the blood of his rivals as it does animal cunning or foretold destiny."

This set includes Sneaky Peet, 3 Sneaky Stabbers, Sneaky Peet's banner and profile cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Variable Player Powers

name: Scarface 1920: Bloody Business
description:
Three years after the start of Prohibition, the battle for Chicago intensifies in an increasingly lucrative but unstable scenario for the gangs. The city has become too small, and the ambition of mobsters like Al Capone prevents them from settling for only a part of the pie. They want it all.

Bloody Business expands the Scarface 1920 universe by introducing mechanics and elements that multiply the game's narrtative power. It does so by increasing its flow, facilating the implementation of some actions, enhancing player's strategies, and turning each game into a memorable battle for the throne of Chicago. It's time to take action!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Song of Shadows and Dust
description:
From the publisher's website:

Song of Shadows and Dust is a standalone miniatures wargame based on the award winning Song of Blades and Heroes rules engine. The rules reflect the gritty reality of urban violence while preserving the keep-it-simple, play-as-you-want, no-book-keeping-required spirit of the Ganesha Games family.
Easy to learn: The elegant core rules are easy to learn in just one game.
Fast to play: Games are designed to be finished in under an hour allowing small campaigns to be completed in a single sitting.
Flexible: Inspired by the break down in civil order which plagued the great cities of the Mediterranean in the first century BC, these rules are suitable for any pre-modern setting from Babylon to Bruges.

Expansive: Includes 57 unique character profiles with whom to populate your faction or guild – from henchmen, assassins and punch-drunk boxers, to street urchins, elder statesmen and courtesans. Players are also free to create their own custom characters choosing from among 46 defining special rules.

Variable: Eleven different faction objectives allow for 121 different tabletop scenarios.
Expandable: Easily supplemented by special rules and scenarios drawn from the other rule books produced by Ganesha Games.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Phantom Epoch
description:
Phantom Epoch is a fully cooperative 1–4 player tactical combat roleplaying board game with a persistent, choice-driven, 40+ mission campaign that blends sci-fi and fantasy themes.

Late Pledge Available!

In a galaxy where the secrets of interstellar travel have been lost to time and primitive peoples war over ancient technology, players are thrust into missions to stop an encroaching threat. As they play through missions on numerous planets with a variety of biomes, they will discover the true nature of their enemy, and will have the opportunity to unearth the rich story of the world of Phantom Epoch.

A wide range of character choices, including human and alien species which can be combined with a diverse set of classes, allows players to create and grow their own characters to match their own play style. Each mission has its own map, objectives, enemies, and challenges. Every map has a completely unique layout. No two missions will be the same, and players will have to adjust their strategies accordingly.

Outside of missions, players will need to gather resources to repair and restore functionality to the starship that serves as their headquarters. Doing so will unlock facilities to improve their characters with upgraded equipment, attributes, and skills. As secrets from the past are revealed, they will gain combat knowledge in the form of branching advanced classes that allow players to further customize and empower their characters.

Before missions, players prepare their equipment and Action cards that they'll bring with them on a mission. During a mission, players and adversaries simultaneously select Action cards at the start of each round. The selected cards determine the turn order for the round. During their turns the players and adversaries play the selected action cards one at a time. The campaign is made up of 40+ missions, and ends when the final story mission is played. As a fully cooperative game, players win a mission together by completing the mission objective, or lose together when all players are defeated or the objective is failed.
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Drafting, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Legacy Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Darkest Doom
description:
Darkest Doom is a competitive strategy game with RPG elements for 1-4 players. Set in a dark fantasy world inspired by XVII century Europe and inhabited by anthropomorphic animals.

Will you survive for the 8 days of the Eclipse as the Darkness tries to annihilate the region of Betel all the while competing with the other Guardians to complete one of the four paths to victory?

The Darkest Doom boardgame puts you in charge of one of four formidable Guardians, each with unique abilities and traits. As you explore the areas of the region of Betel you'll be able to take advantage of each different terrain and use its unique characteristics. You'll increase your Guardian's statistics by completing quests assigned to you by Vicar Percival, adjusting your strategy and attitude towards the game based on the stats you choose to upgrade. During your exploration, you'll also stumble onto ancient relics which will help you satisfy one of four victory conditions. You'll be able to declare Alliances with Citadels in order to gain advantages over other Guardians and battle the Darkness which is slowly bringing the whole region to collapse. Each new round is a new Dawn, and thanks to the Citadel restock you'll always have some help as you replenish the cards in your hand, choosing them from different decks: Equipment, Spells and Traps. The same card has different effects depending on the player using it and the stats they've chosen to increase. Whenever you're required to roll dice, High Priestess Elaine grants you and all other players the power of the Crimsonfate - the Amulet of the Elders - which will let you modify the result of the dice with a result of your choice from the Citadels Supplies cards in your hand. Play by yourself with the Bot Guardians mode, allowing you to play with up to three automated Guardians, or prove yourself by challenging three other players in this Dark Fantasy adventure combining elements of roleplay, exploration, handicap management and traditional boardgames.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Renaissance
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Self-Published), Fabrika Igr, Game Start Studio, Rosiness

name: Wir machen mit     Spiel * Spannung * Umweltschutz
description:
Objective: keep on moving - do not meet (feed) a devil (4 of
them)
find the correct answers for question cards
cooperative game
moving by turn - drawing cards
story:
Family Grünkern (= 'unripe spelt grains') moves all over the board. If you flip a card find the correct answer - otherwise you will feed the 'devil marker'
Questions like 'may you catch butterflies?' or
'may you drop a magazine onto a compost heap?'
content:
1 board
4 coloured meeples
2 dice
1 enviromental little devil
4 polluters
143 cards
1 schedule/scheme
1 rules
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Pot-o-Gold Run
description:
Players are elfs who are seeking for gold while crossing a giant Rainbow. Running fast may guarantee them to be the first to arrive on the Pot of Gold at the other side. The player who collects more gold coins or the one who arrives first at the Pot wins. It's a game of pushing your luck and trying to trick your opponents. In each move players will try to guess if the next card is higher or lower than the previous one, to advance one step. Some lightenings are played against the others to try to fool them and make them return to the beginning while clowds are used as a protection. A player collects as many gold coins as the cards of the same color correctly revealed, when he decides to stop. Some simple tactics and a lot of interaction awaits you in this Pot-o-Gold Run!

In October 2012 the game was finalist in the Boardgame Design Contest of Panzazol Joue (France).
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Sabatu
description:
Theme and Victory Conditions:

Sabatu is a light strategy game of ancient conquest set in the plains of Sumer (Mesopotamia) over 4,000 years ago. There are two ways to win a game of Sabatu. You can employ a strategy of speed and be the first player to seize any 3 Capitals and to occupy all 3 of them at the same time. Or you can be the first player to build four Walls around one City. The first player to successfully implement either one of these strategies and is able to hold it until the beginning of their next turn is declared Conqueror of the Known World or as Sargon King of Akkad called himself Sarru-kinu, “The Rightful King”.

Gameplay:

A player must begin their turn by drawing one Conquest card and immediately following the instructions on the card.
The player then rolls 2 dice (3 if using all 9 regions), unless otherwise instructed by the Conquest card, or uses Spoils coins to move around the board toward their objectives.
When landing on designated spaces such as “Spoils” or “Armory” draw one tile from the appropriate bag. If landing on a “Destiny” space draw one Destiny card and immediately follow the instructions.
Position your troops, buy Walls, trade, do battle if you wish or build your forces and supplies. It’s up to you.
When you are done pass the dice to the next player, signaling that your turn is done.


Battles:

When attempting to occupy the same space already held by another player on the board or when attacking an opponent’s City, the 2 Armies must fight a battle. After each player decides which armor or weapons they will use the players each roll one die and then add the value of the Armory tile to the roll of the die. The Army with the highest total amount is victorious. In the event of a tie, the attacker has the option of continuing the attack or retreat. If discretion is the better part of valor and retreat is the desired course of action then the attacker rolls 1 die and moves away from the defender the number of spaces indicated by the die. As long as a City has one or more walls any army within the walls has a 1 point advantage when fighting a battle, in addition to any Armory tile the defender may wish to play.

No player is eliminated from the game. If a player’s Armies have all been eliminated from the game, that player begins their next turn with a new Army at Home.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Crystal Pyramid
description:
In Crystal Pyramid, 2 - 5 players are competing in auctions for crystals, actions and characters with one goal:
Be the first to complete building your pyramid of crystals.
Harness the power of the Mummy, the Pharaoh, the Noble Brigand and other characters to outdo your fellow pyramid builders.

Does this make any sense at all? You decide.
This game owes its existance mainly to an overabundance of acrylic crystals in the game designer's possession.
But stranger things have happened.

Crystal Pyramid is a family level auction and set building game (unless you tell the seven year old how she has to play, which might end in tears).

This game is available as a free print & play download in English and German right here on BGG.
Enjoy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Set Collection

name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Airco DH.2
description:
From the publisher:

The Airco DH.2 was a single-seat biplane “pusher” aircraft that was the first effectively armed British single-seat fighter. It enabled Royal Flying Corps (RFC) pilots to counter the “Fokker Scourge”, that had given to the Germans air superiority in late 1915. The DH.2 and similar aircraft carried the burden of fighting and escort duties. Great Aces gloriously piloted this aircraft: Robert Saundby, John Oliver Andrews and Lanoe Hawker.

Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW1 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Horus Heresy: Book Five – Tempest
description:
Previously isolated from the brutal devastation of the Horus Heresy as it tore across the Imperium, Mankind’s civil war has now reached Ultramar. The Horus Heresy Book V: Tempest tells of the Word Bearers’ treacherous attack on the Ultramarines at the mustering world of Calth, and of the cataclysmic was that will soon engulf the entire system, pitching not only the Legions against each other, but also the massed ranks of the Imperial Army militia, and the towering god-machines of the Legio Titanicus.

Lavishly illustrated in full colour, this leather bound 270 page book contains an extensive history of the Ultramarines, unit profiles, and an army list as well as rules for the Primarch of the XIIIth Legion, Roboute Guilliman. To represent their part in the conflict, the rules for the Word Bearers Legion have been updated and new units and characters provided for them. The new Imperialis Militia & Cults army list allows you to field the massed troops and war machines of a range of armies raised on a myriad of worlds, including planetary defence forces and twisted Warp cults, with rules to represent your army’s unique background and fighting style.

Additional units for Legiones Astartes and Mechanicum armies are presented within Tempest, such as the Sokar Pattern Stormbird, the Domitar Class Battle-automata, and rules for using the gargantuan Mars Warlord Battle Titan.

Bringing this wealth of source material and game rules together, the Betrayal at Calth campaign lets you refight the apocalyptic battles between the Traitors and the Loyalists, providing missions and rules so you can either fight for Calth, or bring about its utter destruction.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadows in the Weald (2nd Edition)
description:
Description from the publisher:

Shadows in the Weald is the second edition of the game originally published in Yaah! #5 and doubles the number of Matches (up to 10) and maps (now 2). It's numerous matches are meant as an introduction to the Heroes & Hirelings system, using only the 88 counters and TWO 11" x 17" map sheets provided. The game is play, rather than story, focused; the Matches are meant to highlight some of the possibilities inherent in the system, rather than to represent any overarching theme or narrative. As such, Heroes might be allies in one Match, and enemies in another.

Heroes & Hirelings is a fantasy skirmish combat game. Players control a Party comprised of two kinds of Characters: Heroes and, you guessed it, Hirelings. Heroes are powerful, named Characters with special abilities. Hirelings are anonymous mooks who give adjacent Characters the benefits (and detriments) of Buffs. The object of a Match is typically to Defeat a certain number of your opponent’s Heroes. The game is played with 2 Maps, 88 Counters, Markers, Cards, and several eight-sided dice. That’s eight, not six or ten. Everything but the dice is provided.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Big Box Retail
description:
INTRODUCTION:
You are a newly hired store manager, eager to show your prowess to the corporate executives. You have been given two years to successfully generate as much profit as possible, and be moved up to an executive position at the corporate office. However, you have stiff competition from other store managers who are hoping to do the same.

DESCRIPTION:
Big Box Retail is an economic game for 2-4 new store managers who have to juggle marketing, distribution, purchasing, warehousing, sales, payroll, and employees in an effort to generate the most profit as possible.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Generate the most cash by the end of two years (four rounds)

GAME PLAY:
Each player performs market research to determine customer demands, and purchases products for their store. Then, employees will manage store inventory (including new distributor purchases), and prepare for customer sales. Customers will seek out stores to meet their demand. Finally, employees are paid according to their work efforts.

GAME ELEMENTS:

Seasonal customer demands
End-to-End store management
Customer overflow (indirect competition)
Employee talents
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Simulation

name: ALLIANCE: The Ultimate World Leader Political Science MegaGame
description:
Designed by professional graphic designer, illustrator, and game designer, Shaun D. McMillan, ALLIANCE can be played by as few as 12 players or as many as 100. Easily expandable, it can be played with small groups, entire classrooms, or large combined groups. Players work together to lead their nation-teams towards peace using economic strategies, defensive strategies, negotiations, and creative technologies based on each player’s endless imagination. They may collaborate, compete, collude, coerce, negotiate, and create businesses, scientific inventions, and new technologies to solve all the world’s crises to ultimately achieve the epic win, world peace.

ALLIANCE is a megagame. Megagames are played by thirty plus players who all play different roles on different nation-teams simultaneously through a series of timed game days. Through a combination of table top RPG mechanics, board game mechanics, war game mechanics, and live action roleplay, players become world leaders of various different nation-teams and try to achieve world peace together. Though there is competition, in the end they all win together or they all lose together.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Blue Ribbon Pie
description:
You and your fellow compatriots are all on your way to becoming famous pie making Cheflebrities! You have all been selected for a contest competing with each other in the kitchen to build the best quality pies as you possibly can!

Blue Ribbon Pie is a fun, casual, family card game! You take turns drawing cards from the ingredients pile, playing a card on your turn, and putting together the best quality pies you can! But watch out, mistakes can be made and people can sabotage each other in the kitchen with special cards. Points are tallied up at the end based on quality and special conditions to find out who the winner is!

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring

name: XenoShyft: Dreadmire – NorTec Elite
description:
This set was available only during the Kickstarter campaign for Xenoshyft: Dreadmire. However, the cards specifically augment the cards from Xenoshyft: Onslaught. These are updated versions of the heroes and experimental items that were included in the earlier Xenoshyft: Onslaught campaign.

This set includes:

8 Heroic Troop Cards
24 Legendary Item Cards
1 Instruction Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Fate of Venterra
description:
The War Begins... The mystical maelstrom which protected Venterra through the ages has suddenly vanished. As word spreads nations from around the known world hurry to amass their forces. Legends tell of Venterra’s untold wonders and destructive magic, the likes no mortal has ever seen.

Fate of Venterra is a war game set in the fictional land of Venterra. A game of pure strategy, with no dice and combat randomizers, every move you make matters and can decide the outcome of the game. Lead one of 5 different factions, as you build buildings and recruit units on your path to victory. You must conquer the wilderness, build up your army, crush your enemies, and pursue quests to spread your influence and gain power. The end goal is to be the player with the most influence by the end of the game and establish your faction's sovereignty over the land. Blood will be spilled.... this is the fate of Venterra.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Force Commitment, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Multiple Maps, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Auction, Variable Player Powers

name: Virtue Signal: Problematic Card Pack
description:
16 excruciatingly illustrated microaggression and virtue signal cards of the salt and vinegar variety.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political
mechanics: Tile Placement

name: Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed
description:
Game Objective – Players choose Kaiju and battle each other in an all-out melee till one player has defeated all of the other player’s Kaiju and is declared The King of the Monsters!

Starting the Game – Taking turns, one at a time each player chooses one Battle Kaiju for their team till all players have a total of 3 Battle Kaiju chosen.
• One at a time each player chooses a section of the game board. Place them together to form a (4-part, section) game board.
• Players start at opposite ends of the board with their characters spaced apart.
• Play rock, paper, and scissors to decide which player goes first. Game play then continues with the player to the left.
• Shuffle and place face down off to the side of the board within reach of all players the Kaiju Assist Cards.
o Each player may draw 1 card and keep it hidden from all other players.
• Each player takes 3 Rampage Counter Cards and places them next to their kaiju.
• Place 2 Military Vehicles on the game board in the designated areas. Refer to Military Vehicles below for placement/respawn info.
• If you have a kaiju that can either fly or burrow, take a Burrowing & Flying Counter Card for each kaiju.

Game Round – After each player has had all of their kaiju go, a round has passed.
• During a turn, each player’s kaiju goes. Players may choose to do nothing with a kaiju on their turn if they wish to not move it or do a battle.

What to do during your Turn
At the start of a player’s turn, they must announce which one of the following actions they are going to do to start their turn for that particular kaiju.

Battle – Each player rolls 2 dice and the highest die roll wins. The defender wins ties.
• Each Battle Kaiju Card and some select Kaiju Assist Cards have a Wound Counter on them to keep track of when a Kaiju receives a hit.
• Once a player’s Battle Kaiju receives a KO, that Kaiju is no longer in play. Remove that Kaiju from the board and flip over its Kaiju Battle Card.
o Kaiju Assist Cards: Some require being defeated. Once defeated, follow the same rules as above for Kaiju Battle Cards.

Grab/Throw – Grab a Building/Vehicle; roll 4+. To throw a grabbed object; roll the die, the die amount rolled is the x number of spaces you may throw that object.
• Destroying Buildings & Bridges: They are destroyed when a player’s Kaiju attacks them. Attacked Buildings/Bridges are destroyed on a die roll of 4+.
• Once a Building/Vehicle or Bridge has been attacked or used as a ranged attack they are no longer in that space and are considered destroyed. Place a game logo chip on that space.
Hint: Use objects as ranged attack against other player’s Kaiju. A player’s Kaiju takes a hit from a building on a die roll of 3+ and a hit from a vehicle on a die roll of 5+.

Melee Attack (Punch/Kick) – A standard attack against another player’s Kaiju. Refer to Battle for info.

Kaiju Battle Card Special Ability – An attack unique to that Kaiju that can be done against another player’s Kaiju.
• Range Attack Ability: Some characters can perform range attacks. These characters can aim at an opponent’s Kaiju that are in line of sight.
o Line of Sight is an imaginary line drawn from the center of one Kaiju’s head to the center of another Kaiju’s head. If any part of the imaginary line touches or crosses a Kaiju or a building, the Line of Sight is blocked.
• Kaiju must wait x number of rounds before they can regain their range ability back; depending on distance they used their attack.
o Each Kaiju who can perform a Range Attack has a Range Ability Counter on their card to help players keep track of when their Kaiju can perform the ability again.

Movement – Roll the die and see how many spaces you can move a particular Kaiju. This action can be combined with any of the above on a player’s turn.
• Players can either use regular movement or burrow/fly movement on the board and then either do battle, grab/throw or a range attack.

Sharing Spaces – Only a player’s Kaiju may share a space with one other Kaiju they are using at a time. Other players Kaiju may not move onto space with another player’s Kaiju.
• Tails & Wings: Some Kaiju figures have tails/wings that extend into an adjacent square. The Kaiju is NOT considered to be in the square which its tail/wings occupy. If another Kaiju moves into the tail/wings occupied space, either move it off the side to make room or turn the Kaiju figure in the opposite facing direction.

Military Vehicles – These vehicles are sent to defend the city against Kaiju. They seek out the nearest Kaiju and battle them.
• During setup, place only 2 Military Vehicles on the game board two spaces away from the middle and facing opposite ends of the board.
o There will only ever be 4 Military Vehicles on the board at once.
• During a player’s offensive turn, the other player or players (defense) move the Military Vehicles. Any time a Kaiju moves visible to a Military Vehicle, that Military Vehicle will move two spaces towards that Kaiju. Buildings and other Kaiju block Military Line of Sight.
o If the Kaiju moves out of view of a Military Vehicle, that Vehicle will not continue to pursue the Kaiju.
• Military Vehicle Firing (attack) distance: May fire (attack) any Kaiju from a distance of 3 spaces away; long as they are in line of sight.
• Destroying Military Vehicles: They get hit by a Kaiju’s Melee/Ranged Attack, including Thrown Objects or a Kaiju enters the same Space they are in.
o Military Vehicles will spawn at beginning of every round (unless the max number is already on the board) at one of the game setup locations. Player(s) who destroyed a vehicle the previous round or have the fewer number of kaiju on the board will be the one to place a vehicle on the board.
Hint: Use Military Vehicles as projectiles against other player’s Kaiju. A player’s Kaiju takes a hit from a Military Vehicle on a die roll of 5+.

Kaiju Assist Cards – Players can only have 1 Kaiju Assist Card at a time. It can be played at any time, depending on what is written on the card.
• After a Kaiju Assist Card has been played or is no longer in play, place it in a discard pile. Once all of the cards have been used, shuffle the cards and place them face down like at the start of the game.
• If a player draws a Kaiju Assist Card that they do not wish to use or hold on to, they can discard it at the end of their turn. At the start of the next round and it is their turn, they will draw a new card like normal.

Rampage Mode – As a player’s Kaiju wins offensive battles, its Rampage Counter will go up 1 level. After Winning 5 Battles that player’s Kaiju will reach Max Rampage Level.
• On your next turn (or any other offensive turn) go on a Total Rampage against the opponent's Kaiju!
• You have 3 Battle Energy to use within your kaiju’s Rampage. A standard Battle (Punch/Kick) is worth: 1 Battle Energy and ability off your Kaiju's Battle Card is worth: 2 Battle Energy.
• Each player has a Rampage Counter Card next to their Kaiju Battle Card to help you keep track of your Kaiju’s Rampage level.

Burrowing & Flying Kaiju Special Abilities – Some Kaiju have the unique special ability to be able to either burrow or fly. When a player uses this Kaiju’s ability, they can ignore Buildings or Bridges that may be in there way.
• At the start of the player’s turn, they must announce which Kaiju they’re going to use and if they’re going to use the Burring & Flying ability prior to rolling the die for movement.
• Kaiju cannot end their turn under or top of bridges, buildings or water spaces. A player may end either turn on the same space an ally kaiju only.
• In addition, a player’s Kaiju can do pass through another player’s kaiju that is in a space.
o This ability cannot be used during Capture the Flag scenario.
• Player’s will keep track of when they can use this special ability by using the Burrowing & Flying Counter Card. A player’s kaiju will need to wait up to 6 rounds (depending on the x-number of spaces traveled) before using this special ability again.

Water Spaces – If a Kaiju is passing through water spaces -1 is subtracted from their die movement. Kaiju using the flying ability can ignore this rule.

Military Vehicles, Kaiju Assist Cards and Rampage Mode are all extra optional game features to Godzilla Rampage: Kaiju Unleashed.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Hyperwars
description:
Hyperwars is a cyberpunk themed real-time area control board game for 3-5 players that can be played in 10-15 minutes.

Players take on the role of large Corporations set in the dystopian city of Urbana. You are competing for hegemony in the market of illicit products.

​The game is played in two stages: the Action Phase and the Scoring Phase.

​The Action Phase is played in real-time for exactly five minutes. There are no individual player turns. Players perform all actions simultaneously. During this phase, players use their Action cards to deploy Agents and move goods from their sources to the Districts they wish to control. Each District has strict needs the Corporations need to supply.

The Scoring Phase happens after the five-minute Action Phase ends. During that phase, the player with more Agents in a given District is said to control it and has the chance to fulfill the needs of that District, getting points for that or failing miserably. After all Districts are scored, penalties are applied based on the number of Actions cards they have left in their hands, and the winner. is determined.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Real-Time

name: The King's Tournament: Card Game
description:
The King has proclaimed a contest shall be held to establish a new Champion. As a local noble, sponsoring the winning champion would earn you considerable royal notoriety. In this strategic card game, players use their noble influence to guide their sponsored characters in currying regal favor, initiating duels with their opponents, and conspiring against their rivals to determine the winner of The King's Tournament!

To win the game you must earn the favor of the King by advancing one of your Characters from the starting White Level of Distinction through the Red Level up to the Blue Level. Once one of your characters reaches the Blue Level of Distinction, you have won the game!

On your turn you may curry favor with the King by playing a Favor Point card. These cards each contain a numerical value. and have different titles representing the various aspects of life in the Royal Court, but all essentially have the same effect - gaining Favor with the King.

In addition to showing off their manners in Court, the most aggressive way for your sponsored heroes to earn the King’s attention is to challenge their fellow competitors to duels of honor. There are three basic Duel cards: Attack, Defend, and Counterattack. Additionally, there are Enhancer cards such as Weapons and Spells that will increase the strength of a Character's attack or defense in a Duel.

As the Royal Court acts as the heart of the political system in Fleissen, it is a site of intense competition. Nobles vie to attract the King’s notice, but also use the Court to attack the reputation of their opponents. Intrigue cards represent ways a Character can be effected by rumor, innuendo, and sabotage by such cards as Poison, Intimidation, and Humiliation.

Navigating your sponsored heroes through the Royal Courts and coaching them through rounds of duels to win the King's favor will earn them the rank of the King's Champion - and earn you considerable influence and renown within the Four Kingdoms!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That

name: Red Winter: The Soviet Attack at Tolvajärvi, Finland (Second Edition)
description:
Red Winter: Expanded 2nd Edition

This 2nd edition game is more than just a reprint of the 2012 CSR Award winner for best WW2 boardgame. It features an all-new battle, complete with its own map and countersheet.

The Battle of Kelja (December 25-27, 1939) now compliments the original Tolvajärvi battle. Kelja presents a challenge that is unique to the game system but certainly not the Winter War: a large-scale river crossing. The length of the new map is bisected by a wide, frozen river that functions as a frozen lake.

Kelja is a logical fit for the game system in terms of length and scale. At three days, it provides a shorter play experience than the five-day Tolvajärvi battle. The unit density is only moderately higher than that of the previous battle but still limited to a single countersheet, and the featured river crossing offers a unique game situation, providing both players with plenty of decisions and challenges.

Lest the battle become a “one trick pony,” plenty of options are available to both players, including variable unit setups, multiple victory conditions, variable reinforcement units, and smaller scenarios including some hypothetical situations.

Mechanics

Central to play is the Action Phase, wherein each unit may choose only one from several possible actions: move/assault, attempt recovery, dig in, or take replacement steps. This makes for some very tense decisions for both players. It also conveniently moves the game along at a brisk pace.

Combat is fast and well integrated. Units may voluntarily perform combats against adjacent enemies (two-way firefights, which utilize a CRT), conduct assaults as part of movement, or make ranged attacks at a distance of two or more hexes. The “grand tactical” scale of 425 yards per hex yields ranges of 2 hexes for light machineguns, 3 hexes for heavy machineguns and T-26 tanks, 6 hexes for medium mortars, and 12 hexes for heavy mortars. Artillery is somewhat abstracted, being handled as off-map batteries which can strike any hex on the map. Players allocate barrages as they see fit, while keeping an eye on their ammunition.

The rules for night turns provide several layers of strategic depth by means of individually simple mechanics. During each night turn, which simulates a 12 hour period, units have double their normal movement allowances. This means combat units can exploit gaps in the enemy’s frontline, cross lakes, or execute wide flanking maneuvers. However, such ambitious units are susceptible to “Sub-Zero” step losses, simulating frostbite, desertion, and poor morale from the extreme weather conditions. Whether or not each stack (note: stack, not individual unit) receives a step loss is determined by a simple 50-50 die roll. The interaction of these night rules means that ambitious players may be encouraged to push their luck and gain the upper hand during night turns, all while the system simultaneously encourages players to “do nothing” and even huddle their units together into stacks during night turns to reduce total step losses. The end result is that the system nicely mirrors the night actions of the actual battle.

The implications of the night rules don’t stop there. Skilled players will plan ahead for a night turn by positioning their units favorably during the preceding dusk turn, so they won’t need to relocate and possibly take step losses. This nuance can (and should be) exploited by the Finns, who move second in the turn sequence. The Soviet player has the option to build bonfires to avoid sub-zero attrition losses, but in doing so his units become very inviting targets for Finnish assaults. All this gives both players a lot of choices, without burdening them with cumbersome rules or tables.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: On the Wall (fan expansion for T.I.M.E. Stories)
description:
Explore new - but strangely familiar - kingdoms in order to bring back an influential empress who has gone missing in 815 FT.

This scenario has a strong focus on story line and relies on your deduction skills to solve multiple puzzles. It can be played separately from the T.I.M.E. Stories universe, while it carries a few winks to the original white cycle.

Each scene is accompanied by a thematic playlist on Spotify.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Nova Aetas Renaissance: The Mediceo
description:
In the game, the Mediceo will be a new playable hero and will be part of your Company.

His starting class will be the Hunter and he can evolve into a Bounty Hunter or Monster Hunter.

Like every Hero, he will have his own set of 3 basic equipment (his armor and weapons), 2 Hero sheets, and 1 Skill sheet, plus he will have a set of 9 new craftable Special Equipment. Most of his equipment (which can also be used by others Heroes) are fantastic inventions that Leonardo Da Vinci created for the Medici of Florence. Items with spectacular qualities, such as the Automatic Grapple or the Flame-Breath Wrist, will be a great addition to your company arsenal.

The Mediceo skills will represent in-game his abilities as a rifleman and gunslinger, and his cunning and reflexes, which on more than once have saved his life.

As a Bounty Hunter, he will become even more lethal, competing with Sofia as the damage dealer of the group; as a Monster Hunter, the use of traps and high mobility will give him great control of the field, trapping Enemies, blocking Reinforcements Points, and dealing massive damage to larger targets.

With his 6 Destiny cards, you will discover new details about his history!

Available from the beginning and is being sent free to backers that backed within the first 48 hours. Otherwise, it is an add-on.

-description from kickstarter
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Fertile Ground
description:
Fertile Ground is found all over the world, and as a Gardener, you endeavor to find and Sow the unique flora of the globe in your own Garden. As your Garden grows, your plants help and guide you along this path, accelerating your progress while also necessitating thoughtful orientation of new plants in your Garden. But you're not alone; other Gardeners are watching, and working just as hard to create the most productive Garden by the end of Winter - and only one will prevail!

Gardeners begin with a hand of between 1-7 of the 200 unique Plant Cards and work to Sow these into their Garden. As they do so, they will need to Collect resources (Soil, Sun, Water, Seed) to pay for the cards as well as make sure that they have appropriate space where each plant can survive. Taking turns, Gardeners collect resources, gather cards, and Sow plants into their Gardens; as they accumulate more plants and their associated abilities, their capacity to do each of these increases drastically. The game proceeds through the four seasons (rounds) in which each Gardener has a set number of turns, and at the end of each season Gardeners Pollinate their plants to gather Harvest. At the end of Winter, the value of the accumulated plants, resources, various tokens, and more determine the total value of each Garden, and thus the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Market, Open Drafting

name: Fate of Witches
description:
All is not well in the quiet village of Shadowsfall. People are disappearing and there are reports of strange happenings. With fear and suspicion a rife, the villagers have called for the Witch Hunter. Meanwhile, there is turmoil among the Council of Witches. The High Witch is dead and the witches are fighting among themselves for the right to succeed her. But only the most powerful witch can ascend to such a high status.

Can you gather a coven to take the title of High Witch for yourself, while evading The Witch Hunter hell-bent on burning every witch he meets? In Fate of Witches, 2-4 players compete to create the most powerful coven.

Gameplay
Fate of Witches is played over several game rounds. Each round consists of three phases in which players first draw a Character Card, and then cast an effect or place a Character into their Coven. Once all players have had a turn, the Hunters in play move. The player with The Witch’s Coin then resolves an Event Card. The Player with the highest-scoring coven at the end of the game is the winner.

Player Rounds
A round is made of three phases: Drafting, Hunters Movement and the Event. To begin the round, the player with The Witch’s Coin draws 4 cards from the Village Deck and places them in 4 piles right of the Village Deck face up. These 4 cards are referred to as the Village Square.

Drafting Phase
The player with the Witch’s Coin goes first. Players take turns in a clockwise order until all players have had a turn. On your turn, draw into your hand one card from either the Village Deck or the Village Square. Any player can then choose to immediately play a card from their hand: they can either add a Character Card to their Coven (up to a maximum of 5) or cast a Character Card Effect. If an effect is played from a player’s hand, that card is resolved immediately.

Hunter Movement Phase
The Witch Hunter and the Hound are in town and might be investigating your coven. If a Hunter is currently in a player’s coven they are unable to play certain effects.

Event Phase
After the Hunter Movement Phase, the Event Phase begins. The player to the left of the current Witch’s Coin holder will draw an Event Card. That player must keep the Event Card secret, only revealing it once the card has been resolved. There are two types of Event Cards: Scenario and Major Event cards.

Final round
The final round is triggered when the last Event Card is resolved and placed into the Event Discard Pile. You then play one last drafting phase. Once every player has had a turn, this signifies the end of the game. Now added up your total score and subtract any penalties, the player with the highest scoring coven is declared the winner and is crowned the new High Witch.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Events

name: Spellstorm
description:
A tactical deckbuilder for 1-4 players, from the creator of Dragon Bridge.

Set in the Gem Wizards Universe (Gem Wizards Tactics, Dragon Bridge). Spellstorm features the ninja bug-man Omar Evans, the Business Demon Intern Derby Pocket, radical activist skeleton Eve Williams, and a bunch of exciting new characters, each with their own powers and gameplay mechanics.

In Spellstorm, 1-4 wizards do battle, casting a sequence of spells in order, slowly unfolding their tactics and overwhelming the opponent with powerful summons, using a never-before-seen kind of deckbuilding system paired with a simultaneous action system.

Eight Wizards have met at the Spellstorm to obtain the Storm Shards, powerful magic artifacts that can only be gained once every 1,000 years. Who among you is skilled enough to weather the vicious storm?

Choose from 8 wildly asymmetrical characters with their own unique magical powers. Will you win by having a strong economy, purchasing powerful Gems and even Dragons? Will you rush them down with red Fire cards? Or do you lean more into the long-term Ice magics, overwhelming the opponent's deck and causing them to slide helplessly into the depths of the Spellstorm. You'll constantly have to adapt your strategy after each battle.

Players draft a new card between each battle, slightly shifting their strategy. During a battle, players simultaneously play Spell cards, blasting each other and dealing damage.

You can play the game on Tabletop Simulator, HERE: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=27336...

Spellstorm is a game that's easy to learn but takes years to master all of its systems.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Temples of Qaarra
description:
The Lost temples of Qaarra Await!
Over a century has passed since the catastrophe of Qaarra and the abandonment of its temples. The memories of these temples have faded to legends written on dusty scrolls. Adventurers could gain wealth and fame by journeying into the lost temples. However, who knows what mysteries and dangers might lurk there!

Lost Temples of Qaarra is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, featuring:


New d66 dungeon tiles.
New room features.
Lower dungeon floor levels.
New mechanics for Stairs, Scrying Pools, Altars.
New magic items including the Rod of Resurrection.
New monsters: tainted aspect, crystal guardian, hairy mimic, meat-eating moss, flying reptiles, temple automatons, cursed corpse, archdaemon, stone terror, gigantic gorilla, temple cleaner, cursed priest and more!
A new Final Boss type, the temple guardian.
New traps, scrolls, secrets and treasure.
Hardcore play rules for die-hard players.
Two new classes: the artificer and the crystalmancer.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Godtear: Jaak, the Dubious Alchemist & Cauldron Cronies
description:
Strange Jaak’s potioncraft is famous throughout the land. He wanders from town to town, bringing unusual brews with legendary healing powers. Wherever Jaak goes, his Cauldron Cronies are there to keep his knapsack stocked with weird and wonderful ingredients.

Potent potions, intoxicating elixirs, clever concoctions… this Guardian champion can brew it all. He specialises in healing draughts to keep friendly champions and followers in tip-top condition.

In fact, Jaak’s the only champion in Godtear who can heal other champions. If you’re floundering in fights, with champions getting knocked out left, right, and centre, Jaak’s the goblin for you!

But it’s not such good news for Jaak’s enemies. While he’s healing allies, his Cauldron Cronies followers are busy causing mayhem on the battlefield. So supportive are the Cronies, they can even plant Jaak’s banner for him!

Inside this box is everything you need to bring the Guardian champion Jaak, the Dubious Alchemist and his Cauldron Cronies to the tabletop. Use this expansion with any Godtear starter set for a ready-to-go warband.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Total War: ROME – The Board Game: Battle Play Expansion
description: The Battle Play Expansion for Total War: ROME: The Board Game adds a deeper, more tactical battle experience - the equivalent of hitting "Play Battle" in the video game. Using the same army card decks from the core game, fight a battle where you deploy your army in formations and fight 4 phases over 10-15 minutes. Use this expansion in conjunction with the core game or fight standalone battles and tournaments. You can even refight famous battles from history with Battle Play!
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Ultimate Voyage
description:
⚓ Journey back to 1431 AD, Ming China, and stand alongside Admiral Zheng He in the grand expeditions that once enforced the Ming tributary system. The seas have been silent for nearly a decade, dissent whispers through the court, but can you seize this last opportunity to craft the most captivating tale of your travels?

Ultimate Voyage is a medium weight Euro game where players sail, trade, negotiate in diplomacy, combat, build, and explore on the final voyage of the greatest explorer from East Asia, Zheng He.

Distinct Features of the Game

Rich Historical Theme - Explore 16 historical ports across 7 distinct regions, through authentic monsoon wind patterns and historical events. Each port has its own iconic landmark and offers unique trade goods, knowledge, encounters, and changing affiliations with the Ming Empire.
Asymmetric Player Powers - Players choose from one of six characters, each with a unique backstory, abilities, and starting resources, encouraging diverse strategies and interactions.
Friend or Foe - Players are captains of the same fleet. Negotiate sailing routes, decide whether to collaborate against mighty adversaries, or would you sabotage others for personal gain?
Random Setups - Customize each game with randomized events, knowledge, and starting locations to ensure that no two games are the same.
Equitable Dice Mechanics - Every round, three deity dice, symbolizing the diverse faiths of the crew, are rolled. Casting fate across all players uniformly, balancing risk and strategy for everyone.
Risk Management - Do you forge ahead to explore, cautiously observe from behind, or strategically return to Nanjing early to contribute to the Porcelain Tower’s construction?
Multiple End Game Triggers - Game lasts for 7-9 rounds (21-27 actions) for the full game. Players must stay vigilant for opponents' moves and unpredictable events that could precipitate the end.
Multiple Paths to Victory - Earn Victory Points through amassing prestige and profit, achieving objectives, crafting the best travelogs in each region, and building the Porcelain Tower. Success requires delicate balancing of intricate demands within the royal court.
Quick Game and Solo Mode - Enjoy a shorter game (4 round, 12 actions), or a solo challenge in which you assume the role of Admiral Zheng He himself, competing against an automated European explorer, Niccolò de' Conti.
categories: Adventure, Economic, Nautical, Pirates, Political, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Trials of Frostgate
description:
The Trials of Frostgate are not for the faint of heart. Only the bravest shall be named Champion.

Trials of Frostgate transports 2-4 heroes to the Free City of Frostgate, where the Northern Tribes have gathered for feasting, dancing, and sacred rituals, including the famed trials. In four new challenges, the heroes of Terrinoth face grueling tests of courage and strength. Warriors will earn glory and tattoos of their totemic animals to commemorate their victory. Rise to the challenge. Experience a new adventure and face the Trials of Frostgate!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Make it Six
description:
Make it Six is an original roll and reface dice game

Each player has one Blue die that actually serves as the scorepad. It begins on ONE and the first player to get their Blue die to SIX wins the game.

Each player's turn begins with rolling the dice of the other colors. During the player's turn, they will use the abilities (while avoiding the downsides) of the dice. This will enable them to REFACE (manually change the facing on a die) or REROLL some of the dice in order to maximize the scoring opportunity on their turn.

At the end of their turn, they hopefully get to increase the number on their Blue die.

Then it is on to the next player.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Nightmare of the Frogmire Coven: Maps & Monsters Expansion
description:
While deep in your cups at the Distant Lands Inn, you are ambushed by a hunched and hooded stranger whose very presence chills you to the bone. Before you can react, fell sorcery transports you and your companions to the dark heart of the Frogmire swamp. Ensnared by a sinister coven and beset on all sides, the nightmare is just beginning…

This expansion set is a companion to the Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught Harpers vs. Zhentarim core set, featuring stunning monster miniatures, a new double-sided game board, and eight sinister scenarios designed to freeze your blood and test your tactical acumen. Fight your way to the frightening Froghemoth, with removable tentacles and eyestalks that let you switch between underwater and above water versions! It also features a new deck of item cards to swap with the core set item cards, providing new abilities, and adding the danger of cursed items!

The scenarios in Nightmare of the Frogmire Coven take place on the included all-new double-sided map featuring a swamp on one side, and overgrown ruins on the other, both of which use bridge tokens of different sizes to create unique layouts. There are six main interlinked scenarios, a solo scenario and a 3-4 player free-for-all scenario for players looking for new ways to play!

Can you defeat your rivals and escape the nightmare? Or will you be lost forever in the brackish depths?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Moving Multiple Units

name: Robo Rally: Master Builder
description:
Introducing a brand new way to build your Robo Rally Courses! The Master Builder Expansion contains new 6x6 grid boards which allow for crazy course shapes and endless opportunity. This expansion also adds Factory Floor Tokens which are individual grid spaces with various elements on them. These tokens can be placed onto the board for exciting course customization!

These expansion boards and tokens are fully compatible with all existing Robo Rally boards. Tinker away with the Master Builder Expansion!



FeaturesNew 6x6 grid boards allowing unique race tracks!
New Factory Floor Tokens which are individual grid spaces with various elements on them.
Add new twists to your courses and connect boards in ways you never could before!
5 New Upgrade Cards!
Fully compatible with all existing Robo Rally Boards.



Contains8 Double-Sided, 6x6 Factory Game Boards
1 Two Sided Docking Bay
5 Upgrade Cards
17 Factory Floor Tokens

-description from publisher's website



Boards (6x6)
The Wave / Coming & Going
Doubles / The H
Circles / The Zone
All Roads / Winding
Assembly / The X
The Oval / Convergence
Whirlpool / Blueprint*
Mergers / Tabula Rasa*


* Blueprint and Tabula Rasa are blank boards and are, therefore, functionally identical



Boards (2x6)
Docking Bay A / Docking Bay B




Upgrade Cards
Anchor
Overclocked
The Oppositron
Top Heavy
Moon Walk
mechanics: Unspecified

name: La Bataille d'Aspern-Essling 1809
description: Another in the legendary La Bataille series from the original designers, Marshal Enterprises. This title recreates Napoleon's first loss as the Archduke Charles stops the French from crossing the Danube at Lobau Island on May 21 & 22, 1809...over 1000 counters; 5 maps; a commemorative 170 plus page CD with OB's; special rules; historical commentary; 14 scenarios including the bonus game, La Bataille de Neumarkt--which recreates the Austrian Hiller's victory over the Bessieres French and Bavarian forces a month earlier than Aspern-Essling. Only 400 copies are being printed of Aspern-Essling. Game can be played with 2 players; multi-player teams or solitaire.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Men in Tanks: Lazarus' War
description:
Unleash the warlord within!
Greetings, fellow gamers! Get ready to embark on an adrenaline-fueled journey with Men in Tanks - Lazarus’ war, the ultimate modular, action-packed, arcade battle game that bridges the gap between family fun and hardcore gaming. This is not just a game; it's an epic battle for power, featuring a unique blend of strategy, chance, and heart-pounding action.

A battle for Empire's throne
Immerse yourself in the world of Men in Tanks, where Lazarus Croft, the dictator of Arcadia, orchestrates a high-stakes battle between four generals to determine the rightful heir to the empire's throne. The battleground at Cloverfield adds an extra layer of strategy with its varied landscapes. Customize the terrain, from rocks to bridges, and witness dynamic destruction and construction, intensifying the tactical depth of your battles.

Easy to learn, endlessly entertaining
Whether you're a seasoned strategist or a casual gamer, Men in Tanks promises an experience like no other. The modular battlefield and variable units ensure every game is a fresh adventure, keeping you on the edge of your seat. From dramatic comebacks to intense thrill and unexpected drama, this game packs it all.

Missions

Deathmatch: Eliminate foes or collect medals in a relentless battle for dominance.
Capture the Flag: Secure victory by bringing home the flag or collecting precious medals.


Formations

Free for All: Embrace chaos! It's every tank for itself - survive and conquer.
Team Battle: Forge alliances, strategize, and conquer as a united front.


Action modes

Dice Mode: Leave it to chance with a unique dice featuring extra gold opportunities.
Card Mode: Craft a consistent strategy with action cards that shape your gameplay.


Double the battle, double the fun!
With Men in Tanks' groundbreaking modularity, you can assemble two copies for a colossal battlefield, accommodating up to 8 players. Challenge your friends to the ultimate showdown and assert dominance over Cloverfield.

Navigate the battlefield like a pro
Understand the nuances of movement, skills, and actions with player aid cards. Master the art of warfare as you strategize with soldiers, vehicles, and crew members. Join us in this immersive world of strategy, chance, and conquest. Unleash the warlord within and dominate the battlefield! Prepare to dive into the most exciting strategic gameplay ever - Men in Tanks© awaits your command!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Memory, Modular Board, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: Faustus Furius
description:
Faustus Furius is a fast and furious, tongue in cheek table-top racing game based very loosely around the chariot races of the ancient world and adaptable to any racing situation.

Designed for 2-8 participants, it allows players to pit chariots from any culture or period against one another in a no-holds-barred race to fame and glory.*


text from Publisher's website


On their turn a player will roll between 1 and 3 dice (player choice), with each success gaining them an Action, and multiple failures causing potentially negative effects. A player might choose to play it safe, and roll only 1 die, or may push their luck and roll 2 or all 3. One of the neat spins in this version of that dice system is the idea of Normal dice and Fatigue dice. Normal dice succeed on a roll of 3+, while Fatigue dice succeed on a 4+, as the race wears on Normal dice are replaced by Fatigue dice, and the risk of having some sort of negative consequence from rolling multiple failures becomes more significant.

Spending the Actions a player gets from their dice allows them to do things, such as move further, turn, attack fellow Charioteers, and more, with complex actions like Sharp Turns and Inciting the Crowd, costing more Actions to perform.

The player that manages to complete a set of laps (decided before the game, and typically two) will win the day.
categories: Ancient, Book, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Candy Monsters
description:
The candy has been stolen and everything points towards those thieving Candy monsters. Now it’s up to you to get the candy back but beware. You’re not the only one on the hunt.

In Candy monsters 2-4 players are rolling dice and comparing those dice to the monstercards in the middle of the board. Beating those monsters gives the players candy which is also points in the game. Some monsters drop keys which can be used for opening chests. But beware, when moving your pawn at the candy/point track sometimes reveals a trap stopping your movement
The first to get to the Candy monsters cave (30 points) wins immediately.

- Description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Push Your Luck

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Second Edition): Codex – Orks
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


The Codex: Orks is an expansion book for the Games Workshop Table Top game Warhammer 40,000. This book was published for the first time in 1994, and is for the 2nd edition of Warhammer 40,000.
The book has 88 pages and the cover is printed in colour while the majority of the book remains in black and white, although there are usually several pages of colour images of miniatures.

Contents

1) Army List
This book contains a complete army list for using a Ork army. Further special rules and wargear cards are included.

2)Background
This book contains background information and fiction on:
- An Introduction to the Ork Race and Orkdom.
- The Clans
- Orky Know-Wots; including Oddboyz, The Waaargh!, Ork Gods and more.
- Ork 'serjury' from a Gretchin's perspective.
- Gutrog's Cyboar
- Ork Glyphs
- Warlord Nuzzgrond Nosebiter and the Titans

3)Special character models
This book contains background and special character rules for:
- Nazdreg Ug Urdgrub
- Kaptin "Flash Git" Badrukk
- Mad Doc Grotsnik
- Gazghkull Mag Uruk Thraka and Makari
- Zodgrod Wortsnagga
- Wazdakka Gutzmek

4)Hobby Section
This book contains hobby information on:
- Sample Ork Banners
- 'Eavy Metal examples
- Ork Tactiks
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Tome of Champions 2020
description:
The Tome of Champions 2020 is an essential companion to Warcry, no matter how you like to play. From new narrative content to twists for matched play and fresh open play game modes, it’s packed with updated rules and ideas to inspire you. Monstrous melees and incredible quests await.
Inside this book, you'll find:

• Rules for embarking on a deadly Trial of Champions campaign or battling multiple rival warbands in brutal Pit Fights

• A campaign system in which you explore the city of Soroth Kor, featuring expanded territory rules and treasures to be discovered

• New lesser artefact tables specific to each Grand Alliance

• Cooperative challenge battles against deadly wild fighters

A copy of the Warcry Core Book is necessary to use the contents of this book.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Aristeia! All-In-One
description:
The All-In-One box includes the Aristeia! Core Box and the Prime Time box, the expansion that adds all the rules and necessary materials to allow up to 4 players to join the fun, and new scenarios and Aristeia-compatible game elements, such as objective cards, running projectiles and more.

Contents:
Aristeia Core Box
‣ 8 Assembled Plastic Minis
‣ 14 Custom Dice
‣ 1 Double-sided Game Board
‣ 2 Control Panels
‣ 60 Standard Cards
‣ 8 Mini Cards
‣ 3 Booklets
‣ 130+ Markers & Tokens
Prime Time Expansion
‣ 1 Double-sided Game Board
‣ 1 Running Orders Panel
‣ 4 Control Panels
‣ 80 Standard Tactics
‣ 48 Objective Cards
‣ 81 Markers & Tokens
‣ 1 Booklet
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #80 – Italian Partisans
description:
After the tide had turned against the Axis and civil war broke out in Italy following the Armistice of Cassibile in 1943, brave civilians began their insurrection and arose against the tyranny of the former fascist government forces and German invaders. In much chaos and confusion, often battling on several fronts, the Italian civilian resistance groups bravely took the fight to their enemies, ambushing and harassing them, whilst using their local knowledge to full advantage to evade and escape after making their attacks, supported by the local populace.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Partisans (Soldiers), National Republic Army Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Locations, Skills and Weapons. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Italian Partisan Player Soldiers
3 Italian Partisan Non-Player Soldiers
3 Italian Partisan Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
2 Weapons
2 Skills
18 National Republican Army Hostiles
4 Events
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Campaign Trail: Green Party Expansion – Game Boy Geek 2021 Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 2 cards:
Key Endorsement Causes Race in AZ to Tighten - The party behind AZ (when this card is revealed) places 2 registered voters to AZ.
The party in the lead (when this is revealed) gains $10M or 1 registered voter for each committed voter in AZ.
The player who revealed this card draws 1 extra card.

Voters Respond When Their State Flips - While this card is out, every time a state changes majority, the now holder of the majority in that state may place 1 registered voter into that state.

Note: Requires Green Party Expansion.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: After the Empire: Peasant King's Rebellion
description:
Originally available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A new Siege Card.

All players gain swords inside their walls equal to the number of razed farms they have. Reveal another siege card.
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Lobotomy 2: Manhunt – Original Ward
description:
This set includes miniatures of patients and cards of all characters from Lobotomy including add-ons and expansion. This set includes miniatures of patients and cards of all characters from Lobotomy including add-ons and expansion. New character cards make the old miniatures compatible with the new version of the game. The new character cards should only be compatible with Lobotomy 2 and not Lobotomy.

What's in the expansion box:
12 Patients (Character) Miniatures
1 Cat Miniature
Character Cards

Also released in a "cards-only" edition.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Movement Points, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Quest for the Lost Pixel: Deities of Time
description:
New Expansions

Deities of Time is the FINAL expansion for Quest for the Lost Pixel. This expansion (just like Hack Slash Loot) comes with a bonus expansion called GAME OVER.

Deities of Time

Deities of Time comes with a new time deck and deity cards. These can help heal you through your exploration, but come with restrictions that your hero must follow in order to stay faithful to your deity.
Village Game Mode

This expansion also comes with a new Village Game Mode for solo players. This allows the player to build a Village in between floors. Each new build comes with special abilities that will help aid the hero throughout their journey. Building these buildings will also give you Crown Points. These Crown Points will give you a score at the end of the game. Try to beat your last score or a friends high score.
Nightmare Mode

There is now a new harder mode for veterans of the game or those of you that enjoy a challenge. Tweaks to the Artifacts, Spells, and even how you attack with different elemental damage will give the player more decisions to make.
GAME OVER

Want more stuff? Well here it is, more stuff. This includes more cards for your decks, replaces (and adds to) your potion deck, and provides 2 new Heroes - The Chanter and Construct
Rainbow Rift

One of the most requested add-ons to the game has been dungeon variety. Although this isn't a huge variety of dungeons, here is the new Rainbow Rift. A fun yet challenging new area with goofy monsters and high rewards and XP.
A HUGE THANK YOU

Again, this is the final expansion for Quest for the Lost Pixel and I just wanted to say a HUGE thank you to everyone who has supported this game and me throughout the years. The game came out in 2015 and just like the ‘Little Train that Could’, this game kept chugging. It truly wouldn’t be as well known if it weren’t for Geek Gamers and Dungeon Dive. Also, I couldn’t give enough thanks to some of this game’s biggest fans such as David Waller, bark, Prinz Eugen, Scrap Baby, Hlorridi, Nico Farhat, funkboyg, Dani Miller, Jack the Flowerchild, Away111, LordAmaury, coned, Carol (the love of my life), and so many others. Again, thank you all so much and I truly hope you enjoy the new content. There is truly an infinite amount of replayability in this game now. But can YOU get to the Lost Pixel?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Once in a Blue Moon
description: Italy, 1960s. The boss is murdered in the mansion of a mafia family, where a struggle for the heir to the throne is still smoldering. Next to the boss's body, a man is left tied to a chair with a rope. The situation becomes increasingly chaotic as the actions of the boss's brother, wife, and other members of the family, as well as the family fortune teller and prostitutes, become intertwined.
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Trollius'n  Roll
description:
The goal of the game is to grow the Globeflower (Trollius europaeus) flower. A flower needs a seed, water, light, soil, and nutrients. In the game, players throw dice that yield symbols. These symbols are marked on the player's coupon to generate as many points as possible. The player with the most points wins.

At the beginning of the game, each player rolls their number dice and draws that many patterns from the pattern dice onto their player coupon. After this, the number dice are passed around, and more symbols are drawn, but the dice are not rolled again until they return to their original owners. By drawing symbols, players aim to complete objectives before others or achieve the final goals of the game, all the while trying to accumulate as many points as possible from the symbols.

The game includes basic rules for younger players and more challenging rules for experienced players. Players can expect additional features as their skill level increases.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Farming, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Force Commitment, Grid Coverage, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Toothead
description:
Welcome to a world where everyone wants to eat you! To survive, you must watch your own back and consume others to avoid hunger catching up with you. During the gameplay, you embody one of the Tootheads - inhabitants of a polluted island where the waste of human civilization fuels a hunger existence.

WHAT KIND OF GAME IS IT
Toothead fosters healthy selfishness, teaches assertiveness and the art of survival in a highly competitive environment. It's a very simple and fun board-card-dice game with a high level of interaction between players. It provides great entertainment during family gatherings and house parties with friends and in the hands of advanced players it becomes a pure arena of competition.

GOAL OF THE GAME
Devour others and don't get devoured yourself. The game ends with the victory of the player who remains at the table as the last one standing.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: VikinGalaxy: The Dark Attack
description:
VikinGalaxy is a cooperative game for 2-4 players with an average playing time of 45 minutes. Players take the role of the crew of a ship of Viking exploration mission to find new worlds to conquer, but one of these is attacked by a dark force, and the goal is to survive to give notice to the fleet.

The game consists of 6 phases of play, each with a number of attacks, which are added to increase the number of phases, begins with 2 attacks in the first phase and ends with 7 in the sixth.
