The Flash and Arrow expansion book is a special limited 160 page full colour hardcover edition that brings in update with the rules for use of these epic heroes, their allies, villains and much, much more.

With the rules for using the Speed force, new teams, vehicle rules as well as 80 new character traits, this expansion is a must for any collector of the Batman miniatures game.
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Gunsword
description:
Ozora is on the brink of war. The Capulan City States, united for the first time in centuries, have assembled the largest airship fleet ever seen. They rise like smoke over the continent.
To the west, the factories of the Uhrstadt Regime hum with energy. The cogs of the great machine squeal and turn.
The chants of the mystics of Ovog can be heard like distant thunder rolling in from the north.
Vehenna, gleaming like a flower in full bloom, sows the seeds of discord to the south. A bitter fruit has been planted.
And like the tide, the free-men of Amaranth lap at the eastern shores.
The balance of power is delicate, and the will of a few will decide the fate of the land…
Take part in the duels of these heroes, the greatest fighters ever to live…
Take part in the thrilling combat of “GUNSWORD.”

GUNSWORD is a fast-paced, mix-and-match, tactical card game set in the world of Ozora. Long ago, monstrous beasts called Titans roamed the land. Duelists from all over the world trained and competed in the Wild Hunt, an annual event where hopeful fighters would pit their wits and their gunswords against these powerful creatures. Now that the Titans are all but extinct, the denizens of Ozora have focused their skills on each other in dueling tournaments.

First, you pick a character from our roster of Duelists. Then, choose a Weapon for them to wield in battle. Every character has a favorite weapon, but these people are experts: they can fight with anything. With five characters and five weapons to mix and match in the Core Set, there are over 100 unique 2-player match-ups right out of the box.

Your Duelist and Weapon will determine the cards in your deck. You’ll end up with 30 cards representing your skills in combat. Then you just set out your characters in starting position, shuffle up, and fight! Using two unique systems to represent the flow of combat, the Momentum resource and a modified Chess movement system, GUNSWORD is a game for all ages and experience-levels to enjoy.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Elemental Mystics
description:
Enter a fantasy world where monsters battle for control over sea, land and sky.

In Elemental Mystics, players fight against monsters and each other in order to claim the coveted title of victor and determine once and for all, who is the best strategist amongst them. Elemental Mystics is full of twists, turns and abilities that will always leave you on the edge of your seat.

There are 2 ways to play: the streamlined Classic rules and the longer (and more challenging) Tournament rules. You will need to choose between 2 decks types (the Light and the Shadow Deck) and build you decks strategically to combat anything your opponent may throw towards you in battle.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Zombies
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Deadpool
description: Deadpool possesses a superhuman healing factor derived from that of the mutant Wolverine that allows him to regenerate damaged or destroyed areas of his cellular structure at a rate far greater than that of an ordinary human. An extraordinary hand-to-hand combatant and is skilled in multiple unarmed combat techniques. He is a master of assassination techniques, is an excellent marksman, and is highly skilled with bladed weapons (frequently carrying two swords strapped to his back).
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Xēko Mission: China
description:
The Mission: China Starter Set comes in a pagoda-roofed box made from recycled paper. Includes an oversized playmat with an eco-map on the back, 43 cards (4 Endangered, 14 Rare, 23 Common, two limited-edition sketch cards) for a 2-player game, giant learn-to-play cards, and a rulebook Xeko cards are printed on recycled paper with eco-friendly inks. Xeko donates 4% of game net sales to Conservation International.

Additional Mission: China cards could be purchased in 9-card booster packs from displays. Mission: China added a total of 86 new cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Pattern Building

name: The Eye of Judgment: Biolith Rebellion – Series 2
description:
All pre-constructed decks contain 30 Summoning Cards and the Summoner's Companion - 32-pages containing tactical hints, card lists, images and stories. Booster packs consist of random summoning cards. Set/series 2 added 100 new cards to the base game.

Two-player competitive matches can be played online. As a prohibitive measure against cheating the card draw, players' summoning decks are registered and saved by the game. In online matches, the random draw is handled virtually using the registered deck data. The cards are then played as normal.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors
publishers: Sony Computer Entertainment (SCE), Wizards of the Coast

name: Hossa! Lobgesang
description: Hossa! Lobgesang, the fourth expansion for Hossa!, gives you new things to sing about as this expansion of 32 cards depicts 64 items and categories from the world of religious songs. The cards in this expansion will be postcard-sized — at the request of numerous group and choir leaders, notes the designer — as well as laminated so that they can be used outside by large groups more easily.
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Singing

name: Dispatches from the Bunker #45
description:
In this new PDF issue of the Dispatches from the Bunker there are four new action-packed scenarios for ASL enjoyment.

The issue also includes Tactical Tips: "Defend the Beach!" by Bob Johnson and "How To Kill Tigers (And Any Other AFV) With Your Bare Hands (Or Whatever Else Is Available)" by Carl Nogueira.

There are previews of the Bunker Bash, the Albany tourney and a review of the Tussle in the Tundra and the Nor’easter along with all the usual features. The scenarios in this issue are:

The Krinkelterwald: What would be known as The Battle of the Bulge started with a bang in the ‘quiet sector’ of the unfortunate 99th Infantry Division as the Volksgrenadier-Division 277 attacked. Can the GIs hold back the assault?

The Block on the Trail to Hell: With the push east on the East-West Trail by the 3rd Marine Divison, they had to over- come prepared positions along the way. Can they clear the trail of the determined Japanese 6th Infantry defenders?

Operation Archery: Reacting to the German invasion of Norway, Operation Archery was put into motion to silence the gun battery on Maaloy Island. Can the British and Norwegian Commandos achieve their objectives?

Die Verdammten: With the war drawing to a close and the apocalypse being delivered by the 1st Ukrainian Front to the fleeing 9th Army, the situation for both soldiers and civilians trying to escape was desperate. Can they make it out?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid

name: Adventure Post: A Path of Self-Learning
description:
Adventure Post is a series of solo-mini-adventures delivered to your door on a postcard each week. Every week is a small portion of an overall larger campaign which will take many, many weeks to come to conclusion. The postcard will include a QR code or website address that will direct you to the weekly adventure document. The document will explain the setup, instructions, and key areas on the adventure map.

A Path of Self-Learning uses simplistic character creation and dice rolls for combat and interacting with the world. There are a series of questions, all of which alter the final conflict of the game in various ways. On the 12th week, the adventure will be completed and to survive is to win.

The Story:
As punishment for a crime committed against humanity, the Lord of the land has sentenced you to a Trial of Character. You must be judged against both physical and mental challenges in which you will discover who you truly are. You will learn about the three principles, Truth, Love, and Courage. You will face moral dilemmas in each of the eight virtues where your answers must be considered carefully. Finally, you will face a mighty foe in one-on-one combat. A foe whose power is a reflection of the choices you have made. Can you prove yourself worthy to earn your mantle back, Avatar?

A Path of Self-Learning is only the first adventure in a larger overall campaign. There are more aventures of different themes and new rules on the horizon.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Arrington Corp: The Heist
description:
Thirty years ago, a large meteor crashed into a field outside Hagerstown Maryland, bringing the whole world to a standstill and halting the Civil War in its tracks. The United States had banded together, setting aside their differences, simply to survive the aftermath of this catastrophic event.

It was soon discovered that the meteor was a curious metallic alloy, referred to as “Element X”, which had an unexpected characteristic. It caused water to burst into steam

The Heist is a strategic game of deduction and luck. Your goal is to steal pieces of the worlds most valuable resource known as 'Element X'. A seventeen card deck contains many characters eager to get their hands on Element X. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card using that characters action, trying to deduce who's who and eliminate them from the game and be the first to steal 7 pieces of Element X.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Builder Scorpion Crew
description:
Life on the Wall can be hard, but the Brothers of the Night's Watch look out for one-another. It doesn't hurt that they have formidable siege weapons at their disposal. The Builders construct and maintain these defenses, like the Scorpion. It's smaller than the massive ballistae mounted atop the Wall, but it's still capable of launching sizable projectiles at long range with deadly effect.

The Builder Scorpion Crew unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game allows players to add some powerful and deadly long range weapons to their arsenal. Although it moves slowly and takes time to position, the Scorpion is a formidable enemy for any army to come up against.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc., Edge Entertainment

name: ASL: March Madness 2019 Scenario Pack
description: This scenario pack is produced by the Kansas City ASL Club for their annual tournament, March Madness. It contains eight original scenarios that allow for deadly hand-to-hand close combat.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Simulation

name: Trudvang Legends: Darkwoods Expansion
description:
The Darkwoods is no more a forest than a mountain is a hill, or an ocean a pond. It ranges all of northern Trudvang east of the Great Iron Tooth, south of the Great White. A bird might ride thermals forever above a sea of green that stretches beyond every horizon and never find its borders. A squirrel might run from the Great Iron Tooth to Icepeak Mountain leaping from branch to branch, never touching the ground below. Clearings dot the map where trees as large as castles topple, quickly overgrown by hungry young saplings, eager for light. The twilight world beneath the boughs can match any cavern for gloom or any tomb for silence.

Cartographers distinguish between the Darkwoods and the Eastern Darkwoods, but these are mere lines on mortal maps, fragile and brief. The Darkwoods stood when the world was wrought and will stand when Trudvang ends. The Darkwoods lives and breathes, and while roads and trails might crisscross the land between the trunks, take ten paces off the path in any direction, and you look upon a place that has never known the tread of mortalkind, not since the first of us blinked in the young sun’s dawn.

The Darkwoods is not unknowable, but it holds its secrets dear. Even seasoned Elven rangers with centuries behind them will speak of forgotten wonders and unknown horrors concealed in the stillness. It’s a hinterland, a wild land, not an enemy to mortalkind, but no friend either for travelers unprepared for its challenges. The Darkwoods does not suffer fools, no matter how kindly intentioned. The Darkwoods watches.

Trudvang Legends: Darkwoods is an expansion that features a brand-new campaign that brings players a branching story inside the large and eerie Darkwoods Forest, a majestic albeit sinister woods where darkness broods. Rumors have it that a demon has taken refuge in its depths, twisting and manipulating creatures, terrorizing all who come near it. It's up to you to investigate the source of this rumours, and to try and survive the expedition itself! In addition, features a brand new playable Class, the Demon Hunter, who masters the dark forces and twists the limits between good and bad.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game

name: Sell Outs
description:
A game about saying anything to get a sale. Sell Outs is a tabletop card game about solving curious problems with absurd creative solutions! This turn-based game is best with 3-7 players, but can be played with more.

Are you plagued by honey badgers? Not getting that raise you want at work? Have you ever had trouble starting a revolution? Everyone has problems. Now you have solutions!

Sell Outs is the game of solving your friend’s problems by pitching common items with odd features!
A crane that grants wishes that always backfire. A spaceship that does not need any fuel, but flies really slowly. A rabbit’s foot that doubles as a great wingman. Anything is possible when you Sell Out!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Elemental Valley
description:
Are you ready for the test?

In Elemental Valley, players take the role of student elementalists. After years of study, they now face the final graduation test of the Academy.

In the test, each player is given a valley filled with elemental energies. The players will make use of them to construct and upgrade landmarks, activate landmarks' abilities, attack opponents and counter opponents' attacks. The first player who reaches the graduation Victory Points (VP) requirement earns the title of the Royal Elementalist and wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Vamos ao Quadro
description:
Vamos ao quadro (Let’s go to the black board) is a game for two to four players acting as student.
The goal is to complete the challenges on the books to get exam cards. Each exam card provides the player with points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game, wins.
Using dice, players can collect the tiles needed to form words, numbers, signs, among other things, to complete the challenges on the books.
In each turn, there are three actions for each student: one mandatory and two optional. Before starting, students should look at their books and see what pieces they will need.

“Go to the board” - Allocate dice and perform the dice actions. (mandatory)
“Group work” - Exchange tiles with another student. (optional)
“Take a test” - Deliver all needed tiles to earn an exam card. (optional)


—description from the designer (English)

“Vamos ao quadro” é um jogo para dois a quatro jogadores.
O objetivo é completar os desafios dos livros para obter cartas de prova. Cada carta de prova atribui ao jogador pontos e quem tiver mais pontos ganha.
Através dos dados, os jogadores conseguem recolher as fichas que necessitam para formar palavras, números, sinais, entre outras coisas, de forma a completar os desafios dos livros.
Em cada turno, existem três ações para cada aluno, uma obrigatória e duas opcionais. Antes de começar os alunos devem observar os seus livros e ver que fichas é que irão precisar.

“Ir ao quadro” - Alocar os dados e fazer a ação desses dados. (ação obrigatória)
“Trabalho de grupo” - Trocar fichas com outro aluno. (opcional)
“Fazer uma prova” - Entregar todas as fichas necessárias para conquistar uma carta de disciplina. (opcional)


—description from the designer (Portuguese)
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Take That, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Tavern Masters: Dockside Expansion Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
10 promo cards raised during the Dockside expansion Kickstarter campaign.

-Handsome Prince
-Sand Witch
-Old Salt
-Flagon Slayer
-Cat Burglar
-Stinky the Grill Cook
-Fish & Chips
-Black Kettle
-The Silver Chalice
-Treasure Barge
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Tavern Masters: Songs From The Tavern (Soundtrack CD)
description:
Tavern Masters: Songs From The Tavern soundtrack was composed by Caden L. Welborn, with each Song card from the Dockside Expansion being represented in full song on the soundtrack.

Each song sounds like listening to an entertainer performing in an old tavern. Each song is different in style, and each is crafted with rich ambiance to give you an immersive experience while playing Tavern Masters, other World Of Destiny games, or even your favorite role-playing game!

The soundtrack even comes with 3 exclusive Song cards for your Dockside expansion, each available no where else, each card also taken from a track featured on the CD.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Music
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Income, Investment, Open Drafting, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Bolton Blackguards
description:
House Bolton’s reputation makes you either run in terror or calls you to celebrate their wanton violence and slaughter. The Bolton Blackguards universally fall into the latter type of person. Some of the most heavily-armored units fielded in Westeros, their heavy two-handed flails make enemy shields all but useless. Their reputation alone can cause enemies to break and run before the battle has begun.

The Bolton Blackguards unit box gives commanders a terrifying new unit to employ on the battlefield. Heavily armored, the Blackguards’ reputation and looks alone will cause enemies to make a Panic Test whenever they want to attack them in melee. Adding a Bolton Flayer unit attachment to the unit only increases their effectiveness, as they’ll restore Wounds each time an enemy fails a Panic Test while engaged with them.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement
publishers: CMON Global Limited, Dark Sword Miniatures, Inc.

name: Age of Valor: Before the Leaves Fall, the Great War 1914
description:
AOV Before the Leaves Fall, the Great War 1914 is an independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion chapter or mini module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. It covers the Guns of August 1914 campaign of World War I, both Eastern and Western Fronts. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Any changes unique to the Guns of August period of the Great War, the subject of this expansion set, are included for both the conflict overall, and the included battles of Mons and Charleroi in the West, and Gumbinnen and Krasnik in the East scenarios.

The AOV product line is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 42 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/AOV-1914-Research-Portal.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Age of Valor: Revolution 1848, the Schleswig Question, Hungarian Revolution & 1st Italian Risorgimento
description:
This is an upcoming and the final, independent Age of Valor (AOV) expansion module for Age of Eagles II, also known as Napoleonic Fire & Fury. As such AOE II is needed to properly play this game. In most cases all rule changes have been imbedded in the Data Charts as well as the charts and tables on the Quick Reference Sheet. All players need to do is use these new specifications or DRMs with the original rules, then play as normal. Changes unique to the Schleswig Question (1848 and 1864), the Hungarian Revolution and the 1st Italian Risorgimento, the subjects of this module, are included for both the conflict overall, and the six scenarios provided. The battle scenarios include one from the 1st Schleswig War (Idstedt), one from the 2d (Storming the Danevirke), two from the Hungarian Revolution (Isaszeg and Temesvar) and two from the 1st Italian Risorgimento (St Lucia and Novara). A bonus scenario from the Carlist Wars, the battle of Mendigorria, is also included.

This AOV publication, the final one in the product line is totally FREE and can be downloaded via the Downloads Page via the Age of Eagles Website at https://ageofeagles.com/downloads.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/AOV-Rev-1848-Research-Portal.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Turn Order: Random

name: Raid
description:
Raid, the newest game on the Blinks Game System, places you in command of a viking horde, competing with other players to grab as much territory as you can. It's an intense game of strategy and prediction, as each player secretly inputs orders into the AI-powered Blinks game pieces, then watches as skirmishes play out in real time. It's the kind of unique analog/digital hybrid experience that's only possible on Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system. The game started as a post on the Move38 developer forum in early February, and has since been iterated on and perfected with the help of the Move38 team.

In Raid, 2 to 4 players compete to conquer an island made of Blinks. The game requires at least 6 Blinks, and takes 10-20 minutes, depending on the size of the island and number of players. Each round, players close their eyes, then take turns opening their eyes and making an attack on the island with their longboat. Once all players have attack, all eyes are opened and the game calculates the outcome of the round. Armies spread from the coast into the center of the island, competing for a dwindling set of unoccupied territories. When all coastal territories have been attacked and no more longships can land, the game calculates which player conquered the largest territory, making them the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Modular Board

name: Vs. System 2PCG: The Fantastic Battles
description:
The Fantastic Battles, the first Giant-Sized Issue for Volume 3 of Vs. System 2PCG, is the first issue for the First Family story arc. This super-famous, super-powered team of four is an exciting, long-awaited addition to the Vs. System® 2PCG® catalog of heroes and brings a wealth of power and ability to your deck.

Add The Human Torch, Thing, Mr. Fantastic and The Invisible Woman to your deck today!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: heXentafl
description:
heXentafl is an asymmetric abstract strategy game that is sort of the hexagonal version of Hnefatafl. One side (white) plays the attackers, and one side (black) plays the defenders.

heXentafl can be played on a 4x4 or 5x5 hex grid.

The King sits on the central space, the throne, surrounded by three defenders. Six attackers sit on the outer corners of the grid.

The attackers must capture the King in order to win. The defenders must escort the King to any of the six corners of the board in order to win. The defenders usually move first, but either works.

It is recommended that players play in sets of two games, alternating who is the attacker and who is the defender.

All pieces except the King move in a straight line, as many spaces as they like to an unoccupied space (like a rook in Chess). Only one piece at a time can occupy a space. A piece cannot jump over another piece.

The King can move into any vacant adjacent space, moving one space at a time (similar to the king in Chess).
Pieces are captured by surrounding them on two sides. In the image shown, white moves into position to surround the King and capture it, winning the game.

The corners present an interesting challenge, as they can't be surrounded in the normal manner. Pieces can be captured on a corner by surrounding them in the manner shown.

You cannot "capture" your own piece by moving between two enemy pieces.

The Throne

The central space of the board is the throne. Only the King may occupy the throne. When the King is on the throne, he is harder to capture.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Unspecified

name: Manassas: Sunday, July 21st 1861 – Designer Signature Edition
description:
"Manassas, Designer Signature Edition" marks the return of the original tactical level Civil War simulation for two or more players covering the First Battle of Manassas, July 21st, 1861. Minor game enhancements keep this classic game true to its original design with organizational loss displays added.

Manassas, Designer Signature Edition is a tactical level Civil War simulation for 2 or more players covering the First Battle of Manassas, Sunday, July 21st, 1861. Considered one of the best American Civil War games ever published, the entire package is beautifully rendered based on the original design with game enhancements by designer, Richard Britton.

Product Information:
Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: 15 minutes per turn
Map Scale: 135 yards/hex
Unit Scale: infantry regiments, battalions and detached companies. artillery batteries and sections. HQ and individual commanders.
Players: 2 or more
Solitaire: High
Playing Time: 4+ hours

Components:
2 Maps
2 Countersheets
4 Player Aid Cards
2 Loss Record Displays
1 Loss Record logsheet (optional use)

—description from the publisher's website
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Scourge of the Seas
description:
Ahoy captains!

Scourge of the Seas is a card-based game for 2-6 players of age 9+.

Draw from the Land deck to visit taverns in search of pirates to join your crew, then set sail and fight the enemy ships and sea forts you find in the Caribbean Sea deck to grab loot and gain fame.

But beware: terrible creatures lurk in the depths, waiting for reckless captains to get too close...
If things start to go South, make sure to go back on land to fix your ship before it sinks!

The first player to become famous wins... Who will become the Scourge of the Seas?

And remember: You can’t blame Poseidon if you sink... Twice.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Nautical, Party Game, Pirates
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Events, Open Drafting, Stat Check Resolution, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Tulip & Rose
description:
Set at the end of the 17th century Amsterdam Tulip & Rose takes you into the booming flower trade of the period.
The flower market is full of merchants that want to strike the best deals, find rare species for their exceptional collections or earn the best value for their flowers’ merchandise. In order to do so, a fresh twist of I cut you choose mechanic, used to maximize your profit from the following auctions, is implemented.
You and your fellow players are flower merchants, participating in a two days festival! Think smart, make good use of your coins, decide what you’ll keep and what you’ll sell wisely and the victory will be yours.

Here’s a brief description of the game and its gameplay: Players try to get the most points out of the flowers they have gathered and the coins they’ve collected. The game is played in two “days”, and on each “day” several rounds are played (1 round per player). On each round, one player is the “active merchant”, and he tries to sell flowers to the rest of the players.

Contents
84 Flower Cards
22 Special Cards
15 Special Orders Cards (these are used in a variant)
5 Scoring Assistant Cards
5 Merchant Cards
70 coins in 3 different values
10 Loan tiles
1 Rulebook

Setup
Before the game starts, each player selects (or is given randomly) a merchant card, a scoring assistant card and some coins.
The flower and special cards are shuffled together, and are placed as a face-down deck on the center of the table.

Gameplay
Each round consists of the following:
- Receive Income: this applies to all players. Each one gets coins from the bank, depending on who his/her merchant is, and what cards he/she possesses (some cards offer income).
- Reveal cards: The active player draws and reveals a number of cards from the deck, arranges them into two or three “bouquets” and offers them, one by one, for auction. The other players announce their bids (each player can bid more than once), and this continues until someone offers an amount no-one else wishes to surpass. The active merchant then has two options: to give the bouquet to the highest bidder and get the money, or to keep the bouquet to himself/herself, and give the high bidder an amount of money equal to half his/her high bid.

End of the Game
At the end of the second day the game ends, and each player counts the points he/she gathered from his/her flower collection and his/her coins. The player with the most points is the winner!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Contracts, I Cut, You Choose, Loans, Set Collection

name: Zulu Skirmish
description:
Voted Best Table Top Rule Set in 2020 by Texas Toy Soldier Historical Gamers!

Zulu Game Rules for Miniatures. "Zulu Skirmish" is all about you as a "Battalion Commander" or "Zulu Ibutho" directing your Table Top forces in small unit actions. The forces under your Command consist of yourself and one or more subordinate Company or Impi Commanders and their Units.

"Zulu" is designed for 28mm figures or smaller. While fun to play with two to four Units on a side, Zulu plays great at "Tournament" or "Grand Scale Skirmish" level for those that like six or even more Units in their Table Top Army. With Commander and Unit Cards its also quick to learn so it’s a good choice for a quick “pick up” or Convention Gaming.

texas-games.com
- Free Zulu Card Set.
Includes Command Action as well as Commander and Unit Cards in PDF. Designed to Streamline Table Top Bookkeeping.

- Rule Set in Hard Bound or PDF

- Game Markers / Tokens available

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: 7 Fallen
description:
Seven Fallen is a Fantasy collectible card game from France.
You play as a Divinity and your goal is to destroy your opponent with your best army of Angels and Golems.
Released in 2020 under the name "War of the Kingdoms" the first edition is still going on.

The first goal of the game is to include the players into the process of rules creation and gameplay. It is a game created by players for players. Even the way of selling the games is new and fresh, boosters can't contain starter cards and vice versa, the goal is to mainly enjoy the game with the stress of money, which for a TCG is pretty unusual.
100% of the cards can be played and considered in a deckbuild. There is no vanilla cards.

In the story of Sevenfall there is 7 kingdoms fighting for domination of the world.
Game play is pretty efficient and the game is very well balanced, highly addictive.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Medieval, Pirates
mechanics: Deck Construction

name: D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return
description:
D100 Dungeon: The Dragons Return contains campaign quest 2 which is set in the continent of Westpoint. It is the second campaign book released for D100 Dungeon and follows on from the campaign named “The Goblin and the Goblet”, which features in the Adventurers Companion book.

Also included is Martial Artistry that combines new advanced weaponry and unarmed combat, and a new Encounter table EB with 36 new monsters and a new Monster Ability. The new table incorporates the two previously released Encounter tables (E and EA) so you can experience a highly varied range of monsters in your games.

—description from the designer
categories: Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12: ASL Scenario Bonus Pack for Winter Offensive 2021
description:
ASL Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12 (2021) features three new scenarios and one new map (14a/b) for the Advanced Squad Leader system.

MMP has an ulterior motive, however, for the manufacture and sale of this particular product. Proceeds from the sales of each WO Bonus Pack #12 are donated to the WWII Foundation. You get a new map, three more ASL scenarios, and help a great project dedicated to memorializing the efforts of the men who fought in WWII get a very nice donation. This really seems like a win/win in our opinion.

ASL Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12 (2021) contains:
one new 11" x 16" double-sided ASL mapboard (14a/b)
three new ASL scenarios (WO36-WO38):

WO36 Dompaire Destruction – 4½ turns, boards 11b & 14a, 13 September 1944, Dompaire, France
WO37 The Vital Hours – 5½ turns, board 14a, 17 September 1944, Wolfheze, The Netherlands
WO38 Three Bars of Chocolate – 7½ turns, board 14a, 29 November 1944, Lindern, Germany

Designed for the aficionado, Winter Offensive Bonus Pack #12 is not a complete product and assumes the buyer owns the core Advanced Squad Leader game system.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Serpent King on Kitarr'i Beast XXL Enemy
description:
The Serpent Kings rule over the temples of the Sacred Valley, leading their armies to war from atop massive flying Kitarr'i Beasts. The Serpent King on Kitarr'i Beast is perhaps the most epic creature miniature in all of Shadows of Brimstone to date. This monstrous winged beast boasts an outrageous wingspan. With powerful, beating wings and long, razor-toothed jaws, the Kitarr'i Beast can chomp through even the toughest Heroes that stray too close. Atop this deadly mount, the mighty Serpent King rides, coiled around his horned saddle, and commanding the vast Serpentmen armies of his Tribe. The Serpent King wields ancient Tribal Relics and signals Battle Formations from on high, as he crushes the tribe's foes with each swing of his brutal Dark Stone sword.

Includes 1 XXL Enemy, Cards, Rules and Mission.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Rivals – Old West Heroes Card Set
description:
Cards and record sheet for using Hero minis as rival Enemies.

Includes 29 Cards.

-description from publisher's website
